種;species;Wheat . . . heavy.;1) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 28-6-2007(158): After the whole low-carb craze, scientists developed a new low-carb **species** of _wheat_ , so that dieters could eat it without getting _heavier_.;2) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 17-8-2008(155): This kanji also means "Seed." STORY: Scientists have developed a new **SPECIES** of WHEAT that has large HEAVY seeds. Now we can feed the world.
連;take along;What you are meant to **take along** in this kanji are not things but people. The image of the _car_ on the _road_ should ground your image for picking up your friends to _take_ them _along_ to wherever you are going.;1) [[ceeeps](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ceeeps)] 16-9-2007(161): When you put your _car_ on the _road_ you should always **take along** a few friends. Don't confuse with [carry](../v4/303.html) (#303 運).;2) [[Ji_suss](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ji_suss)] 24-8-2008(31): This kanji also means "linked" or "series" so I've changed the kanji meaning to "GO ALONG (WITH EACH OTHER)." Well, a ROAD and a CAR certainly GO ALONG with each other. And the CAR will help you to GO ALONG the ROAD. This Kanji is the "Union" in Soviet Union and the "United" of United Nations (the countries that "go along with each other" at least some of the time).
戦;war;Simple . . . fiesta.;1) [[Dragg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Dragg)] 22-3-2008(236): George W. Bush's plans for **war** were so SIMPLE. To him, its all just a big FIESTA.;2) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 19-1-2009(71): What started out as a _simple fiesta_ , turned into a full-scale **war** after arguments about whose potato salad was the best.
千;thousand;This kanji is almost too simple to pull apart, but for the sake of practice, have a look at the _drop_ above and the _ten_ below. Now put the elements together by thinking of squeezing two more zeros out of an _eyedropper_ alongside the number _ten_ to make it a **thousand**.;1) [[Branduil](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Branduil)] 26-2-2006(136): It takes many drops of ten to get to a **thousand**.;2) [[toddiceton](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/toddiceton)] 4-11-2008(108): _One_ T = one **thousand**.
始;commence;Woman . . . pedestal.;1) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 1-9-2007(254): Many men, before they **commence** their relationship with the _woman_ of their desires, place her on something of a _pedestal_ , which often leads to disappointment later on.;2) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 18-8-2007(86): Just think of any art class. You put a WOMAN on a PEDESTAL then you **COMMENCE** to draw her.

A mid- life crisis perhaps.;2) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 28-6-2007(87): Remember in the Wizard of Oz when the tin man **wished** for a _heart_ and the wizard gave him that dinky little _clock_ instead?
室;room;House . . . climax.;1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 2-11-2007(236): You book a **room** in a love hotel called " _Climax House_ ".;2) [[eieneverafter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eieneverafter)] 25-3-2008(150): A simple **room** is made up of a roof, some walls, and a dirt floor.
公;public;_Come in_ . . . _elbows_. Use the key word in its adjectival sense, not as a noun.;1) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 12-2-2007(335): I always open the doors to the **public** restrooms with my elbows because I don't want to touch the door with my hands.;2) [[mcbainpc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcbainpc)] 27-6-2008(270): I always _enter_ the doors to the **public** restrooms with my _elbows_ because I don't want to touch the door with my hands.
可;can;Remember the story about the "Little Engine that **Could** " when you hear this key word, and the rest is simple. See the determined little locomotive huffing and puffing up the mountain - "I think I **can** , I think I **can**.... " \- spitting railroad _spikes_ out of its _mouth_ as it chews up the line to the top.;1) [[moojitsu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/moojitsu)] 10-10-2006(193): A mouth on the street asking for things: "Can I get some help?! **Can** I get directions, **Can** I have some money? **Can** you please speak English?!".;2) [[Dualta](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Dualta)] 8-1-2008(88): I **can** eat nails.
急;hurry;Bound up . . . broom . . . heart.;1) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 16-9-2007(196): She was always _bound_ to a _broom_ , her _heart_ pounding in a **hurry** to finish before she was punished for being slow.;2) [[snallygaster](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/snallygaster)] 1-10-2007(111): In a **hurry** to tidy up before guests arrive, you're feverishly sweeping with a bunch of **brooms** **bound** together, your **heart** pounding.
島;island;The _bird's tail_ is tucked under here, because it has come to stop on a _mountain_ to rest from its journey across the waters. Thus the kanji comes to mean an **island**.;1) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 7-5-2006(176): This **island** is the home of the terrible mythical bird Roc. It sits mighty atop the mountain waiting for the next hapless ship to pass by.;2) [[mezbup](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mezbup)] 8-7-2009(27): On the mountain of the **island**.. there were birds with no tail feathers.
左;left;By combining the primitive and the kanji of the last two frames and reading the results, we get: _by one's side_ . . . _craft_. Conveniently, the **left** has traditionally been considered the  "sinister" _side_ , where dark and occult _crafts_ are cultivated. Note how the second stroke droops over to the **left** and is longer than the first.;1) [[Ninjasha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ninjasha)] 19-2-2008(92): The **LEFT** _side_ of my brain _posesses_ the faculties needed for logical _crafts_ , like engineering.;2) [[stereovibe](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stereovibe)] 4-2-2008(65): The **left** _side_ of my brain, is for _crafts_.
右;right;When thinking of the key word **right** , in order to avoid confusion with the previous frame, take advantage of the double meaning here, too. Imagine a little _mouth_ hanging down by your _side_  \- like a little voice of conscience - telling you the **right** thing to do. Here the second stroke should reach out to the **right** and be drawn slightly longer than the first.;1) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 31-3-2011(61): The **right** hand is for putting food in your _mouth_. (The other hand is for ass-wiping!). 左右 (さゆう) : left and **right** , influence, control, domination, 右 (みぎ) : **right** hand side.;2) [[stereovibe](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stereovibe)] 4-2-2008(53): The **right** _side_ of my brain is for _speaking_.
黒;black;Like most things electrical, a _computer_ , too, can overheat. Just imagine _flames_ pouring out of it and charring the keyboard, the monitor, and your desk a sooty **black** color.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 30-7-2007(102): If you burn the GROUND of a RICE FIELD with FIRE, eventually it will turn **black**.;2) [[ashman63](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ashman63)] 21-3-2008(37): If your _parent's home_ catches on _fire_ , it will turn **black**.
突;stab;Hole . . . St. Bernard dog.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 3-5-2006(269): When you **stab** something you often leave a big hole.;2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 25-4-2007(55): The police have recruited a special breed of _St. Bernard_ that can lick the wounds of a **stab** bing victim. The bleeding will stop instantly, saving the victim's life. One quirky side-effect, however, is that this treatment leaves behind a rather large hole…
界;world;As the **world** gets _jammed_ with more and more people, there is less and less space. Imagine yourself taking an air flight over a **world** so densely populated that every bit of it is sectioned off like a gigantic checkerboard (the _rice fields_ ). If you look closely at the character, you should be able to see a kind of movement taking place as still more is being **jammed into** that already narrow space.;1) [[mameha1977](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mameha1977)] 22-8-2007(116): One Japanese farmer I know is so small minded that he thinks the entire **world** is JAMMED IN the borders of his little RICE FIELD.;2) [[eltjopoort](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eltjopoort)] 12-5-2008(93): A famous philosopher once said that his **world** consisted of all the things he could _jam into_ his _brain_.

Some call it … **art**.;2) [[thermal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thermal)] 30-6-2008(58): The definition of **art** is getting more and more loose these days. 受;accept;Birdhouse . . . crotch.;1) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 22-2-2006(232): The bird house is the brothel (someone else said so) and of course everyone is welcome - thay **accept** any crotch.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 22-2-2007(83): A _birdhouse_ is a _whorehouse_ that will **accept** any _crotch_ even those with STDs. (Image: a birdhouse whorehouse with every kind of bird coming and going. Some old madam at the front hole **accept** s everyone, even the nasty old crows).
船;ship;Boat . . . gully.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 13-3-2007(206): A boy floats his toy _boat_ in a _gully_ and imagines it as an immense **ship**.;2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 19-2-2008(39): Aargh, hard to keep this separate from boat. How about this: the phrase "shape up or **ship** out!" This phrase originally meant that a soldier had better get his act together, or else face being **ship** ped off into a combat zone. Here we see a poor WW-I soldier who has been **ship** ped off to a combat zone. He's riding in the _boat_ overseas to fight in the _trenches_ ( _gulley_ ).
元;beginning;"In the **beginning**... " starts that marvelous shelf of books we call the Bible. It talks about how all things were made, and tells us that when the Creator came to humanity she made _two_ of them, man and woman. While we presume she made _two_ of every other animal as well, we are not told as much. Hence we need only   _two_ and a pair of _human legs_ come to the kanji that means **beginning**.;1) [[mukade](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mukade)] 10-7-2007(236): In the **beginning** were just _two_ who walked on _human legs_.;2) [[Tsuki11](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tsuki11)] 29-10-2007(71): In the **beginning** God created woman, and God asked her how she liked his work. Woman replied, "Well, you know how I have _two_ eyes, _two_ arms, _two legs_ … it seems redundant to have three breasts. It would look more symmetrical with _two_." God nodded, and the middle breast fell off… and it was good. Woman picked up the breast and said, "Thank you, God! But what do I do with this useless boob?" And God created man. That's why the women today only have _two_ boobs to match their _two human legs_.
観;outlook;Pegasus . . . see.;1) [[DrWarrior12](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrWarrior12)] 8-9-2007(409): Microsoft **Outlook** works about as well as a pegasus that can't see: they both crash all the time.;2) [[tummai](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tummai)] 23-4-2008(100): I used to hate birds.They're loud, stupid and worst of all they shit on your head. Used to think birds were the most vile creatures on earth. Then I encountered a _pegasus_. I was just walking down the road, minding my own business when I happened to _look_ up. I _saw_ it there, braying noisily, ivory wings outstretched like an angel, back leg raised ever so slightly. It dropped a steaming brown load right on my face. It changed my **outlook** completely. Birds are the second most vile creatures on earth.

Where the carcasses are _upside down in a row_ that have _not yet_ been cut up into sausages and steaks.;2) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 9-12-2006(54): My **profession** is taking unfinished rowboats and waterproofing them. 使;use;Person . . . officer.;1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 17-6-2007(176): _Mr. T_ **uses** the _officer_ as a punching bag.;2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 4-2-2007(76): Of course _Mr. T_ will tell a police _officer_ if he catches someone **using** drugs, foo!
西;west;To our way of counting directions, the **west** always comes fourth. So it is convenient to find the character for _four_ in this kanji. But since we want only _one_ of the _four_ directions, the **west** adds the _one_ at the top and sucks the _human legs_ a bit out of their _mouth_ in the process.;1) [[guidedog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/guidedog)] 9-2-2007(224): The old **west** represented by a completely empty whiskey bottle (compare [sign of the bird](../v4/1427.html) (#1427 酉) whiskey bottle about one third full).;2) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 3-3-2008(49): Note: this kanji is also used to denote Spain.
経;sūtra;Thread . . . spool.;1) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 23-6-2006(148): The word ‘sutra’ literally means a rope or thread that holds things together. Here we see that it is a _spool_ that is holding the _threads_ together.;2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 18-2-2008(105): Suggestion: Replace "spool" with "toilet paper/roll". Reasons: (1) _Toilet paper/roll_ usually comes on a _spool_. (2) _Toilet paper_ is used to clean the _soil_ off your _crotch_. Story: _Spiderman_ (= thread) has a roll of _toilet paper_ with the words of a **sutra** printed on each sheet (picture _Spiderman_ saying the **sutra** as he tears sheets off the _toilet roll_ ). Spool also appears in [stalk](../v4/715.html) (#715 茎), [suspicious](../v4/716.html) (#716 怪), [lightly](../v4/717.html) (#717 軽), [diameter](../v4/882.html) (#882 径).
図;map;_Pent in_ . . . _Big Dipper_. Hint: among the songs dating from the days of slavery that have become part of American folklore is one called  "Follow the Drinking Gourd." It referred to the nighttime travel of runaway slaves (those _pent in_ ) who had no **maps** other than the stars to guide them, among them the bright and predominant _Big Dipper_ , the "Drinking Gourd.";1) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 16-4-2007(217): Can't see direct relation to [Big Dipper](../v4/1177.html) (#1177 斗) since its writing order is completely different. As raulir noted, it's written as overlapping at the last stroke of ツ and the first of メ. I take it as a pictograph or treasure **map**. Two dots represent big trees and the cross (marking the treasure) is placed relative to them.;2) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 27-3-2011(56): A pictograph of a treasure **map**. Two steps east then X marks the spot. 図る はかる attempt, deceive, 地図 ちず **map** , 意図する いとする make a goal, intend to do, 図々しい ずうずうしい impudent, shameless, 図書館 としょかん library.
進;advance;Turkey . . . road.;1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 13-5-2007(318): Why did the _turkey_ cross the _road_? To **advance** to the other side, of course.;2) [[astgtciv](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astgtciv)] 19-11-2006(101): [re: raulir] Animals on the _road_ : Turtles [escape](../v4/283.html) (#283 逃) and Pigs [pursue](../v4/539.html) (#539 逐), while the Turkeys **advance** (looking very formidable indeed).
残;remainder;_Bones_ . . . (parade) _float_.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(146): The **remainder** of the bones have been thrown from the float (for the dogs maybe, at the end of the parade).;2) [[Pauline](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Pauline)] 18-6-2006(111): Throwing all those coins (see [coin](../v4/368.html) (#368 銭)) was a really bad idea, people got mad with greed. The only **remainder** s left were the _bones_ of those that was on the _float_.
画;brush-stroke;In forming an image for the key word, it is helpful to know that this kanji is used for artistic representations (like a completed painting), and as a counter for the number of **brush-strokes** in a character (as, for instance, in Indexes II and III at the end of this book). Its elements are: _ceiling_ . . . _sprout_ . . . _shovel_.;1) [[johnskb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnskb)] 20-6-2006(180): You decide one day to paint a kanji on your ceiling. Unfortunately, you don’t have a brush, so, being innovative, you use a sprout. Knowing it could be messy, you search for a drop-cloth, but can’t find one. Instead, you put a shovel down on the floor to catch any drips resulting from the BRUSH-STROKEs.;2) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 17-9-2007(77): To paint a kanji in your _ceiling_ with only natural materials, you use a _sprout_ as a **brush** and _shovel_ some dirt to use as paint for your **strokes**. [modified from johnskb's].
松;pine tree;Tree . . . public.;1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 9-2-2007(198): Following up with the "entering public restrooms" story for the right-hand primitive: _public_ restrooms always reek of **pine _tree_** scented disinfectant.;2) [[astgtciv](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astgtciv)] 15-4-2007(83): A **pine tree** is a _public tree_ : they are frequently planted in public squares, in commemoration of the respect Conficius held for them.
恐;fear;Craft . . . mediocre . . . heart.;1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 27-4-2006(343): If your heart surgeon is mediocre in his craft, you have plenty of reason to **fear**. ("Oops, I think I left my scissors in there").;2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 9-4-2007(125): My deep dark **fear** at the bottom of my _heart_ is that I am _mediocre_ at my _craft_.
赤;red;_Ground_ . . . _dagger_ . . . _little_. The two strokes of the _dagger_ take the place of the middle stroke of _little_.;1) [[Copycatken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Copycatken)] 30-6-2006(204): He was stabbed with a _dagger_ , and _little_ drops of **red** blood dropped onto the _ground_.;2) [[Django](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Django)] 30-9-2007(55): There was **red** all over the _soil_ after Little **Red** Riding Hood plunged a _dagger_ into the wolf. Those two dots we see are wolfies _animal legs_ we see, by the way (a la smithsonian).
殺;kill;Sheaf . . . tree . . . missile.;1) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 25-8-2006(164): Wolverine (sheaf, see [reap](../v4/1488.html) (#1488 刈)) leaps over a tree and with one swipe of his claws **kill** s a bad guy aiming a missle launcher.;2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 1-2-2008(111): I suppose when this kanji was made, it was most effective to **kill** your enemies with _sheafs of wood_ used as _missiles_.
式;style;Take **style** in its sense of some fashion design or model. Then let the element _arrow_ and _craft_ stand for the well-known **style** of shirts known as  " _Arrow_ shirts " because of the little _arrow_ sewn on each one.;1) [[kiisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kiisu)] 17-2-2008(196): Each Indian tribe crafts their arrows in a certain **style**..;2) [[shirahime](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shirahime)] 20-8-2006(64): The latest **style** is shirts crafted out of arrows.
番;turn;This key word has been chosen for its overlay of several meanings similar to those of the kanji: a **turn** of duty, a round, a number, and so forth. Its composite elements: _animal tracks_ . . . _rice field_.;1) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 1-7-2007(211): The famers take it in **turn** s to watch out for any animal tracks on their rice field.;2) [[Biene](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Biene)] 4-5-2008(38): (modified thegeezer3) _Animal tracks_ were found in the _rice field_ , now the kids of the farmer take it in **turn** s to keep watch and hinder the animals to make more _animal tracks_ in their precious _rice field_. They roll the _dice_ to decide in what order they have to keep watch and when everyones **turn** is.
程;extent;_Wheat_ . . . _display_. Do not confuse with _extremity_ (Frame 230) or _boundary_ (Frame 523).;1) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 26-11-2008(257): The **extent** to which some people will go to create ' _wheat displays_ ', or as some call them 'crop circles', is truly amazing.;2) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 1-5-2009(92): The _wheat_ crop has come in, and the mouth of the king is gobbling it all up. Everyone is waiting to see… to what **extent** will the king manage to eat it this year?
師;expert;Maestro . . . ceiling . . . towel.;1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 19-9-2006(159): A _maestro_ in a large auditorium with high _ceilings_ is conducting his orchestra of **expert** musicians at a fever-pitch, sweat pouring out of him. When the piece is over he reaches for his _towel_ to wipe his brow.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 27-8-2007(108): _Maestro_ is such as **expert** , he can conduct even with a _towel_ hanging from the ceiling in front of him.
存;suppose;_Genie in the bottle_ . . . _a child_. Hint: focus on the key word's connotation of  "make believe".;1) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 4-5-2008(269): How do you **suppose** they manage to cram a genie inside a bottle? Well, I **suppose** they put him in there while he's still a little _child_ …;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-10-2005(110): Villagers on a little remote island one day find a bottle washed out by the sea onto the beach. After wiping the bottle and taking a closer look, they are amazed to see a (very small) _child_ in it. The villagers **suppose** that the _child_ is a _genie in a bottle_.
伝;transmit;_Person_ . . . _rising cloud_. Hint: the Amerindians' smoke signal scan help provide a good image for this kanji, whose key word is meant to include **transmissions** of all sorts.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 21-10-2005(295): Mister T **transmit** s a message with rising clouds (smoke) signals, to a nearby American Indian tribe. The smoke signals spell : "I p-i-t-y y-o-u f-o-o !".;2) [[somukeru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/somukeru)] 6-3-2008(21): Hanging one-handed under _Cloud_ City, the _Jedi_ -in-training Luke, uses the force to **transmit** his distress to Leia.
運;carry;A long string of "sweet" _chariots_ "swinging low" to our _roads_ is a sure sign that the Lord is  "comin' for to **carry** " someone home.;1) [[javiergakusei](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/javiergakusei)] 27-3-2007(245): Don’t confuse it with “take along” (287). In that one, there was a car so you could take along your friends once you found them on the road. In this one, there is an army chariot just to **carry** military supplies (sorry no room for you).;2) [[ruisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruisu)] 3-10-2007(66): Roads **carry** armies (in contrast to seas **carry** ing navies or skies **carry** ing air forces).
果;fruit;The final stage of the seed is reached when the plant has reached its full growth (the _tree_ ) and comes to fruition, producing **fruit** full of new seeds that can return to the earth and start the process all over again. The main thing to notice here is the element for _brains_ at the top, which might prove more helpful than _rice field_ for creating an image. The writing, however, follows the order of a _sun_ with a _tree_ whose trunk runs through the _sun_.;1) [[vionnacrowe](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vionnacrowe)] 11-3-2007(259): If only Eve had used her brains and not taken the forbidden **fruit** from the tree.;2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 24-7-2006(55): There really are _brain_ **fruit** _trees_. See <http://www.dpchallenge.com/image.php?IMAGE_ID=108312>. Enough said.
娘;daughter;Woman . . . halo.;1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 30-11-2008(180): Your **daughter** is a good girl……well, let's hope so… :-).;2) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 25-7-2008(80): Be careful **not** to think woman + angel here, which has already been seen for [attractive](../v4/430.html) (#430 嬌). Suggest using _woman_ with a _halo_ , as in an innocent girl, something that everyone sees their **daughters** as being.
識;discriminating;A person of **discriminating** intellect can tell the difference between mere _kazoo_ -buzzing and _words_ spoken wisely.;1) [[amthomas](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/amthomas)] 15-3-2007(261): _Words_ are difficult to discriminate/discern from _sounds_ in the middle of a _fiesta_.;2) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 14-2-2008(72): I have **discriminating** taste. I'd rather listen to the _words_ of a lecture than attend a _kazoo_ concert. (Picture some snobby guy in a tweed jacket turning up his nose at entering a loud raucous kazoo recital).
寄;draw near;Let the idea of **drawing near** suggest something dangerous or eerie that one approaches with fear and trembling. Here we see a _strange house_ \- perhaps the haunted _House_ of Usher that Edgar Allen Poe immortalized, or the enchanted Gingerbread _House_ that lured Hansel and Gretel to **draw near**.;1) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 14-11-2007(195): The _strange house_ has a sign saying "DRAW NEAR" in its window, instead of a 'Beware' sign. It must be a trick!;2) [[pmbeddall](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pmbeddall)] 9-10-2007(66): Imagine a horror movie set in a haunted mansion. The _house_ is very _strange_. The characters **draw near** to one another for protection against the unknown.

非;un-;This key word, a negating prefix, is a doodle of a heavy iron pole with bars extending in both directions, to create the picture of a jail cell. 寝;lie down;Do not confuse this key word with either the element for _reclining_ or the character for _prostrated_ (Frame 1035). He hasn't made a single sale today, so he doesn't have enough money to buy a pillow. He lies down on his pet _turtle_ and cries himself to sleep.
酒;saké;Water . . . whiskey bottle.;1) [[greenapple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/greenapple)] 27-8-2006(176): **Sake** is just watered down whisky.;2) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 13-6-2007(86): **Sake** is the generic term for alcohol (not just japanese rice wine). And a very popular alcoholic drink in Japan is _whiskey_ and _water_.
失;lose;"To **lose** " here takes the sense of "misplace," not the sense of _defeat_ , whose kanji we learned in frame 67. It pictures a _husband_ with something falling from his side as he is walking along, something he **loses**.;1) [[rich_f](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rich_f)] 19-7-2007(222): The _drop_ falling here is the _husband's_ toupee… he's already **lost** his hair once, now he's **losing** it again. It's the same as vermilion, drop first. _Homer_ **loses/drops** his wedding ring.

質;substance;Two axes . . . shells.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 26-2-2007(243): What is this **substance** on this _clam_? I've already broken 2 _axes_ on it! 特;special;Despite the strong phonetic similarity, there will be no problem keeping the key word **special** distinct from the character we met earlier for _specialty_ (Frame 47), since the latter has immediate connotations lacking in this kanji. Anyway, we shall let the key word of this frame refer to something in a **special** class all its own - like the sacred _cows_ of India that wander freely without fear of being butchered and ground into hamburger. Even though the practice is originally a Hindu one, and in any case no longer followed among the majority of Japanese Buddhist monks, the Buddha's refusal to take the life of any sentient being makes it only fitting that the _cows_ should be placed on the sacred grounds of a _Buddhist temple_ in this kanji.;1) [[sethimayne](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sethimayne)] 25-10-2007(200): Think of not **special** people, but **special** animals. The sacred Hindu _cows_ are **special** \- they can wander around the _temple_ without fear of becoming roast beef.;2) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 5-10-2007(45): The Church Lady is traveling through Japan and notices with distaste a sacred _cow_ relieving itself inside a _Buddhist Temple_. "Well, isn't _that_ **special** ".
際;occasion;Pinnacle . . . ritual.;1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 26-6-2007(194): On occasian, _rituals_ are held at the very tip of _The Pinnacle_.;2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 4-9-2006(68): Many _rituals_ are practiced every day (blessing before meals, evening prayer, etc.) Only the _peak_ _rituals_ (wedding, Bar Mitzvah, etc.) qualify to be called an **occasion**.
路;path;Wooden leg . . . each.;1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 17-4-2007(223): When pirates try to hide, it's always easy to find them. Their _wooden legs_ leave distinctive prints, showing where _each_ is hiding and the exact **path** he took.;2) [[inuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/inuki)] 17-8-2006(98): I have a wooden leg for each type of **path**. One with a rubber stopper at the end for absorbing shocks on paved **path** s, and one with a wide foot to distribute weight better on mud **path** s.
政;politics;To the many definitions for **politics** that already exist, this character offers yet another: _correct taskmastering_. Think about what the primitives tell us. On the one hand, we see the pessimistic wisdom that **politics** has to do with _taskmastering_ , maneuvering people with or without their will. And on the other, we see the campaign assurances that this duty can be performed _correctly_ if only the right candidate is given a chance.;1) [[nagisa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nagisa)] 19-5-2007(219): Those involved in **politics** are always trying to elect the _correct_ _taskmaster_.;2) [[cosby](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cosby)] 16-7-2008(189): Insane political _correctness_ on the left, and facists _taskmasters_ on the right- thats **politics** in a nutshell right there.
告;revelation;Folklore throughout the world tells us of talking animals who show a wisdom superior to that of human beings, and that same tradition has found its way into television shows and cartoons right into our own century. This character depicts **revelation** through the _mouth_ of a _cow_ , suggesting oracular utterances about truths hidden to human intelligence.;1) [[pageturner1988](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pageturner1988)] 18-9-2007(412): The **revelation** makes the cow's mouth drop down, "Hamburgers are made of what?!".;2) [[Ningen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ningen)] 6-9-2008(29): In ancient times, the words from a _primitive cow's mouth_ were considered a **REVELATION** because they were the "udder truth.".

貴;precious;Purse . . . shells.;1) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 16-6-2007(161): Frodo kept the **precious** in the purse but did a switch with some worthless shells when he went to sleep. 雪;snow;_Rain_ that undergoes a change so that it can be swept aside with a _broom_ is **snow**.;1) [[BigAmish](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BigAmish)] 15-8-2008(183): **SNOW** isn't all that different from _RAIN_ , except it can be removed with a _BROOM_ because it only forms in freezing temperatures.;2) [[nesert](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nesert)] 28-6-2010(53): Unlike _rain_ , **snow** can be swept away with a _broom_.
万;ten thousand;Japanese counts higher numbers in units of **ten thousand** , unlike the West, which advances according to units of one thousand. (Thus, for instance, 40,000 would be read "four **ten-thousands** " by a Japanese.) Given that the comma is used in larger numbers to _bind up_ a numerical unit of one thousand, the elements for _one_ and _bound up_ naturally come to form **ten thousand**. The order of strokes here needs special attention, both because it falls outside the general principles we have learned already, and because it involves writing the element for _bound up_ in an order opposite to the one we learned. If it is any consolation, this exception is consistent every time these three strokes come together.;1) [[Tsuki11](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tsuki11)] 30-10-2007(249): I _bound_ **ten thousand** dollars together and hid it under the _floor_.;2) [[Sleepyhead](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Sleepyhead)] 30-1-2009(87): IT'S OVER 9000!!!!!!
能;ability;Try relating this kanji to that of the previous frame. For instance, you might imagine that the test of **ability** envisioned here is removing the _bear_ from the oven fire.;1) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 17-3-2008(246): The amputee has no hands but only stumps of _flesh_ beneath his _elbows_. To give him the **ability** to eat he has _two spoons_ implanted in his arm stumps, one in each side.;2) [[Istvan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Istvan)] 16-7-2007(57): Kid from the Oracle's place in the Matrix (whose head is shining like the moon) is holding a a spoon and making it bend using his special **ability**. When Neo asks to learn this **ability** the child replies, " Remember the truth Neo, there is no spoon." Neo Proceeds to the kitchen pondering these words of wisdom. The Child smiles mischeviously and pulls a second spoon hidden up his sleeve in the crook of his elbow. "That's right Neo," the child laughs, "there is no spoon…there are two spoons!".

片;one-sided;This kanji is based on the pictograph of a tree with some branches going upwards and others hanging down, split right down the middle. When that picture's right side is isolated, it becomes the kanji for **one-sided** , in the sense of only one part of a whole.;1) [[saranich](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/saranich)] 11-12-2006(282): Fuaburisu's pictograph of a man kneeling and presenting the ring to his future wife is a **one-sided** version of the story. Others say he was giving her the finger.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 5-2-2006(121): Taking the keyword in the sense of only one part of a whole, I see this as a pictograph of a man kneeling and presenting the ring to his future wife (I couldn't see any trees or branches in there).
王;king;See what you can do to come up with a pictograph of a **king's** scepter here that suits your own idea of what it should look like. You might even begin with the basic element for _I beam_ and then try to fit the remaining third stroke in.;1) [[ceeeps](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ceeeps)] 13-9-2007(141): To be **king** you have to be a real _crafty one_ !;2) [[negreality](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/negreality)] 27-5-2010(102): A **King** is one（ 一 ） who rules over the land （ 土 soil）.

井;well;Recalling that there are no circular strokes, and that the shape of the square and the square within a square (Frame 630) have already been used, it should be relatively easy to see how this character can be consider a pictograph of a **well**.;1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 8-10-2006(182): I nearly died by falling in a **well**. 台;pedestal;Elbow . . . mouth.;1) [[akotkav](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akotkav)] 5-3-2006(224): When someone's _elbow_ is above your _mouth_ he/she is probably standing on a **pedestal**.;2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 12-11-2006(160): After training your whole life, you manage to get a bronze medal in the Olympics. You're extremely proud of your accomplishment as you step up to receive your medal. The guy in first place is up on a **pedestal** , towering above you, his elbow level with your mouth. Being a smug bastard, he "accidentally" knocks his elbow into your mouth, causing you to bleed and lose a tooth. Just cause he won the gold doesn't mean he can place himself on such a high **pedestal** and do whatever he wants!
去;gone;Soil . . . elbow.;1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 2-11-2007(385): "Going, going, **GONE**!", said the gravedigger as he shoveled _soil_ onto the body's protruding _elbow_ (the last bit left to cover).;2) [[khooks](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/khooks)] 9-4-2007(65): If you want the soil stains **gone** from your clothes, then you'll need to put some elbow grease into cleaning them.
乗;ride;The simplest way to remember this character is to find the sprig of _wheat_ in it, hidden because it doubles up with one stroke of _silage_.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 6-9-2007(260): It's a _hay_ **ride**! You sit on piles of _silage_ and everyone likes to imitate old-time farmers with a piece of _wheat_ sticking out of their mouths.;2) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 4-4-2007(50): [ride, power, multiplication, record, counter for vehicles, board, mount, join] In the near future, we hope to **ride** on biomass fueled vehicles. Good news for those who have _wheat_ _silage_ surplus.
茶;tea;As everyone knows, **tea** is made from **tea** leaves. But the **tea** plant itself has its own _flowers_ , which can be quite beautiful and add a special flavor to the _tea_ , as the Chinese found out already over 4,598 years ago. With the image of a terrace of _flowering_ **tea** bushes in mind, picture a number of brightly painted and very l-o-n-g _wooden poles_ (Frame 207) placed here and there in their midst, with a tiny _umbrella_ at the top to shade the delicate-tasting **tea** _flowers_.;1) [[wreckz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wreckz)] 21-1-2008(214): Some people think drinking **tea** is boring and quaint. That's why I spice mine up by adding a cocktail umbrella, which of course is made from a _wood_ -en toothpick supporting a paper _umbrella_ with _flowers_ printed on top.;2) [[ceeeps](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ceeeps)] 13-9-2007(92): When I drink _herbal_ **tea** I like to drink it under a _parasol_. If it's too hot I go "ho, ho, ho !!" (katakana ホ).
故;happenstance;Call it fate or providence or plain old Lady Luck, **happenstance** is the _oldest taskmaster_ we know. It nearly always has its way.;1) [[Deborah](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Deborah)] 27-10-2007(127): An _OLD TASKMASTER_ is no **happenstance** (coincidence). The older you get the more rigid in your ways.;2) [[misha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/misha)] 23-7-2007(51): Need to disambiguate from [enemy](../v4/443.html) (#443 敵) as it's easy to mix up **antique** and **old** here. Let's think of an accidental president – he is an **old** **taskmaster** who has managed to win the election by **happenstance** .
準;semi-;Think of this in terms of the **semi** finals of some sports competition. _Water_ . . . _turkeys_ . . . _needle_.;1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 4-7-2007(195): At the _turkey_ fighting **semi-** final, turkeys are injected with drugs via _needles_ and splashed with _water_ to help them last the match.;2) [[metacall](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/metacall)] 13-1-2008(136): The anhinga, or _water_ _turkey_ , has a _needle_ -like nose, so really it's only a **semi-** turkey <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anhinga>.
宮;Shinto shrine;Way back in lesson 2 we learned the character for _spine_. The two other characters in which it is used we can now learn together in this and the following frame. Here a **Shinto shrine** is composed of _house_ and _spine_.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 27-6-2006(242): A friend of mine made up a rhyme for this one: "house with a spine, **Shinto shrine** "!;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 8-1-2006(163): This **Shinto shrine** is built with human _spines_. Have you ever seen the ossuary in Sedlec, near Kutna Hora in Czech Republic ? It is a small church entirely decorated with human bones. Do a web search for "sedlec ossuary", it's quite a sight.
店;store;Cave . . . fortune-telling.;1) [[sutebun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sutebun)] 15-10-2007(326): Try to remember all those **store** s from Zelda that were inside caves and had fortune-teller like vendors.;2) [[kiisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kiisu)] 7-3-2008(72): The fortuneteller has a **store** in a cave.
終;end;Thread . . . winter.;1) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 17-7-2007(216): This _winter_ is so cold that _spiderman_ 's web gets brittle! Could this be the **end** of _spiderman_?;2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 8-7-2009(105): _Spider-Man_ can't wait for _winter_ to **end**. Going outside in spandex isn't exactly toasty.
息;breath;Nose . . . heart.;1) [[Howdoken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Howdoken)] 14-1-2008(316): Your **breath** brings oxygen in through your _nose_ which is then pumped around your body by your _heart_.;2) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 31-3-2008(102): I think I've met my dream girl, but there's a problem. her **breath** is horrible! So, do I listen to my _nose_ or my _heart_?
雨;rain;This kanji, also a primitive, is one of the clearest instances we have of a complex pictograph. The top line is the sky, the next 3 strokes a pair of clouds, and the final 4 dots the **rain** collected there and waiting to fall.;1) [[notgoing2argue](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/notgoing2argue)] 4-4-2007(132): From the _ceiling_ hangs a _towel_ dripping four _drops_ like **RAIN**.;2) [[shadolite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shadolite)] 19-3-2008(22): The **rain** falls from the sky, landing like teardrops on my windows.
良;good;Drop of . . . silver.;1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 14-6-2007(176): With a _drop_ of _silver_ , the forces of **good** can vanquish the werewolves.;2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 17-6-2006(88): A _drop_ of _silver_ is **good** , but a whole bar of it is better!
電;electricity;Rain/weather . . . eel.;1) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 15-2-2011(170): Think of a two natural sources of **electricity** : electrical storms (a form of _weather_ ) and electrical _eel_ s. 電話 でんわ phone, call, 電気 (でんき) : **electricity** , (electric) light.;2) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 30-5-2007(45): This kanji was invented by the first Chinaman to discover **electricity**. He was so unfortunate, he stepped on an electric _eel_ and got struck by _lighting_ at the same time.
勢;forces;Rice seedlings . . ground . . . fat man . . . muscle.;1) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 25-6-2006(182): [land](../v4/1513.html) (#1513 陸) The _rice-seedlings still stuck in the soil_ gather _round_ in a circle. Their combined _power_ **forces** them out of the ground at last.;2) [[thelooseteeth](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thelooseteeth)] 17-10-2009(42): _Mushroom_ … _Fat man_ ….= _Mario_. _Mario_ jumps on top of Bowser's **forces** , crushing their evil _power_.
衛;defense;_Boulevard_ . . . _locket_. Do not confuse with _ward off_ (Frame 1399), _protect_ (Frame 1072), _guard_ (Frame 198), or _safeguard_ (Frame 756).;1) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 28-5-2007(238): [defense, protection] For " _defense_ against the dark arts" class, you go the magical _boulevard_ and buy an enchanted _locket_.;2) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 1-5-2008(95): Since it was in the middle of the _boulevard_ , everyone could see she hit the man only in self- **defense** , as he was trying to steal her valuable _locket_.
望;ambition;The story of **ambition** talks of a _king_ walking under the _perishing_  (or "waning") _moon_ dreaming great dreams about his kingdom. (The roots of **ambition** are from the same word as  "ambulate," meaning to walk about.);1) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 4-2-2008(238): You're _dead meat_ , buddy, my **ambition** is to be _king_.;2) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 28-4-2008(140): The **ambitions** of _kings_ often result in _dead_ _bodies_.
春;springtime;Bonsai . . . sun.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-3-2007(194): In the **springtime** _bonsai_ get plenty of _sun_.;2) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 11-1-2008(90): When it's **springtime** you can only leave the _bonsai_ out when the _sun_ has gone down. Their little leaves can't handle too much heat.
指;finger;Finger . . . delicious.;1) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 25-4-2006(320): **Finger** lickin' delicious.;2) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 16-2-2006(52): I remember this not as **finger** which has too many uses elsewhere but as "fingering" then its easy: **finger** ing some delicious…
止;stop;The character for **stop** is easiest to learn as a pictograph, though you have to take a moment to see it. Take it as a rather crude drawing of a footprint: the first 3 strokes represent the front of the foot and the last the heel. The big toe (stroke 2 sticking out to the right) on the right indicates that this is a left foot.;1) [[brunosprak](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brunosprak)] 6-1-2008(83): If you find in the _ground_ a _walking stick_ with a _magic wand_ , **STOP**! Maybe it's some kind of macumba/black magic/voodoo bad thing.;2) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 15-6-2008(53): This looks like a little police officer sticking his hand out (first two strokes) signaling for cars to **stop** as a schoolboy/girl is following behind (third stroke). The final stroke is the road.
配;distribute;Whisky bottle . . . snake.;1) [[happychair](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/happychair)] 14-3-2006(217): To **DISTRIBUTE** _WHISKY_ during Prohibition you had to be as sneaky as a _SNAKE_.;2) [[Tommy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tommy)] 13-5-2008(140): In Japan, it's rude to **distribute** the _sake_ to your _self_ before anybody else.
役;duty;Going . . . missile.;1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 26-9-2006(258): Japanese kamikaze pilots (and the American from Dr. Strangelove) are so devoted to their **duty** that they _go_ with their _missiles_.;2) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 29-6-2008(83): It is every American citizen's **duty** to _GO_ and fire _MISSILES_ at defenceless countries.
幸;happiness;Simply by turning the dot at the top of the primitive for _spicy_ into a cross shape, we move from things bitter and _spicy_ to things **happy**.;1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 7-8-2007(174): **happiness** is the ONE bite of SPICY curry.;2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 24-12-2006(89): This is one of those rare occasions when I forgo Heisig for other methods. [「幸せから一本取ると辛い」](midori://search?text=「幸せから一本取ると辛い」) – if you take but one stroke away from **happiness** , you get painfulness. (oh well, Heisig used similar one for 百 ).
角;angle;_Bound up_ . . . _glass canopy_ . . . _walking stick_ . . . _two_. If you write the character once, you will see why we avoided using the element for _soil_ , which would prompt you to write it in improper order.;1) [[FudoMyo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FudoMyo)] 4-5-2007(203): A museum display of two walking sticks bound together under a glass canopy, showing the first device used to measure an **angle**.;2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 29-12-2007(36): [+nuke] As a primitive, a boomerang. This boomerang is used to grab a bunch of meat, or _flesh_ , lying around on the ground at a farm. First, you throw it straight at a _walking stick_ , then it makes a right **angle** and goes to _walking stick_ number _two_ , and wraps around that. A quick tug, and you've got all the _flesh_ flying toward you contained in that tri **angle**. Hooray for free (stolen) food!
階;story;The **story** of this character refers to floors in a building. The elements: _pinnacle_ . . . _all_.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-2-2007(205): _All_ buildings of _The Pinnacle_ are multi- **storey**. They don't have much room, so they have to build up. It sucks when someone presses _all_ the buttons on the elevator! You have to stop at each **storey**!;2) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 25-2-2008(81): Some stupid kid has pushed _all_ the buttons in the elevator. As it stops at _all_ **storey** s you reach a _pinnacle_ of impatience. Finally you reach your **storey** , the last one, at the _pinnacle_ of the building.
首;neck;Reading this kanji from the top down, we have: _horns_ . . . _nose_. Together they bring to mind the picture of a moose-head hanging on the den wall, with its great _horns_ and long _nose_. Now while we would speak of cutting off a moose's  "head" to hang on the wall, the Japanese speak of cutting off its **neck**. It's all a matter of how you look at it. Anyway, if you let the word **neck** conjure up the image of a moose with a very l-o-n-g **neck** hanging over the fireplace, whose _horns_ you use for a coat-rack and whose _nose_ has spigots left and right for scotch and water, you should have no trouble with the character. Here we get a good look at what we mentioned when we first introduced the element for _horns_ : that they can never be left floating free and require an extra horizontal stroke to prevent that from happening, as is the case here.;1) [[bakamono](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bakamono)] 20-8-2007(130): The V shape is your **neck** on top of your collar bone, or the straight line. _Yourself_ , or the rest of your body is below that!;2) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 24-8-2006(96): The mooses **neck** supports it's big horns and long nose.
兄;elder brother;By now kanji like this one should "look like" something to you even though it is more of an "ideogram" than a "pictograph." The large _mouth_ on top and the _human legs_ below almost jump off the page as a caricature of **elder brother** , the one with the big _mouth_ (or if you prefer a kinder image, the one who  "has the say" among all the children).;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 23-7-2007(138): My **elder brother** was basically a mouth on legs when he was a teenager.;2) [[LeoOra](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LeoOra)] 23-1-2008(22): The pac man's ( 只 ) **elder brother** has to have longer legs than his junior.
影;shadow;Scenery . . . shape.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 29-3-2007(221): The _sun_ over the _capital_ cast a **shadow** with the same _shape_.;2) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 9-10-2006(57): _Mystique_ the shape-shifter blends into the _scenery_ by transforming into a form that looks like little more than an animated **shadow**.
渡;transit;Water . . . degrees.;1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 3-8-2006(294): This particular form of **transit** is a ferry (one of the actual meanings of this character). Naturally it can only cross the _water_ if it's not frozen, so the temperature must be above 0 _degrees_.;2) [[Istvan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Istvan)] 15-7-2007(29): The **transit** system in Tokyo is one of the best in the wrold, but why is it that when it is 35 degrees outside, it is about 2 degrees on the train? Or when it is 2 degrees outside, it is 35 degrees inside the train. This degree of difference means I am always sweating then getting the chills! I think I caught a fever!
夢;dream;To have a **dream** after going to bed is really the _crown_ to a perfect _evening_. The _flower_ petals over the _eyes_ (instead of the  "sand" that Westerners are used to finding there when they awake in the morning) only confirms the image of a pleasant **dream** suggested by the rest of this rather complex kanji.;1) [[mameha1977](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mameha1977)] 13-11-2007(164): Last night's date with Miss Sweden was like a **dream**. She even laid _flowers_ over my _eyes_ to _crown_ the perfect _evening_.;2) [[notgoing2argue](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/notgoing2argue)] 27-3-2007(59): In the movie American Beauty, Kevin Spacey liked to **DREAM** about his daughter's friend and have a _rose petal_ fall onto his _eye_ from the _ceiling_. He did this lying in his bed each _evening_. You can almost see him lying in his bed in this kanji.
巻;scroll;_Quarter_ . . . _snake_. The key word refers to a manuscript rolled up into a **scroll** , not to a _hanging scroll_ (Frame 435).;1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 5-3-2007(165): At a mysterious bazaar, you happen to come across something interesting: a rolled- up **scroll** for only _25¢_. You buy it up impulsively until you realize that the powerful spell contained within is cursed by a poisonous _snake_. If you try to cast this spell, the snake will pop out of nowhere and bite you! Hrmph. No wonder it was so cheap…;2) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 7-5-2007(110): How to make snake **maki** : Take a _snake_. Roll it up in rice and nori (seaweed paper) like a **scroll**. Cut into _quarters_ and serve on a wooden geta with ginger and wasabi.
寺;Buddhist temple;You have heard of people "attaching" themselves to a particular sect? Here is your chance to take that metaphor literally and imagine some fellow walking into a **Buddhist temple** with a fervent resolve to attach himself to the place. Since there is plenty of unused _land_ around the precincts, he simply picks out a suitable patch, brushes the soles of his feet with _glue_ , steps down firmly, and so joins the **Buddhist temple** as a  "permanent member.";1) [[ceeeps](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ceeeps)] 3-9-2007(179): At the **Buddhist temple** the monks are seated on the _ground_ , _glued_ there in meditation.;2) [[Murjab](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Murjab)] 2-9-2007(45): To be allowed to join the **Buddhist temple** , imagine an aspiring monk being asked to stand still in the _soil_ for a long time in a _measurement_ of his resolve.
胸;bosom;Part of the body . . . bound up . . . villain.;1) [[parisnoneko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/parisnoneko)] 27-9-2006(195): **Bosom** is a Flesh part that should be bound up lest it provoke villian thoughts.;2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 15-8-2006(114): As you know, female comics _villains_ are always _binding_ the _flesh_ of their **bosom** _up_ in interesting ways. One has to wonder how these clothes stay on their body at all…
制;system;This kanji show a unique **system** for leading _cows_ to the slaughterer's _saber_ : one ties a _belt_ about their waist and fixes that _belt_ to an overhead cable, pulling the _cow_ up into the air where it hangs suspended, helpless against the fate that awaits it.;1) [[Kelly](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kelly)] 25-6-2007(168): The **system** for making leather _belts_ involves slicing up a _cow_ with a _sword_.;2) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 7-2-2009(61): Why all the gore and violence? How about a samurai cow? He doesn't have to be a violent samurai, either. He only wears the sword because he's part of the _bushi_ **SYSTEM**. Actually, he studies ikebana, shodo, and zen. Imagine him sitting cross-legged in a Zen temple (a very _Special_ Zen temple). The master asks him if a dog has buddha nature and, shifting the swords in his belt, he calmly replies, "Moo!".
極;poles;The **poles** this key word refers to are the extremities of the earth or the terminals of an electric field. The elements are: _tree_ . . . _snare_ . . . _mouth_ . . . _crotch_ . . . _floor_.;1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 13-4-2007(362): Can simplify this using [decay](../v4/1243.html) (#1243 朽). Then: The expedition to the **poles** is bad for your health, and the _decay_ that started in your _mouth_ spreads to your _crotch_ – at which point you fall to the _floor_.;2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 17-3-2008(101): (modified Katsuo) Can simplify this using [decay](../v4/1243.html) (#1243 朽). You travel to the _poles_ , a frozen wasteland. In desperate need of food you try to set up a snare but the tree is _decayed_ (see story for [decay](../v4/1243.html) (#1243 朽)) so you catch no prey. The brutal cold first attacks your _mouth_ as your lips turn blue, then your _crotch_ also gets cold as your body fails, finally you fall to the _floor_.
蔵;storehouse;Flowers . . . parade . . . slaves.;1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 31-3-2008(241): The **storehouse** is _overgrown_ with _slaves_. The _slaves_ are to be sold in the store, to differentiate from a warehouse, which doesn't have the word "store" in it.;2) [[shimouma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shimouma)] 21-4-2008(96): Slaves moved flowers from the **storehouse** in preparation for the parade.
奥;core;_A drop_ . . . _pent in_ . . . _rice_ . . . _St. Bernard dog_. Notice that the horizontal line of the bottom primitive doubles up as the final stroke for _pent in_.;1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 27-3-2006(279): In the **core** of a nuclear reactor, scientists have discovered a way to get power from rice, by penting it in under high pressure. It's very dangerous, so they've trained a st. bernard dog to run things, he's adding more drops of rice as necessary.;2) [[Thora](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thora)] 17-2-2008(126): 奥さん （おくさん) is a common way to say "wife". In the innermost **core** of the house, the bored _pent up_ housewife _drops_ her chores and consumes so much _rice_ she becomes a very _large_ housewife.
都;metropolis;Someone . . . city walls.;1) [[Howdoken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Howdoken)] 1-6-2008(163): A vision of a futuristic **METROPOLIS** : standing at the window of your 400th floor apartment, hand in hand with your LOVE DOLL, gazing out at the gigantic CITY WALLS that you can never escape.;2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 15-10-2006(75): In a huge **metropolis** , it's hard not to feel like just _someone_ within the _city walls_.
工;craft;The pictograph of an I beam, like the kind used in heavy construction work on buildings and bridges, gives us the character for **craft** in general.;1) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 15-11-2005(78): I consider **craft** to be one of the harder primitives to use in stories so I've personified it as Bender the **craft** y robot from Futurama who was designed to bend I-beams.;2) [[C00ki3M0nst3r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/C00ki3M0nst3r)] 29-8-2007(37): I **craft** y.
掛;hang;Fingers . . . ivy . . . magic wand.;1) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 19-12-2007(161): Think RPG. The wizard points his _finger_ to the guard and the _ivy_ he has just animated with his _magic wand_ climbs down the wall to **hang** the poor guy, opening the way for the adventurers into the dungeon.;2) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 10-10-2005(105): 3 ways you could **hang** something: 1) the normal way, with your finger putting something on a hook or whatever, 2) **hang** ing from a vine the natural way, or 3) by means of the magic of the wand.
段;grade;The kanji connoting rank or class shows us a new element on the left: the familiar primitive for _staples_ with an additional stroke cutting through the vertical stroke. It is easiest in these cases to make a primitive related to what we already know. Hence, we call it a _staple gun_. To the right, _missile_.;1) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 25-8-2007(268): This is a military- **grade** _staple gun_! It can be loaded with real _missiles_.;2) [[Thunderball](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thunderball)] 24-9-2007(50): In order to get your 1st **grade** , or first-dan (だん) black belt, you have to learn hand to hand combat with new weapons - first the grapple involving the _staple gun_ , and then the _missile_ deployment technique.
態;attitude;Ability . . . heart.;1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 15-4-2007(308): This guy has an **attitude** problem – lots of _ability_ , but his _heart_ 's not in it.;2) [[redskatz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/redskatz)] 9-4-2009(113): Having a good **attitude** means believing in your _heart_ that you have the _ability_ to do anything - like memorizing more than 2000 kanji, for example.
江;creek;Unlike the river, the ocean, the lake, and the pond, the **creek** is often no more then a dribble of _water_ trickling down a small gully. While the geological history of the larger bodies of _water_ is hard to surmise sometimes, all of us know from our childhood how **creeks** are made. You probably even dug one or two in your time. All you need to do is find a mainstream of _water_ somewhere and dig a little path into dry land. The **creek** is thus a lesson in _water-craft_ , as this kanji would agree.;1) [[Ninjasha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ninjasha)] 12-12-2007(136): A **CREEK** is a small trail of _water_ easily _craft_ ed with a stick.;2) [[nwatkins](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nwatkins)] 18-9-2007(83): **Creek** s are small water, easily crossed with a simple i-beam.
悲;sad;Jail cell . . . heart.;1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 20-9-2006(190): **Sad** dness is like having your _heart_ captured and _jailed_ because of some **sad** or terrible event, etc. Here the **sad** _heart_ waits for someone to come and _un_ -lock their _jail cell_ and set them free again.;2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 21-8-2006(74): Stuck in a _jail cell_ with his _heart_ crying out to see his family again, the prisoner has never felt so **sad**.
限;limit;Pinnacle . . . silver.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 12-4-2007(162): The speed **limit** at _The Pinnacle_ is posted on _silver_ signs.;2) [[pazustep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pazustep)] 10-8-2008(64): At _The Pinnacle_ , they **limit** how much _silver_ you can have. Too much silver will lead to wrongfulness.
消;extinguish;Among the many things _water_ is useful for is **extinguishing** fires, and that is just what we have here. First of all, take the _water_ at the left as the _drops of water_ that are used to depict _water_ in general. In the best of all possible worlds, the most efficient way to **extinguish** a fire would be to see that each _drop of water_ hits one _spark_ of the conflagration. An unthinkable bit of utopian fire fighting, you say to yourself, but helpful for assigning this key word its primitives.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 30-7-2007(127): To **extinguish** a SPARK, you need WATER.;2) [[zdnks](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zdnks)] 31-10-2007(55): You need a few drops of water to **extinguish** the candle.
絶;discontinue;Thread . . . color.;1) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 12-9-2007(144): The _Spider-man_ 's multi-colored tie-dye costume comic book series was **discontinue** d after only one issue because of poor sales and fan protests.;2) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 20-2-2008(107): _Spiderman_ has decided to **discontinue** his red _color_ suit in favor of the black one, it looks way cooler.
幾;how many;_Two cocoons_ . . . _person_ . . . _fiesta_.;1) [[misha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/misha)] 30-10-2007(286): At the Mexican _fiesta_ , there is a _coccoon_ eating competition. **How many** _coccoons_ can one _person_ eat? No one has managed more than two before giving up…;2) [[erikkusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/erikkusan)] 7-3-2006(43): **How many** went to the party? Two aliens and one person (I feel sorry for that person).
追;chase;Maestro . . . road.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 14-2-2007(222): _Maestro_ , coattails flapping wildly, is being **chase** d down the _road_ by his fans.;2) [[sleepyday](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sleepyday)] 26-10-2008(51): This Kanji reminds me of Nodame Cantabile. I just have to imagine Chiaki, our _maestro_ in training, getting **chase** d by Nodame down the _road_.
勝;victory;Moon . . . quarter . . . muscle.;1) [[happychair](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/happychair)] 6-3-2006(230): After your **VICTORY** cut your enemy's FLESH into QUARTERs to show your POWER.;2) [[msukovich](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/msukovich)] 12-5-2008(100): After England's **victory** over Scottish rebel William Wallace, they had his _flesh_ drawn and _quartered_ and then sent around Britain to demonstrate their _power_.
離;detach;_Top hat_ . . . _villain_ . . . _belt_ . . . _elbow_ . . . _turkey_. This is potentially one of the most difficult characters to remember. Tackle it positively and let the image  "sink in" by carrying it around with you today and calling it up in your spare moments.;1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 9-5-2007(295): I've finally met my arch-rival, the evilest of all _villains_. Finally, I'm about to fight him. But what's this? He's suspiciously quiet. I move to attack him, and his right arm falls off at the _elbow_. Strange. I walk up to him and **detach** his left arm. Very strange. I undo his _belt_ , and take off his _top hat_ … BLAST! It was just a decoy _turkey_!;2) [[desmidus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/desmidus)] 16-6-2008(135): The most ridiculous character ever dreamt up for a film. **DETACH** O, a top-hat wearing villian who is able to **detach** his body parts for use as weapons. His most powerful weapons are his elbows, which he can **detach** , tie together with his belt and use as nunchucks. **DETACH** O has a sidekick turkey which he uses as an advanced scout as well.
精;refined;Rice . . . blue.;1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 8-8-2007(154): Before _rice_ is **refined** , it is actually _blue_ …bet ya didn't know that!! (alternate…. _Condi Rice_ was _blue_ when insurgents blew up the iraqi **refinery** where oil is **refined** ).;2) [[joxn_costello](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joxn_costello)] 15-1-2009(141): Very **refined** people in the upper classes have skin as pale as _rice_ and _blue_ blood.
与;bestow;_Slingshot_ . . . _one_. Later we shall learn the character for _give_ (Frame 2046), but even so, it is a good idea already at this point to distinguish this key word from _impart_ (Frame 795) and _grant_ (Frame 1131).;1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 26-5-2007(229): David went to battle with a **slingshot** and it only took him **one** shot to slay Goliath. Partly because of this, the prophet Nathan was later instructed to _bestow_ upon David the throne of all Israel.;2) [[eieneverafter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eieneverafter)] 22-4-2008(156): In The Legend of Zelda Ocarina of Time, _one_ of the first weapons **bestow** ed on Link was the _slingshot_.
守;guard;The notion of **guarding** something easily brings to mind the image of someone standing **guard** , like the royal soldiers in front of Buckingham Palace or the Pope's Swiss **Guard**. The whole idea of hiring **guards** is that they should stick like _glue_ to your _house_ to protect it from unwanted prowlers. So go ahead and _glue_ a **guard** to your _house_ in imagination.;1) [[certain](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/certain)] 5-4-2006(173): A **GUARD** is usually "glued" to the house he watches.;2) [[rakutenka](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rakutenka)] 2-7-2007(65): A **guard** provides a _measure_ of security to those under a _roof_.
藤;wisteria;Flower . . . moon . . . quarter . . . rice grains.;1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 7-5-2007(205): According to legend, the great Ogaki **wisteria** tree grew and _flowered_ from magical _rice grains_ that were planted under the _quarter_ _moon_.;2) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 23-12-2005(88): The **wisteria** is a type of hanging vine covered with _flowers_. By the light of the _quarter_ _moon_ , the _flowers_ look like clusters of _rice grains_.
類;sort;Rice . . . St. Bernard dog . . . head.;1) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 5-1-2008(277): Note this character means **sort** in the sense of what kind, I believe a better keyword would be "variety" and this character does appear in some dictionaries with the primary meaning as variety, my story: I'm in a Chinese restaurant and the waiter says "What **sort** of _rice_ would you like with your _dog head_?".;2) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 28-8-2007(118): What **SORT** of person comes from the U.S.? Well, some would say a person with a BIG HEAD.
妻;wife;Ten . . . rakes . . . woman.;1) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 30-8-2007(203): Ten rakes woman. your **wife** digs her fingernails into you and it feels like 10 rakes when she finds you ontop of another woman.;2) [[TheSleeve](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheSleeve)] 8-11-2007(139): (I'm really not sexist, this just helps me remember the kanji): I make my **WIFE** do all the yard work, and as a really mean joke, I bought her TEN RAKES for her birthday this year. "Do the yardwork, WOMAN! You have TEN perfectly good RAKES to choose from!".
素;elementary;Grow up . . . thread.;1) [[lerris](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lerris)] 26-7-2007(161): When he was _growing up_ , _Venom_ never had many friends in **elementary** school. 館;Bldg.;The abbreviation of **Building** suggests that this kanji is used in proper names, as indeed it often is. 史;history;A mouth . . . tucked under the arm.;1) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 24-11-2007(253): I sleep in **history** class with my _mouth tucked under my arm_.;2) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 3-9-2007(118): **History** students usually going to school with a **history** book tucked under their arm. But now instead of a book, you have a small talking mouth that tell you about **history**. "When I was young, I used to walk 5 miles everyday…..".
那;interrogative;_Sword_ . . . _two_ . . . _city walls_. Used classically to indicate an **interrogative** part of speech, this character is used chiefly now for its sound.;1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-10-2007(106): If you arrive with _two swords_ at the _city walls_ , expect some **interrogative** s before they'll let you in.;2) [[woelpad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/woelpad)] 28-8-2008(9): **Interrogation** at the _city walls_ : "Any weapons, **question mark**." "Just a _blade_." "Why the _two_ scratches on the _blade_ , **question mark**." "To remind me that I cut off my other ear too, _exclamation mark_ ([exclamation](../v4/2680.html) (#2680 耶)).".

敷;spread;At the top we have the _arrowhead_ whose vertical line joins it to the _rice field_ (or _brains_ ) below it. 答;solution;Bamboo . . . fit.;1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 16-6-2007(204): The **solution** to this puzzle is, like the match stick game, to make the _bamboo_ pieces _fit together_.;2) [[kumakuma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kumakuma)] 17-7-2008(141): For the frustrated housewife the **solution** came in form of a BAMBOO stick that FITS her well.

折;fold;_Fingers_ . . . _ax_. Hint: make an image out of the Japanese art of "origami" (paper- **folding** ).;1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 14-1-2007(243): It's the latest Japanese game show: **Forudo**! Contestants are given a sheet of paper and are told to **fold** it into a complex origami shape. If they're not done in 60 seconds, a huge axe descends from the ceiling and chops their work in half. Contestants know to recoil their hands from the falling axe, but some have been so absorbed in **fold** ing, they ignore the buzzer and get their fingers chopped off.;2) [[Piitaa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Piitaa)] 22-6-2006(89): **Fold** some origami into the shape of an axe with your fingers. It's even as sharp, so watch out for paper cuts!

計;plot;_Words_ and a meter's _needle_ combine to form the sense of **plot** : to talk over plans and to calculate a course of action.;1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 12-6-2006(222): A **plot** is a summary of a book that can be given in _ten_ _words_.;2) [[gaijinda](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gaijinda)] 28-10-2007(124): _Say-ten_ 's (satan's) evil **plot**.
昭;shining;Let the key word suggest **shining** one's shoes, the purpose of which is to _seduce_ the _sun_ down on them for all to see.;1) [[erlog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/erlog)] 2-7-2008(263): **Shining** is the sun's seduction.;2) [[hazelsmrf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hazelsmrf)] 9-5-2008(176): The sun was **shining** so bright that it seduced Icarus and he flew too close.
注;pour;Picture **pouring** water from a lighted _candlestick_. Water spills everywhere.;2) [[Calchas](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Calchas)] 20-12-2007(65): Like water the hot wax **pour** ed down the side of the candlestick.
造;create;Think of **creating** as making something out of nothing. Then recall how the _way_ of _revelation_ laid out in the Bible begins with the story of how God **created** the world out of a dark and chaotic nothingness.;1) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 23-12-2007(284): A _cow_ **creates** a _road_ by _eating_ all the grass on its _path_.;2) [[saleem](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/saleem)] 23-3-2008(151): CREATION is the ROAD to REVELATION (if you're feeling artsy) :).
放;set free;The _taskmaster_ **sets** an unruly servant **free** , giving him no more than a quick glance at the _compass_ and a boot from behind.;1) [[Kurisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kurisu)] 2-3-2008(179): Go in any _direction_ away from your _taskmaster_ when you are **set free**.;2) [[gothats](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gothats)] 27-7-2010(28): Remember what the Genie from Aladdin wanted, to "to be free: be my own master, choose my own direction".
庭;courtyard;Cave . . . courts.;1) [[saranich](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/saranich)] 21-12-2006(220): When the courthouse caved in, trials had to be held in the **courtyard**.;2) [[peacemik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peacemik)] 7-9-2008(89): Back in caveman days, _courts_ were held in _caves_. When too many people showed up to watch, they spilled out into the **courtyard** (the yard outside the _cave_ _court_ ) . 庭 (にわ): garden, yard, compound 庭園 (ていえん): garden, park 校庭 (こうてい): schoolyard.
為;do;This character rightly belongs to the previous lesson, but we held it until now because of the final element, the _tail feathers_. After the _drop_ at the outset, the next three strokes are completely novel and should be given special attention.;1) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 12-3-2008(392): In this kanji, you can see 3 katakana characters: ソ, ユ, and then ユ again followed by TAIL FEATHERS. STORY: "So (ソ) you (ユ) wanna **DO** it?" "Only if you (ユ) **do** " says the female bird as she raises her TAIL FEATHERS.;2) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 12-10-2007(42): **Do** me _from_ behind, says the bird, as she shakes her _tailfeathers_.
波;waves;Water's . . . pelt.;1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 30-4-2007(241): **Waves** are the ocean's pelt (skin).;2) [[alanj](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/alanj)] 8-3-2008(88): The Inuit used _water_ -proof seal _pelts_ for their kayaks, to travel the **waves**.
断;severance;Fishhook . . . rice . . . ax.;1) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 14-9-2007(244): [Based on fuaburisu's] A man puts some _rice_ on a _fishhook_ as bait, but catches a fish so strong, he needs to take out his _axe_ and **sever** the line lest he be dragged into the depths.;2) [[marydj](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/marydj)] 25-10-2007(117): When you get the ax at work, use your **severance** pay to buy fishhooks and rice. 働;work;_Person_ . . . _move_. 格;status;If you can imagine _trees_ as **status** symbols (as they might well be for those living in Japan's congested cities, where greenery has become something of a luxury item), then _each_ might be aiming to have his/her own _tree_ , just to keep up with the Suzukis.;1) [[Istvan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Istvan)] 13-6-2007(250): "Ranger!
