久;long time;This character uses the diagonal sweep of the second stroke to double up for _bound up_ and a _person_. Think of a mummy, and the key word will not be far behind.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 26-2-2007(225): Note: this is the ひさ in ひさしぶり . **Long time** no see _mummy_! (A bound up person).;2) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 2-3-2006(33): This is a picture of a person bowing "long time no see!".
背;stature;One's **stature** is measured according to the  " _northern_ -most" _part of the body_.;1) [[alantin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/alantin)] 23-5-2007(144): While japanese people are generally small, people in the northern contryes have taller **stature** because of all the flesh they eat!;2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 16-1-2008(68): Up in the Great White _North_ , we eat a lot of _meat_ \- thus giving us great **STATURE**. Mmmm…. baby seals.
旅;trip;Let the last 4 strokes, which are also the concluding strokes to the character for _garment_ , represent a _rag_ as its primitive meaning. We shall meet this only on one other occasion. This gives us as our elements: _banner_ . . . _rag_.;1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 4-12-2006(237): The boat starts to leave on it's **trip** across the Atlantic. Underneath a huge _banner_ that spans the width of the ship and says "Bon Voyage", the people wave their _rags_ signalling a safe journey for all on board the Titanic.;2) [[partyrash](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/partyrash)] 22-1-2008(112): After a long long **trip** , what once was a proud beautiful banner, we had nothing more than a simple rag remaining.
続;continue;Thread . . . sell.;1) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 8-11-2007(239): Even though Peter Parker has become _Spiderman_ , he **continue** s to sell pictures that he takes as a photographer.;2) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 13-10-2008(131): Here's how Spiderman comics sell: At the end of the comic they leave with with a cliffhanger and say "to be **continue** d". In fact, the japanese verb 続く is used in comics and tv shows to mean "to be **continue** d". They have adapted the model created by Spiderman to hook the readers so that they can sell more comics.
広;wide;Cave . . . elbow.;1) [[daredawg3583](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/daredawg3583)] 22-1-2007(217): The Batcave is very **wide** and has a lot of elbow room for Batman to do his yoga.;2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 28-4-2006(107): A **wide** cave has a lot of "elbow room".
線;line;Thread . . . spring.;1) [[jamestaverner](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jamestaverner)] 15-2-2008(251): This kanji is used for train **lines**. _Spiderman_ does a hot _spring_ tour of Japan using the train **lines**. You can see the Spidey costume hanging on the washing **line** as he enjoys the onsen.;2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 11-7-2006(75): Japan's train **line** s are like threads that spring from Tokyo station.
科;department;Think here of the faculty or **department** you entered in university, using the elements: _measuring cup_ . . . _wheat_.;1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 4-8-2010(235): University **department** s study things like _wheat_ (agriculture) and the _big dipper_ (physics/astronomy), and exact _measuring cups_ (engineering).;2) [[cornrow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cornrow)] 9-12-2008(160): The national **DEPARTMENT** of _WHEATS_ and _MEASURES_. 北;north;The cold air from the **north** is so strong that we see _two people sitting on the ground_ back to back, their arms interlocked so they don't blow away. (Pay special attention to the drawing of the first 3 strokes.);1) [[Codexus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Codexus)] 17-12-2007(148): **Warning:** The left part is NOT the primitive _turtle_! The stroke order is different. Sometimes it will look exactly the same but not always depending on the font / style used to draw this character. Be sure to study the difference!;2) [[shadolite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shadolite)] 20-3-2008(122): In the **north** , the weather is so cold that people are often seen sitting back to back to preserve warmth.
驚;wonder;Awe . . . team of horses.;1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 19-4-2007(219): You stand in AWE at the 8th **WONDER** of the world, a huge TROJAN HORSE.;2) [[chibimizuno](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chibimizuno)] 16-9-2009(79): This is another word for surprise. [驚く＝おどろく](midori://search?text=驚く＝おどろく) = surprise. The Trojans stood in _awe_ of the magnificent Trojan Horse that they thought was a gift. But imagine their **surprise (wonder)** when a bunch of Greeks came rushing out of it! (To further cement the connection between the primitives, if needed: It's a **wonder** that the Trojans managed to speak _keigo_ 敬語 even then, saying " わたくしたちを殺さないでください !! お願い致します !!").
売;sell;A _samurai_ , out of a job, is going door-to-door **selling** little windup _crowns_ with _human legs_ that run around on the floor looking like headless monarchs.;1) [[Zarxrax](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zarxrax)] 4-4-2008(101): The _samurai_ happened to find an extra large _crown_ that he wore as a belt on his waist, just above his _legs_. I wonder if he will **sell** it to me?;2) [[Yasser](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Yasser)] 20-11-2008(91): A "samurai" will never **sell** his "crown" (king), even it meant having both his "human legs" chopped off!
忘;forget;Perish . . . heart.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 7-3-2007(331): You only truly **forget** her when she has _perish_ ed in your _heart_.;2) [[alantin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/alantin)] 1-11-2007(47): To **forget** means that something perishes from your heart.
談;discuss;In almost every attempt to **discuss** an issue, the fervor of one's convictions comes to the surface and creates an _inflammation_ of _words_ (if you will, the  "cuss" in **discuss** ).;1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 10-10-2007(218): Think of an online **discuss** ion group where misunderstanding someone's _words_ leads to _flaming_. An angry **discuss** ion = _inflamed_ _words_.;2) [[zardoz73](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zardoz73)] 3-8-2008(104): Internet **discuss** ions often involve inflammatory words. Flame war!

"Buy my **products**!! Buy my **products**! Or else I'll take my own _life_ "! Man, that's selling on pressure.
降;descend;_Pinnacle_ . . . _walking legs_ . . . _sunglasses with a lens popped out_. Distinguish from _fall_ (Frame 320) and _crash_ , which we considered in the previous frame.;1) [[wingedge](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wingedge)] 22-12-2007(207): "Sunglasses-missing-one-lens" is obviously the _monocle_. The proper, high- class way to **descend** _The Pinnacle_ is wearing a _monocle_ with your _walking legs_ splayed to a full gentlemanly stride.;2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 30-5-2007(33): After a cool, hip businessman angered the executives at _The Pinnacle_ , they beat him up, popping out a lens from his _sunglasses_ , and tossed out the window, head first, _walking legs_ second. One executive later commented, "It was like he was **descend** ing into Hell from Heaven!".
谷;valley;_Go in_ . . . _an umbrella_ . . . _a mouth_. Because of space restrictions, the element for _go in_ is shortened in this character. If you stand on your head and look at this kanji, the image of a **valley** stands out more clearly: the _mouth_ of the river whose water flows down at the intersection of the two mountains, with the final two strokes adding the element of perspective. Now get back on your feet again and see if the image still remains clear. If not, then return to the primitives and make a story in the usual way.;1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 21-2-2007(207): This could be seen as a very accurate pictograph of another type of **valley** : a **valley** _mouth_ open under the _umbrella_ of inner labia, with the outer labia _parted_ above. There are even more connections to be made among the primitive keywords and the visuals, but i will _enter_ no further…;2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 3-7-2006(81): Think of the classic anime 風の **谷** のナウシカ (Nausicaa of the _Valley_ of the Wind). We see Nausicaa _entering_ the _valley_ _mouth_ gliding on an _umbrella_.
志;intention;Samurai . . . heart.;1) [[narafan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/narafan)] 25-7-2007(293): A _samurai'_ s **intentions** always come from the _heart_.;2) [[amthomas](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/amthomas)] 17-1-2007(107): _Gentleman_ always have _hearts_ full of good **intention** s.
鳴;chirp;Mouth . . . bird.;1) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 25-10-2005(219): A **chirp** is quite simply the sound that comes from the mouth of birds.;2) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 24-7-2008(91): This kanji is not limited to the **chirp** of a _bird_ , but stands for the sound of any kind of animal. Picture a very weird bird that can imitate with its _mouth_ (a bird with mouth, heh) the voice of many different animals: Meeow! Woof! Mooo! Cuack!!! (Maybe the bird has Kirby powers and obtains the abilities of the animals it eats).
越;surpass;Here we see two _parades_ in competition, each trying to **surpass** the other by _running_ at high speed from one town to the next. Note the little  "hook" at the end of the first stroke of the element for _parade_. This is the ONLY time it appears like this in the kanji treated in this book.;1) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 4-9-2007(223): The person in charge of _running_ the _parade_ **surpass** ed all our expectations (by just a extra drop…).;2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 7-1-2008(102): The _parade_ of _runners_ are all trying to **SURPASS** each other - and they end up running all the way to _Vietnam_ (note that this kanji is also used for the country of Vietnam).

As you can imagine, the crowd goes **quiet** with shock.

走;run;**Running** , we are told here, _mends_ the _soil_. Observe in the following frames how this kanji can embrace other elements from below, much the same way as the element for _road_ does, and how, in order to do this, the final stroke needs to be lengthened.;1) [[Samchan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Samchan)] 4-8-2008(319): Hint: This kanji is NOT _soil_ on top of _mend_ , as Heisig claims - that would duplicate one of the strokes. Instead, it is _10_ on top of _mend_. So my story is: If you **run** _10_ miles, you will need to _mend_ your socks!;2) [[poseid0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/poseid0n)] 11-7-2007(33): The sports ground needs MENDING after the game as the players have been **RUN** NING around which has caused the ground to be chopped up.
舞;dance;The top two strokes show someone _reclining_ , and the next six are a pictograph of an oaken _tub_ ribbed with metal strips, like the kind once used for bathing. At the bottom, the _sunglasses_ round off the character.;1) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 16-6-2007(228): The yakuza boss reclines in the oaken bathtub wearing his shades while his personal harem **dance** s nakes for him.;2) [[captal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/captal)] 15-6-2008(120): I learned [nothingness](../v4/1775.html) (#1775 無) first because it is a very common kanji. Probably easier to think of this kanji in that context. Attractive **dance** rs should **dance** wearing **nothing** but **sunglasses**.

He's brought down terrorist organisations, drug syndicates, but gets all worked up when catching a fish… what a guy.

送;send off;Road . . . golden calf.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 16-3-2007(188): After worshipping the _golden calf_ , God sent the Jews on a long _road_ through the wilderness.;2) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 28-3-2008(92): The problem with the "gold calf" primitive is that the first vertical stroke of "heavenly" is shorter than the second stroke. But as we know, "heavenly" clearly has the FIRST stroke longer, not the second. The primitives we really have here are "animal horns (first 3 strokes)" and "big/dog (last 3 strokes)." What are the BIGGEST ANIMAL HORNS that you can think of? For me its a MASTODON. STORY: In caveman times, you SENT OFF packages with the MASTODON express.

詩;poem;Since silence is treasured so highly at a _Buddhist temple_ the _words_ spoken there must be well-chosen. Perhaps this is why the records of the monks often read to us like **poems**. 似;similar;Be sure to keep this key word distinct from _likeness_ (Frame 104). 河;river;The character in this frame represents a step up from the _stream_ we met in Frame 134, it is a full-sized **river**. The _water_ to the left tells us what we are dealing with, and the _can_ at the right tells us that our  "little engine that _could_ " has now become amphibious and is chugging down the Mighty Mississip' like a regular riverboat.;1) [[gsantise](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gsantise)] 25-8-2007(175): A **river** CAN exist only if there is WATER.;2) [[Avispa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Avispa)] 29-8-2007(85): I kept confusing this with _stream_. My Japanese friend said that to him this is for an artificial **river**. Looking at kanji compounds with this there are two that struck me: One is the Yellow **River** in China ( 黄河 ), and the other is the Milky Way ( 銀河 ). Now I either think of the Little Engine that _could_ dragging a bunch of stuff down a **river** in China and polluting it (so it turned yellow) or I see the Little Engine that Could flying across the sky making the Milky Way.
怪;suspicious;State of mind . . . spool.;1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 1-11-2007(171): When you're **suspicious** , your state of mind twists round and round like a spool of thread.;2) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 4-6-2007(85): Imagine a loud farting sound on The Enterprise (sorry). Everyone looks around trying to find who did it. The one looking most **suspicious** is _Data_. His _soiled crotch_ gives him away.
秋;autumn;Wheat . . . fire.;1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 27-8-2007(268): In **AUTUMN** , the WHEAT looks the color of FIRE, meaning it's time to harvest it.;2) [[torida](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/torida)] 2-6-2008(96): Every **autumn** the wheat is set on fire to clear the way for next year's crop…
晩;nightfall;Sun . . . rabbit.;1) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 9-9-2007(233): At **nightfall** the _sun excuses_ itself and goes to sleep.;2) [[Asriel](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Asriel)] 13-7-2009(93): This is EASY!!! Japanese people see a RABBIT ON THE MOON (<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moon_rabbit> ) and so **nightfall** is when the _sun_ leaves to make way for the _rabbit_.
夕;evening;Just as the word **evening** adds a touch of formality or romanticism to the ordinary word  "night," so the kanji for **evening** takes the ordinary looking _moon_ in the night sky and has a cloud pass over it (as we saw in the last frame).;1) [[stereovibe](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stereovibe)] 13-2-2008(113): The **evening** is young, the _moon_ is not full.;2) [[ctalbottclark](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ctalbottclark)] 7-3-2008(33): In the **evening** , the crescent _moon_ hangs in the sky.
将;leader;Turtle . . . vulture . . . glue.;1) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 1-5-2009(345): The **leader** in this race is the _turtle_! It appears he has covered the _vulture_ ’s feet in _glue_ , so that the vulture cannot get off the starting block.;2) [[Doodsaq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Doodsaq)] 18-12-2007(73): X-men and TMNT join forces: Their new **leader** is an awsome asshole. He is simply Wolverine and Raphael glued together back to back (the biggest assholes from both groups combined).
林;grove;Learn this frame in connection with the next one. A **grove** is a small cluster of _trees_. Hence the simple reduplication of the kanji for _tree_ gives us the **grove**.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 30-7-2007(92): A **grove** has at least two TREEs.;2) [[coolbananas](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/coolbananas)] 6-3-2009(23): If you need a mnemonic to remember this then you had better give up now!
鳥;bird;_Dove_ . . . _one_ . . . _tail feathers_. This is, of course, the character from which we derived the primitive meaning of _dove_. Note the lengthening of the second stroke.;1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 18-7-2007(178): There is only _one_ **bird** with such beautiful _white_ tail feathers: the albino _peakcock_.;2) [[BigAmish](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BigAmish)] 15-8-2008(87): The **BIRD** let loose a _WHITE ONE_ from it's _TAIL FEATHERS_ …right on my new car!
己;self;The kanji carries the abstract sense of the **self** , the deep-down inner structure of the human person that mythology has often depicted as a _snake_ \- which is what the kanji shows pictographically. Be sure to keep it distinct from the similar keywords, _oneself_ (frame 36) and _I_ (frame 17).;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 25-10-2005(255): This kanji looks like the "s" of "self", looking at its own reflection in a mirror (reversed sideways), as if pondering about his "self".;2) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 18-8-2007(90): When Superman looks at him **self** in the mirror, this is what he sees on his chest.
件;affair;Person . . . cow.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 26-12-2006(178): Note: this kanji refers to event or case. Current **Affair** headline: _Mr. T_ has **affair** with _cow_. "It's only animal 'man' enough for me".;2) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 19-6-2008(37): How could you have an **affair** with _that person_?? She's a _cow_!
城;castle;In this frame, we see a mound of _dirt_ that is being _turned into_ a **castle** (the way you may have done as a child playing on the beach).;1) [[stefanot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stefanot)] 21-11-2006(154): The sand **castle** is just the [soil](../v4/150.html) (#150 土) that _turns into_ a **castle**.;2) [[Ninjasha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ninjasha)] 3-3-2008(71): "Someday this mound of _dirt_ here will _turn into_ our **CASTLE** ", the ants think to themselves when scoping out a new ant hill.
血;blood;The _drop_ in the _dish_ is **blood**. It is similar to the _drop_ we saw earlier on the _dagger_ in the character for _blade_ (Frame 88).;1) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 6-6-2007(184): Vampire orders **blood** in one of those posh restaurants. Imagine his shock when all he gets is a giant white bowl and just a single drop of **blood** in the centre and a drizzling of balsamic around the edge. Disgusted he calls the manager over tells him its overpriced tosh and bites into his neck with a huge gush of **blood** spraying everywhere.;2) [[genbaku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/genbaku)] 17-1-2008(49): You cut yourself washing the dishes, drop of **blood**.
徳;benevolence;_Going_ . . . _needle_ . . . _eye_ . . . _heart_. Refer back now to the note in frame 890.;1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 29-5-2007(136): Hearkening back to the kanji for LISTEN… **Benevolence** is a good _listener_ who is willing to _go_ the distance to help.;2) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 29-4-2007(109): In a rare act of **benevolence** , the Sparten _column_ removes the needle from the _cyclops's_ eye, and he repays them by eating their _hearts_.
腹;abdomen;If you _double back_ (fold over) most animals - or people, for that matter - in the middle, the _part of the body_ where the crease comes is the **abdomen**.;1) [[KANJI](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/KANJI)] 28-11-2006(127): The only **body** part that **doubles over**.;2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 30-8-2007(66): Imagine getting punched in the **abdomen** , a fairly tender part of _flesh_ , and instead of doubling forward, you _double back_. That would be pretty painful.
組;association;Thread . . . shelf.;1) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 18-9-2007(241): The leader of the _Spiderman_ **association** has tons of _Spiderman_ figurines lined up on his _shelf_.;2) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 2-3-2008(60): Watch this: <http://i146.photobucket.com/albums/r249/sith_lord10/updated%20showroom%20july/s29.jpg> The leader of the Spiderman **association** has tons of Spiderman figurines lined up on his shelf.(Zactacular).
満;full;_Water_ . . . _flowers_ . . . _both_. Given the abstract nature of this last primitive, you may want to borrow the image from the previous frame.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 24-8-2007(244): Add _water_ THEN the _flowers_. With _both_ the vase will be **full**.;2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 22-5-2007(128): I was thirsty so I gulped down the _water_. Then I realized I was also hungry. So I ate the _flowers_. Yes, I am responsible for _both_ the missing _water_ and the missing _flowers_. Yes, I'm afraid _both_. Am I still hungry or thirsty? Thank you for asking! How kind! But no, I feel quite **full** now.
妙;exquisite;The primitive for _woman_ is on the left (there and at the bottom of another primitive is where you will always find her), and to the right the element for _few_. When we refer to a _woman_ as **exquisite** , we mean to praise her as the sort of person we meet but _few_ and far between. If you are interested in etymologies, it might help to recall that the Latin phrase lying at the root of the English word **exquisite** carries this same sense of  "seeking out" the rare from the ordinary.;1) [[amthomas](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/amthomas)] 11-6-2007(305): **Exquisite** _women_ are _few_ and far between.;2) [[LeoOra](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LeoOra)] 27-1-2008(44): A geisha is an **exquisite** and **delicate** (another meaning of this kanji) women, however, even in the past there was only few of them.
昔;once upon a time;_Salad_ . . . _days_. This is the character with which Japanese fairytales commonly begin.;1) [[the_marshal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/the_marshal)] 30-4-2006(209): **Once upon a time** , the children were forced to eat their salad every day.;2) [[andye](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/andye)] 11-1-2007(147): For those who don't know the expression, "salad days" means the time of one's youth. (originally from Shakespeare's Antony and Cleopatra - see <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salad_days>). I suspect Heisig chose "salad" as the name for the radical just for this phrase…
料;fee;Measuring cup . . . rice.;1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 29-9-2006(259): When buying _rice_ , the **fee** is calculated by the cup. Naturally we don't just use any cup, it has to be a proper _measuring cup_.;2) [[wzafran](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wzafran)] 24-10-2007(62): Samurai(s) once received their **fee** in the form of _rice_ that had been carefully weighed in a _measuring cup_ beforehand.
円;circle;This kanji, also used for Yen, is one you are not likely to need to study formally, since you can hardly get around in Japan without it. The connection is that the yennies, like pennies, are **circular** in shape. In any case, the elements are: _glass canopy_ . . . _walking stick_ . . . _one_.;1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 10-2-2007(154): The shape of a Yen coin.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 28-1-2006(40): A poor old man is almost killing himself trying to lift a huge _glass hood_ with his _cane_ (using it as a lever), to get to just _one_ yen coin. Note : the kanji refers to a circular, round object, but also to the Japanese currency (pronounced "en").
独;single;Think of this key word in connection with bachelorhood. The elements: _wild dogs_ . . . _insect_.;1) [[wasurenaide](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wasurenaide)] 19-6-2007(278): The bachelor's apartment looked like it had been attacked by a _pack of wild dogs_. There were even _insects_ in the kitchen. No wonder he's **single**!;2) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 14-10-2009(123): A **SINGLE** guy is a WILD DOG who BUGS many women.
雲;cloud;Here is the full character for **cloud** from which the primitive for a _rising cloud_ derives. _Clouds_ begin with vapors _rising_ up in small _clouds_ from the surface of the earth, and then gathering to make **clouds** that eventually dump their _rain_ back on the earth.;1) [[roderik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/roderik)] 22-4-2008(199): Every _rising **cloud**_ is a potential _rain_ **cloud**. (Thanks astridtops).;2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 9-6-2006(65): Every **cloud** is a potential _rain_ **cloud**.
沢;swamp;Water . . . shakuhachi.;1) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 7-11-2007(312): You're hiding from the enemy underwater in a **swamp**. To breathe, you have your _shakuhachi_ flute poking up through the surface of the _water_.;2) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 27-7-2007(53): Sirens in the **swamp** play eerie music on their shakuhachi flutes to lure you in - you follow the enchanting music then its too late as you get trapped in the **swamp**!
雑;miscellaneous;Baseball . . . trees . . . turkey.;1) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 13-2-2007(297): Newscast: "Among today's **miscellaneous** stories, we have a report on a _baseball_ team that was chased up a _tree_ by a _turkey_. Stay tuned for this and more!".;2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 25-4-2006(69): On the left we have baseball and wood, which obviously means a baseball bat. Instead of balls, there are **miscellaneous** other objects you may hit with it. While beating people may be one favorite use, in this case we see it used for making turkey mash.
許;permit;Words . . . horse.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(209): If horses could speak, you might have to ask their permission before mounting them.;2) [[pmbeddall](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pmbeddall)] 26-10-2007(117): Mr Ed ( a famous talking _horse_ ) was finally at a loss for _words_ when told he would need a **permit** for public speaking.
窓;window;House . . . human legs . . . elbow . . . heart.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(399): This is either a love scene or a murder scene that you are seeing through a **window**. The love scene: through the **window** of a house (from a distance), you see a pair of human legs, then elbows, and then some pink hearts floating up like in a cartoon. The murder scene: peering through the **window** of a house, you see a gruesome murder scene. Human legs dangling from a ceiling fan, an elbow sticking out of a wall, and a heart still beating on the carpet.;2) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 21-6-2006(81): A photographer is at _home_ , recovering his broken _human legs_. With nothing better to do, he is looking through the rear **window** with his camera (he needs to use his _elbow_ to support those heavy lenses) until his _heart_ begins to race as he witnesses a murder!
往;journey;_Column_ . . . _candlestick_. This character has the special sense of **journeying** to someplace or other.;1) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 1-5-2009(186): In Medieval Japan, _going_ to see your _lord_ was often a long **journey**.;2) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 10-1-2006(69): The fellowship of the ring is on a long **journey** through the depths of Khaz Modan. Imagine they walk through the hall of pillars, with only light being from their own candlesticks that. Soon they will meet much more light than they would ever want to…
示;show;Although the elements _two_ and _little_ are available for the using, it may be easier to remember this character as a picture of an altar. Something placed atop the altar is put on **show** for all to see.;1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 26-5-2007(203): A boy made an _altar_ , but he's afraid to **show** it to God because he thinks it's _two little_.;2) [[BigAmish](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BigAmish)] 15-8-2008(86): "I'll **SHOW** you mine if you **show** me yours!", she said. I did  & she scoffed because it was _TWO LITTLE_.
逃;escape;When **escaping** from something or someone, one always feels as if one is not going fast enough, like a _turtle_ on an expressway. (Since the _turtle_ is on the _road_ and not on the left, it can keep its full kanji shape as given in frame 250.);1) [[Georgi87](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Georgi87)] 3-4-2008(93): I used my pants to make a rope, which I then used to **escape** from prison, hence the naked, hairy legs running along the road!;2) [[atomiton](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/atomiton)] 1-3-2010(64): MARIO KART: When you're blasting down the **road** in Mario Kart, it's REALLY hard to **escape** from **turtle shells**. Especially the red and blue ones!!
喜;rejoice;Drum . . . mouth.;1) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 31-1-2008(189): The _samurai_ sitting on the _drum_ is on a stage, and the people below him are **rejoicing** with their _mouths_ in unison. It helps me to imagine the placement this way.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 13-3-2007(59): **Rejoice** with the sound of _drums_ and _voice_!
官;bureaucrat;By replacing the _maestro_ 's baton (the _drop_ ) with the roof of a _house_ , we have his equivalent in the institutional world of big government: the **bureaucrat**.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 1-1-2007(208): No one likes classical music anymore. Our _Maestro_ is here at _home_ without his baton sighing sadly before he heads off for another day as his new job as a **bureaucrat**.;2) [[stehr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stehr)] 29-9-2007(67): **Bureaucrat** , def: The maestro without a baton, the one who orchestrates oppressive rules, regulations and taxes on every household.
肉;meat;Let this doubling of one of the elements for " _inside_ " yield the sense of " _insides_ " to approach the key word, **meat**. The abbreviated form of this character gave us the primitive meaning of _flesh_ or _part of the body_ for the kanji 月.;1) [[DrWarrior12](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrWarrior12)] 13-1-2008(176): Here we are looking at an x-ray of a cannibal whose insides are full on people-meat.;2) [[narafan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/narafan)] 19-9-2007(61): A _person's_ _inside_ \- fleshy, raw, pink, **meat**.
暮;livelihood;Imagine that you have chosen the occupation of the keeper of a _graveyard_ and spend your _days_ tending to other's dead hood in order to make your means of **livelihood**.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 31-7-2007(215): He made a **livelihood** out of robbing GRAVEYARDS in broad DAYlight.;2) [[Ryuujin27](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ryuujin27)] 31-12-2006(61): I like trikatu's simple way to remember this, but just in case the primitive placements confuse you, change it around to this: Before you complain about your **livelihood** , think about spending your days _under_ a graveyard. Life is always better than death, eh?
博;Dr.;At the left we have the _needle_ , at the right, the kanji for _specialty_ , plus an extra _drop_ at the top. Think of a **Dr.** who is a _specialist_ with a _needle_ (an acupuncturist) and let the _drop_ at the top represent the period at the end of **Dr.** In principle we are trying to avoid this kind of device, which plays on abstract grammatical conventions, but I think you will agree, after you have had occasion to use the right side of this kanji in forming other kanji, that the exception is merited in this case.;1) [[sethimayne](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sethimayne)] 22-9-2007(307): _Ten specialties_ grants you the title of **Dr.** with a dot.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 29-7-2006(109): Watch for [doctor](../v4/1694.html) (#1694 医), the sooner the better! In fact this kanji refers to someone well "learned", with extensive knowledge. This could apply to any kind of field. The kanji 医 ("doctor") is directly related to medicine. I would suggest to take away completely the idea of medicine here, and use a popular character whose name includes the keyword such as "Dr. Who", "Dr. Jekyll", even "Dr. Dobb's" if you're into programming.
吹;blow;To **blow** is really no more than a deliberate effort to make one's _mouth lack_ all the air that is in it.;1) [[usis35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/usis35)] 6-7-2008(281): This is clearly a **BLOW** JOB, we can see the MOUTH and the LACK OF condom. (I am sorry for the image, but it sticks forever in your mind).;2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 21-1-2008(70): How am I supposed to **BLOW** if I _lack_ a _mouth_? (Imagine a kid at his own birthday party, and - like Neo in the Matrix - had no oriface where his mouth was to be. And yet, the people cruelly cheer him on to **blow** out his candles…).
更;grow late;The implication behind the meaning of **grow late** is that things are changing in the same way that the day turns into night. The elements: _ceiling_ . . . _sun_ . . . _tucked under the arm_.;1) [[perfecturbo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perfecturbo)] 28-6-2006(235): It's starting to **GROW LATE** , so God will take the SUN, and TUCK IT UNDER HIS ARM, and walk away. In the morning, he'll bring it back, so don't worry.;2) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 24-7-2007(106): At [nightbreak](../v4/30.html) (#30 旦) the sun rises above the floor, so it is logical that when it is growing late, the sun would rise to the ceiling. Time to pack up your things and take your belongings under your arm.
困;quandary;Pent in . . . trees.;1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 17-10-2007(291): I'm supposed to make an enclosure for my _tree_ , but if I use its _wood_ for the enclosure, there won't be anything left to be _pent-in_. What a **quandary**!;2) [[pazustep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pazustep)] 22-7-2008(64): Trees need space to grow. If you _pent in_ a _tree_ , it will be in quite a **quandary**!
派;faction;_Water_ . . . _drag_ . . . _rag_. Back in frame 1127 we indicated that this latter radical would come up once again, as it does in this and the following two frames.;1) [[revenantkioku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/revenantkioku)] 10-12-2007(321): Drag + rag gave me trouble until I came up with zombie for it. The zombie population became more diverse, separating into different **faction** s. One of them being the water Zombies.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 13-3-2007(48): The radical **faction** is almost eliminated, sir. They're living in the _sewers_ dressed in _rags_ and _dragging_ their supplies.
曲;bend;Picture yourself grabbing hold of the two strokes poking out the top of the kanji and wrenching them apart, thus giving the sense of **bend**. If you think of them as deriving from the element for _brains_ beneath (of course, the middle stroke has been reduplicated and pulled out to where it can be grabbed hold of), you can associate the key word with **bending** someone's mind to your own point of view.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 28-10-2005(250): It looks like the mouth of _Bender the robot_ , from Matt Groening's animated series "Futurama". Thus, I use the character _Bender the robot_ as a primitive.;2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 5-9-2006(120): Also means "melody". Think of it as a pictogram of a guitar where you have to **bend** the strings to make a **melody**.
傍;bystander;Person . . . stand . . . crown . . . compass.;1) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 30-4-2008(205): In Japan, the emperor is a **bystander** \- he _stands on his crown_ but can't really affect the _direction_ of the country. (thx shimouma).;2) [[the_marshal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/the_marshal)] 6-3-2006(132): Mr. T is in the street, standing up, wearing an golden crown and a compass in his hand… he's asking the **bystander** if they know how to get to buckingham palace (!).
縁;affinity;Thread . . . broom . . . sow.;1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 19-4-2007(206): There once was a lonely little pig that constantly followed Spiderman, always nuzzling his leg and oinking tenderly. Spiderman finally caved in and decided to keep the little pig under one condition: the _pig_ was to take a _broom_ and sweep up all of _Spiderman's leftover threads_ after having fought crime. The pig felt such **affinity** for Spiderman, he happily accepted—and did a good job too.;2) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 8-2-2008(159): Spiderman has no **affinity** for a broom hence his house is a pig sty.
橋;bridge;The **bridge** shown here is made of _trees_ in their natural form, except that the trunks have been carved into the forms of _angels_ , a sort of "Ponte degli Angeli.";1) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 27-7-2006(130): The nicest **bridge** is not in Holly _wood_ or Los _Angel_ es, but in San Francisco.;2) [[sutebun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sutebun)] 30-10-2007(93): A small 5 year old child has lost her mother in a tragic death. Her family tells her, "Don't worry, your mom is an angel now, in heaven, watching over you." The small girl takes this very literally and is found one day, gathering pieces of wood. Her dad asks her, "What are you doing with that wood?" "I'm trying to build a **bridge** to heaven to visit the angels.".
興;entertain;_Mortar_ . . . _same_ . . . _tool_. Be careful to make an image that keeps _same_ in the middle.;1) [[laner36](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laner36)] 21-11-2007(202): To me, this looks like a pictograph of a road leading to the big city (see the buildings?) where there are plenty of places to be **entertain** ed. Unfortunately in this city, every store is the _same: staples_. What _tools_! [ayoung24].;2) [[Shizuru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shizuru)] 27-8-2007(90): Photographically, this kanji simply looks like a set of two speakers (the staples primitives) between the sub-woofer (primitive for same) – all this as a tool to **entertain** a group of drunks at a club.
附;affixed;Pinnacle . . . adhere.;1) [[ruuku35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruuku35)] 12-6-2006(153): A sign was **AFFIXED** on the PINNACLE of the Acropolis so that tourists would ADHERE to the rules.;2) [[xentropic](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/xentropic)] 27-7-2008(68): Signs are **affixed** to walls in _The Pinnacle_ to ensure tourists _adhere_ to the rules.
里;ri;That's right - a **_ri_**. Don't bother looking it up in your English dictionary, it's a Japanese word for measuring distances. One **_ri_** is about 4 kilometers or 2.5 miles. The kanji depicts how the measure came to be used. Atop we see the _rice field_ , and below the element for _land_. Those four sections you see in the _rice field_ (and which we made mention of when first we introduced the character in frame 14) are actually measurements of _land_ , much the same as farm-sections in the United States have given us the notion of a "country mile." The _land_ division based on the size of a _rice field_ is called a **_ri_**.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 30-7-2007(141): The **ri** is a Japanese way of measuring the area of the GROUND underneath a **RI** CE FIELD.;2) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 18-12-2007(86): Hint: Heisig makes here a severe disservice to everyone by using a weird keyword for this character. You'll save a lot (and I mean, a whole lot) of trouble later by giving it instead its intended meaning: **House of the Parents**.
並;row;This character represents a slightly stylized duplication of the kanji for _stand up_. By lengthening the sixth and seventh strokes, you will see how this is done.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 8-6-2007(290): This is a simplification of 竝, a ideogram of _two_ people _standing_ in a **row**.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 12-1-2006(53): Hint : as a primitive I use the image of a **row** ing boat. In a **row** ing boat people sit in **row** s, but also side-by-side (another meaning of the kanji), working together (yet another meaning of this kanji). Note : there will also be a kanji for "rowboat" coming at frame 1876. The **row** ing boat is associated with the sport, and is a primitive, while the kanji for "rowboat" has a generic meaning of "a small boat". In any case, the kanji for "rowboat" will not appear as a primitive in the book.
期;period;_Bushel basket_ . . . _month_. As the _month_ indicates, this has to do with **periods** of time.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 13-3-2007(195): The slowest remote chess game ever: a one _month_ **period** between every move.;2) [[lifeflaw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lifeflaw)] 5-4-2009(88): The slowest chess game ever: It took him a one _month_ **period** to move the _rook_! (Edited from dingomick).
米;rice;This kanji has a pictographic resemblance to a number of grains of **rice** lying on a plate in the shape of a star.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(154): Stroke order: I like to think of the first two strokes as “chop sticks” with which one eats the **rice**. The rest then is the “tree” meaning “plant” in this contexct. also: USA.;2) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 19-12-2007(52): Two _drops_ of **rice** in a _tree_ , simple.

抜;slip out;Fingers . . . friend.;1) [[rizzo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rizzo)] 27-10-2005(297): Don't let good _friends_ **slip out** between your _fingers_.;2) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 19-5-2007(146): Imagine a cliché Hollywood situation: one person is lying on the edge of the abyss and another (presumably his _friend_ ) is hanging, only thing holding him is the grip of their hands. 岸;beach;Mountain . . . cliff . . . dry.;1) [[sweetneet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sweetneet)] 4-11-2006(255): At the base of _mountain_ _cliff_ s, there is usually a **beach**. You often can see people lying there, _drying_ off after a swim.;2) [[Pete171](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Pete171)] 17-11-2008(91): Three impossibilities for a **beach** : There cannot be a **beach** at the top of a _mountain_. There cannot be a **beach** on the top of a _cliff_. There cannot be a **beach** that is completely _dry_.
吾;I;There are actually a number of kanji for the word **I** , but the others tend to be more specific than this one. The key word here should be taken in the general psychological sense of the "perceiving subject." Now the one place in our bodies that all _five_ senses are concentrated in is the head, which has no less than _five mouths_ : 2 nostrils, 2 ears, and 1 mouth. Hence, _five mouths_ = **I**.;1) [[kbaum](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kbaum)] 18-7-2007(170): I have 5 senses.;2) [[AxelFoe](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AxelFoe)] 12-11-2007(139): I eat five times at day.
求;request;Let the _drop_ in the upper right-hand corner of this character close the right angle off to make an _arrowhead_. Whenever we find the _needle_ with that _drop_ in an element that has no other special meaning, we will take advantage of this primitive meaning. At the bottom, we see the _grains of rice_ , the vertical line doubling up for the two elements. Do not confuse with _petition_ (Frame 143).;1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 16-6-2007(221): Enemy: "Any final **request** s?" // MacGyver: "Just an _arrowhead_ and some _grains of rice_." (MacGyver then throws the _grains of rice_ at the enemy and uses the _arrowhead_ to cut his hands free from the rope.).;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 22-8-2007(134): _Robin Hood_ holds his rich victim at _arrowpoint_ and kindly **request** s that he hands over his _grains of rice_.
労;labor;Schoolhouse . . . power.;1) [[partyrash](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/partyrash)] 15-1-2008(343): Those jocks who always tried to show their muscles in the schoolhouse are now the ones out there doing manual **labor** jobs while we sit here and learn Japanese. Ha!;2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 13-5-2007(92): At the _schoolhouse_ , the administration develops the children's _muscles_ by making them do manual **labour**.
薄;dilute;Take a good look at this kanji: the "strong" element here is really the _flower_ , not the _water_ as you might have thought on first glance. To the right is the _acupuncturist_ from frame 48. Taking the key word to connote **diluting** the vital humors of the body, we can imagine our _acupuncturist_ performing his task with _flowers_ in place of needles, and using their hollow stems to pipe _water_ into the body of the patient.;1) [[gaijinda](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gaijinda)] 17-10-2007(173): A _Dr._ missing his needle can only use **dilute** _flower water_ for medicine.;2) [[pm215](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pm215)] 15-2-2008(112): [As suggested by stehr and on the forum (<http://forum.koohii.com/viewtopic.php?id=1079>), we create a new keyword 'seaweed' for the _flower_ on top and _water_ below and to the left. See also [fall](../v4/299.html) (#299 落), [clan](../v4/1912.html) (#1912 藩),[seaweed](../v4/2035.html) (#2035 藻). This story is for people using that idea.] The _homeopath_ (a doctor without any needle) specialises in **dilute** medicines. This one's an essence of _seaweed_ – just dip the seaweed into the beaker, swish it about and remove. Barmy!
黙;silence;Oddly enough, the character for **silence** shows us a _black chihuahua_. 確;assurance;On the left you see the _rock_ , which is familiar enough. But pay attention to the right. Taking careful note of the unusual stroke order that has the "chimney" on the _house_ doubled up with the first stroke of the _turkey_ , we may see the right side as a _turkey house_ (or  " _coop_ "). We shall see this pattern only on one other occasion (Frame 2093), but even for these two characters it is well worth the trouble to single it out as a primitive.;1) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 30-8-2007(260): To assure that no one will get into the Turkey coop, put a huge rock in the entrance!;2) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 5-12-2008(129): You've heard the expression "killing two birds with one stone." ( 一石二鳥 _is-seki-ni- chou_ ). We'll, there's another one that roughly translates as "killing an entire coop with a giant boulder. " That's the method that hunters use when they want absolute **assurance** of taking home a bird.

末;extremity;This character is best learned in connection with that of the previous frame. The first stroke shows a branch that is longer than the main branch, indicating that the tree has reached the **extremity** of its growth, so that its branches stop spreading and start drooping downwards. Be sure to keep this imagery in mind, to avoid confusing this key word with synonyms that will appear later.;1) [[amema](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/amema)] 20-11-2007(108): The tree has reached the **extremity** of its growth and no longer produces small, new branches at the top. Instead the existing top branch just grows longer and longer.;2) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 8-4-2008(30): There are no great stories for this one yet, and I always forget it.. So, let's try something ridiculous: The man lived by himself in the wilderness, with no females within miles. So, his only way of relief was to stick his **extremity** into a small hole in a _tree_.. The poor guy. Which horizontal stroke is the **extremity**? The longer one or the shorter one? That, my friends, is up to your own imaginations. I'd prefer not to dwell on that point, myself. ,).

状;status quo;Did you ever hear of the _turtle_ who fell madly in love with a _chihuahua_ but could not have her because their two families did not like the idea of their children intermarrying? 刻;engrave;Acorn . . . saber.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 15-4-2008(199): This famous ninja (I always use ninjas with _sabres_ , distinct from samurai) used to **engrave** the kanji for his name onto _acorns_ , and throw the _acorns_ to distract his enemies. 仰;faceup;This character is used both for lying on one's back **faceup** , and for looking up to someone with respect and awe. 疑;doubt;Spoon . . . dart . . . chop-seal . . . zoo.;1) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 7-2-2008(337): (Katsuo) You come at the zoo entrance. 'lion feeding time is. bla bla' You are having serious **doubt** s about if you still want to go into this zoo.;2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 21-12-2007(100): A very **doubt** ful story: At the entrance to my local zoo they issue you with a special _spoon_ (to feed the animals) and a _dart_ gun (to defend yourself in case of animal attack). You must then _hanko_ ( _seal_ ) a document to say you’ve received both these items, only after which will they let you enter the _zoo_. (Oh, and if you forget your hanko, I **doubt** they’ll let you in).

争;contend;Bound up . . . rake.;1) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 18-1-2008(174): This can be seen as a Retarius, a roman gladiator. The Retiarius always fought with a net to _bound up_ his opponents, and with a _trident_ , which was able to pierce enemies after tying them. They were terrific **contenders** , so they were only paired with gladiators specially equipped to fight them.;2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 21-6-2007(93): A boxing ring is _bound up_ by the ropes. The **contend** er is cheating and using a _rake_.
丸;round;We speak of " **round** numbers, " or " **rounding** a number off, " meaning to add an insignificant amount to bring it to the nearest 10. For instance, if you add just a wee bit, the tiniest _drop_ , to _nine_ , you end up with a **round** number.;1) [[akimoto](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akimoto)] 20-6-2006(235): Nine plus a drop **round** s it off to ten!;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 16-8-2007(97): Watch out for [plump](../v4/120.html) (#120 太). Here Heisig could have added a "t" and we would have had a much better keyword : **rotund**. **Rotund** is more specific than "round" which begs for confusion with [circle](../v4/1811.html) (#1811 円). A dictionary search on "fat" or "round" doesn't yield this kanji, but "rotund" does! Primitive suggestion: the _Laughing Buddha_ is often depicted as a **rotund** , smiling bald man in robes with a largely exposed pot belly stomach (symbolizing plenitude).
緒;thong;_Thread_ . . . _puppet_. Wierd, eh!;2) [[lifeflaw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lifeflaw)] 18-3-2009(44): A **thong** is no more than a _thread_ used by _someone_ as underwear!
句;phrase;By combining the two primitives _bound up_ and _mouth_ , we can easily see how this character can get the meaning of a **phrase**. After all, a **phrase** is nothing more than a number of words _bound up_ tightly and neatly so that they will fit in your _mouth_.;1) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 31-10-2007(144): Some Japanese **phrase** s are difficult to _wrap_ your _mouth_ around.;2) [[shadolite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shadolite)] 25-12-2007(118): A bound mouth cannot utter a single **phrase**.
銀;silver;Metal . . . silver.;1) [[Pauline](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Pauline)] 3-7-2007(165): Like _gold_ , _silver_ is a _metal_.;2) [[mhheie](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mhheie)] 23-1-2008(52): Not sure why Heisig find the right side so troublesome. My grandma's _hairpin_ (just before [long](../v4/1920.html) (#1920 長)) is made of **silver** , the metal that best reflects _sun_ light. I'm sure you can see the flash from her hair as she walks by on a sunny day. Note that the two elements ( _sun_ and _hairpin_ ) share not only a horizontal stroke, but also the left vertical one. Therefore a bit odd stroke order.
未;not yet;As the key word suggests, this kanji has to do with something not quite over and done with. More concretely, it shows us a _tree_ that is **not yet** fully grown. The extra short stroke in the upper branches shows new branches spreading out, leaving one with the feeling that the _tree_ has a ways to go yet before it reaches maturity. In other words, the kanji conveys its meaning pictographically, playing on the earlier pictograph of the _tree_.;1) [[dat5h](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dat5h)] 15-11-2008(148): I believe a better version of that by mameha1977: [Cheat] Remember these as a set: The tree ( 木 ) does **not yet** ( 未 ) have exremities ( 末 ) of vermilion ( 朱 ).;2) [[mameha1977](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mameha1977)] 16-10-2007(64): [Cheat] Remember these as a set: The tree ( 木 ) is **not yet** ( 末 ) vermilion ( 朱 ).

Imagine a so-called **light** vehicle or a **light** -truck with a load of _spools_ driving down a road ever so **lightly** , careful not to let any of the _spools_ roll out onto the street.;2) [[paddy71](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/paddy71)] 2-2-2008(119): I want to tread **lightly** on the environment…. 負;defeat;Above we have the condensed form of _bound up_ , and below the familiar _shellfish_. Now imagine two _oysters_ engaged in _shell_ -to- _shell_ combat, the one who is **defeated** being _bound and gagged_ with seaweed, the victor towering triumphantly over it. The _bound shellfish_ thus becomes the symbol for **defeat**.;1) [[stereovibe](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stereovibe)] 23-1-2008(219): _Tied up_ , the _shellfish_ had to accept **defeat**!;2) [[koldbein](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/koldbein)] 17-2-2009(29): The _shellfish_ admitted **defeat** when they placed a _hook_ on top of his head.

I call the 1st pattern " _Miss World_ " (who is wearing a _crown_ & has long _human legs_ ) and the 2nd " _garter_ " (one _human leg_ passes through the _crown_ wearing it as a _garter_ ). Story: _Miss World_ has climbed a _tree_ to avoid the _finger_ that was **groping** for her. ( 探 means "grope for", i.e. search).

歴;curriculum;That same _grove of trees_ we met in frame 226 shows up here in the character for **curriculum** (in the sense of a record of one's life or academic achievements, the **curriculum** vitae). 員;employee;How do we get a _mouth_ over a _shellfish_ to mean an **employee**? Simple. Just remember the advice new **employees** get about keeping their _mouths_ shut and doing their job, and then make that more graphic by picturing an office building full of white collar workers scurrying around with _clams_ pinched to their _mouths_.;1) [[NooNoo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/NooNoo)] 12-4-2008(119): An **employee** ( **member** of the company) has to clam up his mouth if he wants keep the job!;2) [[seshiiru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/seshiiru)] 13-12-2007(57): An **employee** is basically a shellfish with a mouth.
候;climate;_Marquis_ . . . _walking stick_. 衣;garment;At the top we see the _top hat_ , and at the bottom a pictographic representation of the folds of a **garment**. If you break the  "4-fold" fold into 2 sets of 2 strokes, you will find it easier to remember.;1) [[indigo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/indigo)] 18-1-2008(133): The only **garment** s allowed in this club are _top hat_ and _scarf_.;2) [[jackhuddleston](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jackhuddleston)] 19-4-2008(82): The **garment** s most commonly associated with the _craft_ of a magician are the _top hat_ and the _magic wand_. (It's a stretch, but the way I remembered this kanji is through that phrase. This way you can remember it through using primitives we have already learned.).
微;delicate;Line . . . mountain . . . ceiling . . . human legs . . . taskmaster.;1) [[Istvan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Istvan)] 14-7-2007(111): The Column of 300 spartans were in a **delicate** situation. They had travelled in one line (using only their legs) to the mountain pass to face the fierce Persian task master.;2) [[cingold](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cingold)] 18-9-2009(74): We're _going_ up the _mountain_ announces the _taskmaster_. Anyone with _legs_ too **delicate** must stay behind.
筆;writing brush;Bamboo . . . brush.;1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 14-5-2007(182): _Bamboo_ is the best material from which to make a _brush_ if you want it to be a **writing brush**.;2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 8-7-2008(57): Traditionally, the ふで, or **writing brush** , was made with a _bamboo_ handle and the hair of an animal (usually horse, rabbit, or wolf). Before the advent of paper (which the Chinese invented), writing was also done on segments of bamboo.
礼;salutation;This key word refers to the polite bows and ceremonious forms of **salutation** so important in Japanese culture. Its elements: _altar_ . . . _fishhook_.;1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 24-8-2006(213): "Indy, my friend, you must be very careful! If you approach the **altar** and do not give the proper _salutation_ a large **fishhook** will rip you away".;2) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 15-9-2007(103): You should _fish hook_ (bend/bow) your body before an _altar_ as a form of **salutation** to God/gods.
丁;street;The picture here is of a **street** sign on a long pole: Hollywood and Vine, if you please, or any _street_ that immediately conjure sup the image of a **street** sign to you.;1) [[steves](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/steves)] 10-10-2007(167): Today, the program "Sesame **Street** " is brought to you by the letter "T".;2) [[yoshi_features](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/yoshi_features)] 5-4-2008(82): Two **street** s make a T-intersection.
源;source;With the advice of the last frame in mind, it is easy to see _water_ and _meadow_ in this character for **source**. Both in its etymology (it has a common parent with the word  "surge") and in popular usage, **source** suggests the place _water_ comes from. In this kanji, it is under the _meadow_ , where we just saw it breaking the surface in those bubbly little _springs_.;1) [[dogen2](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dogen2)] 17-3-2007(146): The _water_ that flows from the _meadow_ is the **source** of life for the wild antelope.;2) [[ziggr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ziggr)] 14-8-2006(74): The **source** of clean _water_ is from the [meadow](../v4/134.html) (#134 原): it comes from that _spring_ at the bottom of the _cliff_. Pay no attention to Julie Andrews lying face down in _spring_. The water's clean. Trust me.
昨;yesterday;Day . . . saw.;1) [[kyldyyr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kyldyyr)] 15-11-2005(185): One can use a simple word play to remember this character - the _day_ that I _saw_ before today was **yesterday**.;2) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 15-11-2006(127): Yester- DAY, all my troubles seemed SAW far away…
羽;feathers;From the pictograph of two bird-wings, we get **feathers**.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(94): Pictograph. Easy enough.;2) [[Ceryn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ceryn)] 23-4-2008(63): These days the biggest concern in airline safety is ICE on the WINGS of the plane. Birds that fly long distances also have to worry about getting ICE on their **FEATHERS**.
宗;religion;House . . . altar.;1) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 9-9-2007(173): I never really did figure out what **religion** my host family was - all I knew was that they kept an _altar_ in their _home_.;2) [[Transtic](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Transtic)] 30-1-2008(108): All the **RELIGION** S have their own temples, which are **houses** where they place their **altars**.
尾;tail;Flag . . . fur.;1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 4-1-2007(257): A dog waves its furry **tail** like a flag.;2) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 12-3-2008(50): A FLAG of FUR is a **TAIL**.
眺;stare;To give someone the "evil _eye_ " is to **stare** at them, wishing them evil. The roots of the superstition are old and almost universal throughout the cultures of the world. In this kanji, too, being **stared** at is depicted as an _eye_ that _portends_ evil.;1) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 11-1-2006(140): Sauron's One fiery eye **stare** at Frodo and it is a sign of portent. Evil will become whomever the eye is staring upon.;2) [[sethimayne](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sethimayne)] 13-11-2007(62): People **stare** d, _eyes_ wide, at the girl in the bathing suit - she had extremely _hairy legs_!
転;revolve;As the wheels of the _car_ **revolve** , they kick up small _rising clouds_ of dust and debris behind them.;1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 5-3-2007(153): The REVOLVING wheels of the car (with **REVOLVE** R blaring on the stereo) kicked up RISING CLOUDS of dust.;2) [[komodo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/komodo)] 20-6-2008(125): Just a note to remember the _cloud_ primative: The name of Goku's pet _cloud_ that he used to help him rise (fly) in the Dragonball anime series (and also the scientific name for a certain type of cloud) is _Nimbus_ [ <http://www.rpgclassics.com/shrines/gba/dbztlog/screen2.jpg> ]. The katakana- ization of this is **ニム** バス, so the _rising cloud_ primative is just an abbreviation of that name written from top to bottom in the old Japanese style.
商;make a deal;See the peddlar _standing_ atop his _motorcycle helmet_ as if it were a soapbox, hawking his wares to passersby. The _legs_ and _mouth_ represent the tools of the trade of **making a deal** any way you can.;1) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 21-2-2007(327): I use what I think is the real etymology for this kanji which is so shocking it sticks. The STANDING member at the top is a certain part of the body that all men have and it is approaching the HOLE between TWO LEGS (the HOOD) with extra marks to show they are FLESHY - ie a womans legs. So this shows the oldest DEAL of all time - prostitution.;2) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 21-3-2006(86): Slick Willy standing on the motorcycle helmet he's trying to sell you to demonstrate how rugged it is. His legs crash through the top of it and after a moment of awkward silence his mouth opens and says, "hey, we can still **make a deal**.".
州;state;Here we see _drops of_ land (little islets) rising up out of a _stream_ , creating a kind of sandbar or breakwater. Ever wonder how the **state** -line is drawn between **states** separated by a river? If there were little _drops of_ land as in the kanji, there'd be nothing to it.;1) [[ceeeps](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ceeeps)] 3-9-2007(202): There were 3 little islands in the _stream_ who all decided to set themselves up as independent **states**.;2) [[PeterJD](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PeterJD)] 29-3-2008(28): シュウ The original meaning of this character was "sandbar", and for me this conjures up images of the Mississippi River, which is very wide with many sandbars and which was used to define the borders in ten American **state** s. Picture Huck Finn and Tom Sawyer floating by **state** after **state** as they adventure down the mighty Mississippi, occasionally beaching their raft on sandbars.
投;throw;Fingers . . . missile.;1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 6-2-2007(174): Well, you usually use your _fingers_ to **throw** objects used as _missile_ weapons. Easy. By the way, for those of you looking for a less anachronistic image for the _missile_ primitive as a modern rocket, try a slingshot. it's a _crotch_ (originally a tree branch) that sends missile projectiles flying into/like the _wind_. And for this present kanji, it is something you naturally use with your fingers…;2) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 11-8-2009(169): **If you use the primitive "semen" (flying in the wind from your crotch) instead of missile then all kanjis with this primitive will hilariously create a perfect story**.
願;petition;A _meadow_ and a _head_ are all we are given to work with in the kanji for **petition**. Since the key word already suggests something like a formal request made of some higher power, let us imagine a gigantic Wizard-of-Oz _head_ located in the middle of the flowery _meadow_ we used in the last frame. Then just picture people kneeling hopefully before it, **petitioning** for whatever it is they want. (The scarecrow wanted brains, the lion, courage, and the tin man a heart. What about you?);1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 27-7-2007(310): Let's **petition** to save that beautiful MEADOW from overdevelopment by signing on this PAGE.;2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 9-11-2007(107): Japanese hippies **PETITION** to save a _meadow_ by getting people on the street to sign their _page_ \- as you pass by they call out: " [お願いします、おねがいします。”](midori://search?text=お願いします、おねがいします。”) .
研;polish;Stone . . . two hands.;1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 15-5-2007(218): My _stones_ are so huge that it takes _two hands_ to **polish** them!;2) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 30-1-2007(184): You use two hands to **polish** a stone: one to hold it and the other to rub it.
永;eternity;This kanji also uses the full form of _water_ , though its meaning seems to have nothing at all to do with _water_. Remember what William Blake said about seeing  "infinity in a grain of sand and **eternity** in an hour "? Well, reading this character from top to bottom, we see " **eternity** in a _drop of water_. ";1) [[ruisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruisu)] 7-9-2007(177): It would take an **eternity** to count all the drops of water.;2) [[lilpea](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lilpea)] 3-8-2007(50): It takes but one _drop_ from the most special _water_ : the fountain of youth (and it is written in a special way to with an extra horizontal line on the top) to live for an **eternity**. (In order to remember that the drop is at the top, think that the drop must come from the topmost water in order for its effects to be true).
介;jammed in;The idea of something getting **jammed into** something else is depicted here by having a _walking stick_ get **jammed into** an _umbrella_ frame by someone shoving it into an already occupied slot in the _umbrella_ stand at the door. First notice the vertical strokes: on the left is the curved umbrella handle, and on the right the straight _walking stick_. Now try to imagine the two parties tugging at their respective properties like two kids on a wishbone, creating a scene at the entrance of an elegant restaurant.;1) [[LucidFaia](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LucidFaia)] 9-4-2008(194): The two strokes at the bottom look like a J and I, which stands for "jammed in.".;2) [[alkulp](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/alkulp)] 29-10-2007(63): Two people **jammed in** under an **umbrella**. A woman with a dress and a man (straight). It's always me that ends up getting wet…. but the tail of the skirt is this time!
留;detain;Receipt . . . dagger . . . rice field.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 1-3-2007(322): Got a _receipt_ for that _dagger_ , son? If not, we're going to **detain** you and send you to work in the _rice fields_.;2) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 8-11-2007(89): The use of RANSOM NOTE (think of a receipt with a dagger through it on a door) works great with **DETAIN**. Here the RANSOM NOTE says that the girl has been **DETAIN** ED in an undisclosed location. To get her back take the RANSOM to a empty FIELD.
雄;male;_By one's side_ . . . _elbow_ . . . _turkey_. Think of a 70's pimp walk.;2) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 15-4-2007(94): **Masculine** duties are to offer your _elbow_ to the lady _by your left side_ and to cut the _turkey_ on special meals.
優;tenderness;Person . . . melancholy.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 23-8-2007(126): The _A-Team_ is on a mission to help _Hamlet_. 佐;assistant;Person . . . left.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 27-11-2008(177): Mr T's **assistant** is on his left. Why? Because Mr T has this bad habit of suddenly extending his right arm (what with all the boxing that he did), and his **assistant** got inadvertently punched in the face more than once (ouch). So now his **assistant** is always to his left side, much safer - "Stay on my _left_ , foo!".;2) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 9-5-2007(84): On your right is your "right-hand man" that you credit for all your success….on the left…… is your **assistant** who does all the grunt work and gets no credit for anything…
器;utensil;The picture in this kanji is not a pleasant one. It shows a large and fluffy _St. Bernard dog_ stretched out on a table all stuffed and stewed and garnished with vegetables, its paws in the air and an apple in its mouth. At each corner of the table sits an eager but empty _mouth_ , waiting for the **utensils** to arrive so the feast can begin.;1) [[ceeeps](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ceeeps)] 2-9-2007(184): Imagine four hungry _mouths_ all sitting around the table. They are all banging their **utensils** on the table waiting for a _big_ meal to be placed in the centre.;2) [[NooNoo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/NooNoo)] 16-4-2008(53): Note: 器 by itself means **container/caliber/vessel**. And 食器 means eating **utensil** s ("food container", hehe).
証;evidence;_Words_ that testify to the _correctness_ of some fact are classified as **evidence**. (Here we see a good example of how the more common primitive element takes the  "strong" position to the left, even though it has more strokes.);1) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 26-2-2007(273): Your words must be absolutely correct if you plan to use them as **evidence**.;2) [[sgrant](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sgrant)] 26-11-2008(68): "If what you _say_ is indeed _correct_ , we could use use your testimony as **evidence** ".
回;-times;The suffix " **-times** " refers to a number of repetitions. Its elements: _a mouth_  . . . _pent in_. Hint: you may find it more helpful to forget the primitives and think of one circle revovling inside of another.;1) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 16-2-2008(167): Write _mouth_ two **-times**.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 21-10-2005(73): Pretty much a pictograph, see book. Keyword meanings : to turn round, counter for number of times, counter for rounds. Some simple compounds using previously learned kanji : 次回 (next time), 毎回 (every time/each round), 回る (to wander around).
鹿;deer;Drawn on the walls of a complex of _caves_ near Niaux in southern France are a number of animal likenesses dating from the Upper Paleolithic period. Among them we find pictures of **deer** , some of them showing men in **deer** masks. By _comparing_ their drawings to real **deer** , Stone Age people hoped to acquire power over the animal in the hunt, and by _comparing_ themselves to the **deer** , to take on that animal's characteristics. But time has locked with a "double- _key_ " (the extra stroke through the element for _key_ ) the real secret of this art form from us, and we can only surmise such meanings. But more important than the enigmas of the troglodytic mind is the way in which _caves_ , a double- _key_ , and _comparing_ gives us the kanji for **deer**.;1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 1-5-2007(300): _Bambi_ wanders into a _cave_ and sees a _side order of salad_ and _2 spoons_ …but what's the main course?;2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 26-4-2007(37): Santa's rein **deer** , Rudolf, opens a nightclub in a _cave_. It's popular with all the **deer** and rein **deer** in the world. The _cave_ speciality is a _salad w/ dressing on the side_. There is no other **deer** club that can _compare_. How many other **deer** nightclubs are there?
仏;Buddha;Person . . . elbow.;1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 4-2-2007(143): _Mr. T_ says, "I ain't afraid o' no foo! I'll give anyone an _elbow_ to the face, I don't care if it's _Buddha_ himself!".;2) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 11-4-2007(77): **Buddha** is a _person_ who always seems to have his _elbows_ bent.
髪;hair of the head;Hair . . . shape . . . friend.;1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 7-12-2006(282): Japanese teenage girls consider the style of the **hair of the head** very important. If a particular style is trendy, soon they all want their own _hair_ in the same _shape_ as that of their _friends_.;2) [[kodama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kodama)] 8-11-2007(49): _Friends_ influence the _length_ and _shape_ of each other's **hair**.
致;doth;The archaic English form for "does" indicates a humble form of the verb "to do." It is made up of _climax_ and _taskmaster_.;1) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 12-6-2008(267): This character is used in two very high-frequency words: "you are welcome" ( どう致しまして ) and the honorific form of onegaishimasu ( お願い致します , おねがいいたします). Can't you just picture this ridiculously polite S&M picture? A businessman, who **DOTH** the bidding of his _taskmistress_ , is _climaxing_ and yelling out " お願い致します " while she whips and says " どう致しまして ". (This kanji also means "to bring about" and "do humbly", which is perfect for this image).;2) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 23-4-2007(208): To reach _climax_ I **doth** the bidding of my dominatrix _taskmaster_.
叫;shout;Mouth . . . cornucopia.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(243): There was a man in a village who had a special gift : whenever he **shout** ed and screamed, his mouth became a cornucopia, overflowing with fruits and food of all sorts. Many of the locals thought he was a cruel man, always screaming at his wife, until they realised he was in fact very kind, and his gift brought prosperity to his family.;2) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 28-8-2006(133): You can hold a CORNUCOPIA up to your MOUTH (like a megaphone) to **SHOUT** lounder. Also notice that the shape of CORNUCOPIA implies the **shout** s are 4 letter words.
