He caused the _water_ to shoot up into the air and form the _sign of the tiger_ in airborne droplets. You sure missed a great **performance**!;2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 7-4-2007(51): I remember seeing advertisements growing up with the _sign of the tiger_ saying to "Put a tiger in your tank", meaning that it would increase the **performance** of the _drops_ of gasoline you put in.
退;retreat;Road . . . silver.;1) [[DurablePants](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DurablePants)] 23-6-2006(217): You see a huge army of people in silver armour on the road so you **retreat**.;2) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 25-8-2007(72): In the land of Oz, you advance by following the golden road, but you reatreat by following the _Silver Road_.
眠;sleep;Eyes . . . people.;1) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 26-9-2006(225): In an Orwellian sense, the _eye_ watching the _people_ never **sleep** s.;2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 8-7-2007(63): People need to close their eyes and **sleep**.
刀;sword;Although this character no longer looks very much like a **sword** , it does have some resemblance to the handle of the **sword**. This is to our advantage, in that it helps us keep make a distinction between two primitive elements based on this kanji.;1) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 15-8-2008(134): This **SWORD** is so sharp, it can cut the top part of カ off in カタナ.;2) [[mrcool](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mrcool)] 22-5-2008(47): If you look really close this kanji looks like a person bending over touching the ground Waiting for someone to put there **sword** in his ass!
弱;weak;_Two bows_ . . with _ice_ on them.;1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 6-3-2007(186): Two **weak** archers agree on a duel to the death. They constantly shoot at each other but never manage to hit their target. But what they lack in skill they make up in determination, and they keep shooting for hours, and days, and months, until it's wintertime and their _bows_ are coated in _ice_.;2) [[raseru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raseru)] 8-4-2008(124): BOWS with ICE on them are brittle and **WEAK**.
個;individual;Person . . . harden.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 15-8-2006(120): This keyword gave me trouble, I could write the kanji from memory but could not remember the keyword the other way around. In such case the dictionary definition can be helpful : "Middle English, single, indivisible". Here we have _Mr. T._ who is so _hardened_ (all the body workout he's had) that he became **in-dividual** , that is, in-divisible. "I pity da foo who can be divided into smaller units.".;2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 5-9-2007(86): _Mr. T_ insists that people be **individual**. He appears on television, saying, "Being an **individual** is _hard_! But you gotta do it! _Harden_ yourself, and be **individual**!".
枝;bough;_Tree_ . . . _branch_. Take a moment to focus on the differences between a **bough** , a _branch_ , and a _twig_ (Frame 319).;1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 29-11-2006(269): The _tree's_ primary _branch_ is known as the **bough**.;2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 6-6-2008(94): Differentiate between **BOUGH** and [branch](../v4/711.html) (#711 支): 'branch' is smaller, and can also refer to the branch of a store ( 支店 ), which has nothing to do with a tree. But a **BOUGH** is a main part of a tree, perhaps where the trunk splits into several large **bough** s, and so it logically utilizes the 木 radical.
罪;guilt;Eye . . . jail cell.;1) [[Thora](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thora)] 21-2-2008(208): **Guilt** y under the _eye_ s of the law, therefore sentenced to _jail_. [note: 'UNDER the eye of the law' works in [penalty](../v4/833.html) (#833 罰) as well.].;2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 7-12-2006(80): It is his **guilt** that is causing them. He is having these nightmares where _the great (sideways) eye_ appears at the top of his _jail_ cell, and is staring down intently at him. **Guilt** is a merciless tormentor.
験;verification;Team of horses . . . awl.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 20-3-2007(211): We just **verification** that there are indeed no soldiers in the belly of this trojan _horse_. We're just gonna stab it in the belly with this _awl_ to check.;2) [[raseru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raseru)] 16-6-2008(40): The **verification** proves the horse is real by poking it with an ice pick.
夏;summer;In the **summer** , fatigued by the heat, your _head_ hangs down nearly as far as your _walking legs_ , or rather, your "dragging legs." Note how the _walking legs_ (instead of  "animal legs") are the only thing that distinguishes this character from that for _page_ (Frame 64).;1) [[Birdsong](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Birdsong)] 8-5-2007(172): In **SUMMER** you are hot from the top of your _head_ down to your _walking legs_.;2) [[rachels](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rachels)] 28-7-2008(114): _One_ _drop_ of sweat runs into my _eye_ , when I go _walking_ on a hot **summer** day.
再;again;_Jewel_ . . . with a _belt_ hung on it. Note how the _belt_ is drawn right after the first stroke of _jewel_.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 12-3-2007(240): The _king_ has eaten too much and has to get a new _belt_ **again**. See his fat rolls hanging over?;2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 14-9-2006(93): This is a _belt_ with a non-adjustable _jeweled_ buckle. Everytime you go back to the leathersmith telling him to move the buckle because you've packed on a few pounds (but that this is the last time!), he says "Again?!? Weren't you just here last month?".
職;post;The key word refers to one's occupation, or position of employment. Its elements: _ear_ . . . _kazoo_.;1) [[mothralad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mothralad)] 5-4-2007(258): Worst **post** in history: quality checker at the kazoo factory. Imagine the toll on your ears!;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 26-4-2007(146): Buckingham Palace guards are famous for staying at their **post** no matter what, even if you blow a _kazoo_ in their _ear_!
奇;strange;The elements we are given to work with here are _St. Bernard dog_ and _can_. Lots of phrases pop to mind to attach these words to the key word, but they end up too abstract because of the word _can_. It is important in such cases (and there will be plenty of them as we go along)  to stick closely to the elements, in this case, _mouth_  and _nails_. Now all we need do is create a fictitious  " **Strange** But True " column in the Sunday funnies, featuring a _St. Bernard_ whose _mouth_ has been _nailed_ shut because he was hitting the brandy keg around his neck too hard.;1) [[Beeber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Beeber)] 12-6-2007(238): I find it **strange** that so many people commit suicide in Tokyo by throwing themselves in front of the train. To me when I look at this kanji, I see a train just about to come out of a tunnel, and above the man waiting for his oppourtunity where he can end it all.;2) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 30-7-2007(77): Imagine a ST. BERNARD DOG carrying a CAN instead of a barrel in rescue missions. How **strange**!
視;inspection;Altar . . . see.;1) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 27-2-2006(168): The beaurocracy in Japan is such that even altars need to be **inspection** approved. A little man with glasses comes once a year to give the _altar_ a "visual once over" as he calls it (perhaps checking for unauthorised symbology?).;2) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 2-9-2006(105): [inspection, regard as, see, look at] **Inspection** : you 示 [show](../v4/1086.html) (#1086 示) and someone else 見 [see](../v4/57.html) (#57 見).
報;report;_Happiness_ . . . _stamp_ . . . _crotch_. Compare frame 1501.;1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 4-7-2007(251): Recall the fashion model wearing just a _stamp_ over his _crotch_ ([clothing](../v4/1399.html) (#1399 服)). When he got _happy_ , of course, it ended up in the news **report**.;2) [[PrettyKitty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PrettyKitty)] 30-4-2008(85): On the news: "We are happy to **report** that stamp-sized bikini bottoms are back in style!" (Well, the men are happy about it, at least.).
節;node;Bamboo . . . instant.;1) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 28-6-2006(268): Counting the **node** s on _bamboo_ is an _instant_ way to tell its age.;2) [[rhclaghorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rhclaghorn)] 14-3-2008(71): A certain species of _bamboo_ is considered the fastest growing plant in the world. A new _node_ can be formed in an _instant_.
予;beforehand;Think of this character as identical to the _halberd_ (Frame 1311) except that the final stroke has been omitted. Return to that character and devise some image to take this difference into account.;1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 28-9-2006(302): **Beforehand** , this was a _halberd_ but I cut it short so it could **be for hand** to hand combat.;2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 12-9-2006(126): Your _halberd_ doesn't have a handguard? You should have thought of that **beforehand** (i.e., before you were missing your hand).
富;wealth;Here we have the original character on which the primitive element for **wealth** is based. In keeping with the story introduced back then, note how all the **wealth** is kept under the roof of the same _house_.;1) [[sutebun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sutebun)] 10-9-2007(102): Remember Ducktales? That rich duck had that room in his house where he kept all the **wealth**! He had so much in that house you could even swim in it!;2) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 30-7-2007(88): In ancient Japan, a RICE FIELD is a unit of **wealth** as it can produce enough to feed all the MOUTHs in ONE HOUSE.
骨;skeleton;This kanji and primitive refers to the _part of the body_ composed of the bones and their joints. The top part of the kanji, terminating in the element for _crown_ , is a pictograph of a bone joint. I leave it to you to put the pieces together, so to speak.;1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 1-6-2006(145): Your body _meat_ is attached to the _bone joints_ of your **skeleton**.;2) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 27-11-2009(105): The top box 口 is the skull and the brain 田 has shriveled to the size of marble (but following kanji convention it is depicted as a square) and rolled into the bottom right hand corner. With all the hair and flesh gone the crown has slipped down to the shoulders like a necklace. 月 represents the rest of the body of the **skeleton**. [Idea for position of crown thanks to n1williams].
善;virtuous;_Sheep_ . . . _horns_ . . . _mouth_. Pay special attention to the writing of this character.;1) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 16-12-2007(297): Imagine a priest's teaching: "To achieve **virtue** one must first submit himself as a _sheep_ to God's flock, rejecting the _horns_ of Satan and resisting the _mouth_ of Hell.;2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 9-1-2007(95): To be **virtuous** , a good rule to follow is to put your _sheepishness_ (discretion) over your _horns_ (anger) before using your _mouth_. In other words, "discretion is the better part of virtue".
済;finish;_Water_ . . . _adjust_. Subzero _adjusts_ the _water_ in your body and crushes you into a few million pieces.
是;just so;In this kanji we are shown someone spending an entire _day_ at _mending_ one stocking, because they want the job done  " **just so**. " Be sure to make a clear image of a finicky old fusspot to make the abstract idea as concrete as possible.;1) [[Brad_Thomas](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Brad_Thomas)] 22-6-2006(135): 'Sun' 'Mend' - It **just so** happens that _sun_ shine can _mend_ your gloomy spirits.;2) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 24-1-2008(72): My image here is of Fabrice (the guy who runs this website) spending all _day_ obsessively _mending_ the code so this page looks **just so…**.
写;copy;Crown . . . bestow.;1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 16-5-2007(259): A _crown_ was _bestowed_ to the British royalty museum, but it was only a **copy**.;2) [[pm215](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pm215)] 16-4-2008(84): True fact: in the UK the right to print a **copy** of the KJV Bible is _bestowed_ by the _crown_ – there are only a few authorised bible printers. (see <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/King_James_Bible#Copyright_status>).
育;bring up;Since the key word has to do with raising children to be strong both in mind and body, it is easy to coordinate the primitive elements: _infant_ . . . _meat_.;1) [[ziggr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ziggr)] 14-9-2006(247): **Bringing up** your offspring means raising them from _infant_ until they are _meat_ ready to be harvested. What, cannibalism is in poor taste? Forget I ever brought it up. But **bring up** will forver be _infant meat_ to me. I want my baby back baby back baby back ribs!;2) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 6-10-2008(163): I will **bring up** my _infants_ to eat _meat_. I'll not endure any vegetarian children in my house!
約;promise;Consider for a moment the etymology of the word " **promise** " in order to notice its roots in the activity of putting one thing (e.g., one's word of honor) in place of another (e.g., the fulfillment of a task). For as it turns out, this character also means "to abridge, economize, and abbreviate" \- all activities that involve putting one thing in place of another. With that in mind, we may now work with the elements: _thread_ . . . _ladle_.;1) [[eatyoda](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eatyoda)] 27-10-2008(150): Anytime _Spiderman_ breaks a **promise** , Aunt Mae hits him one over with her _ladle_.;2) [[laner36](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laner36)] 2-10-2007(125): Spiderman **promise** d to get Aunt Mae's ladle back. He started to do a blood oath by spilling drops of blood but Aunt Mae stopped him and bound up the wound. "It's only a ladle Peter".
密;secrecy;House . . . invariably . . . mountain.;1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 29-4-2007(214): To maintain **secrecy** , secret societies invariably have to house themselves in the moutains.;2) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 7-11-2007(161): To maintain **secrecy** , secret societies invariably have to house themselves on top of the moutains. (Slight tweak of chamcham's story, using fuaburisa's idea for remembering where to put the mountain primitive.).
矢;dart;When shot high into the _heavens_ , the **dart** gets so small it looks like a mere _drop_. Although this character could as well mean  "arrow," it has no connection with the primitive of that meaning. Hence the new key word.;1) [[libsrone](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/libsrone)] 18-6-2008(180): Zeus ran out of lightning bolts and has to drop **dart** s from the heavens.;2) [[usis35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/usis35)] 16-6-2008(80): Do not mistake with LOSE 失 .
弁;valve;Elbow . . . two hands.;1) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 1-12-2005(350): Opening a stuck **valve** requires 2 hands and a lot of elbow grease.;2) [[astgtciv](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astgtciv)] 20-1-2007(62): The cubans build a pipe to flood the USA. Castro just has to turn the **valve** on it, and USA is flooded. Suddenly, CIA agents tackle him from behind, grabbing both his arms. But _Castro_ manages to open the **valve** with his _elbow_ , by raising the _elbow_ above his head. Success! USA is no more…

So these can be considered as **bed** s.;2) [[indigo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/indigo)] 11-2-2008(102): (based on mspertus:) The two safe places to sleep in the wilderness are in a _tree_ and in a _cave_. So to be on the safe side it is best to put a tree in a cave and use it as a **bed**.

腕;arm;Part of the body . . . address.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 28-2-2007(253): Like in Memento, I tattoo my _address_ on my fore **arm** _flesh_ so I don't forget it.;2) [[Hyland1](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hyland1)] 19-11-2006(107): In Iraq people are having their addresses tattooed on their bodies, usually their **arm** s, so they can be identified if they are killed. 陽;sunshine;Different from the primitive for _sun_ (which figures in the character) and the kanji for _ray_ (Frame 125), the key word **sunshine** is meant to convey the meaning of the masculine principle in nature, or  "Yang." (The dark is viewed mythically as the feminine principle, see frame 1718.) From there it comes to mean _sun_ also. The elements are: _pinnacle_ . . . _piggy bank_.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 21-1-2006(191): A kid is perched on a _pinnacle_ with his _piggy bank_. He uses the coins to catch the **sunshine** , and redirect it into people's eyes, far below.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-2-2007(77): _The Pinnacle_ is environmentally friendly. They collect **solar** power through **sunshine** on their _piggybank_ shaped solar arrays.
倒;overthrow;Person . . . arrival.;1) [[Django](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Django)] 28-9-2007(245): The A-Team are planning to **overthrow** the government. However, they can't do a damn thing until _Mr T arrives_.;2) [[somukeru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/somukeru)] 6-3-2008(38): In Return of the _Jedi_ , after a _climactic_ light _sabre_ battle, Luke and Vader **overthrow** the emporer (literally throwing him over the balcony).
響;echo;Hometown . . . sound.;1) [[sweetneet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sweetneet)] 5-10-2006(210): People's voices are like **echo** es of _sounds_ from their _hometowns_ ….you can always tell where they're from by how they talk.;2) [[Balaam](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Balaam)] 29-1-2008(85): My hometown is a ghost town, any sounds **echo** es and **echo** es.
坂;slope;Ground . . . anti-.;1) [[jaresty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jaresty)] 8-10-2007(112): As the villain (pushed off by the anti-hero) is tumbling down the **slope** , he activates gadget skis to escape, spraying soil everywhere as he flies down the **slope**.;2) [[nakome](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nakome)] 4-3-2008(100): This kanji depicts a classic enviornmental problem: erosion. Erosion occurs when all of the _soil_ washes of the side of the _cliff_ , eventually causing the _cliff_ to disappear, leaving a **slope** (an _anti- cliff_ if you will) in its place.

勧;persuade;Pegasus . . . power.;1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 11-9-2006(183): Mnemonic " _pegasus_ **persuasion** _power_ ". 即;instant;Silver . . . stamp.;1) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 28-6-2006(307): He scratches off the _silver_ _stamp_ and discovers that he is an **instant** winner.;2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 17-6-2006(137): For **instant** postal delivery, buy a _silver_ _stamp_!
乱;riot;In a **riot** , manners are laid aside and tempers get short, even in so courtesy-conscious a land as Japan. This kanji shows what happens to a **rioting** _tongue_ : it gets "barbed" like a _fishhook_ , and sets to attacking the opposition, to _hook_ them as it were.;1) [[rotifera](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rotifera)] 11-11-2007(216): The **riot** police broke up the **riot** by dragging the **riot** ers away by their _tongues_ with _fishooks_.;2) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 18-8-2007(87): A _tongue_ with a _hook_ can cause a **riot**.
警;admonish;Here you have a perfect example of how an apparently impossible snarl of strokes becomes a snap to learn once you know its elements. The idea of being **admonished** for something already sets up a superior-inferior relationship between you and the person you are supposed to stand in _awe_ of. While you are restricted to answering in honorifics, the superior can use straightforward and ordinary _words_.;1) [[nilfisq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nilfisq)] 13-8-2007(232): To **admonish** is to enforce _awe_ by means of _words_.;2) [[cheechuan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cheechuan)] 22-11-2007(105): Watch in _awe_ as mom **admonish** es the rude clerk with _words_ that you've never heard her use before.
養;foster;_Sheep_ . . . _food_. The key word has the sense of promoting the development of something, especially in a psychological or spiritual sense.;1) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 25-8-2007(162): A sheep became the **foster** parent for a wolf pup, feeding it with milk. This story cannot end well…;2) [[akotkav](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akotkav)] 9-5-2006(117): You **foster** ("promote the growth of") your sheep well when they have food right at their feet.
犬;dog;We know that the character for _large_ takes on the meaning of the _St. Bernard_ **dog** when used as a primitive. In this frame we finally see why. The _drop_ added as a fourth and final stroke means that we have to do with a normal-sized **dog** , which compared to the _St. Bernard_ is no more than a _drop_ in the kennel.;1) [[LucidFaia](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LucidFaia)] 9-4-2008(76): A large **dog** , dripping drool.;2) [[captal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/captal)] 24-3-2008(17): If we remember [large](../v4/107.html) (#107 大) as a man with his arms outstretched, the **drop** represents man's best friend - a **dog**.
岡;Mount;Here we see a _mountain goat_ " **mounted** " under a _glass canopy_. In this and the following frames, think of a particular **Mount** you know.;1) [[ghinzdra](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ghinzdra)] 16-2-2008(235): White **mount** , Fuji **mount** , olympus **mount** whatever ….The choice is yours but wherever you go they sell those snowglobe souvenir : under a GLASS HOOD you can see the **mount** with a MOUTAIN GOAT standing on top of it …. So kitsch you just can't forget it .;2) [[brose](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brose)] 22-3-2007(50): Note: Stroke order is belt..horns..mountain, not the same as _mountain goat_.
姉;elder sister;Of all the _women_ of the family, it is the **elder sister** who has the duty to go to _market_ to do the shopping.;1) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 10-6-2008(260): Unlike the _younger sister_ ( 妹 ), who is _not yet_ old enough to date… the **elder sister** is on the _market_!;2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 9-1-2006(28): She's old enough to be allowed to go to the market.
価;value;Person . . . Old West.;1) [[daredawg3583](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/daredawg3583)] 12-6-2008(213): Mr. T has a high **value** in the Old West because you see him in "Wanted" posters all over the place! 鼻;nose;Let me share a rather grotesque image to help with this kanji. Imagine taking your _two hands_ and reaching up into someone's _nostrils_. Once inside you grab hold of the _brain_ and yank it out. At the end, you would have a picture something like that of this character, the full kanji for **nose**.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 16-12-2007(220): An Egyptian embalmer reaching _both hands_ into the dead pharaoh's **nose** and yanking out handfuls of _brain_.;2) [[imojyochu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/imojyochu)] 14-8-2008(104): I sneezed so hard that through my **NOSE** I blew out my BRAINS into BOTH HANDS.
条;twig;Geppetto made _walking legs_ for his little Pinocchio from two **twigs** of a _tree_ , giving him a set of " **twiggy** " shanks.;1) [[Kurisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kurisu)] 28-1-2008(586): They all say they have a _TREE_ between their _WALKING LEGS_ but most only have a **TWIG**.;2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 8-11-2007(103): Don't confuse with branch or bough - think of snapping **twig** s. A **twig** is always the kind of _wood_ that snaps when the hunter's _walking legs_ just barely touch it, making a snapping sound that alerts the prey to the hunter's presence.
寒;cold;House . . . celery . . . animal legs . . . ice.;1) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 1-3-2006(182): A **cold** lunch: in the _house_ , _celery_ , pre cooked _animal legs_ (i.e. chicken drumsticks) and _ice_ tea.;2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 16-5-2007(104): Some strange animal tried to steal a stalk of celery from my house. However, it was freezing and the floor was covered in ice, so the mysterious animal couldn't get any traction. Picture a _stalk of celery_ and a _pair of animal legs_ slipping and sliding clumsily around the _ice_ , and never able to leave the _house_. Eventually it got so **cold** that the little animal froze to death.

竹;bamboo;**Bamboo** grows upwards, like a straight _nail_ , and at each stage of its growth (which legend associates with the arrival of the new moon) there is a jointed rootstock (the first stroke). Two such **bamboo** stalks are pictured here.;1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 30-6-2008(99): Pandas like to eat **bamboo**. I'm using panda as the primitive name when it fits the story. ^__^.;2) [[kanjihito](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kanjihito)] 5-7-2009(39): Two _reclining_ victims impaled by **bamboo** _spikes_.

児;newborn babe;The top part of the kanji in this frame, you will remember, is the character for _olden times_ , those _days_ so old they needed a _walking stick_ to get around. Western mythical imagination has old  "Father Time" leaning on his sickle with a **newborn babe** crawling around his _legs_ , the idea being that the circle of birth and-death goes on. This is the first of three times that the kanji for _olden times_ will appear as a primitive element in another kanji, so try to make the most of it.;1) [[rakutenka](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rakutenka)] 30-6-2007(301): In the _olden times_ , a **newborn babe** came out _leg_ s first.;2) [[EasyG](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/EasyG)] 30-8-2008(58): In the _olden times_ , a **newborn babe** came from between the _leg_ s. Now we have cesarean section. [modified rakutenka's story].
街;boulevard;This is the character from which the sense of **boulevard** mentioned in frame 938 derives. Its elements: _boulevard_ . . . _ivy_.;1) [[woelpad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/woelpad)] 11-1-2007(104): The **boulevard** of **boulevard** s, the _Champs Elysées_ , with the Arc de Triomphe covered in _ivy_ to give the champions a heroes' welcome.;2) [[wasurenaide](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wasurenaide)] 6-6-2008(61): Specifically… _ivy_ **boulevard** … think hollywood & vine.
任;responsibility;Person . . . porter.;1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 17-6-2007(183): It is always _Mr. T_ 's **responsibility** to be the _porter_ and carry around everyone's luggage because he's so strong.;2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 13-7-2008(67): In [pregnancy](../v4/507.html) (#507 妊), the woman was the porter for the first nine months. Now, as a new father, _Mr.T_ is assuming all the **RESPONSIBILITIES** that comes with it. Can't you just see him here as the new _porter_ , wearing a harness with a his little dude (who already has a little matching mohawk)?
寸;measurement;This kanji actually stood for a small **measurement** used prior to the metric system, a bit over an inch in length, and from there acquired the sense of **measurement**. In the old system, it was one- _tenth_ of a _shaku_ (whose kanji we shall meet in frame 1151). The picture, appropriately, represents one _drop_ of a _ten_  (with a hook!).;1) [[ceeeps](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ceeeps)] 26-8-2007(330): The decimal system uses _drops_ of _ten_ as a **measurement**.;2) [[gaijinda](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gaijinda)] 19-10-2007(73): Glue two sticks together to make the best **measurement**. (I always remember the primitive, but never the original keyword.).

毒;poison;Grow up . . . breasts.;1) [[erikkusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/erikkusan)] 14-3-2006(237): If you grow up with a mother that drinks and smokes, you can be sure it's **poison** in the stuff you get from her breasts.;2) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 4-5-2007(82): Note that stroke order of _grow up_ primitive isn't obvious from Heisig's diagram: single horizontal stroke is drawn first, then vertical and two horizontals.
照;illuminate;Although the range of possible meanings that the kanji for **illuminate** can have is about as rich as the connotations of the English word, we need to focus on just one of them: to make something _shine_. If you glaze a pot and put it into the _oven_ to _fire_ it, you in fact _illuminate_ it. Hence the kanji for **illuminate** compares the kanji for _shining_ with the primitive element for the _oven's fire_.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 27-7-2007(276): SHINING FLAMES **illuminate**!;2) [[atomiton](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/atomiton)] 16-9-2007(91): The sun was seduced to give us fire, by which we **illuminate** the night.
局;bureau;_Flag_ . . . _phrase_. Note how the _flag_ 's long stroke doubles up for the first stroke of _phrase_.;1) [[ziggr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ziggr)] 30-10-2006(372): The Federal **Bureau** of Investigation has email scanners that _flag_ certain _phrases_.;2) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 10-9-2007(92): They do nothing at the **bureau** other than repeating the stupid catch _phrase_ they have on their _flag_.
肩;shoulder;Door . . . flesh.;1) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 18-7-2007(281): The **shoulder** is the best _part of the body_ to bash a _door_ open with (Don't ever try this. Use your foot).;2) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 6-12-2007(108): The **shoulder** is _part of the body_ you use to push through the noren in a _doorway_. I was having trouble with positioning of the primitives until I tweaked shaydwyrm's story slightly. If you think of pushing through a noren, this makes sense as a pictograph. The noren hangs from above, and you push through it from below.

婚;marriage;Woman . . . family name . . . day.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 4-12-2005(270): **Marriage** is the _day_ in this _woman_ 's life where she gets a new _family name_.;2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 20-2-2008(90): Tip: Heisig later introduces the kanji 昏 [dusk](../v4/2451.html) (#2451 昏). 周;circumference;Look more closely at your _lidded crock_ and you will see little ruler marks along its bottom edge. This is so you can use it to calculate the **circumference** of your _motorcycle helmet_ : just begin at a fixed point and turn the _lidded crock_ around and around, keeping it flush against the side of the _helmet_ , until you come back to your starting point. If you kept track of how many turns and part-turns your _lidded crock_ made, you now know the **circumference**.;1) [[hanako1975](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hanako1975)] 8-1-2008(188): If my LIDDED CROCK has the same **CIRCUMFERENCE** as my head, I like to use it as a HELMET.;2) [[mdspencer](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mdspencer)] 3-4-2009(47): When the _ground_ has an _opening_ (a hole), you need to cover the entire **circumference** or you will fall in.

丈;length;The **length** whose measure this kanji depicts extends from the tip of one hand to the tip of the other with _arms_ at full length. Notice the final stroke, which cuts across the vertical second stroke to distinguish it from _large_ (Frame 112).;1) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 14-9-2007(197): Both a meter and a yard are about one arm-length.;2) [[samesong](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samesong)] 29-8-2008(67): When girls ask about my **length** , I hold out my _one arm_ , and tell them "you get the idea".
鉄;iron;Metal . . . to drop.;1) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 17-6-2006(282): **Iron** is a _metal_ that gradually becomes _lost_ due to oxidation and rust.;2) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 20-10-2008(105): Compare with [pig-iron](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/270) (#270 銑). In moving from **pig-iron** to **iron** , some of the _metal's_ maleability is _LOST_. (The only difference between the two kanji is that **IRON** has knee- less, unbending legs, while PIG-IRON (270) has very supple, bendable legs.).

駄;burdensome;Team of horses . . . plump.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 5-2-2006(166): The Greek warriors inside the _Trojan Horse_ are complaining about this **burdensome** _plump_ warrior who is not helping at all (say, just eating candies and watching). - "You know you're such a burden!". 狂;lunatic;A **lunatic** is literally one driven mad by the light of the moon, and the most famous of the  " **looneys** " are the legendary lycanthropes or "wolfmen." Sometimes the transformation is only a temporary phenomenon, sometimes it is permanent. In the latter case, the poor chap takes off on all fours to live with the beasts. To remember this kanji, imagine one of these lycanthropes going **looney** and setting himself up as _king_ of a _pack of wild dogs_ that roams about and terrorizes innocent suburban communities.;1) [[ceeeps](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ceeeps)] 13-9-2007(201): Oh no ! A _pack of dogs_ has bitten the _king_. He has turned into a rabid **lunatic** !;2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 19-11-2006(32): Think of _King_ Nebuchadnezzar, who for 7 years **lost his sanity** and had to live like a _wild animal_.
織;weave;Thread . . . kazoo.;1) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 30-7-2007(195): Spiderman **weave** s his way through the skyline while listening to his theme song on his ipod. It is played, of course, by kazoos.;2) [[akimoto](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akimoto)] 4-3-2007(46): Play the kazoo magically and the thread will **weave** itself.
境;boundary;Imagine the **boundary** of a plot of _land_ marked with gigantic _mirrors_ enabling the landowner to keep trespassers in sight at all times.;1) [[nyquil](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nyquil)] 13-3-2007(195): In the dense cities of Japan even a small garden is a luxury. In this house, the owner has put _mirrors_ on the **boundary** of his _land_ so it feels much bigger.;2) [[brose](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brose)] 16-12-2006(108): This is an old trick to keep out migrants. You put a bunch of dirty mirrors on the **boundary** of your land and theirs. When they approach the **boundary** , what they see in the mirror is their own land and someone that looks like themselves, only dirtier, so they figure your country isn't any better than their own and they head back home.
英;England;_Flowers_ . . . _center_. 布;linen;The maid, _towels by her side_ , distributes the **linen**.;1) [[inuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/inuki)] 15-9-2006(138): A matador holding his red **linen** by his side.;2) [[shadolite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shadolite)] 18-3-2008(93): The first rule of the _Hitch-Hiker's Guide to the Universe_ is "DON'T PANIC!" 習;learn;Feathers . . . white bird.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 11-10-2005(198): Imagine a white bird loosing a _couple feathers_ as it is **learn** ing to fly. 帯;sash;The part of the _apron_ where one finds the _buckle_ (represented pictorially by the first 5 strokes) is on the **sash**.;1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 10-6-2006(166): First, note that the top half of the kanji consists of _one_ and _mountain_. Of course, the " _number 1_ " _mountain_ in Japan is _Mt._ Fuji. The bottom half, under _Mt._ Fuji, consists of _crown_ and _towel_. Now for the story. Archaeologists digging under _Mt._ Fuji (Japan's _#1_ _mountain_ ) in an ancient royal tomb (they know it's royal because of the _crown_ ) discover what looks like a _towel_ , but after they clean it up, they see it is actually a splendid royal _sash_ for the king's kimono.;2) [[LazyNomad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LazyNomad)] 28-3-2009(160): WARNING: Try to avoid thinking of the upper element as a combination of _one_ and _mountain_ , because in this case you will get used to the incorrect stroke order.
因;cause;St. Bernard dog . . . pent in.;1) [[rizzo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rizzo)] 21-10-2005(190): We once had a _dog_ with big paws // and oh what great trouble he'd **cause** // we built a huge pen // to keep him _pent in_ // and stop him from breaking more laws //.;2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 5-7-2006(128): Why is there poop on the kitchen floor? Oh, the **cause** is that you kept the _dog_ _pent in_ the house all day. Next time remember to walk him.
踏;step;The meaning of this character is virtually identical with that of the last frame. Be sure to come up with distinct connotations suggested by phrases in which each is commonly used. _Wooden leg_ . . . _water_ . . . _sun_.;1) [[trikatu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/trikatu)] 28-2-2007(219): You have to watch your **step** when moving your _leg_ on a _watery day_.;2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 16-5-2007(80): So, we've walked on the moon, but it's going to take a pirate with a _wooden leg_ , with a huge supply of cooling _water_ to land on the _sun_ and take that "one small **step** for a man".
湯;hot water;Water . . . piggy bank.;1) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 31-8-2007(305): Imagine a **hot water** kettle for your tea, except this one is a pink piggy bank that pours the water from its snout (and squeals when the water is piping hot). Make sure to use a potholder!;2) [[Clint](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Clint)] 13-7-2008(33): **Hot water** is a phrase that can mean "getting into trouble." This kanji pictures just one of the many meanings of that phrase: it's _water_ that you get into (with creditors and the like) when your _piggy bank_ is empty!
移;shift;Wheat . . . many.;1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 28-8-2007(229): Picture the WHEAT field, filled with MANY, MANY stalks of WHEAT. Notice how they **SHIFT** like waves in the slightest breeze. When you hear **SHIFT** , just picture that scene.;2) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 10-9-2007(144): _Many_ people are making the **shift** from white to whole _wheat_ bread.
倉;godown;The single _gate_ is used here not in order to represent one _gate_ , but many of them, indeed a _meeting of gates_. Add _mouth_ (as an entrance here) and you end up with **godown**. That should help keep this character distinct from _warehouse_ (Frame 633).;1) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 5-10-2007(256): (Warning-this one is crude) Imagine a **godown** (dockside warehouse) where you can _meet_ girls who will _godown_ on you with their _mouth_. To keep the place a bit of a secert, they only have one _gate_.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 26-10-2005(56): Hint : the "godown" is like a warehouse, it's on the docks and mostly in Asia. To make an image distinct from that of "warehouse" or "storehouse", etc, I picture the goods stored there, piled up on pallets really high, and thus they have to "godown" before they can be taken outside. The front of this **godown** is a " _meeting of small gates_ ", i.e. a row of gates through which goods come in and out. The _mouth_ can be an opening somewhere in the back, or the top, where cranes lift down the goods.
甲;armor;This kanji reverses the element for _sprout_ , giving the image of roots being sent down into the earth by a seed planted in the _rice field_. From there you must invent a connection to the keyword, **armor**.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 20-1-2006(200): Funny.. this appeared to me as a pictograph of a samurai's **armor**. Then I looked up images of the samurai **armor** and it is not even remotely similar. Then I realised it looks in fact like the belly of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, which I somehow associated with the samurai **armor** because of the "turtle samurai" that appeared earlier. Fits me. The bit that pokes down is to protect the genitals, I guess.;2) [[ruisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruisu)] 21-11-2007(156): It looks like a bird's eye view of a tank (modern **armor** ).
低;lower;Person . . . calling card.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 12-3-2007(208): _Mr. T_ travels to Japan and knows he must bow **lower** when presenting his _business card_.;2) [[mattimus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mattimus)] 17-11-2009(71): Primitive: The Japanese always _underline_ their _family name_ on their **Calling (Business) Cards**. (Easy to remember, Underlined Family Name = Business Card).
積;volume;_Wheat_ . . . _blame_. This key word has to do with measurement, and should be kept distinct from the kanji for _quantity_ (Frame 189) - even though the meanings are similar.;1) [[sweetneet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sweetneet)] 12-9-2006(207): On many _wheat cereal_ boxes, there is a disclaimer stating that "This package is sold by weight, not by **volume**. Some settling of contents may have occurred." well they only say that because they don't want to be _blame_ d by people getting really disappointed after they see what a small **volume** of _cereal_ the box really contains.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 4-3-2007(138): The **volume** of the _wheat_ crop is way down this year! _Blame_ the weather!
婆;old woman;Waves . . . woman.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(325): An **old woman** is seen here as a woman with waves (i.e. wrinkles, creases).;2) [[walexander5](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/walexander5)] 20-7-2008(58): Picture an **old woman** on her balcony, watching the _waves_ , wondering if her husband will ever return from the sea.
仮;provisional;Person . . . anti-.;1) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 9-8-2008(145): _Mr. T_ is _anti_ anything **provisional**. "I pity da foo' who's so indecisive that he can't make nothin' permanent".;2) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 19-11-2007(90): Mr. T was offered a job in the Iraq **Provisional** Authority, but he turned it down, because he's anti-war. "I pity da fool thinks this sand pit worth invadin' when our schools be in such sad shape!".
津;haven;Seeing the tiny boats of poor mortals tossed about in a stormy sea like so many corks, the All-Merciful took its _brush_ and drew little inlets of _water_ where the hapless creatures might seek shelter. And so it is that we have **havens**.;1) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 13-10-2007(215): A brush laying in dirty water is a **haven** for bacteria.;2) [[liosama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/liosama)] 4-7-2008(78): The **haven** for a BRUSH is in WATER.. Otherwise they get dry and withered and cant be used?!
訪;call on;When making a courtesy **call on** a dignitary, one has to gauge one's _words_ with great care. Hence the need for a _compass_.;1) [[GenPDP7](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/GenPDP7)] 20-12-2007(234): When you **call on** someone, you point your words in their direction.;2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 22-3-2007(71): Japanese streets usually don't have names, so finding places can be difficult. So if you plan to **call on** someone you need two things, 1) _words_ (for asking the way) and 2) a _compass_ (in case you get really lost).
魔;witch;_Hemp_ . . . _ghost_. Take care not to confuse with the primitive of the same name we learned earlier (Frame 458).;1) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 10-12-2006(230): The **witch** sold me some _hemp_ that made me see _ghosts_ don't do drugs.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 7-7-2006(62): This modern version of the **witch** lives in some hippie community. She smokes a lot of _hemp_ , and spends the day talking to _ghosts_ , which not surprisingly appears only to her.

But he sang only RIGHTEOUS songs, no cursing or anything like that. (all true: <http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7_rBidCkJxo> ).
魚;fish;The composition of this kanji shows three elements, which we list in the order of their writing: _bound up_ . . . _rice field_ . . . _cooking fire_. Not much to work with at first sight. But we can join them together by thinking of a three-part story: first a **fish** is caught and _bound up_ on a line with its unfortunate school-mates, when the fisherman gets home, he cuts off the head and tosses it, with the entrails, out into the _rice fields_ for fertilizer, and the rest he sets in a skillet over a _cooking fire_ for his supper.;1) [[silkcherryblossoms](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/silkcherryblossoms)] 10-6-2007(106): The elements of this kanji are bound up, rice field and cooking fire. When I think of bound up cooked rice, it makes me think of sushi, which in turn brings to mind **fish**.;2) [[tomusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tomusan)] 12-2-2008(56): _Bind_ that **FISH** and _cook_ his _brains_! Yarhh!
怒;angry;Guy . . . heart.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 14-10-2005(268): This _woman_ is **angry** because of the guys in the previous frame who pay more attention to her _crotch_ than her _heart_. I prefer to decompose the kanji in three elements here because it is easier to read like a mnemonic.;2) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 15-8-2007(84): WOMEN get very **ANGRY** over the thought that GUYS are more interested in her CROTCH than her HEART.
戻;re-;The key word signals a "coming back" or return to some place or activity. Its elements: _door_ . . . _St. Bernard dog_.;1) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 11-7-2006(222): The _St. Bernard dog_ whining at the _door_ of his master’s house in order to **re-** enter / **re-** turn inside.;2) [[thermal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thermal)] 16-6-2008(140): This is common with cats, but also happens with dogs. They go out the door. 5 minutes later they change their minds and come back in. They **re-** go out the door. They **re-** come back in. They **re-** go out the door. They **re-** come back in. They **re-** go out the door. They **re-** come back in. They **re-** go out the door. They **re-** come back in. They **re-** go out the door. They **re-** come back in. They **re-** go out the door. They **re-** come back in. They **re-** go out the door. AAAAAARRRRRGGGHHHH!!!
午;noon;With a bit of stretching, you might see a horse's head pointing leftwards in this character. That gives the primary meaning of the Chinese zodiacal sign of the horse, which corresponds to the hour of **noon**. Note how this kanji primitive differs from that for _cow_ (Frame 260).;1) [[tomusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tomusan)] 28-2-2008(231): **Noon** is a good time for a _ten_ minute _nap_ (using lie down as nap).;2) [[Qroxxy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Qroxxy)] 17-11-2008(67): **Noon** is a good time to _lie down_ for _ten_ minutes or so.
映;reflect;Sun . . . center.;1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 29-12-2006(360): In the solar system, the Sun is the central source of all light, everything else just **reflect** s it.;2) [[sacmaliyorsun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sacmaliyorsun)] 3-3-2008(58): A _solar_ power plant consists of thousands of mirrors **reflect** ing the _sun_ 's rays, concentrating the energy on a focal point at the _centre_. See here: <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solar_Two>.
枚;a sheet of;English counts thin, flat objects, like bed linen and paper, in **sheets**. The kanji does this with a _taskmaster_ whipping a _tree_ into producing **sheets** against its will.;1) [[applesuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/applesuki)] 14-12-2006(142): The _taskmaster_ is a strict bathroom monitor who hands out only one **sheet of** really rough, splintery toilet paper per person. You can see the _wood_ fibers.;2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 6-12-2007(60): This _taskmaster_ is the bathroom nazi: he counts how many **sheets of** toilet paper and tissue you use, and then tells you what % of a tree you just killed.
修;discipline;Person . . . walking stick . . . taskmaster . . . shape.;1) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 1-10-2007(152): _Mr. T_ is a harsh _taskmaster_ who will **discipline** you (beat you into _shape_ ) with his _walking stick_.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 29-1-2008(30): Note : the meaning is in the positive sense, to cultivate one's character or interests. To work to make yourself or something better.
印;stamp;At last we come to the general character meaning **stamp**. Its elements: _staples_ . . . _stamp_.;1) [[greenapple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/greenapple)] 27-8-2006(275): Before sticky backs, they had to staple **stamp** s to letters.;2) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 10-3-2008(88): Aaaagh, this old **stamp** doesn't _stick_! Okay I'll just _staple_ it.
荒;laid waste;The _flowers_ that _perish_ in the _flood_ are taken here as symbols of an area that has been **laid waste**.;1) [[Zarxrax](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zarxrax)] 13-4-2008(214): After Godzilla **laid waste** to the city, the survivors put some _flowers_ on the bodies of the _deceased_ and floated their bodies down the _stream_.;2) [[ziggr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ziggr)] 28-8-2006(90): **Laying waste** is just a euphamism for flushing poop down the toilet. It smells nothing like _flowers_ , more like _deceased flowers_ , and it's flushed down into a _stream_ of sewage. Use "waste" to avoid [destroy](../v4/365.html) (#365 滅) [demolition](../v4/400.html) (#400 壊).
束;bundle;In the same way that we were able to see the _sun_ in the _tree_ within the kanji for _east_ , here we see a square container in the shape of a _mouth_.;1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 7-10-2006(184): Mnemonic: **Bundle** of joy. Here I see the proverbial stork with a baby hanging from its _mouth_ fly straight into a _tree_. Painful, but he doesn't drop the **bundle**.;2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 13-12-2006(126): Unlike in 杏 , this big mouth isn't content to wait for apricots to fall in his mouth, so he has climbed the tree and is taking them in **bundle** s.
晴;clear up;Take the key word in its associations with the weather (unless that tempts you to include the primitive for _weather_ , which doesn't belong here). Its elements: _sun_ . . . _blue_.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 22-2-2006(378): Sun and blue sky! Yep, the weather's cleared up!;2) [[dilandau23](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dilandau23)] 1-4-2007(25): When we speak of **clearing up** we easily think of both the _sun_ and _blue_ skies. But in another since to **clear up** is the absence of weather. And therefor the reason weather has no place in its writing.
軒;flats;This kanji, a counter for houses, is made up of _cars_ . . . _dry_.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 7-3-2007(231): **Flats** in the city are crowded. You get a space for your _car_ in front, and a _clothesline_ out back. Nothing else.;2) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 11-7-2007(58): Small **flats** (garages) for _cars_ help keeping them _dry_.

沈;sink;The technique for **sinking** used in this kanji is unique. Rather than the biblical image of tying a millstone about the victim's neck, here we see a _crown_ tied about one _leg_ before the unfortunate party is tossed into the _water_.;1) [[jreaves](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jreaves)] 20-7-2007(178): (thx geezer) The maimed waitress (no head and arms just her legs and trunk) is dropped into the water with a cement crown to make sure she **sink** s. She shouldn't have been so nosy about her yakuza-boyfriend's schemes.;2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 10-2-2007(87): This is the famous story of Archimedes and the Crown, where buoyancy was discovered. Watching the _crown_ **sink** in the _water_ , Archimedes detected the fraud and ran naked through the city ( _human legs_ distorted from running) yelling "Eureka! Eureka!" See <http://math.nyu.edu/>~crorres/Archimedes/Crown/CrownIntro.html and <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eureka_%28word%29>.
紅;crimson;Thread . . . craft.;1) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 24-3-2008(211): Spiderman crafted a **crimson** costume to fight crime in.;2) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 20-8-2007(151): After _Spider-Man_ is whacked in the head with a _I-beam_ , **crimson** blood flows from the wound.

普;universal;Row . . . sun.;1) [[Reikon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Reikon)] 4-8-2007(223): People at **Universal** Studios wait in rows so long that the sun goes down.;2) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 9-12-2006(57): To me, _row_ is way too close to [file](../v4/812.html) (#812 列), so I'm adopting Fab's meaning of _rowboat_ from the previous frame. **Universal** Studios went through a number of logo animations before settling on the one they are most famous for: the letters **UNIVERSAL** orbiting the Earth. 払;pay;Finger . . . elbow.;1) [[misha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/misha)] 3-8-2007(326): You're at a restaurant and raise your _finger_ to indicate to the waiter that you want to **pay**. 欲;longing;_Valley_ . . . _yawn_. Be sure to keep the key word distinct from _pining_ (Frame 683).;1) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 22-6-2008(283): Guess what? Japanese has dirty words too! (In fact, a lot of them) A sexual story is NOT inappropriate here, as this kanji is very sexual, such as in 性欲 , lust. 旦;nightbreak;While we normally refer to the start of the day as "daybreak," Japanese commonly refers to it as the "opening up of night" into day. Hence the choice of this rather odd key word, **nightbreak**. The single stroke at the bottom represents the _floor_ (have a peek again at frame 1) or the horizon over which the _sun_ is poking its head;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 21-7-2007(191): A **nightbreak** happens when the sun rises over the horizon (floor).;2) [[tomb771](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tomb771)] 9-2-2007(65): It may be easier to think of the keyword "DAYBREAK" or "MORNING" for this kanji (other kanji dictionaries do). Then the mnemonic phrase "SUN rising over the HORIZON" works better. It is an infrequent kanji, but can be found in: 旦夕 （たんせき） morning and evening, or 元旦 （がんたん） New Year's Day.
固;harden;_Old_ . . . _pent in_. Leave the people out of your story to avoid complications later when we add the element for person to form a new kanji (Frame 1047).;1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 10-5-2007(252): Fossils are _old_ things _pent in_ that have **harden** ed.;2) [[Cheesemaster64](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Cheesemaster64)] 15-8-2009(113): Remember Metapod from Pokemon? All it used was **harden** , which kept it _pent in_ until it grew _old_ enough to evolve into Butterfree..
護;safeguard;Words . . . flowers . . . vessels.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 8-3-2006(203): Think of the _flower-vessels_ as a the Greenpeace vessel “Arctic Sunrise”, only instead of a rainbow there is a big _flower_ painted on the hull (this will come back in [seize](../v4/701.html) (#701 獲) and [harvest](../v4/908.html) (#908 穫)). Think of “flower-power” and of the “peace” in “Greenpeace” and it will make some sense hopefully. – In this kanji, we see an inauguration _speech_ being given before the Greenpeace vessel is set afloat and sent to **safeguard** our planet.;2) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 24-11-2007(128): _Words_ and _Flowers_ are exchanged between sailors and their wives before they board the _vessel_ to **safeguard** the world.
銭;coin;Those special _gold_ -colored tokens minted each year for the Mardi Gras and thrown into the crowds from people on the _floats_ give us the kanji for **coins**.;1) [[Squintox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Squintox)] 3-10-2008(125): Interesting fact: The Japanese one yen **coin** is the only **coin** in the world that can float on water. <http://www.hanamiweb.com/floatingyen.jpg>.;2) [[PParisi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PParisi)] 12-10-2007(118): Political hopefuls in Rome threw gold **COIN** S from floats when they were campaigning for office.
皇;emperor;An **emperor** , as we all know, is a ruler - something like a _king_ but higher in status. The _white bird_ perched above the _king_ , elevating him to **imperial** heights, is the messenger he sends back and forth to the gods to request advice and special favors, something that _white birds_ have long done in folklore throughout the world.;1) [[mameha1977](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mameha1977)] 4-10-2007(151): Ancient Rome had **Emperor** s instead of Kings, and they wore white robes. Thus an **emperor** is a _king_ in _white_. (make sure you picture a roman **emperor** not a japanese one and you'll be ok).;2) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 13-10-2008(63): I don't think the Japanese would be happy if their **emperor** was a _white king_ …
皮;pelt;The simplest way to remember this character is to see it as built up from that for _branch_. The first stroke can then stand for something  "hanging" down from the _branch_ , namely its bark or **pelt**. The barb at the end of the second stroke is the only other change. Merely by concentrating on this as you write the following small cluster of characters should be enough to fix the form in your mind. By way of exception, you might doodle around with the kanji's form to see what you can come up with.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(150): A **pelt** is hooked on a branch. A small tent is made with a **pelt** and a branch planted in the ground. The mnemonic hints at the first stroke (the hanging **pelt** ) and the hook at the end of the second stroke. This is chinese radical #107 meaning “skin”.;2) [[myglagata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/myglagata)] 14-5-2008(54): To be honest, this is one of those cases where I have found it easier to "just remember it" as a radical, as it occurs so frequently: 彼 （かれ him） 波 （なみ wave）and so on.
牛;cow;Can you the "doodle" of a **cow** that has just been run over by a steamroller? The small dot in the first stroke shows its head turned to one side, and the next two strokes, the four legs.;1) [[Georgi87](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Georgi87)] 1-4-2008(210): A **cow** tried to climb up a vermilion tree, but in doing so, it broke its two bottom branches off.;2) [[dannyfartmaxwell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dannyfartmaxwell)] 6-5-2009(44): Mooooooooooooooooooo!!!!
呉;give;The complex of strokes in this kanji is unusual and difficult, because of the fourth stroke, which is rare (see frames 33 and 34). The _mouth_ and _tool_ are already familiar.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 14-3-2007(262): As a present, I **gave** my dentist a _hand-crank tool_ for spreading _mouths_. He was so happy since it makes his job easier.;2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 27-10-2006(66): I see this as a pictograph of an old-style phonograph - a stand, record, crank and bell (the mouth). Even the primitives work out - a _tool_ with a _crank_ which plays music out of the bell _mouth_. Imaginge **giving** one of these old and beautiful phonographs to a classical or jazz music buff!
秘;secret;Cereal . . . invariably.;1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 29-5-2007(158): The prize at the bottom of a _cereal_ box is _invariably_ a **secret** decoder ring.;2) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 25-2-2008(120): A young couple meets in **secret** in the _wheat_ field because their families are enemies. They _cross their hearts_ and swear eternal - even if **secret** \- love. Do not confuse with [secrecy](../v4/775.html) (#775 密).
酔;drunk;Whiskey bottle . . . baseball . . . needle.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-9-2007(267): God you're **drunk**! How many _whiskeys_ did you have? _9_? _10_?;2) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 7-2-2008(91): Whiskey with 90 percent alcohol will get you **drunk**. I don't care who you are.
捨;discard;Fingers . . . cottage.;1) [[stauff](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stauff)] 11-12-2005(258): Someone stuck their _fingers_ in my _cottage_ cheese! I'm going to have to _discard_ the lot!;2) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 30-10-2007(145): The wicked witch from Hansel and Gretel only likes the meaty parts of kids. Outside her candy _cottage_ , you can see a pile of **discard** ed _fingers_.
割;proportion;Harm . . . saber.;1) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 10-4-2007(181): [proportion, comparatively, divide, cut, separate, split] Hey, don't take this out of **proportion**! I did you just a little _harm_ , no need to come over here with a _saber_ …;2) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 15-10-2007(136): As shown on this pie-chart, the **proportion** of people _harmed_ by _sabres_ is relatively a small slice compared to those _harmed_ by guns.
柄;design;Tree . . . third class.;1) [[captal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/captal)] 27-4-2008(497): Half Way!!!!;2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 19-6-2006(223): This is a " _design_ " as in a "pattern", not a verb as in "to _design_ ". The **tree** grain _design_ was too expensive for the **third class** airline to use for the panelling. They just painted it.
危;dangerous;Bound up . . . unlucky.;1) [[nyquil](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nyquil)] 11-2-2007(281): You're _bound up_ by ropes to an _unlucky_ person. It's **dangerous** , because whatever happens to him will happen to you too.;2) [[greenapple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/greenapple)] 24-5-2006(37): While rock climbing you are bound to the cliff by just your fingerprints, which is why it's so **dangerous**.
甚;tremendously;_Bushel basket_ . . . _equal_. Note how the first stroke of _equal_ doubles up with the sixth stroke of the _bushel basket_ , and how the _animal legs_ of the _bushel basket_ are dropped to make room for the _human legs_ of _equal_.;1) [[Zareon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zareon)] 3-4-2007(203): It's a tremendous match between the two chess-players. They are clearly eachother's equal.;2) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 4-8-2007(49): These two _bushel baskets_ are **tremendously** huge. But not only they are huge, they are also perfectly _equal_ in size.
便;convenience;_Person_ . . . _grow late_. Hint: this kanji also means that unmentionable material that one disposes of when one goes to the  " **conveniences**. ";1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 17-12-2007(164): _Mr. T_ loves the **convenience** of the new konbini. Not only does it stay open even if it _grows late_ , they have brand new _toilets_ , and a _Post Office_!;2) [[cbogart](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cbogart)] 26-2-2007(79): Mr. T takes a dump on the floor of a **convenience** store. Well, it was growing late and he couldn't wait. He pities the fool who will have to clean it up!
騒;boisterous;Team of horses . . . crotch . . . insect.;1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-8-2006(266): The hidden Greeks inside the _Trojan Horse_ are getting **boisterous** as one of them is bitten in the _crotch_ by a nasty _insect_. If they don't shut up, the Trojans will hear them…;2) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 9-5-2006(76): Or more precisely: the team of horses are getting **boisterous** because one of them got bitten in the crotch by a horse fly. The kanji also means to roar, make up noise, to kick up a fuss and to make merry. Perhaps it is exactly the etymology behind this kanji.
聴;listen;_Ear_ . . . _needle_ . . . _eye_ . . . _heart_. Compare frame 427 for this and the following kanji, and then once again when you get to frame 950.;1) [[dukelexon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dukelexon)] 26-2-2008(250): I promise to use my _ear_ to do nothing but **listen** … stick a _needle_ in my _eye_ , cross my _heart_ and hope to die! (Intentionally said backwards to get the order of the primitives correct).;2) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 14-8-2006(115): **Listen** ing to others is different from hearing [1626] with the _ear_. One must allow the words to pierce through the _eyes_ (the window of the soul) and reach deep into the _heart_ …a symbol of thinking about and contemplating on what was said, not just the sounds of words spoken. A married man while reading his newspaper, his wife going on about something suddenly, says, "You're not **listen** ing to me, are you?" He replies, "I heard every word you said. You said…" “Yes, but you're not **listen** ing.".
短;short;Dart . . . table.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 1-3-2007(144): He's so **short** , he can't even throw over a _table_ while playing _darts_.;2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 25-11-2008(79): Sort of like ping pong, this kanji represents a game where you throw _darts_ over a _table_ at your opponent. The serve is rarely returned, so the games tend to be **short**.———— This character apparently refers to duration, not just to height.
席;seat;Caverns . . . towel.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 18-4-2007(192): Remember those poor commoners huddled in groups of 20 in a cave? The only thing they had for a **seat** was some old toweling (while their lords could recline on luxurious couches).;2) [[epsilondelta](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/epsilondelta)] 14-12-2009(62): PRIMITIVE: _Cave_ \+ _twenty_ = **Finnish sauna** (instead of Heisig's "caverns", which I'd confuse with "cave"). STORY: You don't directly sit on the wooden **seat** in the _sauna_ – rather, you put a _towel_ underneath.
哲;philosophy;Fold . . . mouth.;1) [[ithil](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ithil)] 2-11-2006(229): A two-hour lesson of **philosophy** in high school. All the students, bored to death, are _folding_ sheets of paper into planes, love notes or whatever, while the _mouth_ of the teacher is talking about Platon, Kierkegaard and many other notorious philosophers.;2) [[jwy2k2](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jwy2k2)] 19-5-2007(88): I fold my mouth, therefore I am.
各;each;"Suum cuique" goes the popular Latin proverb. A certain disease of the English language makes it almost impossible to translate the phrase without gender bias. In any event, here we see someone walking with his/her _mouth_ between his/her _walking legs_ , giving us an image of "To **each** his/her own. ";1) [[penne](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/penne)] 16-3-2008(260): Son, I've never told you this but **each** woman has a second _mouth_ between their fiiiiiine _walking legs_.;2) [[johanvg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johanvg)] 18-7-2006(156): **Each** and every one of us walks and talks differently.
承;acquiesce;The sense of passive acceptance or reception of information is contained in this key word. The form is based on the middle portion of the preceding character, with three additional strokes, best thought of as the kanji for _three_.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 14-3-2007(222): To get someone to _completely_ **acquiesce** it takes _3_ dunks in the _water_ before they give.;2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 25-10-2007(87): To get someone to **acquiesce** , duck them _completely_ in _aqua_ (= _water_ ) _three_ times. (variation on dingomick's).
亡;deceased;A _top hat_ hanging on a _hook_ in the front hall, right where the **deceased** left it the day he died, reminds us of him and his kanji.;1) [[cheechuan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cheechuan)] 29-10-2007(124): The _top hat_ hanging on a _hook_ belonged to the now **deceased** Charlie Chaplin.;2) [[Robatsu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Robatsu)] 5-3-2009(43): The recently **DECEASED** are said to hang their _hats_ on a _hook_ by the door to the afterlife.
遣;dispatch;This kanji takes away the _maestro_ 's baton and replaces it with a _purse_. The _road_ represents his being **dispatched** on his way a san obvious misfit. You will remember that when he did have his baton, he was being _chased_ down the road by his fans. All of which shows what a difference a single stroke can make!;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 11-3-2007(208): **Dispatch** all cars and _chase_ the _maestro_! He's gone crazy and stolen a ladies _purse_!;2) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 27-2-2008(55): Apart from meaning **DISPATCH** , this kanji can mean "to give (to someone lower than you)," "to do," and to even "have intercourse." STORY: The MAESTRO is on the ROAD waiting for a pimp to **DISPATCH** some new ladies (lower than him) so that he can GIVE THEM money from his PURSE and then DO IT with them. Where is the MAESTRO'S baton? You don't wanna know…
資;assets;The first _shells_ (money) you earn, you use to pay your debts. From then on, the _next shells_ you accumulate become your **assets**.;1) [[peace123](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/peace123)] 12-1-2006(246): **Assets** are the next best thing to money.;2) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 25-8-2006(86): The first SHELLS you get you obviously spend, but the NEXT SHELLS are your **ASSETS** , you should bury them in a low safe place (placement!).
灯;lamp;Since it is very hard to read by the _fireplace_ without going blind from the flickering of the flames or burning up from the heat, our ancestors invented a way to _nail_ down a bit of that _fire_ , just enough to light up the text of their evening newspapers and no more. Voilà! The **lamp**.;1) [[ceeeps](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ceeeps)] 3-9-2007(202): Imagine old gas **lamp** s which had a _flame_ to light up the _street signs_.;2) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 5-10-2007(85): A **lamp** is _fire_ you can hang from a _nail_.
徒;junior;Line . . . run.;1) [[Deborah](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Deborah)] 28-11-2007(160): The **junior** employee is always _RUNNING_ around _GOING_ here and there for his superiors.;2) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 28-9-2006(58): Your **junior** or Jr. in the succession _line_ is the one who _run_ s after you.
令;orders;Meeting . . . chop-seal.;1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 30-4-2007(208): (re: dingomick) "These are your **orders** ," declares the general while passing out documents at the _meeting_. As everyone started to leave, the general exclaims "Oh wait! I need to certify these **orders**!" and went around stamping each paper with his personal _chop-seal_.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 28-2-2007(73): "These are your **orders** ," declares the general at the _meeting_ as he stamps them with his _chop-seal_. (Primitive: chop-seal imaged as a papal ring, the one's they would press into wax as their official seal. Also a cattle brand.).
舎;cottage;A _lidded crock_ with an _umbrella_ overhead gives us a mixture of the modern and the nostalgic in this design for a **cottage**.;1) [[ibardell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ibardell)] 27-7-2007(260): The **cottage** is so small - it has an umbrella for the roof, soil for the floor and room for only one mouth.;2) [[astgtciv](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astgtciv)] 13-11-2006(57): Picture a _lidded crock_ full of tasty **cottage** cheese… yum! Now all we need is an _umbrella_ over it to protect the **cottage** cheese from the sun.
章;badge;Try to imagine a club **badge** pinned to your lapel in the form of a mammoth _sunflower_ protruding from a wee little _vase_.;1) [[sethimayne](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sethimayne)] 21-11-2007(189): In the military, **badge** s are given out _early_ in the day, with everyone _standing_ at attention.;2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 9-1-2006(121): Ash Ketchum _stood_ up _early_ in the morning, and said, "Pikachu, let's go get us another **badge**!".
鏡;mirror;After lakes but before glass, polished _metal_ was used for **mirrors**. These _metal mirrors_ are recalled in this character for a **mirror**.;1) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 3-2-2008(270): **Mirror** should suggest vanity. Imagine a spoiled girl who gets her parents to buy her a _Golden_ **mirror** so she can _stand_ in front of it all _day_ vainly admiring her lovely _human legs_.;2) [[digicult](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/digicult)] 16-4-2009(23): The _metal_ **mirror** makes a _sound_ \- it's answering the question "who has the fairest _human legs_ of all?".
値;price;Person . . . straightaway.;1) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 11-5-2007(163): Mr. T ( _person_ ) tells the used car salesman to tell him the real **price** _straight away_ , and when he doesn't he throws him through the windshield.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 22-2-2007(88): _Mr. T_ is shopping for new chains. He knows what he wants and money isn't an issue. "Cut the jibba-jabba, tell me the **price** , _straightaway_!".
就;concerning;_Capital_ . . . _chihuahua_ with a _human leg_ in place of one of its paws.;1) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 8-12-2006(279): In the _capital_ they have been having hearings **concerning** bioethics and bioengineering they call as their first witness a _chihuahua_ with _one human leg_.;2) [[BigAmish](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/BigAmish)] 15-8-2008(58): Ahem… **CONCERNING** your recent science fair project, it was a _CAPITAL_ idea, but the _CHIHUAHUA with a HUMAN LEG_ is freaking out the other contestants!

傷;wound;Person . . . reclining . . . piggy bank.;1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 7-12-2006(138): **Mr. T** cannot believe the **reclining** **piggy bank** won't give up. 阿;Africa;This kanji, an abbreviation for **Africa** , is now used chiefly for its sound, "a," not unlike the kanji for _Italy_ and the sound  "i" that we met earlier (Frame 1245). Its composite elements are: _pinnacles_ . . . _can_.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-2-2007(255): _Can_ you see **Africa** from _The Pinnacle_? I _can_! I _can_!;2) [[alreadytaken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/alreadytaken)] 11-5-2008(79): A kinda pictogram: 'BoT', the first 3 letters in 'Botswana' an **Africa** n country.
殊;particularly;Bones . . . vermilion.;1) [[saranich](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/saranich)] 14-3-2006(177): A t-bone steak is vermilion - **particularly** if served rare.;2) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 23-10-2006(146): Castlevania – The _vermillion_ skeletons ( _bones_ ) are **particularly** hard because they just keep regenerating.
冬;winter;_Walking legs_ slipping on the _ice_ are a sure sign of **winter**.;1) [[Ameyama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ameyama)] 30-3-2008(78): Don't slip off your legs in **winter** , strap two skis to your feet.;2) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 10-6-2008(50): In **winter** my _walking legs_ feel like blocks of _ice_.
勇;courage;Chop-seal . . . man.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-5-2006(206): I imagined some kind of initiation rite in old China, where every young _man_ has to show his **courage**. They then receive a _chopseal_ which is a mark of their **courage**.;2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 28-1-2008(76): Re: fuaburisu - The initiation rite in question is actually a reverse elbow chop to the _brain_ , and you receive the _chop seal_ if you have the _power_ to withstand it. This initial imagery helps me with the altered _chop seal_ and vertical placement.
温;warm;Water . . . sun . . . dish.;1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 17-1-2007(299): If you leave **water** out in the **sun** in a **dish** , naturally it will get _warm_.;2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 16-4-2007(30): I'm mixing this up with [warmth](../v4/1949.html) (#1949 暖) far too much. Trying to use mnemonic "Warm Water" - 温泉 （おんせん） obviously relates to _water_ that is **warm** , from the _sun_ and when you think about it, is kind of like a big _dish_.
妹;younger sister;The **younger sister** in the family is the _woman_ in the family who, like the newest branch in a tree, is _not yet_ old enough or mature enough to do everything the elder sister can do (See frame 442).;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 31-7-2007(172): My **younger sister** is NOT YET a fully grown WOMAN.;2) [[Istvan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Istvan)] 12-6-2007(50): Is your **younger sister** a woman? 般;carrier;Boat . . . missile.;1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 2-1-2007(165): **Carrier**?! This means "general" (as in the general public or generally). 頂;place on the head;The key word is actually a formal metaphor meaning "humble acceptance." Reading off the two primitive elements in the order of their writing, we have: _nail_ . . . _head_. As in  "hitting the _nail_ on the _head_. " Now one presumes that most people can handle metaphors, but if you were to run into a dimwit working in a hardware store who only knew the literal meaning of things, and were to ask him, in your best Japanese, to **place on your head** a nail, he might miss the point and cause you considerable torment.;1) [[ceeeps](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ceeeps)] 30-8-2007(284): If I put a _street sign_ on my _head_ what do I get ? A **place on the head** !;2) [[Kurisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kurisu)] 7-2-2008(68): _NAILS_ \- **place directly on the _fore_ head**, _NAILS_ \- **place directly on the _fore_ head**, _NAILS_ \- **place directly on the _fore_ head**, The **HEAD ON** commercial _nail_ s it into your _head_ ……

備;equip;_Person_ . . . _flowers_ . . . _cliff_ . . . _screwdriver_. In cases like this you can jumble up the primitive into any order that seems best for the composition of a story, provided you feel confident about the relative position that those primitives take to one another in the completed character.;1) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 14-2-2006(282): Mr. T wants to climb up and pick the flowers at the top of the cliff. He **equip** s himself with screwdrivers to use as climbing spikes to reach the top of the cliff.
