Before you enter a battle, you **equip** the _flower cliff screwdriver_. This is a small _screwdriver_ obtained at the bottom of a _cliff_ that, when used in battle, shoots out pink _flowers_. When they touch the ground in front of the enemy, they create a massive cliff, and the ground under the enemy falls away into the sea. He keeps watching it over and over again, trying to figure out how the _Fairy Godmother_ does her magic.
既;previously;_Silver_ . . . _waitress_. Do not confuse this kanji's key word with _before_ (Frame 263).;1) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 20-1-2008(222): Distinguish from [formerly](../v4/501.html) (#501 曽). Think of **previously** as "the previous customer" in a restaurant. At a cheap sleazy diner, the _waitress_ gives you unwashed _silver_ ware that was **previously** used by the previous customer. Yuck.;2) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 8-1-2008(78): For the waitress primitive, I don't really see the receipt. So instead, I imagine a waitress holding a plate above her head, using those legs to weave through the tables.
総;general;This kanji, meaning universal or widespread, is composed of three elements: _thread_ . . . _public_ . . . _heart_.;1) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 26-10-2007(305): _Spiderman_ could not achieve **general** acceptance by the media even after winning the _public_ 's _heart_.;2) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 27-3-2008(57): **NOTE** : This kanji stands for [ **Total** , All, whole, gross]. The Kanji commonly used for "In **general** " will appear later as [carrier](../v4/1871.html) (#1871 般).
輪;wheel;Car . . . meeting . . . scrapbook.;1) [[adhmm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adhmm)] 23-11-2007(131): Someone stole all the **wheel** s off the ladies' cars at the scrapbook convention.;2) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 17-9-2007(112): During a talk at the _academic conference_ , speaker shows an introductory slide depicting the structure of _car_ , and then moves on to the more narrow topic of **wheels**.
敬;awe;Standing in **awe** of someone, you get self-conscious and may try to speak in _flowery phrases_ out of veneration or fear. The _taskmaster_ at the right is drilling you in the practice of your  "honorifics.";1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 30-10-2011(155): The _flowery phrases_ of **keigo** ( 敬語 ) with which you must address the _schoolmaster_.;2) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 14-6-2008(75): 敬 【けい】 (n) reverence, respect. 敬語 【けいご】 (n) honorific, term of respect, (P) STORY: The TASKMASTER demands RESPECT. If you don't talk to him in HONORIFICS and FLOWERY PHRASES you will be sorry.
臣;retainer;This kanji is actually a pictograph for an eye, distorted to make it appear that the pupil is protruding towards the right. This may not be an easy form to remember, but try this: Draw it once rather large, and notice how moving the two vertical lines on the right as far right as possible gives you the pictograph of the eye in its natural form. The "pop-eye" image belongs to an Emperor's **retainer** standing in awe before his ruler.;1) [[lifeflaw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lifeflaw)] 17-12-2008(112): **Retainer** : _a servant, especially one who has worked for a person or familly for a long time._ Now, if you imagine looking at a **retainer** (e.g. Igor) from top, you see how he is bending his head (middle rectange) between his two shoulders as he offers something with his two hands (upper and lower lines) to his master.;2) [[yvanc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/yvanc)] 12-6-2007(71): Its a pictograph of a teeth with a **retainer** in the middle.

尋;inquire;Broom . . . craft . . . mouth . . . glue.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 3-9-2006(349): The policed **inquire** d into the erotica scandal. They tried to sweep away the evidence, but some of it stuck. Imagine the police inquiring in an in-depth investigation. They are interrogating a suspect. But the suspect has a _crafty mouth_ and is very sly. He/she also knows when to keep their mouth shut( _glued_ ) at the right moments to avoid self-incrimination. As a final measure, the police torture the suspect by tickling him/her with a broom while they **inquire**.

滅;destroy;Picture a _march_ of _flames_ demonstrating against the Fire Department for their right to **destroy** , but being doused with _water_ by the police riot squads.;1) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 20-7-2007(208): Water flows down to **destroy** the march of fire.;2) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 26-10-2007(98): Use a _water_ cannon to **destroy** a line of _march_ ing _fire_ monsters. I keep mixing this one up with [disaster](../v4/167.html) (#167 災) and [demolition](../v4/400.html) (#400 壊). Remember, you **DESTROY** monsters (think of the Godzilla movie "Destroy All Monsters!"). Fires and floods are natural DISASTERs. And DEMOLITION is something you carefully do while wearing protective garments. (vaguely based on stefanot's balrog story).

泉;spring;Call to mind the image of a fresh, bubbling **spring** of _water_ , and you will probably notice how the top of the **spring** you are thinking of, the part where the  "bubbling" goes on, is all _white_. Happily, the _white_ is just where it should be, at the top, and the _water_ is at the bottom.;1) [[lilpea](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lilpea)] 3-8-2007(181): _White_ is a symbol of purety, so _white_ _water_ is pure water, the precise definition of **spring** water.;2) [[hikarudo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hikarudo)] 19-8-2008(123): Perhaps the most common appearance of this kanji is in the word 温泉 (おんせん, onsen), a Japanese hot **spring**. The kanji is an excellent image of someone enjoying a Japanese hot **spring** : a little _white_ towel on top, _water_ below. (This helps keep all associations: **spring** , little and onsen).

埋;bury;When we speak of **burying** something (or someone, for that matter), we usually mean putting them under _ground_. Only here, we are **burying** our beloved _computer_ that has served us so well these past years. Behind us a choir chants the  "Dies irae, dies illa" and there is much wailing and grief among the bystanders as they pass by to shovel a little _dirt_ into what will be its final resting place. 帝;sovereign;An uncommon, but not altogether unlikely picture of a reigning **sovereign** has him _standing up_ in his _apron_ , presumably at the behest of HIS **sovereign** (she who is to be obeyed), who needs help with washing the dishes.;1) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 6-7-2006(254): The crazy **sovereign** stands up from his throne, wearing nothing but a crown and a towel. That's why they try to keep him locked up in the castle away from the public.;2) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 16-2-2008(51): This one is so tricky for me. The key is to remember that the bottom stroke on the _standing_ element takes those little crown "winglets" on the right and left. The most effective image might be of QEII (who is quite short) using her crown as a kind of stool. She's _standing_ on her _crown_ rummaging through a high cupboard looking for her _apron._ I guess the **sovereign** 's servants have the day off.
捕;catch;Fingers . . . dog tag.;1) [[bihzad](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bihzad)] 1-5-2008(196): I was retreating from the battlefield. In the chaos, my friend threw his dogtags at me to give to his family. It has an _arrowhead_ and _screwdriver_ -shaped radio beacon. It's evidently fired in animals to track their movements. When animal has a _dog tag_ , it's easy to **catch** it: just take a _dog tag_ in your _fingers_.
池;pond;_Water_ . . . _scorpion_. It would be easy to slip into a  "lazy image" in cases like this one, picturing, let us say, a _scorpion_ near the _water_. But if you picture rather a _scorpion_ letting its venom out _drop by drop_ until it has made a whole **pond** of the stuff, the image is more likely to remain fixed.;1) [[khooks](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/khooks)] 13-7-2008(110): Remember the story of the _scorpion_ that begged the turtle for a ride across the **pond**? 級;class;Threads . . . outstretched hands.;1) [[daredawg3583](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/daredawg3583)] 19-5-2008(276): This Kanji is the same ones used in the Japanese Language proficiency tests, i.e. ikkyuu ( 一級 ) The Kanji doesnt describe **class** as in a "class of students" or "classroom," but rather a grade of quality or ability. ———- Spiderman is taking the JLPT Level 1. In desperation he REACHES OUT to grab his friend's answer sheet next to him, who seems to be doing well. The other test takers are obviously a **class** above him. Looks like this test is above his **class** of knowledge.;2) [[jamiemw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jamiemw)] 17-9-2007(65): Spiderman with his arm stretched out showing the **class** how he produces webs.

植;plant;You have no doubt seen how people practicing the Japanese art of bonsai take those helpless little saplings and twist them into crippled dwarves before they have a chance to grow up as they should. The more proper way to **plant** a young _tree_ and give it a fair shake in life is to set it into the earth in such a way that it can grow up _straight_.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 18-8-2007(273): **Plant** s don't become _tree_ s _straightaway_.;2) [[liosama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/liosama)] 28-6-2008(109): When you **plant** **plant** s, you use a piece of WOOD to make the **plant** grow STRAIGHT.
陰;shade;Just as the _sunshine_ (Frame 1397) represents the masculine principle in nature (Yang), the **shade** stands for the feminine principle (Yin). 完;perfect;In order not to confuse the key word **perfect** with others nearly synonymous in meaning, pull it apart to have a look at its native Latin roots. _Per- factum_ suggests something so  "thoroughly made or done" that nothing more needs to be added to it. Now look at the kanji, which does something similar. We see a _house_ that has been made **perfectly** from its _beginnings_ in the foundation to the roof on the top. Now return to frame 101 and make sure not to confuse this key word with the kanji for _complete_.;1) [[yukina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/yukina)] 3-11-2006(172): Make the **perfect** impression in the _beginning_ by removing your shoes upon entering a Japanese _home_.;2) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 2-12-2007(154): In the beginning, Adam and Eve had a home in Eden. It was **perfect**.

The directors were so impressed that they let him stunt double for Hannibal in a few episodes. OR, _Mr T_ **chief** in' on some _crack cocaine_. You make the call.
忍;endure;Blade . . . heart. **Endure** here means long-suffering patience.;1) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 22-10-2006(280): A ninja must be able to **endure** the pain of clinging to a ceiling, motionless, for hours at a time, waiting for just the right moment to drop down and thrust the _blade_ of his sword into the _hearts_ of his enemies. 了;complete;Learn this character by returning to frame 99 and the image given there. The only difference is that the "arms" have been left off (actually, only tucked inside). Thus a _child_ with its arms wrapped up into the back-sack is the picture of a job successfully **completed**.;1) [[sutebun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sutebun)] 8-9-2007(252): The experiment was a **complete** failure! The child was made without any arms!;2) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 23-7-2007(73): A child with the arms inside the blanket will be **complete** ly wrapped up.
暴;outburst;Sun . . . strung together . . . rice grains.;1) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 31-8-2007(164): Having spent all _day_ _stringing together_ _grains of rice_ he suddenly had an **outburst** , "I can take it any longer!".;2) [[laner36](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laner36)] 2-11-2007(140): Noah was having an **outburst** after being at sea for 40 days and 40 nights and running out of rice grains to eat. Then the _sun_ suddenly burst out in an **outburst** over the _Ark_ and there was an **outburst** of cheering.
珍;rare;Jewel . . . umbrella . . . shape.;1) [[Zareon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zareon)] 3-4-2007(196): The king has a really **rare** umbrella, it can change shape.;2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-2-2008(60): Tip: _umbrella_ \+ _shape_ : This combination of primitives appears four times in Heisig, so it may be worthwhile giving it a name. I suggest " _parasol_ " (because it is the same _shape_ as an _umbrella_ ). REF: _rare_ (FRAME 1723) , [check-up](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/1724) (#1724 診), [measles](../v4/2574.html) (#2574 疹), [fallible](../v4/2720.html) (#2720 謬).
区;ward;The **ward** referred to here is a subdivision of a large city. Its elements: _box_ . . . _sheaves_. When used as a primitive element, it may be helpful at times to break it up into these same composite elements.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(175): That's the homeless **ward** of the city. _Wolverine_ lives in a _cardboard box_ there.;2) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 31-1-2006(33): In the **ward** office the _sheaves_ of paper of the **ward** registration forms are kept in a _box_.
洗;wash;This character is so logical that one is tempted to let the elements speak for themselves: _water_ . . . _before_. But we have already decided we will not allow such rationalism to creep into our stories. Not even this once. Instead, let us change the character from the Peanuts comic strip called  "Pigpen," who is always preceded by a little cloud of dust and grime, and rename him " **Wash** -Out." Everywhere he walks, a spray of _water_ goes _before_ him to sanitize everything he touches.;1) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 10-2-2008(286): In Japan, you always **wash** with _water_ from the shower _before_ you enter the bathtub.;2) [[undershaft](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/undershaft)] 27-2-2007(80): You **wash** things with WATER to get them back to the clean state they were in BEFORE.
梅;plum;Behind _every_ Jack Horner's pie maker, a _tree_ full of **plums**.;1) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 30-8-2007(185): **Plums** actually grow on every single tree. What, you didn't know that? They do. Orange trees, apple trees, cantaloupe trees. **Plum** s are simply mutant fruits that have been installed in the root software of every single tree. I hear that some **plum** -loving scientists are working on a way to hack _every_ _tree's_ genetic code so that _every tree_ will bear nothing _but_ **plum** s.;2) [[Spoonz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spoonz)] 1-3-2009(74): _every_ man's _wood_ has 2 **plum** s.

迫;urge;To **urge** someone to do something, you make the _way_ as appealing as possible, perhaps even _white_ washing it a bit.;1) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 13-10-2006(179): When you have the **URGE** to go to _White_ Castle, you know it's time to hit the _road_.;2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 28-8-2007(106): When you start down the **road** of **cocaine** , you're sure to feel some pretty bad **URGE** s soon.

I asked. "Simple, foo," he answered, "you gotta _build_ the body up by bodybuilding!".

There, he uses his good looks to **beguile** women (gets them to buy him drinks or such), by playing with their hearts.

翌;the following;_Feathers_ . . . _vase_. 才;genius;Whatever one is particularly adept at - one's special " **genius** " \- one can do very easily, "with one finger" as the phrase goes. This kanji is a pictograph of that one finger. Note how its distinctive form is created by writing the final stroke of the element for _fingers_ backwards.;1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 31-10-2007(143): Spinal tap: "Every other band's amps go to _ten_. But you see my _extra stroke_ of **genius** \- these go to eleven.".;2) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 29-6-2008(133): A TEN year old had a STROKE of **GENIUS** and wrote this joke: [何歳ですか？](midori://search?text=何歳ですか？) [。。。天才です！](midori://search?text=。。。天才です！) .
称;appellation;Wheat . . . reclining . . . little.;1) [[wrightak](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wrightak)] 16-5-2006(224): Taking **appellation** to mean the act of naming, we have the _little_ baby superman _reclining_ in the space craft that landed in a _wheat_ field. Mr. and Mrs. Kent look down and decide to call him Clark. (I also thought of Jesus but he was born in a barn full of hay not wheat).;2) [[the_marshal](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/the_marshal)] 17-1-2007(119): _WHEAT_ that is _RECLINING_ and _LITTLE_ ( _small_ ) can't get the _APPELLATION_ "quality wheat".
膝;knee;Flesh . . . tree . . . umbrella . . . rice grains.;1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 26-7-2009(80): Before [lacquer](../v4/932.html) (#932 漆) was made with water, it was made by draining this _body part_ of fluid: the **knee**!;2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 2-8-2008(44): Back in ancient Japan, people didn't have **knee** pads for things like rollerblading and such (what, come on. Ninjas on rollerblades. Ultimate 90s flashback). Instead, they would simply dip their **knee** s in _laquer_ , and wait until it dried (hence the _flesh_ , and the abscence of any _drops of water_ ). Unfortunately, this meant that you would have to wait about 30 minutes after deciding to go rollerblade until you could actually do it (took some time to dry) - and removing it was a serious pain.
豊;bountiful;Bend . . . table. Think of a **bountiful** harvest, and you will not be far from the meaning of this character.;1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 17-6-2006(256): The **bountiful** feast was so **bountiful** that it _bent_ the _table_ below it under its weight! いただきま〜す！.;2) [[WithLoveFromExIA](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/WithLoveFromExIA)] 26-1-2013(64): Her bust and bum was so **bountiful** I couldn't resist the urge to _bend_ her over a nearby _table_ and…
崎;promontory;_Mountain_ . . . _strange_. Hint: you might save yourself the trouble of a story here simply by recalling the kanji for _cape_ (Frame 164) and toying around with the differing images suggested by the key words **promontory** and _cape_.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 30-1-2008(297): This is “Cape Strange” from FRAME 153, only with _mountain_ in place of _soil_. Interestingly, there is also 碕 which is made of the primitives _stone_ and _strange_. The three kanjis 碕, 埼 and 崎 all have the same meanings and pronunciations. They have very little uses other than names, for which **promontory** is the clear winner with over 2300 uses in place and people names, while the other two kanjis account for less than 200 names.;2) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 3-9-2007(128): A **promontory** is a small, _strange mountain_ that juts out into the sea.
剣;saber;_Awl_ . . . _saber_. As we promised way back in frame 87, here at last is the kanji on which the primitive element of the same name is based.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(140): If it helps, make the awl primitive **ice pick** instead. They're basically the same thing. This kanji is an easy David vs. Goliath story of the **icepick** vs. the _saber_ …;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 2-7-2008(96): Every self-respecting ninja knows the story of "The _Awl and the Sabre_ ". According to the legend, a woman once defended herself by using an _awl_ against a _sabre_! She used to work all day with that _awl_. However, the bandit using the _sabre_ had no skill. And thus the _awl_ beat the _sabre_. And from there the saying goes : "The _sabre_ is powerless against the _awl_ , if one can't use the _sabre_.".

This cliff is quite famous for daring individuals to cliff dive off of, but is any of them daring enough to threaten the owl?;2) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 9-3-2008(70): ( 厳しい strict, **stern** ) You remember of course the daring fella who had his ear pierced and went standing in front of the taskmaster. The taskmasters punishment was very **stern** /strict. Fella thrown of the cliff, where the owls are ready to feast. No funny guy doing that anymore.

祭;ritual;_Flesh_ . . . _crotch_ . . . _altar_. Note how the second element is cut short, giving a tent-like effect to the character.;1) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 8-8-2007(404): A **ritual** such as a circumcision: a small piece of flesh from the crotch is left on the altar.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 17-4-2007(41): There are many famous penis **matsuri** s(festivals) in Japan. The **ritual** s of these festivals involve placing the _flesh_ of the _crotch_ on an _altar_.

脚;shins;_Part of the body_ . . . _instead_. This character has more or less the same meaning as that for _leg_ learned back in frame 1372. It can also indicate the part of the legs from the **shins** down, which explains the choice of the key word.;1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 5-6-2007(266): **Shins** are the _part of the body_ that Japanese traditionally sit on _instead_ of their asses.;2) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 12-10-2007(204): **Shins** are the _part of the body_ that one uses _instead of_ one's eyes, for finding furniture in the dark. (Ouch!).
充;allot;Infant . . . human legs.;1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 10-11-2007(305): Scene at the baby factory: Manager: "Good news! Your _infant_ has been **allot** ted _human legs_ ". Parent to be: "Thanks **a lot**!".;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(40): An infant at the maternity ward is **allot** ed a new pair of human legs, because his are not grown properly or absent. Picture the “lot” as a parcel, placed near the infant, to be used later. The “lot” of human legs has been **allot** ed by some doctor, to be used later. Mnemonic “infant **allot** ed new pair of human legs”. Note: to **allot** means to apportion by lots, it has the same root as the word “lottery”.

姓;surname;Woman . . . cell.;1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 16-8-2006(292): When _women_ marry, they adopt the **surname** of their husband, signifiying the start of a new _life_ together. (adapted from gorgon).;2) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 1-3-2006(87): _Woman_ change their **surname** when they "start their new _life_ ".
疲;tired;Sickness . . . pelt.;1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 30-5-2007(208): I picture an **exhausted** _sick caveman_ snuggling up in a _comfy pelt blanket_.;2) [[inuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/inuki)] 12-10-2006(97): Your body feels **tired** when you have a sickness. All you want to do is wrap yourself up in a nice warm pelt and get better.
染;dye;_Water_ . . . _nine_ . . . _tree_. From those elements you must compose a plot for the key word, **dye**. Here, as elsewhere, any of the alternate meanings of the primitives may be used, provided they do not require a position other than that of the kanji in question.;1) [[munia](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/munia)] 21-8-2008(210): To make this **dye** , I used _water_ and the barks of _nine_ different _tree_ s.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 8-8-2007(108): The _baseball_ team hangs their freshly **dye** d _dripping_ jerseys at the top of a _tree_ to dry.
暫;temporarily;Chop off . . . days.;1) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 30-1-2006(219): Your car has been savagely (see steadily) attacked by an ax. It will be some days before your car is fixed. So you are **temporarily** without car.;2) [[jotun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jotun)] 24-5-2008(107): Today is Car Axe Day. The day where you can **temporarily** (today only) attack cars using an axe without punishment.
犯;crime;Wild dogs . . . fingerprint.;1) [[erlog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/erlog)] 16-3-2007(250): **Crime** s can often be solved using the tools of dogs and fingerprints.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 12-1-2006(84): This **crime** gang has yet to be caught because their _pack of wild dogs_ takes care of licking off the _fingerprints_ from all the **crime** scenes.
辞;resign;Tongue . . . spicy.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-7-2006(282): This guy's job is tasting the _spicy curry_ at the local Indian Food Factory. He has to **resign** from his job before his _tongue_ is rendered completely useless after all the spicy food that he has to try all day long…;2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 17-7-2006(55): A lecherous male worker is forced to **resign** because the female employees compained about his _spicy_ _tounge_.
砂;sand;Good **sand** for beaches has _few_ or no _stones_ in it. That means that all of us whose feet have been spoiled by too much time in shoes don't have to watch our step as we cavort about.;1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 31-5-2006(143): Here's how I remember that _stone_ is on the left. This is because **sand** starts as _stones_ , and only later they become _few_.;2) [[TerryS](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TerryS)] 26-11-2008(112): In good **SAND** , _stones_ are _few_ , if any.
邪;wicked;Tusk . . . city walls.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 12-4-2007(191): The **wicked** queen builds her _city walls_ out of menacing _tusks_.;2) [[johnskb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnskb)] 19-5-2006(66): As everyone knows, rhinoceroses and elephants are often killed for the value of their TUSKS. Here we see a **WICKED** city mayor who has had countless elephants killed just to make his CITY WALLS out of TUSKS.
油;oil;Water . . . sprout.;1) [[stefanot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stefanot)] 16-1-2007(196): The _liquid_ **oil** that _sprouts_ from an **oil** field.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 11-10-2005(65): In a rather surprising scientific breakthrough, genetically modified _Brussel sprouts_ (which have become extremely absorbative), are thrown in the _water_ to suck up **oil** spills.
闇;pitch dark;Gates . . . sound.;1) [[enryu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/enryu)] 3-9-2009(68): Through the gates of hell there is no sound, no light, its all **pitch dark**.;2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 29-7-2009(26): In the **pitch dark** , I can hear the _sound_ of the _lesbians_ rubbing their _gates_ together.
概;outline;_Roots_ . . . _waitress_. Note that the kanji meaning of the two primitives to the right is not used here because we shall later meet a primitive meaning _beforehand_ and want to preempt any confusion. The same holds true in the following frame.;1) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 1-9-2007(221): A murder has been commited. A corpse was found under a _tree_. The police chalks the **outline** of the victim, an old _silvered_ -haired _waitress_ working at a restaurant nearby.;2) [[RobMow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RobMow)] 16-9-2009(60): If you attempted to **outline** the biography of most famous actresses, you'd find that they have _roots_ working as _waitresses_ before getting their big break.
遂;consummate;The _horns_ atop the _sow_ suggest a boar at work in the background. Add the element for a _road_. Now create a story whose meaning is: **consummate**.;1) [[rizzo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rizzo)] 20-10-2005(173): This is still Miss Piggy only she's gotten _horny_ (as she often does) and now she's _pursuing_ Kermit to help her **consummate** her desires.;2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 30-6-2008(74): I don't often complain about Heisig's keywords - but 'consummate' is a little misleading. Think about this kanji in terms of **ACCOMPLISH** or "realize" rather than a sexual encounter. Or, combine the two: the policemen thought they had **accomplished** the task of _driving out_ (see **pursue** , last frame) all the _sows_ , but they received a phone call reporting two _horny_ pigs **CONSUMMATING** on a _road_. When they got there, they found a male and female police officer, not pigs!
鬼;ghost;Drop of . . . brains . . . human legs . . . elbow.;1) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 6-4-2007(189): A **ghost** , or **oni** , wandering slowly on its _human legs_ , searching for _brains_ to eat. What looks like an _elbow_ here is actually a pictoral representation of the _forked tail_ protruding out of its rear.;2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 18-11-2006(95): **Ghost** s aren't very intelligent - they have but a _drop_ of _brains_ \- so can't tell the difference between an _elbow_ and a pair of _human legs_.
聖;holy;Ear . . . mouth . . . king.;1) [[tcjeff](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tcjeff)] 11-6-2008(182): A **holy** man hears with his _ears_ before he speaks with his _mouth_ , which places him higher than a _king_ in people's esteem.;2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 3-7-2007(175): The trick for me is to remember that the 耳 is to the left of the 口 . However, this is easy because a true **holy** man uses his _ear_ to listen (i.e., to God or his supplicant) before he opens his _mouth_ to speak, unlike a charlatan who just makes something up. Of course, _king_ s are often true **holy** men and prophets (e.g., King David in the bible).
汽;vapor;Think of this character as a sibling of that for _spirit_. Simply replace _sheaves_ with drops of _water_ on the left in order to get _vapor_.;1) [[inuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/inuki)] 1-12-2006(197): Water **vapor** almost looks like a spirit but has no soul.;2) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 25-2-2007(44): Wolverine disappears into _water_ **vapor** , seemingly his _spirit_ dissipating into nothingness.
舟;boat;After the _drop_ and the _glass canopy_ , we come to a combination of three strokes that we met only once before, in the character for _mama_ (frame 105). The pictographic meaning we gave it there has no etymological relationship to this character, but use it if it helps.;1) [[Copycatken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Copycatken)] 29-6-2006(188): I see this kanji as a pictograph of a two story **boat** seen from the front. The _glass canopy_ is the body of the **boat**. The _drop_ on top is the chimney. The horizontal line is the _ceiling/floor_ between the the 1st/2nd floor. Finally, the _two drops_ in the middle are the lights on the decks.;2) [[jajaaan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jajaaan)] 1-1-2010(54): Pictograph of a **boat** seen from above. The middle line is the oars. The drop on top is the rudder (at the back of the **boat** ). The two drops inside represent the passengers: one is bent over with the effort of rowing and the other is sitting up straight, in the front of the **boat** , looking at the horizon for any signs of land.
順;obey;In primitive language, this character would read _stream_ . . . _head_. And that turns out to be convenient for remembering its meaning of **obey**. Either one **obeys** the person who is _head_ of an organization or else **obeys** by following the _stream_ of opinion ( "current" practice, we call it). Both these senses come together in this kanji.;1) [[steves](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/steves)] 10-10-2007(185): "Obey, **Obey**!" says the brain-washing scientist as he sends a _stream_ of orders to fill your _head_.;2) [[jonny49cc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jonny49cc)] 4-7-2008(92): **Obey** the orders streaming down from head office.
憎;hate;State of mind . . . increase.;1) [[eriklc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eriklc)] 20-11-2005(209): Like the saying goes, **Hate** just begets **Hate**. A state of mind that just increases and increases until it explodes.;2) [[Rivvie](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rivvie)] 17-2-2008(85): Your _state of mind_ would turn to **hate** when someone would take away a loved one that was _formerly_ yours.
益;benefit;Poised over the _dish_ here is a pair of _animal horns_ that are attached to a pair of _animal legs_ by a single horizontal stroke.;1) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 19-7-2007(279): The **benefit** of having sharp _horns_ and fast _legs_ is that an animal can get to the food _dish_ first.;2) [[QuackingShoe](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/QuackingShoe)] 23-7-2008(110): The **benefit** of being an animal with _horns_ and fast _legs_ is in keeping it from becoming a _dish_ for the other animals! (shaydwyrm).
泊;overnight;When you stop at an inn for an **overnight** rest, all you expect is a bit of _water_ for a wash and a set of clean _white_ sheets to wrap your weary bones in.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 27-7-2007(171): Please supply a guest who stays **overnight** with WATER and WHITE sheets.;2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 27-8-2007(99): When I go to an **OVERNIGHT** party, all I need is a bit of **water** and some of that hard **white**. (crack). (not really, but come on. much easier to recall than white sheets).
陣;camp;Pinnacle . . . car.;1) [[stehr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stehr)] 29-9-2007(155): Paparazzi make **camp** outside of _The Pinnacle_ in their _cars_ , waiting for the celebs to come out.;2) [[Hinode](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hinode)] 11-2-2009(117): Note: This kanji is most often used in a military context. Story: Here we see an en **camp** ment of military _vehicles_ laying siege to _The Pinnacle_. With other countries being envious of the perfect life they lead there that makes sense. Fortunately, the pinnacle knows how to [ward off](../v4/1302.html) (#1302 防) enemies.

You have to think with **prudence** (ponder carefully) about approaching a tiger, as is evident from 虎 .;2) [[javiergakusei](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/javiergakusei)] 4-11-2007(127): You have to think with **prudence** about approaching a tiger. 弾;bullet;Bow . . . simple.;1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 30-3-2007(215): Hunting with a _bow_ is too complicated. I'm switching to something _simpler_ –using a **bullet**.;2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-2-2007(55): The _bow_ was a weapon for _simple_ times, but nowadays it has been replaced by **bullet** s.
勤;diligence;Cabbage . . . muscle.;1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-5-2007(140): Growing _cabbages_ takes _muscle_ and **diligence**.;2) [[lynbroughton](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lynbroughton)] 25-7-2007(68): It takes great **DILIGENCE** for a cabbage patch dolly to build up her _muscles_ and win the Miss Universe contest!
推;conjecture;Fingers . . . turkey.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-10-2005(239): In mathematics, a **conjecture** is a mathematical statement which has been proposed as a true statement, but which no one has yet been able to prove or disprove. Have you heard of the _Finger-Turkey_ **conjecture** ? It states that if _turkeys_ had _fingers_ , they would be able to count. Be sure to imagine a turkey with fingers at the tip of its wings, counting from one to ten.;2) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 19-7-2007(87): In the midst of **conjecture** on whether it was done or not, mom stuck her _fingers_ in the _turkey_ to check.
卓;eminent;The word **eminent** suggests a famous or well-known person. So all you need to do - given the primitives of a _magic wand_ and a _sunflower_  \- is to think of the world's most **eminent** magician as one who uses a _sunflower_ for a _magic wand_ (like a flower-child who goes around turning the world into peace and love).;1) [[thatkidpercy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thatkidpercy)] 16-11-2007(338): The most **eminent** magician is he who learned to use his _magic wand early_ in life.;2) [[canji](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/canji)] 26-7-2008(38): The world's most **eminent** sourcerer, Harry Potter, used his _magic wand early_ in life.
誌;document;Words . . . intention.;1) [[indigo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/indigo)] 15-2-2008(190): This is quite simple: a **document** is a set of _words_ describing your _intentions_.;2) [[Johan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johan)] 24-4-2006(144): A will is an important **document** that contains your final _word_ on how you _intend_ to distribute your assets.
仙;hermit;Person . . . mountain.;1) [[ruuku35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruuku35)] 9-5-2006(163): A **HERMIT** is a PERSON who lives in the MOUNTAINS.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 6-1-2006(81): After living as an **hermit** (recluse) for a while in the _mountains_ , _Mister T_ becomes an immortal mountain fairy ("fairy" is another meaning of this kanji).
欠;lack;The pictograph hidden in this character is of someone yawning. The first stroke shows the head thrown back, the second, the arm bent at the elbow as the hand reaches up to cover the mouth, and the last two, the legs. Since yawning shows a **lack** of something (psychologically, interest, physiologically, sleep), the connection is plain to see.;1) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 13-8-2007(138): To me, this kanji looks like a person with two arms and two legs, but who **lack** s a head.;2) [[bendyarm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bendyarm)] 5-10-2007(56): When your body **lack** s oxygen you _yawn_.
陸;land;The sense of **land** carried by this kanji is distinct from _soil_ (Frame 161) and _ground_ (Frame 554) in that it is meant to represent **land** seen from a distance, that is, _land_ as opposed to  "water." Its elements: _pinnacle_ . . . _rice seedlings_ . . . _ground_.;1) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 11-4-2006(162): My rice-seedlings have become sentient and will go on a mission. I can only apologise for the next 6 frames. In the distance, there is a _pinnacle_ , which the newly-awakened _rice-seedlings_ who are still stuck in the _ground_ can see. Could it be the Promised **Land**?;2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 23-7-2006(90): When sailors see **land** in the distance, they first see the _pinnacles_ of the new **land** , but when they come close enough they'll be able to make out the _rice seedlings_ , and finally the _ground_!
頬;cheek;Scissors . . . head.;1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 23-11-2007(67): Your **cheeks** contain your jawbones, which are known as the " _scissors_ of the _head_.".;2) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 26-11-2008(51): The Joker from Batman had his **cheek** s cut with scissors to give him that eternal smile. Now the Joker isn't right in the head.
拠;foothold;Fingers . . . dispose.;1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 17-11-2006(312): When rockclimbing, when your weight _disposes_ of the valuble **foothold** , all that's left is your _fingers_ keeping you from death. Meanwhile, your _walking legs_ are left dangling in the _wind_.;2) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 10-4-2008(174): Once you have a good **foothold** , you can _dispose_ of your _finger_ hold.
嬢;lass;Woman . . . grass skirt.;1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 18-4-2007(203): Conversation at a party: A: "Who is that **lass**?" B: "Which one?" A: "The _woman_ wearing the _grass skirt_." B: "Alas, I don't know".;2) [[Beneus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Beneus)] 1-1-2009(46): "There once was a **lass** , whose skirt was made of grass…" insert your own humorous ending.
糸;thread;Remember when your granny used to ask you to bend your arms at the _elbows_ and hold them out so that she could use them like a rack to hold a skein of string or yarn (here **thread** ) while she rolled it up into a _little_ ball? Now can you see the two _elbows_ (with the second stroke doubling up) at the top, and the character for _little_ below?;1) [[lerris](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lerris)] 3-7-2007(195): I also went with Spiderman. However, in the cases where this primitive appears under other primitives, as opposed to on the left (I think there are ~5 times in this chapter) I've opted to use a similar character: Venom. This helps keep the positioning clear, especially on such characters as [dainty](../v4/1363.html) (#1363 細) and [accumulate](../v4/1364.html) (#1364 累).;2) [[Piitaa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Piitaa)] 17-7-2006(81): You'll be seeing this one a lot. Seriously.
旧;olden times;A _walking stick_ is needed for _days_ of **olden times** , since _days_ , too, get old - at least insofar as we refer to them as the "good old days." The main thing here is to think of "good old days" when you hear the key word **olden times**. The rest will take care of itself.;1) [[gangsterdesunee](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gangsterdesunee)] 17-8-2007(225): Age 18 = **olden times**.;2) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 21-7-2007(86): The old man with a walking stick kept talking of **olden times** all day long.
省;focus;When we think of **focusing** on something, we usually take it in a metaphorical sense, though the literal sense is not far behind. It means to block out what is nonessential in order to fix our _eye_ on a _few_ important matters. The kanji suggests picking up a _few_ things and holding them before one's _eye_ in order to **focus** on them better.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 18-8-2007(251): You **focus** by concentrating your _eye_ on _few_ er objects.;2) [[smujohnson](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smujohnson)] 26-8-2008(48): To remember the order: When **focusing** , keep a _few_ things your TOP priority, so only they come UNDER your _sight_.
却;instead;Gone . . . stamp.;1) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 31-1-2007(428): [instead, on the contrary, rather] _Gone_ is the time for _stamps_ \- use e-mail **instead**.;2) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 8-1-2010(47): We use e-mail now **instead** of regular mail. My e-mail is _gone_ before you can even put a _stamp_ on your snail mail.
障;hinder;Pinnacle . . . badge.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-2-2007(177): The officer at the gate to _The Pinnacle_ with a giant _badge_ sewn to his chest **hinder** s all visitors. But not the **handicapped**. They're **hinder** ed enough already. They're given a _badge_ and can pass right into _The Pinnacle_.;2) [[Soseki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Soseki)] 27-2-2008(65): The _pinnacle_ of racism was that of the Nazis. They made the Jews wear a _badge_ on their clothes to identify them. They **hindered** their every movement. Moreover the peace-loving Dutch all wore the _badges_ so that the Jews would be unidentifiable. Effectively **hindering** the Nazi plot.
戯;frolic;Void . . . fiesta.;1) [[joxn_costello](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joxn_costello)] 8-2-2009(166): This is a story about the end of the universe. The universe is turning into a featureless _void_. There's nothing we can do about it except for throw a _fiesta_ and **frolic** a little bit before it's all over.;2) [[nerdjnerdbird](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nerdjnerdbird)] 6-10-2007(47): Sigfreid and Roy's contract having been _void_ ed, the tiger is free to **frolic** about at the _fiesta_.
尽;exhaust;Shakuhachi . . . ice.;1) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 8-2-2011(285): A women is so **exhaust** ed by her "shakuhachi" that she needs to ice her jaw.;2) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 27-6-2008(67): **Exhaust** here is like car **exhaust** or using up something such as **exhaust** ing your supplies. So picture a SHAKU-HACHI flute being played in ICE cold temperatures. You'll see the **EXHAUST** from your breath as it leaves the SHAKU-HACHI flute.
併;join;The sense of the key word is one of **joining** things together that were previously separate. Its elements: _person_ . . . _puzzle_.;1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 16-4-2007(158): _Mr. T_ furiously works a _puzzle_ in an attempt to **join** Mensa, the high-IQ society.;2) [[ziggr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ziggr)] 30-11-2006(75): "Why do I gotta **join** these two _puzzle_ pieces? I ain't got time for **joining** no jigsaw-jabba!" _Mr. T_ apparently gets a severe case of crankypants when doing puzzles.
惜;pity;_State of mind_ . . . _once upon a time_. The sense of the key word is that of a lost opportunity or bad turn of affairs, as in the phrase  "What a **pity**! ";1) [[jmadsen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jmadsen)] 13-2-2006(189): What a **pity**! My _state of mind_ when i think of the opportunities I missed from _once upon a time_.;2) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 10-11-2008(85): "I **pity** da foo who **borrowed** my place in this kanji! 畳;tatami mat;Rice field . . . crown . . . shelf.;1) [[DurablePants](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DurablePants)] 22-6-2006(322): The king is peacefully sleeping on his new **tatami mat** when all of a sudden a shelf falls over and kills him. You can see his crown poking out and the brains splatter out the top of his head from all the pressure.;2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 20-6-2007(74): Making **tatami mats** from _rice field_ waste was Japan's _crowning_ achievement, but for some reason other countries just _shelved_ the idea.
姫;princess;Woman . . . slave.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 10-10-2005(223): **Princess** Leia becomes Jabba's slave (“princess Leia is a woman slave”).;2) [[mhaellix](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mhaellix)] 28-9-2007(106): Cinderella: A woman who was a slave who became a **princess**.
検;examination;Tree . . . awl.;1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 15-1-2007(158): You're giving a TREE an **EXAMINATION**. You take a wood sample from the TREE with an AWL (cmp [exam](../v4/1278.html) (#1278 校)).;2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 4-2-2008(112): Don't confuse with [exam](../v4/1278.html) (#1278 校), [test](../v4/354.html) (#354 試), [evaluate](../v4/1487.html) (#1487 評). Think of **examination** as a doctor's **examination**. You're having problems getting _wood_ in bed. You go in for a doctor's **examination**. The doctor shoves an _icepick_ into your manhood as part of the **examination**.
党;party;Think of this key word as referring to a political **party** , not a gala affair. Its elements: _human legs_ . . . sticking out of an _outhouse_ window.;1) [[calittle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/calittle)] 2-10-2007(424): Every major political **party** , if personified, would look like a giant _outhouse_ walking around with _human legs_ spewing out a constant stream of bullshit.;2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 4-9-2007(50): Every political **party** is full of shit. But nobody ever says how they get that way. Well, here's your answer - a political **party** memer is in the outhouse, greedily chowing down on the contents inside. He's grown so accustomed to the taste that he's in all the way, and all you can see are his legs through the window. He'll come inside later to the auditorium to make a speech and spew everything out.
製;made in...;A label indicating that a _garment_ was **made in** U.S.A. or Taiwan or Japan is itself a symbol for the _systematization_ of the _garment_ industry.;1) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 24-10-2006(155): **Made in** china - a system of exploitation . making garments for nothing.;2) [[gwadonna](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gwadonna)] 12-8-2008(89): **Made in…** is a _system_ of labels you can find on every _garment_ s.

呂;spine;This character is rather like a picture of two of the vertebrae in the **spine** linked by a single stroke.;1) [[Thaliel](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Thaliel)] 8-7-2006(145): **Spine** connects head and body.;2) [[Senshi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Senshi)] 20-7-2007(54): The **spine** goes from one opening mouth/opening (mouth/face) to another mouth/opening (genitals). Just think of these openings being enlarged to represent the head and the body. The bottom is bigger because the body is bigger than the face.

袋;sack;Substitute . . . garment.;1) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 27-4-2007(261): A **sack** is an easy substitute for a garment.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 18-10-2005(44): A worker who was recently **sack** ed from his job, is wearing a **sack** of potatoes as a _substitute garment_ (naked otherwise), in some kind of protest. The kanji is close to frame 1547 "bag", and although the later really refers to a "straw **sack** ", I use the image of a **sack** of potatoes here, and that of a "plastic bag" for frame 1547. The keywords would have been better swapped in my opinion, but the relevancy is not so important at this point (see notes of Lesson 31 in the book).

創;genesis;Godown . . . saber.;1) [[nmkohi](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nmkohi)] 23-7-2006(233): Back in the day the people were so excited to get hold of the Sega **genesis** they looted the godown with sabers.;2) [[imojyochu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/imojyochu)] 17-12-2008(84): I prefer to have girls _Godown_ on my _sabre_ to prevent unwanted **GENESIS** of babies………… 創造 そうぞう (creation).
墓;grave;The mounds of _soil_ with crude wooden crosses set at their head suggests those boot-hill **graves** we all know from cowboy lore. The only odd thing about this kanji is that the _soil_ comes UNDER the _graveyard_ , rather than to its left, where we might expect. Just think of the bodies as "lying under boot-hill" if you have any trouble. By the way, this is not the first time, nor will it be the last, that we learn a kanji whose key word is the same, or almost the same, as a primitive element based on it, but whose shape differs somewhat. There is no cause to worry. By using the primitive in a variety of other characters, as we have done here, the confusion will be averted as a matter of course. In most cases, as here, the primitive element is taken from a part of the fuller kanji.;1) [[simple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/simple)] 14-9-2007(212): The _soil_ under a _graveyard_ is full of **graves**.;2) [[mameha1977](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mameha1977)] 14-10-2007(64): A **grave** is a patch of _soil_ in a _graveyard_.
救;salvation;Request . . . taskmaster.;1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 24-12-2006(243): Like in the biblical sense, someone looks skyward and makes a _request_ for **salvation** from this horrible _taskmaster_ …;2) [[Johan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johan)] 22-4-2006(131): For **salvation** you have to _request_ forgiveness from God (the ultimate _taskmaster_ ).
模;imitation;Ah, but haven't modern _graveyards_ become a parody of their ancestors! The flowers are plastic, the writing on the stones is unimaginative and cold, and the whole thing looks more like a marble orchard than a right and proper graveyard. This kanji continues with the modernization trend by picturing **imitation** _trees_ in the _graveyard_. But of course, how convenient! They don't need pruning or fertilizing, their leaves don't fall, and they remain the same color all year long.;1) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 21-1-2008(149): If I find out this furniture you're selling me is made of **imitation** _wood_ , I'll put you in the _graveyard_.;2) [[Ninjasha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ninjasha)] 15-1-2008(67): The Japanese are so enamored of everything plastic, they even put **IMITATION** plastic _trees_ in their _graveyards_! (No, not really, but I wouldn't be surprised).
燃;burn;_Hearth_ . . . _sort of thing_. Beware of letting the simple reading off of the primitive elements do your work for you. Unless you make a vivid image of something **burning** and relate it just as vividly to those primitive meanings, you can count on forgetting this character very quickly.;1) [[saruwatari](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/saruwatari)] 5-1-2008(202): Any sort of thing can **burn** in the fire.;2) [[sweetneet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sweetneet)] 5-2-2009(59): The Japanese are very particular about what SORT OF THINGs are considered **BURN** able trash and what's not.
型;mould;_Punish_ . . . _soil_. In cases like this, you might find it easier to break the character up into its more basic elements, like this: _two hands_ . . . _saber_ . . . _soil_.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-10-2005(231): A famous ninja once pressed his _two hands_ and _saber_ into the _soil_ of his temple, before going onto a mission from which he never came back. Think of some sort of signature that he left behind him. The **mould** of his two hands and saber has since become a popular attraction in the area.;2) [[Ceryn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ceryn)] 5-6-2008(103): As a PUNISHMENT they made me lay face down in the DIRT leaving a nice imprinted **MOULD** of my whole BODY.

That is, it doesn't loose its needles/leaves in the winter.;2) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 29-2-2008(34): Mystique leaning against a **cedar** tree for a photo shoot.

責;blame;Grow up . . . oyster.;1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 22-2-2007(318): As one _grows up_ , one typically starts to **blame** all of their problems on _money_.;2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 20-10-2008(79): This is the story of a poor fisherman and his wife. A long time ago he caught an oyster with a small but precious pearl. The intelligent wife told him to sell the pearl immediately: the greedy husband figured if he kept the oyster and fed it, it would grow up and yield an even bigger pearl. One day the _oyster grew so big_ , it crashed through the house and escaped back to sea. The angry wife left her husband, **blaming** his blind greed for their poverty.

But often the most attractive!
麗;lovely;The painting of a _deer_ itself with its form and color is enough to fill the bill for an image of something **lovely**. But to give a bit of contrast, we see two _mediocre_ drawings from a later age on two patches of _ceiling_ above. Note that the drop in _mediocre_ has been lengthened somewhat and the second stroke drawn down straight.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 9-4-2007(153): The anthropologist made an exact _deer painting_ from the cave _ceiling_ on the _ceiling_ of his house. Too bad they're both _mediocre_. 尚;esteem;Above we see the primitive for _little_ attached to one of those _glass canopies_ you might use to display a family heirloom. The _littleness_ is important, because what is in fact on display is the shrunken, stuffed, and mounted _mouth_ of an **esteemed** ancestor. We may be used to **esteeming** the words our forebears leave behind, but here we also **esteem** the very _mouth_ that spoke them. I leave it to you to imagine a suitable place in your room for displaying such an unusual conversation piece.;1) [[gaijinda](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gaijinda)] 14-10-2007(242): An especially **esteem** ed alien has three antennae on his helmet.;2) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 17-1-2007(114): Remember that scene from Star Wars, where Luke is wearing that _helmet_ that only his _mouth_ could see, and was swinging at that _little_ thing buzzing around the room? That was Obi-Wan's trick to get Luke to build his self- **esteem** , or his confidence in the Force.

費;expense;Dollar sign . . . shells/money.;1) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 6-10-2007(212): An **expense** is an **expense** , whether you put it in _dollars_ or in local _money_.;2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 16-5-2007(98): A _dollar sign_ next to an amount of _money_ denotes an **expense**.
延;prolong;This character is a kind of pictographic image of how **prolonging** is a clever way of _stopping_ things by trying to _stretch_ them out a little bit at a time (the extra _drop_ at the top of _stop_ ). Be sure to get a concrete image of this process, by imagining yourself **prolonging** something you can really, physically, _stretch_.;1) [[Ameyama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ameyama)] 24-3-2008(289): _Stretch_ ing _correct_ ly **prolong** s life. Even the top part of 正 is stretching…;2) [[ashman63](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ashman63)] 14-4-2008(99): If you want to **prolong** your sexual encounters, the best way to _stretch_ them out is to _stop_ your orgasm after just one _drop_ has come out. (with inspiration from gorgon).
除;exclude;Pinnacle . . . scale.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(245): To become a member of _The Pinnacle_ , they test you on a _scale_. If you weigh _too much_ , they **exclude** you.;2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 28-11-2006(69): You won't make it unless you **exclude** something. 机;desk;We need to fix imagination here on two things to learn the kanji for **desk** : the wonderful rough _wood_ of which it has been hewn and the _wind_ that blows across it, sending your papers flying all over the room. 宝;treasure;Every _house_ has its **treasure** , as every thief knows only too well. While the things we **treasure** most are usually of sentimental value, we take the original sense of the term **treasure** here and make it refer to _jewels_ kept in one's _house_.;1) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 7-11-2007(99): On **treasure** island is a single _house_ \- where all the _jewels_ are stored.;2) [[NooNoo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/NooNoo)] 23-4-2008(84): Put a " _roof_ " (lid) on your _jewels_ and voila! 竜;dragon;_Vase_ . . . _eel_. 尺;shaku;The key word **shaku** has actually come into English in the word _**shaku** hachi_, the ancient Japanese flute that measured "one **shaku** and eight _sun_ " (the "sun" being about an inch in length). Since the **shaku** is about one foot in length, this makes about 20 inches. Let the final sweeping stroke be like a tape measure added to the _flag_.;1) [[jwy2k2](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jwy2k2)] 6-5-2007(194): Slang for blowjob and that's priceless for stories…but also the character looks like the letter R which I think of as standing for RULER (12 inches) other meanings include: rule, measure, length.;2) [[crystalcastlecreature](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crystalcastlecreature)] 15-6-2009(65): Since this is SLANG for BLOW JOB and since it looks like an "R", let's have the primitive be the R in BROW JOB. :).
扉;front door;Door . . . jail cell.;1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 21-5-2007(260): The only way out of a _jail cell_ is to serve your time and walk out the **front door**. There are no other _doors_.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 26-10-2005(64): An old man serving a very long jail sentence painted a life-like _door_ at the back of his _jail cell_ , hlafway open, with the blue sky, clouds, etc, as some kind of symbol of freedom. Every time the prison officers come to take him they ask him to come to the door. The old man with a grin always answers "Which _door_?", looking at his painted door with a grin. And the prison officer always answer, sighing - "The **front door** !".

召;seduce;A _sword_ or _dagger_ posed over a _mouth_ is how the character for "beckoning" is written. The related but less tame key word **seduce** was chosen because it seemed to fit better with the - how shall we put it? - Freudian implications of the kanji. (Observe if you will that it is not sure whether the long slender object is **seducing** the small round one or vice versa.);1) [[arekuru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/arekuru)] 24-6-2008(172): A man is easily **seduce** d by a mouth to his "sword.".;2) [[cornrow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cornrow)] 1-11-2008(94): When you **seduce** a girl you can put your sword in her mouth.
揚;hoist;Fingers . . . piggy bank.;1) [[mairov](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mairov)] 2-9-2007(236): My piggy bank is so heavy that I cannot **HOIST** it using just my fingers.;2) [[DrWarrior12](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrWarrior12)] 12-9-2007(157): Picture a major robbery where some dudes are breaking into a bank to steal their money. They get their man in the vault through the ceiling - now he's hanging from a rope a few feet from the ground (like in the movies, dodging laser beams). He reports back that he has found the loot, and its all in a large piggy bank in the center of the vault. The alarm sounds and he's got to think fast. He jams the four fingers of his right hand in the piggy bank slot and tells his team to **hoist** him up, he's got the loot!
宇;eaves;House . . . potato.;1) [[erikkusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/erikkusan)] 19-3-2006(187): Under the **eaves** of the house the poor family has potate plants.;2) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 23-4-2006(84): Very good image Erik. To help those who struggleded with this, the **eaves** of a house is usually the bit where you hang the roof gutter along, usually made of zinc or plastic and shaped as a half-pipe. It catches rain water, so it flows to a drain pipe instead of down onto people and windows. And in this family the potato plants grow along the **eaves** so the water pours down on them. They are poor. so no gutter.

While these differ a bit from the _five holes_ that we used to represent the  " _I_ " (frame 17), the idea of achieving a special _state of mind_ by covering those five places can help you learn this kanji. 甘;sweet;This kanji is a pictograph of a small wicker basket. (The extra short stroke in the middle helps keep it distinct from the character for _twenty_.) All one needs to add is some image of **sweet** cakes or breads carried in the basket, and the union of picture and meaning is complete. Take care not to confuse with _confectionary_ (Frame 1203).;1) [[greenapple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/greenapple)] 10-5-2006(119): Little red riding hood is carrying around a wicker basket filled with **sweet** baked cookies for granny.;2) [[kumakuma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kumakuma)] 7-7-2008(62): Girls are kinda **sweet** and sexy until they reach their twenties. So 20 minus ONE.

畑;farm;Looking at the primitives, a _fireplace_ and a _rice field_ , we find the essential ingredients for a **farm** : a warm _hearth_ to sit by at night, and a well-plowed _field_ to grow one's crops in by day.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 30-7-2007(245): Many **farm** s are created by first setting FIRE over the land to clear the land for the FIELDS.;2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 16-7-2007(49): When creating a **farm** , the prospective **farm** er must first set _fire_ to the forest to clear the ground. 則;rule;The character depicts a _clam_ alongside a great and flashing _saber_. Think of digging for _clams_ in an area where there are gaming **rules** governing how large a find has to be before you can keep it. So you take your trusty _saber_ , which you have carefully notched like a yardstick, crack open a _clam_ and then measure the poor little beastie to see if it is as long as the **rules** say it has to be.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 12-10-2011(271): When you have both _money_ and the power of the _sword_ , you can make the **rules**.;2) [[ashman63](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ashman63)] 4-2-2008(126): If you've got CRABs on your SABER, then you didn't follow the **rule** s of safe sex!
兼;concurrently;At the top we have _the animal horns_ and the single horizontal stroke to give them something to hang onto. Below that, we see one _rake_ with two handles. Finally, we see a pair of strokes splitting away from each of the handles, indicating that they are both splitting under the pressure. The composite picture is of someone holding down two jobs **concurrently** , using the same kit of tools to move in two different directions and ending up in a mess. Take the time to find this sense in the kanji and it will be easy to remember, despite initial appearances.;1) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 29-1-2008(254): Our ninja hero, disguised as a gardener with a _rake_ , is suddenly attacked from both left and right **concurrently** by bulls with _animal horns_. Our hero lets out a blood-curdling scream and tears his rake handle vertically in half, so he now has two wooden staffs ( _split rake handle_ ) to fight with. He grips each staff (left side and right side) and rams it into the horns of the charging bulls. The force of each charging bull causes the tips of each staff to split again ( _split bottom of each rake handle_ ).;2) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 12-1-2008(68): You decide to take the bull by the _horns_ and do both chores **concurrently** , grabbing your _double-handled rake_ before attempting to clean up both your's and your neighbours' garden. But unfortunately, it's not long until your _rake_ _splits in two_.
乳;milk;Fledglings . . . hook.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 28-10-2005(315): A _fledgling_ is being nursed at a zoo, it is fed **milk** through a small tube that is bent in the shape of a _hook_ (so that it fits inside its beak). The _fledgling_ soon becomes addicted to **milk** , giving us this very catchy mnemonic: “ _fledgling hooked_ on **milk** ”.;2) [[stehr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stehr)] 1-10-2007(67): Drinking **milk** not only reduces [cavity](../v4/96.html) (#96 孔)'s but also strengthens _nails_ (claws) thanks astgtciv.

釣;angling;The character we learned for _fishing_ (Frame 184) refers to the professional, net-casting industry, while the **angling** of this character refers to the sport. 舌;tongue;The primitive for _mouth_ and the character for _thousand_ naturally form the idea of **tongue** if one thinks of a _thousand mouths_ able to speak the same language, or as we say,  "sharing a common **tongue**. " It is easy to see the connection between the idiom and the kanji if you take its image literally: a single **tongue** being passed around from _mouth_ to _mouth_.;1) [[wzafran](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wzafran)] 16-5-2007(199): What is in a _mouth_ that permits it to speak a _thousand_ things? Yes, a **tongue**.;2) [[TerryS](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TerryS)] 16-11-2008(82): A _thousand mouths_ speak the same **TONGUE**.

襲;attack;_Vase_ . . . _meat_ . . . _slingshot_ (doubled up with) _snake_ . . . _three_ . . . _garment_. The top half of this character is the old form for the kanji in frame 575.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 14-1-2006(250): The top 16 strokes are the chinese radical for "dragon". Joining up both meanings of the radical we can name the top part of this kanji "imperial dragon". Two-headed snakes do exist as biological curiosities, and they look a bit like a _slingshot_ (with the heads splitting at a junction). Our _imperial dragon_ here, the pet of a Chinese emperor, is a rare "three-headed slingshot- snake" kept in a _vase_ and fed with _meat_. When the emperor **attack** ed neighbours, his army wore the _imperial dragon garment_.;2) [[jackswitch](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jackswitch)] 31-3-2009(99): Fuaburisu's story is incredibly good, but I made it a bit simpler: The _imperial dragon_ is a rare " _three-headed slingshot-snake_ ", kept in a _vase_ and fed with _meat_. It's very aggressive, so at feeding time you need to wear the special _garment_ or it will **attack** you.旗;national flag;Banner . . . bushel basket.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 11-3-2007(201): The United Republic of Chess' **national flag** is actually a _banner_ with a _rook_ , that way they can hang it at every tournament.;2) [[misha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/misha)] 30-11-2007(61): The **national flag** of Croatia. 熊;bear;_Elbow_ . . . _meat_ . . . _spoon_ ATOP _spoon_ . . . _oven fire_.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 16-3-2007(264): Most don't know it, but **bear** s have the _ability_ to walk on _fire_. 嫁;marry into;The kanji in this frame demonstrates the traditional Japanese approach to marriage: it is the _woman_ who leaves her family for another _house_ hold, thus **marrying into** a man's family.;1) [[vosmiura](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vosmiura)] 30-5-2007(188): Since the Nihonjin man is hardly ever home, the _woman_ feels more like she's married into the _house_ than into a relationship.;2) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 16-5-2008(102): Traditionally, it was the _women_ who would **marry into** the _households_ of their husband's families.
策;scheme;_Bamboo_ . . . _belted tree_ (See frame 446).;1) [[Hyland1](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hyland1)] 14-10-2006(229): The temples in kyoto belt bamboo around trees in a **scheme** to protect them from the huge number of tourists. (true story)———– 対策 たいさく measure, countermeasure.;2) [[pm215](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pm215)] 3-4-2008(122): (Elaboration of jameserb's story:) A clever **scheme** from Wile E Coyote – he ties one of those rubber _belts_ to some _trees_ and uses it to launch a _bamboo_ spear at the roadrunner…
圧;pressure;One of the things that causes the erosion of _soil_ is the excessive **pressure** of the top _soil_ on the lower _soil_. This can be caused by any number of things from heavy rainfall to heavy buildings to the absence of sufficient deep-rooted vegetation to hold the layers together. Here we see a steep _cliff_ without a tree in sight. The **slightest** pressure on it will cause a landslide, which, with a little help from your imagination, you will be able to see happening in this character.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 30-7-2007(212): The GROUND at the base of a CLIFF must suffer from enormous **pressure**.;2) [[DrWarrior12](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrWarrior12)] 4-8-2007(52): For physics people: p = F/A (p:pressure, F:Force, A:Area). Where the force is from the immensity of the cliff. The area on the cliff is covered by soil. So the equation becomes p = F/A = cliff/soil which preserves the position of the primitives.
寧;rather;House . . . heart . . . eye . . . spike.;1) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 31-10-2007(236): A pretty tough kanji. Think of elegant old housewives with English accents dining together at a HOUSE party. The hostess brings out a dish of hors d'oeuvres: a SPIKE of metal with an EYEBALL and a HEART skewered on it. Upon being offered this treat, one of the housewives says in her English accent, "I'd **RATHER** not.".;2) [[saranich](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/saranich)] 25-3-2006(235): **Rather** a house with a heart than an eye with a spike.
専;specialty;_Ten_ . . . _rice fields_ . . . _glue_. That is how one would read the primitive elements of this kanji from top to bottom. Now if we make a simple sentence out of these elements, we get:  " _Ten rice fields glued_ together. " A **specialty** , of course, refers to one's special " _field_ " of endeavor or competence. In fact, few people remain content with a single **specialty** and usually extend themselves in other _fields_ as well. This is how we come to get the picture of _ten fields glued_ together to represent a **specialty**.;1) [[Ameyama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ameyama)] 17-11-2007(287): After you have chosen your _10_ _fields_ of study, _measure_ how good you are at each to find out your **specialty**.;2) [[DrWarrior12](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrWarrior12)] 7-7-2007(97): 10 brains glued together allows you to specialize in any **specialty** that you want. Imagine each brain having its own **specialty**.
財;property;Clam . . . genie.;1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 31-10-2007(257): If you're a _money genius_ , you can afford a lot of **property**.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-10-2005(116): The keyword refers to **property** in the sense of money or funds rather than of buildings or real estate. Keep this one distinct from frame 193 (“wealth”) and frame 473 (“assets”). Here we have a genie, gulping down oysters. Someone tries to grab an oyster and the genie puts his big arms around his oysters and states his “right of ownership” : “They're mines, my **property**!”.
揺;swing;Fingers . . . condor.;1) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 4-9-2008(174): For the _condor_ primitive: A **condor** is like a _vulture_ , but _twice_ as big and it lives near _mountains_ (a suitable place for such a majestic bird). For **swing** : I'm sitting on a **swing** when a _condor_ comes by and picks up the whole **swing** set with its big _finger_ -like claws and now I'm **swing** ing in mid-air. Weeeeeeeee!!!!!;2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 15-6-2007(141): I keep **swing** ing gleefuly on the talons of the _soaring condor_ until he slices off my _fingers_ and sends me plummeting.
鮮;fresh;Fish . . . sheep.;1) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 10-4-2007(268): The **fresh** est _fish_ is caught in the middle of the night while most people are "counting _sheep_." (If you've ever been to Tsukiji fish market, you know what I mean).;2) [[Bullfrog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Bullfrog)] 27-6-2009(222): This one's easy to remember. The kanji gives 2 examples of foods that should be purchased **fresh**. To remember which foods, take the first letter of **fresh** , "F", to stand for fish and the final sound of **fresh** , "SH", to stand for sheep: **FreSH**. It even puts the primitives in the right order.
防;ward off;Pinnacle . . . compass.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-2-2007(207): A giant compass is _The Pinnacle_ 's self- **defense** system. It points in the direction of any invaders so the city is prepared well ahead to **ward off** the intruders.;2) [[Johan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johan)] 28-4-2006(68): To **ward off** enemies, the ancient Greece kept watch from the _Acropolis_ , where they had a clear view in all _directions_.
偶;accidentally;The _person_ on the left is familiar. As for the right side, we may combine the _insect_ with a _brain_ (observe the writing) and a _belt_ to create the _Talking Cricket_ who served as Pinocchio's conscience. ( _The belt_ is there because he pulls it off to give unrepentant little Pinocchio a bit of  "strap" now and again.);1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 23-4-2007(165): _Mr. T_ **accidentially** stepped on _Jiminy Cricket_ (a brainy insect, with a belt sort of sash to hold his "conscience" badge).;2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 20-7-2007(69): _Mr. T_ **accidentally** steps on _Jiminy Cricket_. // Primitive: right side: _Talking cricket_ = _Jiminy Cricket_ , a _brainy insect_ with a _belt_ to whip little kids who misbehave.

干;dry;It is best to see this kanji as a pictograph of a revolving circular clothesline (viewed from the side). Spin it around quickly in your mind's eye to give it the connotation of to **dry**.;1) [[tomusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tomusan)] 23-4-2008(168): **Dry** _one_ item in _ten_ minutes on the _clothesline_.;2) [[brose](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brose)] 17-2-2007(57): Note: the book shows the strokes for _potato_ rather than **dry** …dry does not have the hook at the end.

Your real **hope** is that your parents don't find out that you left the house.
垂;droop;_A drop of_ . . . _silage_ . . . _walking stick_ . . . _floor_. The character is written in the order of its elements.;1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 16-8-2006(158): For an old man with a _walking stick_ , even a _drop_ of _silage_ to carry on his back will make him _droop_ low down to the _floor_.;2) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 13-9-2008(107): Even a _drop_ of _silage_ is enough to make an old man with a _walking stick_ **droop** low down to the _floor_. (rgravina - fixed up order).
阪;Heights;This character is used for proper names, much as the English word " **Heights** " is. Its primitives: _pinnacle_ . . . _anti-_.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 27-8-2007(260): If you're scared of **Heights** , you don't want to stay at _The Pinnacle_ , you are _anti-_ _The Pinnacle_. Primitive: _The Pinnacle_ is a dream-like gated community at the top of a mount. This allows for innumerable stories for all the kanji with this primitive since you have a whole city to work with. Also prevents confusion with "mountain".;2) [[wasurenaide](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wasurenaide)] 6-12-2007(47): People are being displaced in 大阪 to make room for a new development, Osaka **Heights** , the _pinnacle_ of modern Japanese housing. An angry mob of protestors are outside with _Anti-_ Osaka **Heights** signs.

鉢;bowl;Let **bowl** suggest a large and heavy _golden_ **bowl** into which you are throwing all the _books_ you own to mash them into pulp, for some outrageous reason you will have to think up yourself.;1) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 17-6-2008(202): This is the **BOWL** of an alchemist: see how he mixes _metals_ in his **bowl** , as he follows the instructions from his _book_?;2) [[sannomiya](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sannomiya)] 20-11-2006(66): If I was begging with a **BOWL** , I would want GOLD and BOOKS.
潮;tide;Before we get to explaining this character, take a look at it and see if you can figure out the primitive elements on your own.... On the left is the _water_  \- that much is easy. On the right we have only one primitive, the kanji for _morning_ learned back in Frame 53. See how an apparently complex kanji falls apart neatly into manageable pieces? To get the meaning of the key word **tide** , just think of it in connection with the character for _eventide_ that we learned back in Frame 115. Here we have the _morning_ - **tide** , its complement. By the way, if you missed the question about the number of primitives, it is probably because you forgot what we said earlier about kanji becoming primitives, independently of the pieces that make them up. As a rule, look for the largest kanji you can write and proceed from there to primitives stranded on their own.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 27-7-2007(205): The morning **tide** is basically, well, WATER in the MORNING.;2) [[Mesqueeb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Mesqueeb)] 19-4-2009(46): If it's not Eventide ( 汐 ) it must be _morning_ **tide**!
