I suggest " _furniture_ " (a common type of _wooden goods_ ). REF: [parch](../v4/215.html) (#215 燥) , _maneuver_ (FRAME 671), [winding](../v4/1369.html) (#1369 繰), [seaweed](../v4/2035.html) (#2035 藻). Story: Using just a _finger_ you are trying to **maneuver** your _furniture_ round your room.;2) [[jaresty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jaresty)] 3-10-2007(147): Luke skywalker points his fingers and uses the force to **maneuver** the goods through the tree branches and up over the tree.
免;excuse;This character is used for **excusing** oneself for a failure of courtesy. 唐;T'ang;The key word here refers of course to the **T'ang** Dynasty in China (and not to the name of the drink astronauts take with them into outer space, though this could be useful for the next frame). One picks up a _rake_ and says, "What about this – T'ang, do you think?" The second puts the _rake_ in his _mouth_ and answers, "Yes, it does **tang** a bit".;2) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 17-12-2005(133): Screw it, this character refers to the drink. The powdery orange substance is actually found on the floor of tropical _caves_ , where trained aboriginal peoples use wooden _rakes_ to rake the Tang into a pile before putting a bit of it in their _mouths_ to see if it's tasty or not.

略;abbreviation;_Each field_ has its own **abbreviations** (chemistry, philosophy, sports, etc.). 序;preface;Cave . . . beforehand.;1) [[FudoMyo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FudoMyo)] 13-3-2007(308): The **preface** to all human history was written _beforehand_ in _caves_.;2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 29-1-2008(45): Rename the "beforehand" part to be _glove_ (because you have to wear _gloves_ beforehand if you want to wield the halberd, which is why this primitive is an incomplete halberd). But he can't get started. He sits and stares at empty paper until evening. It gets cold and he puts on _glove_ s, shivering, but still unable to start his **preface**.
獄;prison;Although we did not make note of it at the time, the kanji for _dog_ is also a low-grade term for a spy. And later (Frame 1517) we will meet another association of criminals with _dogs_. The **prison** here depicts a _pack of wild dogs_ (the long-timers and hardened criminals) into which the poor little c _hihuahua_ (first offender) has been cast. The only thing he has to protect himself against the pack are his shrill and frightened _words_.;1) [[f98plow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/f98plow)] 25-5-2007(226): The wild dog family visits their cousin in **prison**. They exchange words over the interphone at the visiting booth.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 13-12-2007(41): The only thing keeping the new _chihuahua_ inmate from being 'initiated' by the _pack of wild dogs_ were his quick _words_ in **prison**.

Just examine it carefully, ask politely about the (few by now) kanji that you don't know, and put it away carefully in a location that shows your counterparts how important they are to you.

只;only;When we run across abstract key words like this one, the best way to get an image it to recall some common but suggestive phrase in which the word appears. For instance, we can think of the expression "it's the **only** one of its kind. " Then we imagine a barker at a side-show advertising some strange pac-manlike creature he has inside his tent, with only a gigantic _mouth_ and two wee _animal legs_.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 21-8-2007(231): Imagine an animal with **only** a _mouth_ and _leg_ s.;2) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 3-5-2008(118): My girlfriend insists that the _only_ thing I want from her is what's between her legs.. She's drawn me this pictograph to demonstrate. It's a _head_ and two legs spread apart.. I explain that I also love her breasts, and then she smacks me in the face. I'll never understand women.. (I keep failing this kanji, hopefully this silly story will help me!).
扱;handle;Finger . . . outstretched hands.;1) [[nilfisq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nilfisq)] 30-8-2007(192): See [suck](../v4/689.html) (#689 吸): if it's too big to **handle** , just use your _fingers_ instead…;2) [[joesan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joesan)] 6-10-2007(131): One of the first thing a baby can do with his hand is to _reach out_ and grab your _finger_ as if it was a little **handle**.
緑;green;Thread . . . broom . . . rice grains.;1) [[lerris](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lerris)] 3-7-2007(303): _Spiderman's_ nemesis the **Green** Goblin is in a slump, He's replaced his glider with a _broom_ and is throwing _grains of rice_ instead of bombs.;2) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 8-4-2007(55): Tie **green** _thread_ around the _broom_ that you use for sweeping up _grains of rice_ (ie the kitchen broom) to distinguish it from the other colour threaded brooms that you might use in say the toilet, or the garage etc…
繁;luxuriant;Cleverness . . . thread.;1) [[Viking101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Viking101)] 8-1-2010(215): Important: **Luxuriant** does NOT mean luxurious, as the other stories indicate. Definition: abundant or lush in growth, as vegetation. When _Venom_ realized he couldn't beat _Spider-Man_ in a fair fight, he showed his _cleverness_ by spraying venom all over Spider-Man's **luxuriant** garden.;2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 26-1-2008(52): _Venom_ is covered in a **luxuriant** and surprisingly _clever_ symbiotic suit, but it's also the _taskmaster_ for his _every_ evil act.
隆;hump;This character, used for everything from little **humps** of hills to camel **humps** , easily suggests the hunch on the pig's back and hind parts where the best cuts of meat are to be found (and hence the English expression for luxury, "living high off the hog.") The elements we have to work with are: _pinnacle_ . . . _walking legs_ . . . _cell_.;1) [[jamiemw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jamiemw)] 25-9-2007(186): You are struggling to the top across the **hump** s, but you suddenly see the _pinnacle_ and you feel new _life_ in your _walking legs_.;2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 14-4-2007(51): A woman takes her _bra_ off and what happens? Nine months later the **hump** in her belly pops out between her _legs_ as a new _life_.
巧;adroit;Craft . . . snare.;1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 22-2-2007(210): **Adroit** : dextrous, deft, skillful. Snare is a little generic so I'll use BEAR TRAP, with huge teeth cartoon style that snares you around the ankle. In the _crafting_ of a _bear trap_ , one must be particularly **adroit**. Otherwise they will become the victim of their down device.;2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 1-1-2007(77): To be _adroit_ one must have mastered the **crafting** of **snares**.
誠;sincerity;The sure sign of **sincerity** is that one's mere _words_ are _turned into_ deeds.;1) [[CountPacula](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CountPacula)] 25-4-2008(213): **Sincerity** happens when what you _say_ actually _turns into_ something.;2) [[gwadonna](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gwadonna)] 3-9-2008(93): **Sincerity** is _turn_ ing your _word_ s into actions.
狭;cramped;Pack of wild dogs . . . scissors.;1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 18-4-2008(271): In a **CRAMPED** space, a brave man holds off PACK OF WILD DOGS with only a pair of SCISSORS.;2) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 23-9-2007(65): A _pack of wild dogs_ , waiting in a very **cramped** waiting room, to get their hair cut by _Edward Scissors Hands_ , who is very popular.
遇;interview;Talking Cricket . . . road.;1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 15-6-2007(119): I was finally able to score an **interview** with the wisest being around: _Jiminy Cricket_. However, his schedule is really packed, so they had to squeeze me in while his tour bus rode between gigs. In fact, it was really short—after a few miles I was kicked out of the bus and stranded in the middle of the _interstate_. But man, it was worth it!;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 17-4-2007(96): On the _road_ to my **interview** I _accidentally_ bump into _Jiminy Cricket_ who gives me some good advice.
厚;thick;When we refer to someone as **thick** -skinned or **thick-** headed, we are usually quick to add - even if only under our breath - something about their upbringing. Perhaps it is because deep down we cherish the belief that by nature people are basically tender and sensitive. Be that as it may, the Japanese character for **thick** depicts a _child_ abandoned out on the wild _cliffs_ , exposed to the heat of the _sun_ , and thus doomed to develop a head and skin as **thick** as the parent who left it there.;1) [[potempkin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/potempkin)] 26-8-2008(209): The **thick** _cliff_ walls protected the _children_ from the _sun_.;2) [[kfactor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kfactor)] 7-7-2007(142): In Sparta we throw our Children over a Cliff. Under the Sun, they fight other Children. In the end, if they survive, they sure have **thick** skin.
綱;hawser;Thread . . . Mount.;1) [[Terhorst](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Terhorst)] 21-12-2007(183): _Spiderman_ saves Japan from floating away by tying _Mt. Fuji_ to mainland Asia using a **hawser** made of web.;2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 5-1-2007(46): A sturdy thread is equally obviously **hawser** (heavy rope). (see previous frame).
鋭;pointed;_Metal_ that has been **pointed** (as an awl, a pick, a nail, or a knife) tends to serve the _devil's_ purposes as well as civilization's: our tools are also our weapons.;1) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 6-3-2006(162): **Pointed** is the metal devil's pitchfork.;2) [[lee101](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lee101)] 28-8-2011(77): 500 kanji…Come on guys we're about 1/4 of the way there.
透;transparent;Excel . . . road-way.;1) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 5-9-2007(220): If you _excel_ in the _Mario Kart road_ , your movements are saved and you can race against yourself as a _transparent_ racer. <http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xe8CkcrL-k4>.;2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 1-2-2007(125): If you want to _excel_ at driving in the _roadway_ , it's better if your windows and windshield are **transparent**. Picture the drivers with opaque windshields all wrecked on the side of the road.
潜;submerge;Water . . . exchange.;1) [[mayurp](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mayurp)] 20-3-2006(223): When a submarine or similar vessel **SUBMERGE** S an EXCHANGE of air for WATER takes place in special compartments.;2) [[Asgard](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Asgard)] 3-9-2006(116): The _two husbands_ _exchange_ for a _day_ on the reality TV show (see [exchange](../v4/842.html) (#842 替)) finally goes underway. One of the _two husband's_ first job is to fix the _water_ faucet in his new family's apartment. Unfortunately, he isn't very good at fixing things and after a few failed attempts the entire apartment is **submerged** in _water_.
封;seal;Think of the key word **seal** as referring to a letter you have written and are preparing to close. Instead of using the traditional wax **seal** , you _glue_ a sprig of _ivy_ on the outside. In this way the elements _ivy_ and _glue_ give you a curious and memorable way to **seal** your secret letters.;1) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 11-1-2006(128): The king used a special **seal** of ivy leaves glued onto his document.;2) [[Ninjasha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ninjasha)] 12-12-2007(64): A bit of _ivy_ _glued_ to a letter can make a lovely **SEAL** when in a pinch, says Martha Stewart.
愉;pleasure;_State of mind_ . . . _butchers_ (See frame 307).;1) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 9-11-2007(345): At the _meeting of butchers_ , in their narrow _state of mind_ , they throw lame jokes around like, 'Oh hello, it's a **pleasure** to _meat_ you', and find this rather pleasing.;2) [[Kurisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kurisu)] 13-5-2008(77): Image : _Data_ attending a _meeting of the butchers union_. As a joke to begin his speech he says, 'Its a **pleasure** to MEAT you all.' (thanx to Shibo  & nestOr).
牧;breed;When it is time to **breed** new cattle, the bull is usually willing but the _cow_ is often not. Thus the _taskmaster_ to the right forces the _cow_ into a compromising position, so to speak, so that she and her mate can **breed**.;1) [[roderik](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/roderik)] 21-6-2008(158): Imagine a _taskmaster_ giving a _cow_ the command to "start **breed** ing, and start doing it now!", except that the cow takes his advice a bit too literally and starts chasing the taskmaster to carry out this command! instead of finding another cow to **breed** with. Hence, you see the _taskmaster_ running to the right, trying to stay ahead of the _cow_.;2) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 26-12-2007(78): Hint: This is the kanji from which _taskmaster_ is derived. Actually, this kanji has nothing to do with **breed** , and a lot to do with **pastures** and **shepherds** (also for cowboys, japanese and spanish don't differenciate between animals). Think of a _cowboy_ (taskmaster) who brings his _cows_ to the **pasture**.
巡;patrol;A virtual  _flood_ of motorcycle police washing down a _road_ is this kanji's image for a **patrol**.;1) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 28-8-2007(134): The cops don't **PATROL** anymore - they just **flood** the **road**.;2) [[diracbracket](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/diracbracket)] 16-11-2007(71): The Venice cops **patrol** on river roads.
標;signpost;Tree . . . ballot.;1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 2-5-2007(231): _Trees_ were frequenly used as **signposts** in those days, indicating where one had to go to cast their _ballots_.;2) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 31-1-2007(66): Large _wooden_ **signpost** s are planted on peoples lawns, with the faces of their representatives all saying: "Vote [1] Me!" for the upcoming _ballot_.
裁;tailor;You might think here of _garment_ that have been specially **tailored** for _Thanksgiving_ celebrations to look like traditional Pilgrim garb.;1) [[sethimayne](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sethimayne)] 13-11-2007(191): The **tailor** was hard at work making sure all the pilgrims were dressed in their best _garments_ for _thanksgiving_.;2) [[Buronzu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Buronzu)] 18-7-2009(49): The **tailor** worked hard after _thanksgiving_ to alter _garments_ so they'd fit people who'd eaten too much at their _thanksgiving_ dinners.
乞;beg;See someone _lying down_ in a public place with a _hook_ in place of a hand, **begging** a morsel of rice or a few pence.;1) [[Pauline](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Pauline)] 4-6-2006(145): _Lying down_ , Captain _Hook_ is **beg** ging to be spared from the ticking crocodile.;2) [[penot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/penot)] 13-9-2008(90): Men **beg** _lying down_. Women **beg** as _hookers_.
豆;beans;This kanji depicts a pot of **beans** , although it looks more like a table on which the pot is resting.;1) [[happychair](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/happychair)] 14-3-2006(241): If I eat **BEANS** , after _ONE_ _MOUTHful_ I fart like some kind of _HORNED ANIMAL_.;2) [[sindhikara](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sindhikara)] 4-1-2009(91): I hate using primitives that are completely unrelated. Let's call this one Mr. Bean! He's an easy character to build stories with.
壇;podium;_Soil/ground_ . . . _top hat_ . . . _-times_ . . . _nightbreak_. With kanji as difficult as this one, it generally pays to toy with the various connotations of its primitives before settling on one image. Aim for as much simplicity as you can.;1) [[scottamus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scottamus)] 23-11-2005(414): A man on the **podium** announce the rules for the contest: You must fill a _top hat with dirt as many times_ as you can by _nightbreak_.;2) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 27-3-2007(111): Abraham Lincoln used a simple mound of _soil_ for a **podium** , when he wore his _top hat_ and gave the speech he had practiced many _times_ until _nightbreak_. But it was so magnificent that no one noticed.
靴;shoes;Leather . . . change.;1) [[shaydwyrm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shaydwyrm)] 19-7-2007(218): _Leather_ **shoes** are nice because they _change_ shape to fit your foot.;2) [[xiaoma](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/xiaoma)] 25-3-2009(71): _Leather_ is often _changed_ into **shoes**.
授;impart;Fingers . . . accept.;1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 26-10-2007(231): "Please _accept_ this _finger_ ," you say, **impart** ing it to your yakuza boss.;2) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 3-11-2005(217): This character depicts a student and teacher. The teacher **impart** s his knowledge on the student, pointing the way and guiding with the finger. Meanwhile, the student sits there passively accepting the tutelage of his superior.
典;code;We introduce this character here because of its connection to the book-related kanji treated above. It is based on the character for _bend_ (frame 1256), whose last stroke is lengthened to coincide with the first stroke of the element for _tool_.;1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 15-10-2006(178): **Coding** is a _tool_ which you can use to _bend_ the computer to your will.;2) [[vileru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/vileru)] 8-1-2010(75): This kanji means a **code** of law, not a secret language or symbolic language (such as programming **code** ) … Story: The **code** of law is a _tool_ used to _bend_ citizens to society's will. You can use the image of a totalitarian state, but be careful not to confuse it with the pinnacle primitive [Heights](../v4/1294.html) (#1294 阪).
幽;faint;_Two cocoons_ . . . _mountain_. Observe how the two vertical strokes of _the mountain_ are extended upwards to serve as a kind of enclosure.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 20-12-2007(184): The villagers haven't the **faint** est idea that giant _coccoons_ resting in the _mountain_ are soon to hatch.;2) [[greenapple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/greenapple)] 24-5-2006(100): Frodo and Sam **faint** ed in the mountains and the spider wrapped them in cacoons.

His **lips** move, but sometimes words don't come out of his _mouth_.;2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 12-7-2009(47): _Bruce Lee_ says "Read my **lips** …", but when I try to, his _mouth_ isn't moving with the dialogue.
茂;overgrown;The sense of the key word **overgrown** is of something growing luxuriously, though not necessarily in excess - in this case a whole _parade_ of weeds (outcast   _flowers_ ). By way of exception, the _flowers_ take their normal place over the enclosure.;1) [[nilfisq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nilfisq)] 14-8-2007(189): The _gay parade_ looks astonishing, as if **overgrown** with _flowers_.;2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 29-8-2007(108): When your garden gets **OVERGROWN** , it's like the plants are mocking you. Here, you can see the roses actually parading around the yard, wilfully choking out the other, more docile plants. Then they actually go and parade down the street!

奪;rob;Whereas _burglary_ (Frame 381) implies clandestine appropriation of another's property, **robbery** refers to taking by force. The primitive elements: _St. Bernard dog_ . . . _turkey_ . . . _glue_.;1) [[pupul07](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pupul07)] 20-11-2007(210): Don't let the neighbor's _St.Bernard_ **rob** tonight's _turkey_ …. _glue_ it to the table if you must.;2) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 25-8-2007(145): Remember the scene in **A Christmas Story** where the _big dogs_ **robbed** the family of their Christmas _turkey_? Well, the following year Ralphie's mom glued the holiday bird to the kitchen table, just as a precaution.

属;belong;_Flag_ . . . _gnats_ (see frame 563) . . . with a _belt_.;1) [[onsen_monkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/onsen_monkey)] 12-9-2006(188): These bugs **BELONG** TO an extremist group promoting insect independence. They are parading the FLAG of their group, the Nationalist GNATS, and wearing explosives BELTS for their planned terrorist war.;2) [[Transtic](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Transtic)] 14-3-2008(133): [WARNING: violent story] Two teams of **insects** are playing “capture the **flag** ” (ala Unreal Tournament). All of them wear ammunition **belts**. Here you try to take the **flag** of the opponent team, when you are faced by an **insect** : “You’ll get our **flag** over my dead body!”. You reply: “All your base are **BELONG** to us!”, shoot him on the head, take the **flag** and run away. See the **drop** of blood flowing from his head?
挨;shove;Fingers . . . elbow . . . dart.;1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-5-2007(53): In the busy pub, one of the _dart_ players **shove** d his dart into my _elbow_ by accident when it nearly slipped out of his _fingers_.;2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 3-1-2009(26): Your _fingers_ slip when someone's _elbow_ **shove** s you, causing you to drop the _dart_ you were about to throw. But as you can see, their elbow is very small, so you decide they're too weak to **shove** back.
汚;dirty;_Water_ . . . _two_ . . . _snare_. Note that the first two strokes for _snare_ doubles up with the first stroke for _two_.;1) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 18-11-2007(175): A hunter Washes, with WATER, his TWO SNAREs, because they are **dirty**.;2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 12-1-2008(133): Washing your **dirty** snare in water, the extra line represents the water level as you submerge the snare.

帆;sail;A **sail** made of a _towel_ makes a _mediocre_ vessel.;1) [[gsantise](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gsantise)] 28-8-2007(156): When stranded at sea, we needed a **Sail**. 抗;confront;Fingers . . . a whirlwind.;1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 17-5-2007(239): Gandalf **confront** s the evil beast, shouting "you shall not pass!". He holds up a single finger and sends forth a whirlwind.;2) [[desmidus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/desmidus)] 27-1-2008(158): The **confront** ation between the two sign-language people looked like a whirlwind of fingers.
奈;Nara;We choose the city of **Nara** as the key word in this case because this kanji, frequently used in proper names, appears in **Nara** , and also because of **Nara's** famed religious monuments, which help us with the primitives: _St. Bernard dog_ . . . _altar_.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 26-2-2007(219): It's beautiful place, but the dark side of **Nara** is that they sacrifice _St. Bernards_ on _evil altars_ every night after the tourists leave!;2) [[ezmoreldo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ezmoreldo)] 3-4-2008(129): **Nara** is just a _big_ _show_ for tourists.
卒;graduate;Top hat . . . assembly line . . . needle.;1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 31-12-2009(183): Ph.D graduation for assembly line of doctors( _needles_ ) with the cap and tassel( _top hat_ ). It took them _10 years_ (Bachelor's, Masters, PhD) to get there…. :-p.;2) [[fagie37](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fagie37)] 2-4-2008(95): When you **graduate** , you wear a hat and **graduate** in an assembly line while your parents sit on pins and needles because it will take ten years to pay off those loans.
監;oversee;Slaves . . . reclining . . . floor/one . . . dish.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 1-3-2007(203): The slavetrader **oversees** the slaves washing _dishes_ int he kitchen. No _reclining_ on the _floor_!;2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 1-11-2007(79): The _slaves_ are _reclining_ on the _floor_ when the **oversee** r comes in. They tell him "We're not goofing off, a _dish_ fell and broke and we're cleaning it off the _floor_ ".
鈴;small bell;Gold . . . orders.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 13-6-2006(243): Some restaurants have a small gold bell to call someone to take customers' orders.;2) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 25-2-2008(122): In high society, people ring a **small** _golden_ **bell** to call their servants and give their _orders_.
討;chastise;_Words_ spoken to **chastise** us stick to us like _glue_ in a way no other _words_ can.;1) [[Istvan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Istvan)] 13-6-2007(155): I said some bad words, and my mother **chastise** d me by washing my mouth out with glue instead of soap!;2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 18-3-2007(110): In Colonial New England, people who committed adultery had _words_ _glued_ to them. A famous example is the "A" worn by Hester Prynn for committing adultery (i.e., not being chaste). In this way, _words_ _glued_ to you are supposed to **chastise** you and prevent further breaches of chastity.
垣;hedge;The **hedge** depicted in this frame is the miraculous **hedge** of briar roses that completely _spanned_ the castle _grounds_ in which Sleeping Beauty lay for a hundred years, so that none but her predestined beloved could find his way through it.;1) [[Wahlin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wahlin)] 29-8-2006(134): Before the Great Wall of China, there was a dirt **hedge** that spanned across.;2) [[Ninjasha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ninjasha)] 20-12-2007(76): The **HEDGE** of roses growing from the castle _grounds_ fully _spanned_ the castle walls.
膳;dining tray;Flesh . . . virtuous.;1) [[blannk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blannk)] 29-10-2009(73): The _virtuous_ vegan will not touch this **dining tray** because it has had a piece of _meat_ on it.;2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 16-5-2007(26): Some people insist that the serving maids who bring in the **dining tray** s are especially _virtuous_ and never let any man touch their _flesh_.
駒;pony;_Team of horses_ . . . _phrase_. In American slang, a **pony** is an underground translation of a classical text, which students who cannot manage the difficult _phrases_ of the original language consult and pass on from one generation to the next.;1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 23-4-2007(207): The cute little innocent-looking plastic **pony** on the desk of a student is in fact a _trojan horse_ , hiding _phrases_ in its belly which are used for cheating during an exam. No **pony** will be permitted on desks during tests!;2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 26-10-2007(94): A particular My Little **Pony** has a string that when you pull it, it repeats the same dumb phrase like "I love you".
卑;lowly;A drop of . . . brains . . . cornucopia.;1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 17-11-2006(209): A **LOWLY** single rice grain, DROPPED in an empty FIELD, can produce a CORNUCOPIA of food.;2) [[brose](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brose)] 5-2-2007(138): **Lowly** people only have a _drop of brains_ and use nothing but _4-letter words_.
眉;eyebrow;The _flag_ here has an extra vertical stroke in it. Think of it as an **eyebrow** pencil stuck in the _eye_.;1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 2-12-2006(79): The **eyebrow** s hover over the _eyes_ like a _divided flag_.;2) [[brose](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brose)] 29-3-2007(18): Pictograph: opera glasses over eyes ビ ミ まゆ.
閣;tower;Gates . . . each.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 18-1-2007(150): To keep this distinct from other kanji such as "watchtower" and "pagoda", I use the mnemonic " _towering **tower**_ ". – In some old 8-bit kung-fu videogame, with a plot similar as Bruce Lee's last, unfinished movie, the hero must break through a _gate_ at _each_ level of the **tower** ing **tower** , fighting with opponents using various styles of kung-fu until he meets the finale at the topmost level of the "towering **tower** ".;2) [[Proxx](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Proxx)] 27-11-2007(65): Remember the two **tower** s from lord of the rings… _each_ has it's own - very difficult to master - entrance _gate_.
営;occupation;Schoolhouse . . . spine.;1) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 18-3-2007(247): The _schoolhouse_ is the _backbone_ of a foundation that will allow you to find a good **occupation**.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-11-2006(87): During the German **occupation** , this Nazi officer's **occupation** was to manage _schools_ that were requisitioned for training the children of the Aryan race to stand proud with an erect _spine_ (mnemonic : "the **occupation** 's _spine schools_ "). Kanji meanings : to manage, to conduct (business), and also "barracks, camp, encapment". This story should help avoid confusion with [post](../v4/824.html) (#824 職) and [employ](../v4/1083.html) (#1083 雇). The military **occupation** theme hints to the secondary meaning, e.g. 営倉 "detention barracks".

猿;monkey;This clever little **monkey** has captured an entire pack of _wild dogs_ , locked them inside a _lidded crock_ , and wrapped the whole thing up in a silk _scarf_ to present to the dogcatcher.;1) [[sannomiya](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sannomiya)] 6-5-2007(147): The **MONKEY** likes to play hide and seek with the PACK of WILD DOGS by hiding in the LIDDED CROCK. But he is easy to see because the SCARF he always wears is at the base of the LIDDED CROCK.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 25-2-2007(129): To catch a **monkey** , chase him with _wild dogs_ into a _lidded crock_ , then tie it with a _scarf_.
乃;from;This pictograph of a clenched fist is another of the "hand primitives." Take note of its rather peculiar drawing. Try to think of drawing a _fist_ (the primitive meaning)  " **from** " this character to give yourself a connotation for the otherwise abstract key word.;1) [[sutebun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sutebun)] 18-10-2007(218): **FROM** a pictograph of a thumbs up. That's how it also gets the primitive meaning of fist.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 13-10-2005(86): Pictograph, see book. This kanji, as a chinese character, is in fact the origin for the hiragana possessive particle “no”. Try drawing this kanji fast, in a single stroke and you will end up with の .
暑;sultry;The key word refers to the heat of summer. Its elements: _sun_ . . . _puppet_.;1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 10-5-2007(178): Ahh, a fine **sultry** day with my _love doll_ under the hot _sun_. I think she's getting a tan!;2) [[skinnyneo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/skinnyneo)] 5-11-2007(71): [from decamer0n] This is the kanji for atsui ( 暑い ) as in hot. If you've ever been in Japan in the summer no doubt you have heard hoards of people bellowing "Atsui! Atsui!" Here you are laying with your _love doll_ under the hot _sun._ Luckily the manufacturers were smart and when the doll got to hot it would bellow "Atsui! It's so **sultry**!".

Or, people who do lots of **favor** s for others have a heart as big as 10 fields, a "10-field-heart".

較;contrast;Cars . . . mingle.;1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 16-3-2007(254): The people I had invited to the party were mingling quite well with one another, until they all suddenly started talking about the cars they own. Pretty soon the crowd divided itself into distinct, **contrast** ing crowds: rich snobs with fancy cars, soccer moms with minivans, and hippies with bicycles.;2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 1-6-2006(67): Our world of today, _cars_ _mingling_ on busy streets, is in stark **contrast** to the one of yesteryear, where it was people who would _mingle_ on the streets.
貫;pierce;If one is asked to think of associations for the word **pierce** , among the first to come to mind is that of **piercing** one's ears to hold earrings, a quite primitive form of self-mutilation that has survived into the 21st century. The kanji here is read, top to bottom: _mama_ . . . _oyster_. All you need to do is imagine **piercing** an ear so that it can hold a mother-of- pearl (actually, a _mama_ -of-pearl) you have just wrested from an _oyster_.;1) [[Kurisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Kurisu)] 12-2-2008(190): Ariel the Little Mermaid's _clamshell_ bra was held to her _breasts_ by **piercings**.;2) [[Codexus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Codexus)] 28-11-2007(67): The sad fate of _Mama_ _shellfish_ was to be captured and **pierced** to make an earring.

Here we see the victims _begging_ for just a little _mist_ for relief.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 7-8-2007(211): During a **drought** , everything _begs_ for even a _mist_ for relief.;2) [[TheMage](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TheMage)] 11-10-2008(75): During a **drought** , even _mist_ is _begged_ for.

系;lineage;The single stroke added to the beginning of the primitive for _thread_ gives the image of threads woven into a single cord. Hence the meaning, **lineage**.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-9-2007(281): (Primitive: _DNA_ , a drop of looong spiraled thread that is the key to your **lineage** ).;2) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 6-2-2008(95): Spiderman's **lineage** (who his family is etc…) can be found in his DNA in a drop of blood. The villain that gets blood of Spidey will be able to find out who is family and **lineage** is. be carfefull spidey…
札;tag;The **tags** you see hanging on _trees_ in public places in Japan are helpful to identify what sort of _trees_ they are. Next time you see one, imagine the bit of wire that fixes the **tag** to the branch as a large _fishhook_. REALLY imagine it, illogical as it is, and you will never have trouble with this kanji again.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 31-7-2007(173): Botanists like to identify TREEs by HOOKing **tag** s on them.;2) [[elktapestry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/elktapestry)] 30-3-2007(69): Might be good to note that this is also the Kanji for "Paper Money" w/ the reading さつ ( [千円札＝](midori://search?text=千円札＝) 1000 Yen paper bill)… It also takes on the meaning of Playing Card with the reading of ふだ as in 花札 (Hanafuda cards) or トランプの札 ("trump" playing cards). For the **tag** meaning I like to think of wooden **tag** s hung on hooks from trees… but for these other meanings I like to think of both paper money and playing cards as paper (tree) products with the ability to "hook you in" so to speak.
匠;artisan;Box . . . ax.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-9-2007(178): Most people don't know that one of the most revered **artisan** s in Japan preserves the ancient art of cutting _cardboard boxes_ with an _ax_.;2) [[sarek05](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sarek05)] 3-10-2008(62): The axe murderer considered himself an **artisan** for how his tastefully chopped up his victims and arranged their remains artfully in boxes.
湖;lake;_Water_ . . . _old_ . . . _flesh_. You have heard of legends of people being abandoned in the mountains when they had become too old to work. Well, here is a legend about people being set adrift in the _waters_ of a stormy **lake** because their _flesh_ had gotten too _old_ to bear the burdens of life.;1) [[Shizuru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shizuru)] 2-8-2007(305): This is my favorite story. Simply associate the sad moment of an OLD person, standing near the WATER of the **lake** and looking at the MOON reflected in the **lake**. The created primitives themselves are put so beautifully, that you will not forget this kanji.;2) [[DBJ07](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DBJ07)] 17-2-2007(94): Water reflects the old moon in the **lake**.
勉;exertion;_Rabbit_ . . . _muscle_. 貨;freight;Change . . . shells.;1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 14-2-2008(185): **Freight** is the _shells_ (money) paid to _change_ the location of something big. Don't confuse with the similar 賃 [fare](../v4/1004.html) (#1004 賃).;2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 7-9-2007(97): This is a **freight** train that runs on _spare change_. You look at the slot..there's actually a slot for _spare change_ and one for regular _shells_. Your call, but it seems to prefer _spare change_ over _shells_.
憂;melancholy;_Head_ . . . _crown_ . . . _heart_ . . . _walking legs_. Two things merit mention here. First, the doubling-up of the last stroke of _head_ with the top of the _crown_ serves to make the whole more aesthetically beautiful. It happens so rarely that the exceptions are easily learned. Second, try to make a single image out of the four elements. (Religious statuary of **melancholy** figures should offer plenty of suggestions.);1) [[rizzo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rizzo)] 7-2-2006(244): **Melancholy** makes me think of Hamlet cause he was so 'emo'. In order to play up his feelings he bares his _head_ and holds his _crown_ over his _heart_ then walks (on _walking legs_ ) around the palace making everyone see how **melancholy** he is. What a wuss.;2) [[howdycowdy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/howdycowdy)] 24-3-2008(155): This is an image of the crucifixion. Jesus is on the cross. His _crown_ of thorns has slipped down and is around his neck, right between his _head_ and his _heart_. His _walking legs_ can be seen dangling from the cross as well. How **MELANCHOLY**!
占;fortune-telling;This is one of those kanji that is a real joy of simplicity: a _divining rod_ with a _mouth_  \- which translate directly into **fortune-telling**. Note how the movement from top to bottom (the movement in which the kanji are written) is also the order of the elements which make up our story and of the key word itself: first _divining rod_ , then _mouth_. This will not always be possible, but where it is, memory has almost no work at all to do.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 24-7-2007(147): **Fortune-telling** : using a mouth as a divining rod.;2) [[Hikari](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hikari)] 27-8-2007(95): A great number of people who do **fortune-telling** are "almost old".

Our friend the _St. Bernard_ is alive and well, its _nose_ in the air sniffing suspiciously after something **stinking** somewhere or other.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 30-7-2007(172): The ST. BERNARD DOG lifted his large NOSE high in the air to find out where the **stinking** smell comes from.;2) [[ageru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ageru)] 21-1-2008(54): When _I_ is _big_ , Ego **stinking**.

尻;buttocks;Flag . . . baseball team.;1) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 15-12-2007(77): The _baseball_ team stick _flags_ in their **buttocks** and wave them at the opposing team to put them off.;2) [[Rooboy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rooboy)] 24-4-2009(74): I wonder if this story will be _flagged_ for saying i give her **buttocks** a score of _9_.
氷;icicle;The appearance of the primitive for _water_ in its full form tells us that we have something to do with _water_ here. The extra _drop_ to the left, added as a second stroke, changes the picture from a splash caused by a _walking stick_ dropped into _water_ to form an **icicle**. If it helps, when you hold an **icicle** up to the light, you can usually see little crystallizations of five-pointed stars inside of it, which is the shape we have in this kanji.;1) [[brian44](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brian44)] 28-8-2007(238): **Icicle** s start with 1 frozen _drop_ of _water_.;2) [[stereovibe](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stereovibe)] 27-2-2008(73): _A drop_ in temperature turns _water_ into an **icicle**.
嘆;sigh;Mouth . . . scarecrow.;1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 28-8-2007(245): A **sigh** escapes the _mouth_ of the _scarecrow_ , who laments: "…if I only had a brain, I could learn kanji".;2) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 19-4-2008(155): I will let out a huge **sigh** of relief from my mouth when I learn the last kanji.
貞;upright;Now take the last primitive, the _shellfish_ , and set a _magic wand_ over it, and you have the kanji for **upright**. After all, the _clam_ and the _oyster_ are incapable of walking **upright**. It would take a magician with his _wand_ to pull off such a feat - which is precisely what we have in this kanji.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 21-8-2007(169): A _magic wand_ is needed to make a _clam_ stand **upright**.;2) [[krungthep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/krungthep)] 2-5-2008(121): Just the thought of my _magic wand_ on her _clam_ makes my _magic wand_ stand **upright**.
孔;cavity;Probably the one thing most _children_ fear more than anything else is the dentist's chair. Once a _child_ has seen a dentist holding the x-rays up to the light and heard that ominous word **cavity** , even though it is not likely to know that the word means "hole" until it is much older, it will not be long before those two syllables get associated with the drill and that row of shiny _hooks_ the dentist uses to torture people who are too small to fight back.;1) [[ssmoler](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ssmoler)] 21-6-2007(157): The child's arms flailed around at the sight of the hooked tool the dentist was going to use to fill his **cavity**.;2) [[thequietfox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thequietfox)] 20-1-2008(93): I warned him about **cavities** , but the _child_ is still _hooked_ on sweets.
濁;voiced;The key word for this kanji connotes the "muddying" effect on a soft consonant brought about by vibrating the vocal chords. For example, in English a "j" is **voiced** while a  "sh" is unvoiced. In Japanese, the し is changed to じ when it is **voiced**. The primitives are: _water_ . . . _eye_ . . . _bound up_ . . . _insect_.;1) [[Istvan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Istvan)] 28-6-2007(228): The fly is wrapped in a spiderweb voicing "Help me, Help Me" under the watchful eye of the spider who's venom is dripping like water from her fangs.;2) [[rhclaghorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rhclaghorn)] 29-12-2007(153): Pour _water_ over the _eyes_ of a _bound up_ _insect_ if you want to hear a pitiful buzz that is very similar to a **VOICED** consanant.
駅;station;Team of horses . . . shakuhachi.;1) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 17-3-2008(215): Anyone living in Japan knows that train **station** s play little melodies when the train is about to arrive. In Ye Olden Days, when _horses_ and carriages were used for transport, the carriage driver would play a little melody on his _shakuhachi_ to let the passengers know the carriage was arriving at the next **station**.;2) [[jreaves](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jreaves)] 23-7-2007(160): This reminds me of those infamous Mexican porn movies in which shakuhachi is performed on a horse. Here the deed is being done at a train **station**. As the passengers get off, so does the horse.
堅;strict;Slave . . . crotch . . . soil.;1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 15-11-2006(267): The **strict** parent thinks adolescent kids are " _slaves_ to their _crotch_ " (= can't control their hormones), so he _grounds_ them. Permanently!;2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 30-4-2006(40): **Strict** masters treat even [intelligent](../v4/852.html) (#852 賢) slaves like dirt, and they get no shells.
唱;chant;This one is easy! You have one _mouth_ making no noise (the choirmaster) and two _mouths with wagging tongues_ (the minimum for a chorus). So think of the key word, **chant** , as monastery singing and the kanji is yours forever (see frame 11).;1) [[DrWarrior12](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrWarrior12)] 29-6-2007(201): Someone **chant** ing with their mouth open for two consecutive days.;2) [[Tanuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Tanuki)] 5-8-2007(50): **Chant** s from our mouths are meant to reach the sun and the stars. Stars are just suns just further away so they seem smaller.
塔;pagoda;On the left we see a mound of _dirt_ , and to the right _flowers_ made to _fit_ together. The two sides combine to create a great **pagoda** made of _dirt_ , with _flowers_ by the tens of thousands _fitted_ together for the roofing of each of the layers. Be sure to put yourself in the scene and _fit_ a few of the _flowers_ in place yourself so that the image works its way into memory with full force.;1) [[nilfisq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nilfisq)] 14-8-2007(165): In order to build a **pagoda** in this small Japanese garden everything has to _fit_ : the _soil_ to the left and the _flowers_ in the upper right corner.;2) [[xeyes](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/xeyes)] 21-5-2007(48): Pictograph- o-rama. This is a corner of a Japanese garden, with a small mound of _soil_ on the left, and a little concrete **pagoda** in the front with _flowers_ behind it. (To my eye, the _fit_ looks a lot like a little **pagoda** anyway. This may or may not cause confusion for you, though…).
曹;cadet;This character is written in the order of its elements: _one_ . . . _bend_ . . . _sun_.;1) [[mikemikepw](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mikemikepw)] 19-9-2007(166): A space **cadet** eager to make one bend around the sun. (a dangerous maneuver).;2) [[diracbracket](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/diracbracket)] 23-12-2008(134): _Bender_ lasted just _one day_ in the space **cadet** s.
率;ratio;_Mysterious_ . . . _sparkler_ . . . _ten_. Do not confuse with _proportion_ (Frame 1673).;1) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 5-2-2008(152): Keep separate from proportion. _Gandalf_ is trying to adjust the aspect **ratio** of his monitor from 4:3 to 16:9 so that he can watch Lord of the Rings in widescreen format. He's poking around the inside of his monitor with a magnesium _needle_ when he causes a short circuit which sets his needle on fire making the needle look just like a _sparkler_.;2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 28-9-2006(137): It's quite _mysterious_ how each _sparkler_ gives of sparkles at a precise **ratio** of _ten_ to one. Physicists have been studying this effect for decades, known as the Sparkler Effect, and using it to explain why stars look like sparklers in the night sky.
涯;horizon;After seeing a constant **horizon** of _water_ , _water_ everywhere for months at sea, could there be anything more delightful to the eyes than to look astern and see the _ivy_ -clad _cliffs_ of land on a new **horizon**? Of course, you'd need the eyes of a stellar telescope to recognize that the vegetation was in fact _ivy_ , but the phrase " _ivy_ -clad _cliffs_ " has such a nice ring to it that we won't worry about such details.;1) [[sutebun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sutebun)] 10-9-2007(230): Try to reverse Heisig's story in this Kanji: imagine being trapped in one of those prison towers on an ivy cladcliff like in the movies. From your prison ontop the ivy clad cliff all you can see in the distant **horizon** is nothing but water.;2) [[jljzen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jljzen)] 3-1-2009(72): From the water, I can see the ivy-clad-cliffs on the **horizon**.
灰;ashes;The kanji for **ashes** naturally includes the primitive for _fire_ , or more specifically, a _fireplace_. Now what do you do with that bucket of **ashes** you have just cleaned out of the _fireplace_? You walk to the edge of a _cliff_ and tip it upside down, watching as they are swept away in the wind like a swarm of gray mosquitoes. Thus the _fire_ , once it has turned to **ashes** , ends up at the bottom of the _cliff_.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 18-8-2007(125): The _fire_ underneath the _cliff_ will eventually turn everything above to **ashes**.;2) [[Ninjasha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ninjasha)] 2-2-2008(83): After the cremation _fire_ , many prefer to scatter their loved-one's **ASHES** from seaside _cliffs_.

Fuji (Japan's ichiban mountain). Now we see an _infant_ being **abandon** ed on top of _Mt. Fuji_ well above the _tree_ line to die of exposure.

枯;wither;What makes a _tree_ begin to **wither** up, and perhaps even die, is a kind of arteriosclerosis that keeps its sap from flowing freely. Usually this is due to simple _old age_ , as this character shows us. Be sure to picture a wrinkled _old tree_ , **withering** away in a retirement center so that the commonsense explanation does not take over.;1) [[sutebun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sutebun)] 16-10-2007(189): A tree **wither** s away as it gets old.;2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 15-11-2007(68): When flowers get old they _suffer_ (frame 225), but _old trees_ just **WITHER** away painlessly. (Picture flowers crying in pain, but a dried up tree silent and sad).

宣;proclaim;Under the primitive for _house_ we meet the kanji for _span_. Therefore, scientists have genetically engineered it to grow _walking legs_ once the grain is _grown up_ and mature, so it can harvest itself.

沙;grains of sand;We have already learned the kanji for _sand_ (Frame 122), so let's use it to remember the character for **grains of sand**. Instead of the  "few stones" that make for nice sand, here we have a _few drops of water_ , one for each **grand of sand** \- a beach in perfect ecological balance.;1) [[DrWarrior12](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrWarrior12)] 15-7-2009(58): To keep this separated from [sand](../v4/117.html) (#117 砂): _Water_ erodes away stone a _few_ **grains of sand** at a time until there is no stone left.;2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 15-2-2007(31): Wet sand is simply sand but to see beautiful **grains of sand** , the _water_ must be _few_.
淡;thin;The primitives in this kanji read: _water_ . . . _inflammation_. Taking _inflammation_ in its medical sense, the first _water_ -related _inflammation_ that pops into mind is dehydration, the principal symptom of which is that it makes one shrivel up and look very, very **thin**. If that is hard to remember, try thinking it backwards: a very **thin** chap passes by and you imagine him suffering from (being _inflamed_ with) dehydration (hence the element for _water_ ).;1) [[atomiton](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/atomiton)] 11-10-2006(328): Drink _water_ and _burn twice_ as many calories as you eat… you'll definitely get **thin**. Imagine inside your body, all those calories literally being _burned_ from above and below… THAT's what it takes to become **thin**.;2) [[mezbup](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mezbup)] 5-11-2008(182): **Thin** girls are twice as hot when they're wet.

As punishment he was made to _bring up_ their infant.;2) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 7-11-2005(122): Ha! In this frame, a bunch of taskmasters are lined up to **penetrate** the kids they raise/bring up! I'm thinking of some priests and choir boys.

丘;hill;Since this supposedly pictographic representation of a hill looks like anything but, picture a row of _axes_ driven into the ground up to their heads, and see if that doesn't present a more memorable image of **hill** \- at least a riskier one sliding down!;1) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 18-2-2008(284): Excalibur is the sword planted in a rock. Lesser known AXCAHILLBUR is the _axe_ planted on top of a **hill**.;2) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 31-10-2006(67): At Capitol **Hill** proposals get _axe_ d on the _floor_.
誇;boast;Words . . . St. Bernard dog . . . ceiling . . . snare.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 19-12-2007(401): The hunter's **boast** : I _say_ , it was a " _big_ _one_ ", but the _snare_ broke and it got away. (credit to many others before).;2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 15-1-2008(65): A dog owner **boast** s about how obedient, not how smart, his _Saint Bernard_ dog is. "Why, my dog will even walk right into a trap if I tell him to. Watch!" With a single _word_ , "go!", his dog obediently runs into a _snare_ trap hanging from the _ceiling_. In a flash, the dog is netted tightly and swinging from the _ceiling_. Don't forget the _ceiling_!
悔;repent;_State of mind_ . . . _every_ (See frame 497).;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 2-5-2007(186): "For all have sinned…" so _every_ one's _state of mind_ should be to **repent**.;2) [[smujohnson](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smujohnson)] 22-7-2008(115): When you **repent** , you heal your _state of mind_ by going over _every_ thing you regret doing.
藩;clan;Flowers . . . water . . . dice.;1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 4-1-2007(165): This character refers to feudal **clan** s that were abolished in 1871 (Meiji 4) in favor of prefectures ( 廃藩置県 ), and thus were predecessors of the modern prefectures. As we know from 落 , flowers and water drops each have their own way of falling. This character says that **clan** s' location was decided in the way flowers, water drops and dice fall: at random. See <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Han_%28country_subdivision%29>.;2) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 17-3-2009(132): In the particular **clan** depicted by this character, each member has to take his or her _turn_ _watering_ the _flowers_.
笛;flute;Bamboo . . . sprout.;1) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 7-4-2007(186): **Flute** is made of _bamboo_ _sprout_.;2) [[Django](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Django)] 25-12-2008(126): You pick up your _bamboo_ **flute** , and recoil in shock as out comes not the dulcet melody you had hoped to play, but rather a _Brussels sprout_! You play again, and again a Brussels sprout. A _bamboo_ **flute** that plays _sprouts_! Fabulous! Puts that golden egg laying goose in its place.
熟;mellow;The _tall_ and _fat children_ from the last frame are here cast into a cauldron over an _oven flame_ until they have sufficiently **mellowed** that they can return to the normal life of a student.;1) [[ceeeps](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ceeeps)] 28-11-2007(162): Imagine _tall children_ sitting _round_ the _fire_ toasting marsh- **mellow** s.;2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 4-12-2007(107): The cram school (309) tortures its students - especially the _tall_ and _fat_ ones who need to grow up - over a fire until they **mellow**. (Note that here the keyword 'mellow' only means to mature, ripen, or acquire skill, not the colloquial meaning of 'chill out').
締;tighten;Thread . . . sovereign.;1) [[Filip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Filip)] 3-2-2008(174): (astridtops) Spiderman managed to get behind the sovereign. (pick your favourite nowadays country ruler who isn't doing a good job). Spidey has **tighten** d a web around the sovereing's throat. As long as the sovereign says what spidey whispers, he will be fine. Sovereign yelping : ' we will draw are troops back! and we will spend more money on healthcare, schools and less on wars!' Spidey whispering: ' If you continue at this pace, you might be doing good things AND the people will like you.'.;2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 12-3-2007(98): The _sovereign_ appears to be ruling, but in reality someone behind him (for instance his wife) has a _thread_ around his throat, and if he dares to make a decision she doesn't like, she starts pulling the _thread_ and **tighten** s it around his throat.
暖;warmth;Unlike the character for _warm_ weather learned earlier (Frame 1560), this kanji and its key word can also refer to the **warmth** of human congeniality. Its elements are: _sun_ . . . _migrating ducks_.;1) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 25-10-2005(240): Ducks migrate south for the winter… they follow the **warmth** of the sun.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 28-2-2008(58): A massive group of _migrating ducks_ is blocking the **warmth** of the _sun_ as they pass over your house/barbecue/picnic. Their formation is so humongous they block the **warmth** for a good 10 minutes while they pass over. Mnemonic for the _migrating ducks_ primitive : the migrating ducks stick together like the best of _friends_ , flying together _as one_ (fifth stroke), they are not easy prey for the _great eagles / vultures_.
葬;interment;_Flowers_ . . . _death_ . . . _two hands_. Do not confuse with _bury_ (Frame 191).;1) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 3-11-2005(284): I imagine an **interment** as a funeral. At this funeral it's an open casket, and the dead body (death) is holding flowers with both of its hands.;2) [[calittle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/calittle)] 2-10-2007(74): During the **interment** ceremony, the grandchildren placed _flowers_ over the _dead_ body while the widow sat praying with _two hands_.
稿;draft;The key word connotes the preliminary composition of a plan or manuscript. Its elements: _wheat_ . . . _tall_.;1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 31-3-2007(235): Aliens often **draft** their plans for invasion by cutting designs among the _tall_ _wheat_.;2) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 2-10-2007(220): The first **DRAFT** of catcher in the rye was actually called "catcher in the TALL WHEAT"…good thing they changed it. I read it in 高校 .
偵;spy;Person . . . upright.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 23-8-2007(213): _Mr. T_ is a terrible **spy**. He walks around _upright_. "Why should I hide?! 爵;baron;Vulture . . . eye . . . silver . . . glue.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 20-12-2007(259): An _eagle_ stole the **baron** 's _eye_ in the war, but now he has a _silver_ coin _glued_ in the socket instead.;2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 17-6-2006(66): Here we see an evil **baron** \- a _vulture_ perched on his shoulder, and a _siver_ _eye_ -patch _glued_ to his _eye_.
課;chapter;Words . . . fruit.;1) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 16-5-2008(229): After I finish each **chapter** of RTK, I eat a piece of _fruit_ to celebrate all the new _words_ I've learned. (Thanks Misha!).;2) [[misha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/misha)] 26-9-2007(135): _Words_ signify the written words in a book. The _fruit_ represents something whole, complete. A **chapter** in a book often offers a complete idea, setting, or account. It's good to disambiguate the keyword from [paragraph](../v4/82.html) (#82 項). To reinforce the kanji, imagine eating a fruit at the end of each **chapter** of Tolstoy's "War and Peace" to reward yourself. (If you ate a fruit at the end of each paragraph, you'd very quickly run out of fruit).
県;prefecture;Above, an _eye_ and a _fishhook_ , and below the primitive for _little_. Although apparently the simplest of these first six kanji, when you begin to work on its plot and story you will soon find out that the number of strokes and visual complexity of a kanji does not make it easier or harder to remember. It is the primitives you have to work that are the critical factor, as in this case where the meaning of the key word is so seemingly distant from the elements. Remember, you can always break larger elements down ( _eye of a needle_ into _eye_ and _fishhook_ ) if you think it helps.;1) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 6-4-2008(206): In Japanese this is KEN, as in Barbie's boyfriend. He has lovely blue _eyes,_ a girlfriend who is as thin as a _straightened out fish hook_. But, down where it counts, he has very _little_ to show…;2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 9-1-2007(177): After sticking a _fishhook_ in your _eye_ , the yakuza boss probably has _little_ more to do to convince you to move to a different **prefecture**.
曰;sayeth;_Pent in_ . . . _one_. The key word refers to famous sayings of famous people, and is the origin for the primitive meaning of _a tongue wagging in the mouth_ that we learned in frame 12. The size of this kanji, a relatively rare one, is what distinguishes it from _day_.;1) [[AndamanIslander](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AndamanIslander)] 17-2-2008(148): "Sayeth"?! Who the hell says "sayeth"? Doesn't seem quite right…just like this kanji, which is just like "day" but doesn't seem "quite right.".;2) [[Francois](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Francois)] 10-4-2008(87): When _pent up_ alone, _one_ **sayeth** little.
慰;consolation;Military officer . . . heart.;1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 27-5-2007(287): A _military officer_ must offer **consolation** to the _hearts_ of the families of his fallen men.;2) [[RobMow](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RobMow)] 8-9-2008(107): This Kanji appears in the word 慰安婦 いあんふ, which was what the infamous WW II "comfort women" were called in Japanese. The story goes something like this: As a way of providing **consolation** to battle-weary, _heartsick military officers and soldiers_ , the Japanese set up comfort stations (brothels) for their servicemen. (Just to be clear: this is not an endorsement of the practice, just a way to remember the Kanji.).
巨;gigantic;This kanji depicts a **gigantic** "pop-eye," which accounts for its shape. Be sure not to confuse it with the _slave_ ( _retainer_ ) we just learned.;1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 1-5-2007(342): This is actually the top view of a porn star with a **gigantic** erect penis. The top and bottom are his arms and the middle is his penis. Imagine him making the pumping motion while he's banging some chick. The arms move in, the penis moves out and vice versa.;2) [[thegeelonghellswan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeelonghellswan)] 4-10-2008(130): The letter E, with a **GIGANTIC** middle stroke.
仁;humanity;To refer to the fullness of **humanity** that can only be achieved in dialogue with another ( _person_ . . . _two_ ), Confucius used this character.;1) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 11-5-2008(136): Mr. T shows his **humanity** by giving _two_ bucks to every homeless person he sees.;2) [[Codexus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Codexus)] 21-12-2007(90): **Warning** : This is not **humanity** as in all the people. But rather the qualities that make us human such as compassion and benevolence.
憤;aroused;State of mind . . . haystack . . . clams.;1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 18-9-2006(250): Note: this word in Japanese has the idea of "indignant". So **aroused** here refers to being **aroused** because of anger over some unjust or wrong act, unfairness etc. It doesn't seem to carry a meaning associated with arousal in the sense of sex or pleasure. So, my story: think of the angry _state of mind_ **aroused** at finding all your _clams_ buried under your _haystack_ stolen, gone!;2) [[joesan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joesan)] 25-10-2007(68): _Data_ was **aroused/indignant** when he saw what the volcano had done to the farmers building their _haystacks_ and the fishermen collecting their _shells_ . The tragedy of it all **aroused** him so much he didn't even notice he was feeling emotion.
攻;aggression;The special _craft_ of successful _taskmasters_ is their ability to remain constantly on the **aggressive** , never allowing their underlings a moment to ponder a counter- **aggression** of their own.;1) [[Ninjasha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ninjasha)] 24-2-2008(140): **AGGRESSION** is a well-honed _craft_ for any decent _taskmaster_.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 17-4-2007(100): **Aggression** is the _craft_ of a good _dominatrix_.
超;transcend;When one is _running_ after something, the goal that _seduces_ one is said to **transcend** the seeker.;1) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 2-8-2007(220): A successful marathon runner needs to be able to **transcend** seductions, such as the possibility of rest, shelter from the rain, or a cold beer.;2) [[pazustep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pazustep)] 16-7-2008(178): To **transcend** to a higher path you need to _run_ from the _seduction_ of earthly desires.
忙;busy;State of mind . . . perish.;1) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 29-6-2006(224): **Busy** (as in "occupied") means a _state of mind_ where all other thoughts are _perished_.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 28-5-2010(104): ^^^Make the "state of mind" primitive _Data (from Star Trek)_ instead right now and save yourself the headache, 'state of mind' is too vague! ( _Data_ can stay so **busy** as not to sleep without _dying_. He's a robot).
裸;naked;Cloak . . . fruit.;1) [[FudoMyo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FudoMyo)] 26-4-2007(299): Here we have Adam and Eve eating of the forbidden fruit and realizing they were **naked** , and so clothing themselves in a cloak.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-3-2007(120): Hey honey, I'm **naked** underneath this _cloak_. I've got some nice _melons_ and a fresh _peach_ waiting for you. Don't you want to taste my forbidden _fruits_ …?
鼓;drum;The full kanji for the _drum_ adds a _branch_ , apparently to serve as a **drum** stick, to the primitive for _drum_.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-9-2007(165): Japanese festivals have **drums** so big, a _samurai_ has to SIT (not stand) on a _table_ to beat one with a tree _branch_! <http://www.d2.dion.ne.jp/>~hidafyh/furukawayh/gyouji/image/maturi03.jpg.;2) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 20-2-2008(41): I really hate the primitive meaning of "table" for "bean." I just use "bean." Anyways, for the **DRUM** primitive, imagine a SAMURAI who beats on a **DRUM** with two chopsticks, and a BEAN skewered on each end of the chopstick to produce a better sound. And the obvious story is: "DRUMing on a **DRUM** with a huge BRANCH".
須;ought;_Shape_ . . . _head_. This is the only time that _shape_ is placed to the left of its relative element, the _head_.;1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 28-7-2006(140): Why, I **OUGHT** to RESHAPE your HEAD…;2) [[Airymon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Airymon)] 15-4-2008(101): Since this Kanji is exceptional, the _shape_ **ought** to be on the left side. Got that into your _head_?
壮;robust;**Robust** is seen as a _turtle_ turned _samurai_.;1) [[bendyarm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bendyarm)] 13-4-2011(160): The image is a **robust** green bulging-muscle cartoon turtle. 寛;tolerant;The _house_ of _flowers_ or  "hothouse" has become a metaphor for a narrow- minded, biased, and intolerant attitude distrustful of change. **Tolerance** , in contrast, is open-minded and welcomes novelty. The way to encourage **tolerance** in those who lack it is first to have them _see_ through their own hothouse attitudes, which is the very counsel we are given in this kanji.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 31-7-2007(343): A **tolerant** person will ignore SEEing GRASS (marijuana) in the HOUSE of a friend.;2) [[saruwatari](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/saruwatari)] 30-12-2007(178): To be **tolerant** is to see flowers (meaning "beautiful things") in every house, instead of looking for drawbacks.

沼;marsh;Unlike the meadow with its cliffs, the **marsh** lands are low and near a source of _water_ that feeds them until they get soggy through and through. Why certain land becomes **marshy** is probably due to the fact that it felt thirsty, and so tried its best to _seduce_ the _water_ over to its side. But, like most inordinate _seductions_ , the last state of the victim is worse than the first. Hence the slushy **marsh**.;1) [[moojitsu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/moojitsu)] 19-10-2006(175): The **marsh** lands near Mordor seduce Frodo into gazing upon them, and he falls into the water–splash!;2) [[dshill99](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dshill99)] 3-2-2008(156): A **marsh** is where _water_ is _seduced_ into the ground.

肌;texture;Ever notice how the **texture** of your face and hands is affected by the _wind_? A day's skiing or sailing makes them rough and dry, and in need of a good soft cream to soothe the burn. So whenever a _part of the body_ gets exposed to the _wind_ , its **texture** is affected. (If it is any help, the Latin word hiding inside **texture** connotes how something is  "to the touch.");1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 6-2-2007(245): When you expose your _flesh_ to the _wind_ it gets **textured** : goosebumps!;2) [[Rachael](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rachael)] 25-1-2008(136): The _moon_ 's lack of _wind_ preserves its **texture**.

彩;coloring;Vulture . . . tree . . . shape.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 29-3-2007(102): In Sydney we occasionally get exotic birds. You first notice a **colouring** in a _tree_. 虎;tiger;The kanji in this frame recalls the famous Bengali fable about the group of magicians (the _magic wand_ ) who decided to make a **tiger**. It seems that each of them knew how to make one part of the beast, so they pooled their talents and brought all the pieces ( _diced_ into pieces) together, at which point the fabricated **_tiger_** promptly ate its makers up (the bodiless _human legs_ ). Whatever the parable's significance for modern civilization and its arsenals, it should help with this kanji. Oh yes, we should not forget that cliff-like element. Think of it as an abbreviation of the primitive for _zoo_ (the first and fourth strokes, actually), in order to fit the **tiger** somewhere into the picture. In fact, the abbreviation is perfectly logical, since the bottom elements usurp the room for the rest of the primitive for _zoo_.;1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 9-4-2007(122): Magic wand + first two strokes of pelt ( 皮 ) + diced + human legs. A wizard who turns people he doesn't like into newts with his magic wand goes for variety - he has always wanted a **tiger** pelt - but things go awry when the **tiger** promptly dices and eats him, leaving only a pair of legs. (a fitting end for a wicked wizard).;2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 23-4-2007(107): **Tigger, the **tiger**** , (from Pooh stories) is happy to have found a _magic wand_. Using it he can bounce up to a the top of a _cliff_ , _seven_ times as high as some _human legs_ could bounce. **Tigger** thinks "Its great to be a **tiger**!
悦;ecstasy;State of mind . . . devil.;1) [[ruuku35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruuku35)] 27-4-2006(189): **ECSTASY** alters our STATE OF MIND and makes us DEVILS.;2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 10-4-2008(82): The state of mind that horny teenagers are looking for.

獣;animal;Owl . . . rice field . . . one . . . mouth . . . chihuahua.;1) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 30-10-2006(311): The _owl_ looks for its prey in the _rice field_. It sees so many potential **animal** s to eat but since it only has _one mouth_ , it decides that the tasty looking _chihuahua_ will be its meal for tonight. (adapted from Copycatken,1-9-2006).;2) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 13-10-2007(77): I have a strange story for this one but it works. I imagine a _owl_ getting into a _rice field_ which serves as a boxing ring. His opponent is a little _chihuahua_. The fight starts, the _owl_ takes _one_ punch to the _mouth_ and is out cold. In the _chihuahua's_ corner is that coach from Rocky saying "Your an **ANIMAL**!!". A vivid image of this story works pretty well for me.
爆;bomb;Fire . . . outburst.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 20-6-2007(184): Actually means explosion, like an outburst of fire.;2) [[Piitaa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Piitaa)] 11-7-2006(96): **Bomb** s make fiery outbursts. It's almost too logical, this one.
測;fathom;Connoting the measurement of the depth of _water_ , the keyword **fathom** begins with the _water_ primitive. To its right, we see the compound-primitive for _rule_ (Frame 92) which we learned in the sense of a  "ruler" or "measure." Hence, when we _rule_ _water_ we **fathom** it. What could be simpler? But be careful, its simplicity is deceptive. Be sure to picture yourself **fathoming** a body of _water_ several hundred feet deep by using a _ruler_ of gargantuan proportions.;1) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 11-1-2007(150): A _fathom_ is the unit you use when making **rules** about **water** 's depth.;2) [[XanthosDeia](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/XanthosDeia)] 13-7-2008(76): You can't **fathom** how deep this _water_ is. Perhaps you should use a _ruler_ to measure it?

He was naturally [graceful](../v4/721.html) (#721 淑) ( 淑 ) in the water, and you knew he was once on the Olympic synchronized swimming team. You knew that there was something different about him, but you joined his youth team and he _watched_ over you carefully as [coach](../v4/719.html) (#719 督) ( 督 ). It was uncomfortable, though, how your [uncle](../v4/718.html) (#718 叔) often touched you just _a little above_ the _crotch_ ( 叔 ) when **COACH** ing…

競;vie;Two _teenagers_ are seen here _standing up_ to one another, **vying** for the attention of their peers.;1) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 26-2-2008(158): TWO twin BROTHERS are competing (VYING) for the title of who is the older BROTHER.
