疎;alienate;_Zoo_ . . . _bundle_. Note that the element for _zoo_ is flattened out on the left just as _leg_ (Frame 1372) had been. This is the only time we will meet this form in this book.;1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 24-9-2006(183): [True story] In Osaka the homeless (the **alienate** d) live in large numbers around the city _zoo_. Picture them in winter all _bundled_ up in rags trying to keep warm, **alienate** d from the society, living literally worst than the animals in the _zoo_ who at least are _bundled_ in their natural furs and have pens to live in sheltered from the elements.;2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 10-7-2007(85): This kanji is so strange that it was **alienate** d at the kanji _zoo_. The _bundle_ of joy stork bundles this kanji up and takes it to a kanji foster home.
貢;tribute;A **tribute** has a kind of double-meaning in English: honor paid freely and _money_ collected by coercion. Simply because a ruler bestows a noble name on a deed is hardly any consolation to the masses who must part with their hard- earned _money_. Little wonder that this ancient _craft_ of getting _money_ by calling it a **tribute** has given way to a name closer to how it feels to those who pay it: a tax.;1) [[Aploosh](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aploosh)] 27-6-2007(326): "This next song is a **TRIBUTE** to a little SHELLFISH friend of mine who was tragically crushed by an I-shaped table.".;2) [[ablindmouse](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ablindmouse)] 28-8-2007(114): **Tribute** is the craft of raising money.

Each wife approaches her HUSBAND, berates him, gives him a sharp **SLAP** in the face and, Three-Stooges style, pokes him in the eyes with her FINGERS.

輸;transport;On the left we see a _vehicle_ used for **transport**. On the right, we see a new tangle of elements that need sorting out. The first three strokes, you will remember, are the primitive for _meeting_. Below it we see the elements for _flesh_ and _saber_ , which combine to create a compound element for a _butcher_ and his trade. Together they give us the image of a  "trucker's convoy.";1) [[jmadsen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jmadsen)] 17-12-2005(219): The _car_ is a cattle-car, used to **transport** animals for the _butcher_ 's _meeting_ \- a convention on new butchering techniques. Hear the screams of the animals as it pulls up in front of the convention hall, where the butchers are waiting with their knives out front.;2) [[pageturner1988](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pageturner1988)] 18-9-2007(109): The vehicle **transport** s animals for a meeting with the butcher.

株;stocks;The **stocks** bought and sold on the market by the tens of millions each day get their name from a comparison to a healthy _tree_ , in which one takes " **stock** " in the hopes that it will grow and produce more and more _trees_ like itself. Usually good **stocks** are referred to as  "blue chip," but here we are asked to associate the key word with the color _vermilion_ , perhaps because one can assess the value of a tree from the color of its autumn leaves.;1) [[cellophane](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cellophane)] 12-10-2007(306): Which _tree_ would you buy **stocks** in - the healthy one on the left, or the one with only one _vermilion_ leaf left on the right?;2) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 2-3-2007(145): Ideally, one buys **stocks** when a company is young, "green," and rapidly growing – then sells them just before the last vermillion leaf falls off, and a period of dormancy or limited growth begins.

葛;kudzu;**Kudzu**  is a word taken over from Japanese to name the crawling vines that creep up and completely take over trees. Seeing it at its worst in the Georgia countryside makes it easy to understand why it has a reputation as the "plague of the South." From there it should not be hard to arrange the primitives, _flowers_  and _siesta_  into a memorable image.;1) [[abaddon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/abaddon)] 17-5-2008(78): Flower, siesta: The muchacho was not careful. He passed the warning signs and decided to hold a _siesta_ in the **kudzu** field. The **kudzu** grew so fast, he was completely covered by it in a few hours and not able to escape. Now, the **kudzu** _flowers_ mark his grave.;2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(15): The muchacho takes a _siesta_ under the _flowers_ of the **kudzu**.

We all know that cows like to eat flowers, so he planted lines of flowers leading to his own fields. The livestock followed the lines, eating the flowers one by one, and **amass** ed in his field.;2) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 17-12-2006(28): It may seem illogical, but the fact is, you need to plant **flowers** if your aim is to _amass_ **livestock**.

滞;stagnate;People that have been " _sashed_ " to something (whether their mother's apron strings or a particular job) for too long become like _water_ that has stopped moving: they start to **stagnate**.;1) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 1-12-2008(246): History of the first karate blackbelts: In those days, it was often difficult to find fresh, clean _water_ , so samurai usually had to wash their _sashes_ in **stagnant** puddles. The longer one had been studying martial arts, the older the sash on one's karate uniform and, therefore, the darker the color. So why weren't their karate uniforms black too? Never seen a ninja????;2) [[jwy2k2](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jwy2k2)] 20-3-2007(72): A moat is a **stagnate** ring of water like an obi (sash) of water tied around the castle.

桂;Japanese Judas-tree;Unless you are a botanist, you are not likely to know what a **Japanese Judas- tree** looks like, and probably never even heard of it before, but the name is sufficiently odd to make remembering it easy. Using the primitives as our guide, we define it as a _tree_ with _ivy_ growing down its branches in the shape of a hangman's rope.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 26-1-2006(158): Simple mnemonic : "The **Japanese Judas-tree** is the _tree_ on which Judas hang himself to the _ivy_ " (Judas the traitor of the Christian bible). Just picture Judas hanging himself, using _ivy_ as a if it was a rope.;2) [[Ninjasha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ninjasha)] 6-1-2008(92): A _tree_ covered in poison _ivy_ will quickly betray you, thus the name **JAPANESE JUDAS-TREE**.
況;but of course;This key word is a connector used to link contrasting phrase sand sentences together with much the same flavor as the English phrase **but of course**. Just picture yourself ready to go off on your first date as a _teenager_ , and having your mother grill you about your manners and ask you embarrassing questions about your hygiene. "Did you have a good shower?" " **But of course** ," you reply, annoyed. So _water_ and _teenager_ combine to give us **but of course**.;1) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 21-9-2006(174): If you ask your _teenager_ if what he's drinking is _water_ (and not Vodka), he will answer "but of course".;2) [[PeterJD](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PeterJD)] 10-4-2008(137): キョウ **But of course** , this character really means "situation/condition". "Elder brother gulped some water and said, 'What the hell was Heisig's mental CONDITION when he came up with this definition? Heisig must have a drinking CONDITION. **But of course** , if Heisig sticks to water, rather than sake (like me, _water_ quaffing, situation assessing, sober _elder brother_ ), his SITUATION may improve.'" [MODEL COMPOUND: 状況 (じょうきょう) state of affairs, conditions].
伐;fell;_Person_ . . . _fiesta_. Hint: recall the German legend of the English missionary, Saint Boniface, who **felled** the sacred oak tree dedicated to Thor at Geismar (in lower Hessia), occasioning a great _fiesta_ for the Christians in the neighborhood to mark the defeat of their pagan competition. Be sure to fit your special _person_ into the story if you use it.;1) [[johnskb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnskb)] 18-2-2006(193): At a _fiesta_ , Mr. T tries to knock down a large pinata, but in his overly enthusiastic swings to get "the sucka," he actually **FELL** S the tree the piñata is hanging from, crushing some party goers. “I pity da fools who got crushed by my **FELL** ED tree!”.;2) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 26-6-2006(43): _Mr T_ at the _fiesta_ **fell** over blind drunk.

謎;riddle;Words . . . astray.;1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(119): _Words_ meant to lead you _astray_ are those of a **riddle**.;2) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 24-2-2010(5): Any good **riddle** contains a few loaded _words_ that are deliberately inserted to lead your thinking _astray_. For example: "A man is afraid to go home because of the other man in the mask, but once he got there he knew he was safe. Exactly what is going on in this situation?" In this **riddle** , the _word_ that leads you _astray_ is "home".

Here's a _St. Bernard dog_ jammed ass-first into the top of a _haystack_ , looking like some kind of proper Victorian-era lady as he struggles to get out.

蔽;cover over;Flower . . . shredder.;1) [[Crowfoot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Crowfoot)] 30-4-2008(74): You **cover over** the _shredder_ with _flowers_ when the FBI comes a-knockin'.;2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 29-7-2008(21): _Shredder_ is writing a anonymous ransom note to the police. "Bring me one billion dollars or I'll destroy your city with my Foot Soldiers! Signed, _Shredder_." …oops! This was supposed to be anonymous, but he signed his own name! He can't re-write it now, he spent all that time doing the letter in beautiful calligraphy. What to do? …Thinking fast, _Shredder_ grabs a large _daisy_ and some tape, and **covers over** his name, leaving only the "-er." Good thinking, _Shredder_!

融;dissolve;_Ceiling_ . . . _mouth_ . . . _hood_ . . . _human legs_ . . . _spike_ . . . _insect_. This is the maximum number of elements _to appear in_ any story in the book.;1) [[zenkun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zenkun)] 13-3-2006(653): I have created the element "old camera" out of the left side of the kanji: from the subject's point of view, the light is captured by _one_ _mouth_ (the lens). The photographer is under a big _hood_ , we only see his _legs_ , and he is holding a _spike_ in his right hand, which is the shutter release. Now, at the time the photographer takes the photo, a little _insect_ is flying near the flash. 胃;stomach;You will need to refer back to frames 13 and 14 here for the special meaning of the two primitive elements that make up this character: _flesh_ ( _part of the body_ ) and _brain_. What the kanji says, if you look at it, is that the _part of the body_ that keeps the _brain_ in working order is the **stomach**. To keep the elements in proper order, when you write this kanji think of the _brain_ as being  "held up" by the _flesh_.;1) [[brian44](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/brian44)] 27-8-2007(321): The _rice field_ is harvested once a _month_ to get food for our **stomach**.;2) [[johanvg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johanvg)] 21-7-2006(41): The **stomach** is the part of the body that digests food (which, in Japan, is mainly rice).
脂;fat;This kanji tells us that if you feed the _flesh_ with too many _delicious_ things, it soon picks up a thick layer of **fat**.;1) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 17-7-2007(212): Every chef will tell you, **fat** is what make the meat taste delicious.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 7-8-2007(60): **Fat** is the most _delicious_ part of the _flesh_. (Note this refers to physical **fat** , not the concept of obesity [obese](../v4/494.html) (#494 肪)).

Ears! He eats ears!

He visits schools with the slogan "Bullying CAN be stopped," and hands out _flowers_ of peace and understanding.
需;demand;The sense of **demand** is best captured by thinking of the economic principle of  "supply and **demand**. 斗;Big Dipper;The **Big Dipper** here is of course the constellation of Ursa Major, of which this kanji is a sort of pictographic representation.;1) [[snallygaster](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/snallygaster)] 7-10-2007(162): Since the meaning of "big dipper" is rather specific and the sense of measurement seems to be a more common usage, I concentrate on the primative meaning of **measuring cup**. This is a pictograph, with the first two strokes representing the measuring ticks on the side of the cup.;2) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 10-10-2008(98): Is it just me, or do all of these traditional kanji pictographs look like they were drawn by a retarded bunny rabbit?
鳩;pigeon;Baseball . . . bird.;1) [[sutebun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sutebun)] 1-3-2008(94): **Pigeon** s are the birds that come in hordes after baseball games to eat all the trash left by fans.;2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 30-10-2006(47): Imagine some **pigeon** s going to see a _baseball_ game. 麓;foot of a mountain;Grove . . . deer.;1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(65): Many _deer_ can be found in the _grove_ at the **foot of a mountain**.;2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 15-8-2008(18): _Deer_ are well known for frolicking in _groves_ of _trees_. However, they are not well known for actually watching where the heck they are bounding about. Here we have a bunch of dead _deer_ bodies that you find at the **foot of a mountain**. You are trying to figure why there are so many dead _deer_ in one spot, and then you trace a line up the mountain - leaves and such are scattered all the way up…to a grove. Looks like they hopped through some leaves to their doom.
刹;moment;The key word here is the noun meaning "a breif moment." Its elements: _sheaf_ . . . _tree_ . . . _saber_.;1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 13-10-2008(43): _Wolverine_ waiting atop a _tree_ to spring down on _Sabre_ tooth at any **moment**.;2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-1-2007(25): The kendo artist takes a brief **moment** to practice his skills: he throws _sheafs_ over the _tree_ and tries to cut them with his _saber_ when they come down again.
径;diameter;Line . . . spool.;1) [[calittle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/calittle)] 7-10-2007(162): Scientists recently measured the **diameter** of Earth by drilling a deep hole and dropping a _line_ of thread off a humongous _spool_ until it got to the other side.;2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 18-2-2008(109): Suggestion: Replace "spool" with "toilet paper/roll". Reasons: (1) _Toilet paper/roll_ usually comes on a _spool_. (2) _Toilet paper_ is used to clean the _soil_ off your _crotch_. Story: Measure the **diameter** of a _column_ (maybe Nelson's Column in London?) using a roll of _toilet paper_. Spool also appears in [stalk](../v4/715.html) (#715 茎), [suspicious](../v4/716.html) (#716 怪), [lightly](../v4/717.html) (#717 軽), [sutra](../v4/1360.html) (#1360 経).
騰;inflation;Meat . . . quarter . . . team of horses.;1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 21-7-2007(179): Every _quarter_ _moon_ , the cost of a _trojan horse_ rises one quarter by **inflation**.;2) [[FudoMyo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FudoMyo)] 9-11-2007(70): Flesh+quarter=McDonald's _quarter pounder_. Due to **inflation** , McDonald's has had to start making quarter pounders out of _horse meat_.

溶;melt;Water . . . contain.;1) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 15-6-2006(183): Think of what happens when the snow on top of the mountains **melt** s: it turns into _water_ and flows down onto the rooftops of all the _houses_ in the _valley_ below.;2) [[Ricardo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ricardo)] 11-11-2006(140): [melt, dissolve, thaw] An ice cube is **melt** ing, loosing the _water_ it _contained_.
藍;indigo;Flowers . . . oversee.;1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(65): **Indigo** _flowers_ have to be _overseen_ because they are often picked for their beauty.;2) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 5-1-2010(45): Traditionally, 青 [blue](../v4/1534.html) (#1534 青) could be used to describe blue OR green. However, two kanji that describe the hues specifically are 藍 and 緑 . This kanji is the "blue" counterpart of [green](../v4/1371.html) (#1371 緑). Story: The _overseer_ , master of the slaves, wore a cloak dyed with **indigo** , and _flowers_ in his hair.
羨;envious;_Sheep_ . . . _water_ . . . _yawn/lack_. Although this character looks rather simple, special care should be taken in learning it because of the proximity of the final two elements to the character for _next_ , which we learned in frame 510. Note, too, that the _water_ comes UNDER the _sheep_ , rather than on its own to the left.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 11-10-2005(289): A very thirsty sheep, who always _lacked_ _water_ , spends his days watching his fellow _sheep_ (in the farm next door or in another pen) and being very **envious** of their _water_.;2) [[dtstutz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dtstutz)] 11-1-2008(153): **Envious** of the greener grass on the other side of the fence, the **sheep** looks down in disgust at his own dry grass **lacking water**.
削;plane;Long before the invention of the carpenter's **plane** , people used knives and machetes (or here, _sabers_ ) to smooth out their woodwork. If you have ever seen the process, you will have been amazed at the speed and agility with which the adept can **plane** a hunk of wood into shape. Indeed, you can almost see the _sparks_ fly from their _sabers_.;1) [[Ninjasha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ninjasha)] 21-12-2007(258): _Sparks_ will fly if you attempt to **PLANE** your _sabre_.;2) [[snozle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/snozle)] 21-10-2006(85): With today's strict air regulations, carrying a _sabre_ onto a **plane** could _spark_ quite a commotion.

畏;apprehensive;Field . . . hairpin.;1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 5-6-2007(68): The man being tortured was **apprehensive** as he saw his tormentor approaching with a _hairpin_ poised to pierce his _brain_!;2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 12-6-2007(14): I’m feeling **apprehensive** because I’m wading barefoot in a _paddyfield_ and I've just dropped my _hairpin_.
嗅;sniff;You have seen those scratch'n' **sniff** advertisements for perfumes. This one is for a _mouth_ wash that replaces one _stinking_ oder with another.;1) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 27-6-2010(30): **Smell**. _Mouth_ agape, _nose_ in the air, a _chihuahua_ **smells** some BBQ miles away. NOTE: Assigned keyword "sniff" in RTK Newly Approved General Use Kanji Supplement.;2) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 8-12-2009(16): **smell** : You open your mouth and gasp for air, that stinking (notice the chihuahua instead) smell is too much.
蛮;barbarian;Apple . . . insects.;1) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 3-5-2008(278): The **barbarian** picks an _apple_ from above and eats it even though there is a worm ( _insect_ ) in it.;2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 3-4-2007(39): **Barbarian** s eat apples with worms still in them.
漬;pickling;Water . . . blame.;1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 25-5-2007(239): When **pickling** you MUST use distilled water! When it doesn't come out right, generally it is the _water_ that is to _blame_.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 4-3-2007(54): Bad _water_ is to _blame_ for the process of **pickling**.
糧;provisions;Rice . . . quantity.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 26-11-2007(292): Imagine Japanese army **provisions** like obentou boxes, always containing the same _quantity_ of _rice_. (thanks darg_sama, emphasizing _quantity_ and the nuance of food "rations", "food supply": the kanji also appears in "military **provisions** " and "army rice").;2) [[darg_sama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/darg_sama)] 7-11-2005(120): All Japanese **provisions** contain a certain quantity of rice… they eat it with just about every meal!
郊;outskirts;Mingle . . . city walls.;1) [[blackstockc](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/blackstockc)] 24-1-2008(129): The country folk and and the city folk mingle at the **outskirts** of town, just past the city walls.;2) [[cbogart](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cbogart)] 12-3-2007(75): The city walls mark the **outskirts** of the inner city, where it begins to mingle with the suburbs.
糖;sugar;Rice . . . T'ang.;1) [[guidedog](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/guidedog)] 19-7-2007(139): **Sugar** made from rice has a tangy flavour.;2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 18-11-2007(125): The _T'ang_ are the ones who began using **sugar** in China–of course, the first thing they tried it on was _rice_.
粛;solemn;_Rake_ . . . _rice_ . . . _fenceposts_. Take special care to draw this character in the same order as the primitive. Note too, that the fourth stroke for _rice_ is already taken care of by the fourth stroke of _rake_.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 11-9-2007(261): Even though it's a maddening task, the monks stay **solemn** as they rake _rice_ between the _fenceposts_.;2) [[cangy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cangy)] 7-4-2008(169): **Note:** This is not _sieve_ as it has a full _rice_ and not _rice grains_ and the hook is missing from _rake_. Also the given stroke order is incorrect ( _fenceposts_ should come last).
遭;encounter;Cadet . . . road.;1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 22-6-2007(198): Close **encounter** s of the third kind. The space _cadet_ **encounter** s aliens on the _road_.;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 4-12-2005(54): _Bender the cadet_ (see frame 1172) has an "encounter of the third kind" on the _road_. Reference to Steven Spielberg's 1977 movie "Close **Encounter** s of the Third Kind". Also a reference to popular stories of people reportedly chased by UFO's while driving on the road.
柏;oak;This kanji calls to mind the famous myth of the "golden bough." As you may recall, what made the sacred **oak** in the forest of Diana the Huntress outside of Rome  "golden" were the _white_ berries of the mistletoe that grew in the branches of the tree. When the light of the sun shone through them, they turned yellow and the branch to which they clung appeared to be made of gold. (If you don't know the story, take a break today and hunt it down in a dictionary of myth and fable. Even if you forget the kanji - which of course you won't - the story of the mistletoe and the fate it brought to Balder the Beautiful is most memorable.);1) [[lilpea](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lilpea)] 12-8-2007(121): The wood from **oak** _trees_ can be used to make barrels in which _white_ wine is aged. What's more, I love _white_ wine with an **oaky** flavour…;2) [[ashman63](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ashman63)] 31-3-2008(104): An **oak** _tree_ is _white_ , from left to right!
棟;ridgepole;If the piece of _wood_ in the roof known as the **ridgepole** points _east_ , the sunrise will be visible from the front door.;1) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 2-2-2007(235): Feng Shui states that the **ridgepole** of a house should be made of _wood_ and face _east_.;2) [[liosama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/liosama)] 23-7-2008(61): Ok just a note to the 'ridgepole facing east story' im making up a story to JUSTIFY why that is the case. Assuming that 99% of you guys use the age old story of a 'sun rising through a tree tells you were the east is', back in those days when people used **ridgepole** s they wanted to align their houses in such a way that they face the rising sun, so they wake up with a bright day, and wake up early with the sun seeping through in a perpendicular manner( as the ridge pole faces the sun in the morning).
升;measuring box;This is the character for the little wooden box that the Japanese use for measuring things, as well as for drinking saké out of. Simply imagine the outside as spiked with a _thousand_ sharp _needles_ , and the quaint little **measuring box** becomes a drinker's nightmare! Be very careful when you write this character not to confuse it with the writing of _thousand_. The reason for the difference gives us a chance to clarify another general principle of writing that supersedes the one we mentioned in frame 4: when a single stroke runs vertically through the middle of a character, it is written last.;1) [[solarmist](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/solarmist)] 26-6-2008(393): It is a thousand or ten? I need my **measuring box**.;2) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 21-7-2007(120): I can fit a thousand needles into my **measuring box** , but only if I bend the thousand.
契;pledge;_Grow up_ . . . _dagger_ . . . _St. Bernard dog_. The connotation of this character should be kept distinct from that for _vow_ (Frame 1214) and _promise_ (Frame 1462).;1) [[frozach](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/frozach)] 18-10-2007(164): Imagine a totalitarian regime where, while _growing up_ , you have to **pledge** allegiance to the flag at _dagger_ -point and with _St. Bernard_ guard dogs watching you.;2) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 27-5-2008(81): With our new pills we **pledge** to _grow_ your _dagger bigger_ \- typical junk mail.
昧;obscure;The most **obscure** ideas are those that the _sun_ of reason has _not yet_ dawned on. Be sure to give the _sun_ a professorial demeanor, complete with spectacles and a pipe.;1) [[Aerin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Aerin)] 18-11-2007(90): Something that is **obscure** has _not yet_ been brought before the light of _day_.;2) [[to_nihon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/to_nihon)] 11-1-2009(48): 'Can't you go outside and get some _sun_?' ' _Not yet_ , I have to learn all these **obscure** RTK3 kanji!'.
塾;cram school;**Cram schools** are after-hours educational institutions where kids can do concentrated preparing for their coming entrance examinations or drill what they missed during regular class hours. The exception are the _tall children_ who are out on the school _grounds_ practicing sports, and the _fat_ ones who are out there burning off calories. So this character depicts those who do NOT go to the **cram schools** , rather than those who do.;1) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 12-1-2007(286): Welcome to our **cram school** : you will _receive_ a _rounded_ education on our _grounds_.;2) [[sethimayne](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sethimayne)] 6-11-2007(71): "You can _receive_ a well- _rounded_ education if you study at our **cram school** " says the advertisement. "Just come to our school _grounds_ and check it out yourself!".
硬;stiff;Rocks . . . grow late.;1) [[Deborah](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Deborah)] 12-11-2007(256): A **stiff** drink on the _ROCK_ s after it _GROWS LATE_ is a way to unwind after a long day…;2) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 11-7-2006(113): _Stones_ are so **stiff** that even if you spent all day straining trying to change their shape, it would _grow late_ far before you ever accomplished your task.
坪;two-mat area;This kanji belongs to an old Japanese system of measurement and indicates an area of about 36 square feet, or the **area** taken up by **two** tatami **mats**. Its elements: _ground_ . . . _water lily_.;1) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 28-6-2006(205): A **two-mat area** is just about as much _ground_ as you will need for a _lily_ pond.;2) [[pmbeddall](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pmbeddall)] 21-1-2008(114): A **two-mat area** is plenty of space for sleeping in a tent but you won't be comfortable unless the _ground_ is _even_.
貼;post a bill;The key word in this frame has do with **posting bills** to a billboard. In this case, the billboard is standing at the exit to a Chinese restaurant displaying the latest alternative to the tradition _fortune-telling_ cookies. Look closely and you will see rows of leftover shells of _clams_ with little slips of paper sticking out of them **posted** to the billboard.;1) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 12-11-2008(43): Fortune teller writes your fortune on a piece of paper and tells you to **affix** it to a shell and throw into the ocean for it to come true. Picture licking the back of the shell like a stamp and **affix** ing it to the fortune.;2) [[CasualTatsumaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CasualTatsumaki)] 7-5-2010(25): To prevent confusion with [affixed](../v4/1303.html) (#1303 附) I changed this to "paste (v.)" or "cut and paste" because it is the character for pasting in a PC and in graphic design. Careful [paste](../v4/2650.html) (#2650 糊) Story: You pay money and the fortune teller cuts and pastes a good fortune and prints it out for you on his notebook PC. 切り貼り きりはり cut and paste, 貼る はる to stick/to paste, 貼付け はりつけ (computer file) paste.
朴;crude;As all magicians who have passed their apprenticeship know, one makes one's _wand_ out of a hazel branch and is careful not to alter the natural form of the _wood_. For the magic of the _wand_ derives its power from its association with the hidden laws of nature, and needs therefore to be kept in its **crude** , natural state.;1) [[simple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/simple)] 12-9-2007(153): _Wooden wands_ are the **crudest**. They are nothng compared to their carbon fibre equivilents.;2) [[wingedge](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wingedge)] 17-12-2007(78): A beginner magician starts with a **crude** _wooden magic wand_. Later he'll upgrade to magicite, of course.
寅;sign of the tiger;_House_ . . . _ceiling_ . . . _sprout_ . . . _animal legs_. Compare, and do not confuse with, the kanji in frame 1887.;1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 16-10-2006(230): If you draw the **sign of the tiger** on the ceiling of your house, you will sprout tiger's legs (animal legs) and be able to run and pounce like the big cats yourself.;2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 11-4-2007(75): The **sign of the tiger** is that he's eaten all of the [yellow](../v4/1750.html) (#1750 黄) salad in the _house_.
蜜;honey;House . . . invariably . . . insect.;1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 3-7-2006(311): When I think of **honey** , I think of a bee hive, which is a HOUSE that INVARIABLY has INSECTS.;2) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 13-12-2007(95): A _house_ with a lot of **honey** will _invariably_ attract many _insects_.
侶;partner;Person . . . spine.;1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 15-5-2007(53): _Mr. T_ don't take a **partner** , especially one with no _spine_. 飢;hungry;Food . . . wind.;1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 21-1-2007(297): The smell of cooked _food_ wafts past you in the _wind_ , making your stomach rumble and feeling **hungry**.;2) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 24-10-2007(67): The _wind_ blew away my _food_ , so now I'm **hungry**.
貯;savings;To avoid confusing this frame with the last one, try to think of **savings** as actual money. The only difference is that our currency is not paper bills but _shells_ , a not uncommon unit of exchange in older civilizations. The _nail_ under the roof of the _house_ points to a hiding place in the rafters on which one strings up one's _shells_ for safekeeping.;1) [[pmbeddall](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/pmbeddall)] 9-10-2007(158): It takes a lot more than one _clam_ of **savings** to buy a _house_ on a _street_.;2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 17-6-2008(68): My **SAVINGS** plan - I _nail_ my _money_ bags up in the rafters below my _roof_. I'm very secretive about it, and I wear a disguise with a big **mustache** (another meaning of this kanji) while I stash my loot.
漕;rowing;Water . . . cadet.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 4-12-2005(149): _Bender the cadet_ (see frame 1172) is **rowing** , during some army exercise, and he's very afraid of _water_ (Bender is a robot).;2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 22-6-2007(67): The space _cadet_ is in training, **rowing** in the _water_ (see it splash).
弧;arc;Bow . . . melon.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 22-5-2008(146): Joan of **Arc** ("arc" also means "bow" in french) is practicing with a _bow_ , shooting at _melons_ in a distant field.;2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 14-4-2008(107): When you use a _bow_ to shoot a _melon_ , the **arc** varies depending on how far away you are.
餓;starve;Food . . . ego.;1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 13-12-2006(278): All those starving models in Hollywood - they want to _eat_ , but their _ego_ (about their appearance and trim look) makes sure they grin and bear it!;2) [[richcoop](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/richcoop)] 8-10-2008(106): He **starve** s for FOOD but his EGO won't let him beg.
択;choose;Fingers . . . shakuhachi.;1) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 13-4-2007(339): Hand job or "shakuhachi", **choose**.;2) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 10-9-2007(150): Depending on where you **choose** to put your _fingers_ , the _shakuhachi_ will produce a different note.
碑;tombstone;Rock . . . lowly.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 8-1-2006(252): There is a grave of a _lowly_ man with a **tombstone** made of a simple, small _stone_. If you bow really low you can read the very small inscription engraved on the _stone_ , it says - “Now that you bowed so low to read this, you are as _lowly_ as I once was”.;2) [[ruuku35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruuku35)] 6-8-2007(139): A STONE makes a LOWLY **TOMBSTONE**.
渓;mountain stream;Water . . . vulture . . . husband.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 9-8-2007(189): The Simpsons are on vacation. _Homer_ stops to take a leak in a **mountain stream** but gets snatched by an _eagle_. Hear his scream?;2) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 8-4-2006(92): A husband who went fishing at the **mountain stream** to feed his family, fell in the rapids (we'll assume this is a large **mountain stream** ). He is saved from the waters by a great eagle. He comes back home with nothing to feed the family, his clothes still dripping wet as he tells his wife of how he was saved by a great eagle, and of course she does not believe him. The story continues in [chicken](../v4/1947.html) (#1947 鶏).
后;empress;Drag . . . one . . . mouth.;1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 10-6-2007(186): The **empress** is cruel. Normally she'll violently pull her servants by the ear when they've failed to follow orders. But _one time_ she _dragged_ this one guy around the palace by the _mouth_. She must have been really angry—ever since that moment, he's never been seen again.;2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-9-2008(110): The _F_ word often comes out of the _mouth_ of the **empress**.
妄;delusion;The "ideal _woman_ " one daydreams about is no more than a **delusion**. Hence, _perish_ the thought of her.;1) [[Georgi87](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Georgi87)] 7-10-2007(227): I had a problem with remembering that "deceased" went over the "woman". 俵;bag;Keep this kanji distinct from that for _sack_ (Frame 1081). Its elements are: _person_ . . . _surface_.;1) [[volfy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/volfy)] 17-4-2006(176): _Mr. T_ 's punching **bag** has one beat up _surface_.;2) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 28-2-2006(57): Do you know why every _person_ in Japan has a Louis Vuitton **bag**? After the 1985 JAL air crash that killed 520 people (the world's worst). An image on tv of the crash showed Louis Vuitton **bag** s (whose LV logo covered _surface_ was somehow impervious) litering the crash site. From that point on they stuck in Japanese people's mind's as durable and high quality. (True story).
喪;miss;_Soil_ . . . two _mouths_ . . . _hairpin_. Hint: see _spit_ (Frame 162). The key word carries the wide range of meanings readily associated with it: error, loss, absence, and so on.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 25-12-2007(188): I **miss** my parents dearly. Here they lay, under a big _cross_ , their _mouths_ side by side. I stick _hairpins_ in their graves. CAREFUL: the stroke order/primitive order is: ten, L mouth, R mouth, hairpin. "Soil" is not drawn in its stroke order.;2) [[tristanthorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tristanthorn)] 18-3-2009(104): _Ten_ days ago, our _two mouths_ met for the last time… then she gave me her _hairpin_ as a sayounara gift. How I **miss** my Geisha girl…
虐;tyrannize;_Tiger_ . . . _box_ with a _one_ in it (or a backwards _broom_ , if that makes it easier).;1) [[Hyland1](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Hyland1)] 30-4-2007(281): Here we see the evil tyrannizing tiger. What is on his chest? A giant E, for EVIL, of course.;2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 7-1-2007(69): The "E" shape actually means claws here, and the real etymology is a tiger tyrannizing other animals with its claws (the etymologies actually make sense once in a blue moon!). I think of the claws here as two hooks, representing the front paws. (stroke order of that part: [二＋](midori://search?text=二＋) last of 直 ).
褒;praise;_Top hat and scarf_ . . . _protect_. Note that the  "tree" in _protect_ becomes a _wooden pole_ here.;1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 17-6-2007(195): _Mr. T_ is **praise** d for his _protecting_ of the trees by being given a _top hat and scarf_ which he wears over his mohawk and chains, respectively.;2) [[TunS77](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/TunS77)] 28-7-2009(33): I have to **praise** this _tophat and scarf_ , it sure did do a great job _protecting_ me from the cold!
託;consign;Words . . . lock of hair.;1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 4-1-2007(264): When you **consign** a matter to someone, you get their word and a lock of their hair (to be used in a voodoo ritual if they don't keep their word).;2) [[ivandiaz](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ivandiaz)] 4-3-2007(53): In "The Lord of the Rings", Galadriel **consign** ed a lock of her hair to Gimli the dwarf, along with some wise words.
伎;performing artist;Person . . . branch.;1) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 4-10-2007(50): _Mr T_ is dancing and singing and all that, but he's doing it on a _branch_. All that talent and can still still keep his balance? That's a real **performing artist**.;2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 11-8-2006(24): (note: this is the 'ki' from kabuki).//The **performing artist** is a _person_ doing Kabuki theater and dancing around with a _branch_ in his hand.
桐;paulownia;Since you probably don't know what a **paulownia** _tree_ is, we shall let the key word suggest the phrase  "the Little Brothers of St. **Paulownia.** " It is a short step to associate the _tree_ with the _monks_ to its right. (For the curious, the name of this oriental _tree_ really comes from a Russian princess, Anna Pavlovna.);1) [[elktapestry](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/elktapestry)] 29-3-2007(371): In Japan, a **paulownia** (きり）is known as the "princess tree". It was once a traditional TREE planted at the SAME time as the birth of a daughter. It would grow fast enough that, at the time of her wedding, it could be used to make a dresser as a wedding present for her.;2) [[akira](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akira)] 1-2-2007(98): **Paulownia** is a Japanese tree which looks same as any other tree.
殻;husk;Samurai . . . superfluous . . . missile.;1) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 28-7-2007(190): Samurai's **husk** /shell/armour is superflous to missile attacks 甲殻 卵殻 貝殻 .;2) [[nilfisq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nilfisq)] 30-8-2007(152): **husk** or **shell**. Japan's recent history in a nut **shell** : first the _samurai_ became _superfluous_ and then the Americans started to _throw missiles_ and bombs during WWII.
廉;bargain;Cave . . . concurrently.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 6-3-2007(176): Stores don't want you to know it, but if you find the secret _cave_ , they run **bargains** there _concurrently_ to their regular prices. (Image: pulling a certain level in a store to find the " **bargain** _cave_ ).;2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 3-5-2007(43): Think of the cave as a **bargain** basement, where shoppers rush in concurrently as soon as it opens.
副;vice-;The key word **vice** has the sense of someone second-in-command. The great and flashing _saber_ to the right (its usual location, so you need not worry about where to put it from now on) and the _wealth_ on the left combine to create an image of dividing one's property to give a share to one's **vice** - _wealth_ holder.;1) [[geisel](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/geisel)] 27-4-2007(174): The _wealthy_ guy with the _sword_ standing next to the king, that's the **vice-** roy who does all the dirty work.;2) [[applesuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/applesuki)] 10-2-2006(106): **Vice-** president Cheney: a wealthy saber rattler.
克;overcome;In this frame we get a chance to use the kanji we just learned in its primitive meaning of _teenager_. The _needle_ on top indicates one of the major problems confronting the _teenager_ growing up in today's world: drugs. Many of them will fall under the shadow of the _needle_ at some time during those tender years, but only when a whole generation rises up and decides that "We Shall **Overcome** " the plague, will the _needle_ cease to hangover their heads, as it does in this character.;1) [[wfreeman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wfreeman)] 3-2-2007(184): Ten elder brothers can **overcome** anything.;2) [[canji](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/canji)] 1-8-2008(81): A **teenager** addicted to heroine must **overcome** the _needle_.
戚;relatives;If you think of a _parade_ of particularly disagreeable **relatives** , it should not be hard to imagine them as large bodies with _little_ pea-brains _above_.;1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 26-10-2007(72): Your _half-uncle_ is leading a _parade_ of your **relatives**. (Note: 上 + 小 makes up part of "uncle" 叔 , so I've called it "half-uncle".).;2) [[FoxintheStars](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FoxintheStars)] 1-8-2010(54): (Using the RTK1 supplement so I haven't had "uncle" yet.) When you take visiting **relatives** to a _parade_ , hold the _little_ ones _up above_ so they can see over the crowd.
項;paragraph;To the right we see a _head_ and to the left an element that means _craft_. When we think of a **paragraph** , we immediately think of a _heading_ device to break a text into parts. (Think of the elaborate _heads_ often seen at the start of medieval manuscripts and the task becomes easier still.) Just where and how to do it belongs to the writer's _craft_. Hence, we define **paragraphing** as the  " _heading craft_ " to remember this character.;1) [[crazy88](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/crazy88)] 19-9-2007(237): To write a **paragraph** is the _craft_ of grouping sentences on a _page_.;2) [[stereovibe](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stereovibe)] 5-2-2008(115): To _craft_ a _page_ well, we need **paragraph** s.
椿;camellia;Tree . . . springtime.;1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 14-3-2007(280): The _tree_ of _spring_. Fact: **Camellia** are highly valued in Japan and elsewhere for their very early flowering, often among the first flowers to appear in the late winter [early spring?].;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-3-2007(43): Anyone who's lived in Japan knows **camellia** are by far the first tree of spring to flower. And how can you miss those shockingly pink flowers!
牙;tusk;If you play with this primitive's form with pencil and paper, you will see that it begins with a _box_ -like shape, and ends with the final two strokes of the _halberd_ , a convenient combination for the **tusk** protruding from the mouth of an animal.;1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 20-12-2008(142): The kanji looks like an elephant with **tusk** s. the box is the elephant's eye. The final stroke is the **tusk**.;2) [[Copycatken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Copycatken)] 2-7-2006(87): He stored the **tusk** s into a _box_ , along with the _broken halberds_.

呈;display;The trick to remembering this character lies in associating the key word with the line from the nursery rhyme about 4 and 20 blackbirds baked in a pie: "Wasn't this a dainty dish to set before the _king_? " If we think of **display** in terms of that famous line, and the _king_ with his head thrown back and his _mouth_ wide open as 4 and 20 blackbirds fly in one after the other, we shall have satisfied both the elements and their position.;1) [[Georgi87](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Georgi87)] 5-9-2007(157): The mouth of the king is **display** ing his bling.;2) [[sethimayne](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sethimayne)] 21-10-2007(131): What a pathetic **display**! The _king_ is sprawled on his throne, head back and _mouth_ wide open, fast asleep. We should never have let him drink so much at that banquet last night.

碁;Go;_Bushel basket_ . . . _stones_. Fortunately there are millions of _apple_ trees growing in the cliffs above the **gulf**. The archers use their _bows_ to shoot down _apple_ after _apple_ , which all fall into the _water_ and slowly fill up the the **gulf** until the archer soliders can cross on foot.

婿;bridegroom;What makes a man a **bridegroom** is obviously a _woman_ and her dowry, here presented as a small _zoo_ (animals were often used for this purpose in earlier societies) and a _month_ away from it all (the  "honey _moon_ ").;1) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 24-6-2008(174): The virgin **bridegroom** tries to understand the new, mysterious _part of_ his _woman's body_ \- but with little success. 佳;excellent;_Person_ . . . _ivy_. To distinguish from _excel_ (Frame 980), _eminent_ (Frame 52), _esteem_ (Frame 196), and _exquisite_ (Frame 130), give the key word its own unique connotation.;1) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 5-9-2007(138): _Mr T_ wants to go to an **excellent** school, so he enrolls in Harvard, an _ivy_ -league school.;2) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 29-10-2006(122): Bill and Ted are walking through medieval Europe when they see a humongous _square jewel_. " **Excellent**!" they both yell. But only after grabbing it do they realize it is chained to the neck of _Mr. T_ , who grimaces angrily at them. "Bogus!" they cry, and totally run away.
杏;apricot;Since **apricots** can be eaten just as they fall from the _trees_ , picture this _mouth_ agape at the bottom of a _tree_ (just as the elements have it), waiting for **apricots** to fall into it.;1) [[Ninjasha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ninjasha)] 21-12-2007(195): From the _tree_ straight into the _mouth_ is the best way to eat an **APRICOT**!;2) [[thegeezer3](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thegeezer3)] 8-9-2006(37): Imagine Totoro sleeping under his _tree_. As he snores a giant **apricot** falls nicely into his open _mouth_ and he emits a giant burp of satisfaction. I can hear that music alreay….to - to to - to - ro…
挟;sandwiched;_Fingers_ . . . _scissors_. Do not confuse with the kanji for _pinch_ (Frame 709).;1) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 12-1-2008(241): 挟まる 【はさまる】 (v5r,vi) to get between, to be caught in, (P) Story: You know how in tokyo there are those really packed trains where train staff in gloves shove people in? Well imagine being **sandwiched** in so tight, that when the doors close, only your FINGERS are sticking out. The train staff have no choice… they must cut them off with SCISSORS =( snip snip..;2) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 3-3-2010(134): Fingers **sandwiched** between a pair of scissors. Don't move or else!
喝;hoarse;When the muchacho on _siesta_ looks up at you and opens his _mouth_ to talk, his voice is so **hoarse** that you cannot understand him.;1) [[Francois](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Francois)] 1-4-2008(185): If you have a _siesta_ with your _mouth_ open, you will wake up with a **hoarse** voice.;2) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 17-7-2007(27): After taking a siesta, you find that your mouth is **hoarse** (after all you ARE thirsty remember).

So you turn the _water_ hose on him.;1) [[wazzab](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wazzab)] 10-3-2007(133): You awaken from your _siesta_ because you feel extremely **thirst** y so you go looking for some _water_.;2) [[onsen_monkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/onsen_monkey)] 23-9-2006(72): The muchacho taking his SIESTA cries out that he is **THIRST** Y. So you pull out a bottle of WATER and pretend you're going to give it to him…but then you dump it all on the ground before his eyes. HAHA, sucked in muchacho!!
髄;marrow;Skeleton . . . possess . . . road.;1) [[notgoing2argue](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/notgoing2argue)] 30-7-2007(300): A _skeleton_ is shuffling along the shoulder of the road, so you pull up next to him and ask where he is going. He says he's going to donate his **marrow** to the hospital because he got into some financial trouble and lost everything, his **marrow** is the only thing he still _possesses_.;2) [[Istvan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Istvan)] 16-7-2007(25): Did you know there are road ways in skeleton? 溺;drowning;_Water_ . . . _weak_. Do not confuse the meaning of this key word with "Drown" (Frame 763), which is closer to "founder.";1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 8-5-2007(90): Weak people placed in the water start **drowning**. Get some strength in those arms and learn how to swim!;2) [[nadiatims](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nadiatims)] 24-6-2009(7): Weak people who can't hang onto the deck(DEKI) during a storm end up **drowning**.
旬;decameron;There simply is not a good phrase in English for the block often days which this character represents. So we resurrect the classical phrase, **decameron** , whose connotations the tales of Boccaccio have done much to enrich. Actually, it refers to a journey of ten _days_ taken by a band of people - that is, a group of people _bound together_ for the _days_ of the **decameron**.;1) [[yukkuri_kame](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/yukkuri_kame)] 6-4-2009(218): Hesig should be BOUND for a DAY (or maybe 10 days - a **decameron** ) for calling this Kanji **DECAMERON**. See [martyrdom](../v4/809.html) (#809 殉).;2) [[Pulse](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Pulse)] 18-3-2012(165): **Hint:** _Here's info from Wikipedia regarding why this kanji exists, which helped me remember it:_ [Japan also divides the month roughly into three 10-day periods. Each is called a jun ( 旬 ). The first is jōjun ( 上旬 ), the second, chūjun ( 中旬 ), the last, gejun ( 下旬 ). These are frequently used to indicate approximate times, for example, "the temperatures are typical of the jōjun of April", "a vote on a bill is expected during the gejun of this month."].
錠;lock;_Metal_ of itself doesn't **lock**. It needs to be so _determined_ by a **lock** smith. Now make a concrete image of that.;1) [[ngoli1](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ngoli1)] 26-9-2007(211): Even if you **lock** up your GOLD, a DETERMINED thief will get it in the end.;2) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 14-3-2008(173): The best stories for this kanji tend to have a thief in them, which always makes me confuse them with the kanji for burglar (357). So, let's try this one: My girlfriend wears a _metal_ chastity belt with a **lock** but I am _determined_ to open it! I must get inside!

He was suddenly in _high demand_ as people came from all over to ask for his sage advice, immensely satisfied with suggestions such as, "You will find happiness with a new love".

This is **reparations** for slavery!".;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 5-3-2007(72): NOTE: do not confuse with [compensation](../v4/476.html) (#476 賠)賠. However, 賠 is always used in conjunction 賠償 … But 償 is used in various other compounds. _Mr. T_ sold all his jewelry to give as **reparation** s to slave families. The governent tried to honor his charity by giving him a _prize_ , but it was a shitty _outhouse filled with clams_.
赴;proceed;In **proceeding** to a new city or a new job, something in you _runs_ ahead with excitement, and something else holds you back, like a _divining rod_ built into your psyche warning you to check things out carefully before rushing in too wildly.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 7-8-2007(289): "Don't _run_ into trouble," Dumbledore tells Harry. 畔;paddy ridge;_Rice field_ . . . _half_. The key word here refers to the **ridges** that rise up between the sections of a rice **paddy**.;1) [[ruuku35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruuku35)] 1-6-2007(299): A **PADDY-RIDGE** divides the RICE FIELD in HALF.;2) [[MeisterLlama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/MeisterLlama)] 20-1-2009(65): Better keyword: waterside (as in lakeside, etc.) words: 河畔 (riverside) 湖畔 (lakeside), 池畔 (by a pond), etc. New keyword captures most common meaning, and avoids confusion with 畦 , which means ONLY **paddy- ridge**. story: A rice field is divided in half, half is field half is water. If you stand at the halfway mark, you are at the waterside.

苗;seedling;To avoid confusion with the image of rice seedlings to appear later, we shall take these **seedlings** out of their agricultural setting in the _rice fields_ and into the frame of Brave New World surgery, where  "ideas" or "values" are being implanted into _brains_ like **seedlings** to insure a harmonious society. Then you need only imagine them taking root and breaking out into _flower_ right through the tops of the skulls of people walking around on the streets.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 31-7-2007(184): If you plant **seedling** s in a FIELD eventually they will FLOWER.;2) [[SammyB](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/SammyB)] 5-6-2008(61): Crap! 諭;rebuke;The stern tone of a **rebuke** is seen here in the image of _words_ spoken at a _meeting_ of _butchers_ (See frame 307) waving their choppers at one another and  "cutting one another down" as only _butchers_ can.;1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 10-10-2007(289): A PETA activist _speaks_ at a _meeting_ of _butchers_ to **rebuke** them.;2) [[matt_jenkins](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matt_jenkins)] 16-3-2008(54): I imagine _Socrates_ gate-crashing a _meeting of butchers_ and REBUKING them: 'You've been killing things again, you have, haven't you?' while the embarrassed butchers blush and try to hide their knives behind their backs and stand in front of hanging sides of beef.
脊;spinal column;The **spinal column** has sprouted out of the _flesh_ of your back into an _umbrella_ that you always have with you, rain or shine. The pair of 2s on each side are the  "ribs" of the _umbrella_. Take care to keep your image of the key word distinct from that for spine (Frame 24).;1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 8-5-2007(71): "Look", says the teacher in biology class. 諧;orderliness;The harmoney of "a place for everything and everything in its place" is applied here to the **orderliness** of _all_ the _words_ one speaks.;1) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 11-1-2010(38): **harmonious** : If a choir is to be **harmonious** , _all_ the voices need to combine to hit the right notes, and say the right _words_.;2) [[perrin4869](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perrin4869)] 14-9-2010(14): Think of a chat in which _everyone_ is writing _words_ at once, of the lack of **orderliness** of such a chat.

拓;clear the land;Fingers . . . rocks.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 11-10-2005(210): A huge index _finger_ coming down from the sky is kicking boulders of _rock_ , **clear** ing the land. 捻;wrench;This kanji does not refer to the tool but to the act of twisting. 冥;Hades;The key word in this frame refers to the underworld, the world of the dead. By way of the classic Greek association, it is also used for the "dwarf planet" Pluto. Since no one knows precisely when this part of the cosmos was finished, we may imagine it as the _crowning_ deed of _day six_ of the creation.;1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 2-11-2007(68): The beast of **hades** one _day_ will wear a _crown_ , and the number of the beast is _666_.;2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 30-7-2009(45): In **Hades** you have to work _six days_ a week before _crowning_ it with something vaguely resembling a weekend. Oh wait, that's Japan.
濯;laundry;Water . . . feathers . . . turkey;1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 1-3-2008(245): At the **laundry** you stuff your large _futon_ (made from _turkey feathers_ ) in the machine, thereby causing it to break – as shown by the _water_ spurting out the side.;2) [[zazen666](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/zazen666)] 30-8-2007(130): When turkeys do the **laundry** , they put their feathers in water (they don't have clothes).
懲;penal;Indications . . . heart.;1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 1-5-2006(280): **Penal** servitude is served until indications show that one has had a change of heart (learned one's lesson). Easily confused with [punish](../v4/679.html) (#679 刑) and [penalty](../v4/833.html) (#833 罰). Concentrate on the reasons behind the **penal** system ("changing people's hearts" here), instead of the **penal** ty itself or the punishment (revenge) aspect. It may help to note that there's no sword, but a heart :-) (Note: 懲りる = learn from one's bad experiences).;2) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 1-5-2009(170): Judge: You will serve a **penal** sentence until _indications_ show you have a _heart_.

圭;squared jewel;Now I am going to do something unusual. The character in this frame is going to get one meaning and the primitive another, with no relation at all between the two. In time, I hope you will see how helpful this is. The kanji key word, **square jewel** , depicts a mammoth precious stone, several feet high, made by piling up large heaps of _soil_ on top of one another. Not something you would want to present your betrothed on your wedding day, but a good image for remembering this rare character, used chiefly in personal names nowadays.;1) [[Immacolata](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Immacolata)] 9-10-2005(166): Piling _SOIL_ upon _SOIL_ for aeons is how **SQUARE JEWEL** S are formed deep in the earth.;2) [[mdspencer](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mdspencer)] 14-4-2008(62): How would you stop someone stealing your biggest **square jewel**? Bury it deep in the _soil_ under _ground_. Then plant _ivy_ to mark the spot.
韓;Korea;As with _Italy_ (Frame 1245) and _Africa_ (Frame 1391), this character simply abbreviates the full name of _Korea_. Its elements: _mist_ . . . _locket_.;1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 21-9-2006(174): There's a young **Korea** n male actor, Yon-sama, famous amongst middle-aged Japanese women. Extremely famous. Read about his affect on Japan/ **Korean** relations on Everything2.com. In any case, women just flipped over this guy, traveled to **Korea** to see his home, started taking **Korea** n language classes, etc. So, imagine here the _misty_ eyes of the Japanese women as they clutch their _lockets_ with Yon-sama's picture inside watching his **Korea** n romantic mini series called "Winter Sonata".;2) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 27-9-2007(113): This character represents the flag of South **Korea** : a _locket_ (circular taegeuk) in the middle of the _mist_ (white background). <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_South_Korea>.
隻;vessels;The key word indicates the Japanese generic term for counting ships. Its elements: _turkey_ . . . _crotch_.;1) [[perfecturbo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perfecturbo)] 28-6-2006(308): On **Vessels** that travel long distances, sailors often get quite lonely. They keep TURKEYS on the **VESSELS** , but not for use as food. The lonely sailors take turns enjoying the turkey's CROTCH.;2) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 23-12-2007(129): Donald Duck is a _big bird_ that does _not wear pants_. It's good to use him as a mnemonic because he is a sailor, and this kanji is used to count **vessels**.
繕;darning;Thread . . . virtuous.;1) [[joesan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/joesan)] 8-11-2007(200): After a day being _virtuouos_ and keeping the city safe, _Spiderman_ 's outfit is in need of some repair. Luckily, as he can shoot out threads **darning** is very easy for him to do.;2) [[Rakushun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Rakushun)] 7-7-2007(60): **Darning** is too obscure a word for me, I prefer to just think of it as repair. And obviously, repairing someones broken cloth things is a virtuous thing to do, and you need thread to do it.
寡;widow;_House_ . . . _head_ . . . _dagger_. Immediately we get another instance of a very odd exception. Notice how the final stroke of the head is lengthened, giving the final two strokes a chance to stretch out and make room for the _dagger_ that fits in beneath.;1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 26-5-2007(295): The new **widow** sits in the _house_ , her _head_ in her lap (the extended stroke), her _dagger_ in her husband.;2) [[narafan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/narafan)] 28-7-2007(49): The _house_ 's _head_ , her husband, was murdered with a _dagger_. You can still see the drops of blood above the dagger. She is now a **widow**.
昆;descendants;By _comparing_ apes with anthropoids, we not only discover the latter have **descended** from those progenitors educated in the higher branches, but that the very idea of seeing everything **descended** from everything else, one way or another, means that there is  "nothing new UNDER the _sun_. ";1) [[samuize](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/samuize)] 21-2-2007(241): Grandparent spends all DAY COMPARING photos of their **DESCENDANTS**.;2) [[Francois](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Francois)] 10-3-2008(114): Japanese people have compared themselves as being **descendants** of the sun. (Amaterasu, the sun godesss). Sun, comparing = **descendants**.
庶;commoner;Caverns . . . oven fire.;1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 31-1-2010(209): **Commoner** s have to huddle in _caverns around a campfire_ , while higher class people get heating and central air conditioning in a hotel.;2) [[fagie37](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fagie37)] 28-5-2008(71): If you are so poor that you are a **commoner** , you will have to live twenty **commoner** s to a cavern, with only one fire for everyone to share.

It'ts **overflow** ing!;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 1-3-2007(112): The _overseer_ isn't doing his job and he lets the slaves **overflow** the sink!
腫;tumor;Flesh . . . heavy.;1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(74): A **tumor** is a useless _body part_ that is nothing but _heavy_.;2) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 19-1-2010(18): The world's _heaviest_ **tumor** ever removed from a human body was a 300-pound stomach **tumor** , removed in 1991 in Stanford Hospital. Now that's a _heavy body part_!
漆;lacquer;Water . . . tree . . . umbrella . . . grains of rice.;1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 28-8-2007(202): **LACQUER** is a type of WATERY type of liquid used to protect items made from TREES, sort of an UMBRELLA of protection. So protective, you can carry around RICE in the **LACQUER** ED, WOODEN product.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 25-12-2006(172): _Water_ is falling from a _tree_ onto the _umbrella_ underneath which is protecting the _rice_ underneath it. But it's completely dry since the umbrella is **lacquer** ed.
陛;highness;This key word indicates a title of address to royalty. Its elements: _pinnacle_ . . . _compare_ . . . _ground_.;1) [[Copycatken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Copycatken)] 6-9-2006(196): Your **highness** is the _pinnacle_ of finesse _compared_ to all of us commoners who are but like _dirt_ on the _ground_.;2) [[desmidus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/desmidus)] 30-3-2008(113): His **Highness** , the main man at the Pinnacle, often compares those who live outside the city's walls to dirt.
抄;extract;Fingers . . . a few.;1) [[Zarxrax](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zarxrax)] 25-4-2008(399): You can **extract** her juices by inserting a _few fingers_.;2) [[kyotokanji](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kyotokanji)] 9-5-2007(141): The mafia want to **extract** information from you. You don't say a word, so out comes the knife. They cut of your fingers until you only have a few left and then you speak.
燥;parch;**Parch** ment, made from animal skins, was the most common form of writing material used until the beginning of the nineteenth century. When paper took over, a method was devised to make artificial **parch** ment from _wood_ pulp. The _fire_ at the left and in the  "strong" position serves to remind us of the root word, " **parch** ," since nothing dries, puckers, wrinkles, and scorches quite like _fire_. And here is how we put it all together. Take a sheet of paper (a  " _wood-good_ ,"), wet it, and hold it over a _hearth_ in your mind's eye. Now watch as it **parches** the paper, leaving it with a strange and bumpy surface resembling **parch** ment.;1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 14-2-2008(273): Tip: _goods_ \+ _wood/tree_ : This combination of primitives appears four times in Heisig, so it's worthwhile giving it a name. I suggest " _furniture_ " (a common type of _wooden goods_ ). REF: _parch_ (FRAME 215) , [maneuver](../v4/671.html) (#671 操), [winding](../v4/1369.html) (#1369 繰), [seaweed](../v4/2035.html) (#2035 藻). Story: It's been so **parch** ed recently that your _furniture_ suddenly catches _fire_.;2) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 18-8-2007(76): The **parch** ment says you need _fire_ to make _good_ s from _tree_ s.
剤;dose;_Adjust_ . . . _saber_. Think of this as a **dose** of medicine.;1) [[Zareon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zareon)] 3-4-2007(193): When my medicine **dose** is way too large, I adjust it by cutting it into smaller pieces with my saber.;2) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 21-1-2008(119): We had to _adjust_ his **dose** slightly, after he went on a rampage with a _sabre_.
租;tariff;Wheat . . . shelf.;1) [[felicitygreen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/felicitygreen)] 27-4-2006(206): The EU and US impose such high **tariff** s on food imports that third world _wheat_ (the most basic of staples) never reaches first world supermarket _shelves_.;2) [[wrightak](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wrightak)] 6-8-2006(134): According to Henshall, this kanji originally represented the harvested rice (the wheat primitive) that farmers paid as a tithe. Its meaning today would seem to be very similar. Imagine the farmer putting aside some of his harvested _wheat_ on a _shelf_ in order to pay the **tariff** to his lord.
簿;register;Bamboo . . . water . . . acupuncturist.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 19-1-2006(213): Note : the keyword is not a verb, think of a record book. This _acupuncturist_ who uses _bamboo_ in place of flowers to dilute _water_ into his patients (see frame 227), managed somehow to appear on the **register** of acupuncturists. Chances are, he won't stay on the **register** for long. My image is close to that of gorgon's story.;2) [[gorgon](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gorgon)] 29-1-2006(106): This doctor dilutes (see 227) his patients with bamboo stalks rather than the flowers of a standard diluting acupuncturist hence he needs to be on the Bamboo Accumpunturist Diltuers (BAD) **register**. Pumping that much water into a body can be dangerous, see the huge bamboo stems with gallons of water sloshing in and out of the patient.

券;ticket;Quarter . . . dagger.;1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 28-7-2007(386): Entering the movie, the dude asks for your **ticket** , so he can tear it in half. He looks at you funny when you hand him a **ticket** already torn in half. He quietly tears the stub into _quarter_ s after you show him your _dagger_ with a smile.;2) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 7-5-2007(28): In Japan, the JR railway ju-hachi-kippu seasonal discount **ticket** can be cut into _quarters_ with a _dagger_ and shared with your friends. 繊;slender;Thread . . . Thanksgiving . . . row.;1) [[Zarxrax](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zarxrax)] 15-6-2008(221): _Spiderman_ has to stay **slender** , so during _thanksgiving_ , he keeps away from the long _row_ of food.;2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 30-12-2006(50): At the time of Thanksgiving, there's a row of all sorts of food on the table, which you mustn't eat if you want to stay as **slender** as a thread.
閲;review;_Gates_ . . . _devil_. Keep the connotation of this key word distinct from those of _inspection_ (Frame 1174), _revise_ (Frame 362), and _perusal_ (Frame 919).;1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 16-1-2008(261): A little _devil_ at the _gates of hell_ **review** s your record to see if you're evil enough to get in.;2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 22-5-2007(37): As I was **reviewing** for my exam at a quiet saloon, the _devil_ popped out of nowhere and offered to make sure I pass. But I told him no way, since that's cheating. Besides, I'm just **reviewing** things I already know. I won't fail. But he kept insisting, so I kicked him and sent him crashing through the entrance _gates_.
奨;exhort;_Leader_ . . . _St. Bernard dog_. Do not confuse with _urge_ (Frame 300).;1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 21-8-2007(213): It's easy to picture a LEADER that uses a BIG dog to **EXHORT** his people to do more.;2) [[cjon256](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cjon256)] 1-5-2009(96): Here we have a _St.Bernard_ **exhort** ing the vulture to become the _leader_ in the race against the turtle, but he can't because of the glue. see [leader](../v4/731.html) (#731 将).
粘;sticky;Rice . . . fortune-telling.;1) [[matticus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matticus)] 28-10-2006(355): This is another way of _fortune telling_ – throw **sticky** _rice_ against the wall, and look for the message in whatever sticks.;2) [[aniseed](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aniseed)] 22-8-2008(35): Despite Heisig's warnings against this form of thinking, this is one of those rare kanjis that makes a good pictogram. Think of **sticky** as in **sticky** mochi paste, which is traditionally made by dropping rice in a bucket and pounding it with a mallet. So, you have the rice on the left, and on the right you have the mallet poised over the bucket. Nuff said.
勃;uprising;If you think of the _ten_ as a little  "cross" sitting atop the root of a _house_ where we are used to seeing the  "chimney" ( _drop_ ), then you have the image of a _chapel_. (This combination will appear once more in this book: Frame 1465.) To complete the picture for **uprising** , add: _child_ . . . _muscles_.;1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 16-2-2007(54): An **erection** can shoot like a _needle_ from its _crown_ and has the _power_ to make a _child_.;2) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 20-1-2009(18): The **erection** is the crowned needle that's got the power to make children.
累;accumulate;_Rice field_ . . . _threads_. Make use of the position of the elements to distinguish this kanji from that of the previous frame.;1) [[Django](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Django)] 19-9-2007(160): (dingomick) _Venom_ is upset because Spidey is just that much brainier than he is! He chooses to **accumulate** as many _brains_ as he can, snatching them out of people's heads and storing them on top of his own, till there's just one massive _brain_ on top of his head!;2) [[Mighty_Matt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Mighty_Matt)] 22-2-2008(140): When you **accumulate** knowledge in your _brain_ , neural pathways are constructed. All those pathways end up like a huge ball of _thread_ tangled together. The more knowledge you **accumulate** the more _threads_ you throw into the mix!!
栽;plantation;On a fruit **plantation** it is the _trees_ that one is particularly grateful for at the time of _Thanksgiving_. Imagine yourself inviting a few representative _trees_ from the fields and orchards to join you around the table to give thanks.;1) [[PrettyKitty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PrettyKitty)] 11-9-2007(180): The **plantation** is where we get our Christmas trees. We pick them out at Thanksgiving to be sure we get a good one.;2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 16-4-2007(43): During _Thanksgiving_ , all the _trees_ on the **plantation** celebrate the harvest. It's a good time for them, too.
舷;gunwale;Boat . . . mysterious.;1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 29-6-2007(79): The **gunwale** is perhaps the most _mysterious_ part of a _boat_ for it is neither a **gun** nor a **whale**.;2) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 24-10-2007(17): **Gunwale** (rhymes with "tunnel") is the top edge of the side of a _boat_ , for example the widened lip on the sides of a canoe. The _mysterious_ origin of this part of a _boat_ comes from the strengthened sides of warships that used artillery (it means "gun ridge").
岬;headland;Like the _cape_ (Frame 164) and the _promontory_ (Frame 840), the **headland** refers to a jut of land. Its elements: _mountain_ . . . _roots_.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 10-3-2007(206): A **headland** is a _mountain_ that is firmly _rooted_ despite being surrounded on 3 sides by water. (Just like your head is a mountain surrounded by air on 3 sides, a **headland**!).;2) [[matt_jenkins](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/matt_jenkins)] 21-4-2008(125): **Headland** s are natural forts, in fact, once men build castles on them, they become _armoured mountains_. (Gibralter, for example, is basically an _armoured mountain_ ).
梗;spiny;This character refers originally to a deciduous, rough tree that grows on mountain plains. From this it gets the secondary sense of rugged or **spiny**. Its primitive elements: _tree_ . . . _grow late_.;1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 13-6-2007(64): I learned this one from the movie Evil Dead, but when it _grows late_ , _trees_ change shape and become **spiny** creatures! Lesson: don't go out at night.;2) [[Gwindarr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Gwindarr)] 13-6-2008(15): As it grows late, Lakitu retires for the evening, leaving the **spiny** s to fend for themselves against Mario. Picture them jumping out of trees instead of being hurled from Lakitu. Lakitu - is the guy who flys the cloud in the Mario games…
駐;parking;Team of horses . . . candlestick.;1) [[ithil](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ithil)] 5-4-2007(133): **Parking** in the dark may be difficult…specially if you're **parking** a _trojan horse_. To lend you a tiny bit of help, take this _candlestick_ with you, and at least you'll have some light.;2) [[sweetneet](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sweetneet)] 21-1-2007(63): In the olden days **parking** lots used to have reserved spaces for where the _lord_ (of the set of houses, shops, whatever) could park his _team of horses_. nowadays it's pretty much the same…reserved **parking** in front for the big bosses' cars….
貿;trade;_Receipt_ . . . _dagger_ . . . _shells_. Though the meanings are related, do not confuse with _make a deal_ (Frame 471) or _wholesale_ (Frame 1499).;1) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 3-5-2007(188): There's a buyback program where you can **trade** in your _dagger_ for _money_. 毀;break;Mortar . . . soil . . . missile.;1) [[Nukemarine](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Nukemarine)] 26-5-2008(79): Wow, that baker must really be mad! He's trying to **BREAK** his MORTAR by throwing it to the SOIL. Whoa! Now he's aiming a MISSILE at it!;2) [[aircawn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/aircawn)] 17-9-2007(40): To " **break** the _soil_ " is to make a symbolic gesture that indicates the beginning of construction. Like when a politician in a hardhat gets a shovel and lifts a piece of dirt. 窃;stealth;Hole . . . cut.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 8-5-2006(184): This more commonly means "steal", like how a thief _cuts_ a _hole_ to steal the jewels.;2) [[Howdoken](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Howdoken)] 14-4-2008(97): The word **STEALTH** makes me instantly think of Solid Snake, who CUTS a HOLE in a cardboard box so he can peer out of it.
賦;levy;A certain portion of _shells_ (money) is collected by the _warrior_ from the local villages as he passes through to defray the costs of keeping the land safe, and this is called a **levy**.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 7-8-2007(167): A _warrior_ stands guard at a bridge collecting _shells_ as a **levy** for any who want to pass.;2) [[lb4269](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lb4269)] 28-2-2006(69): "Drove my Chevy to the **levy** but the **levy** was dry. 債;bond;_Person_ . . . _blame_. The key word refers to financial **bonds**.;1) [[Wakela](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Wakela)] 16-5-2007(166): Mr. T's plot of world domination is foiled. 臼;mortar;The image here is of _back-to-back staples_. 穫;harvest;_Wheat_ . . . _flowers_ . . . _vessels_.
