喩;metaphor;People who try to sound literary often end up butchering the language. Here we see a _meeting_ of _butchers_ whose _mouths_ are producing the **metaphors**.;1) [[Themistoclaus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Themistoclaus)] 24-4-2011(51): **Metaphor** ically speaking, all the equipment in your _mouth_ is basically just a _meeting of butchers_ , designed to pulverize whatever meat you put in there.;2) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 16-7-2010(18): **Metaphor** : A good **metaphor** flows from the _mouth_ like the _meeting of flesh and saber_ , smoothly piercing the listener with its meaning. But a bad **metaphor** is like when you barely nick the _flesh_ and only spill _two drops_ of blood or when your _saber_ doesn't penetrate at all but rather bends into a くく shape when you whack the _flesh_. (Note: This story incorporates both the traditional form of the kanji ( [口＋兪](midori://search?text=口＋兪) ) and the simplified form ( [口＋俞](midori://search?text=口＋俞) )) .
肢;limb;Part of the body . . . branch.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 14-10-2005(237): The **limb** s that this kanji represents are _parts of the body_ that are connected to the trunk, like the main _branches_ to a tree (“arms and legs” is the second meaning of this kanji). In other words, **limb** s are " _flesh branches_ ".;2) [[ruisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruisu)] 4-11-2007(91): **Limb** s are _body parts_ that _branch_ off.
搾;squeeze;Fingers . . . hole . . . saw.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 8-4-2007(163): You have trouble squeezing your hand through the hole so you use a saw to enlarge it.;2) [[Spidercat](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Spidercat)] 27-3-2008(99): (Thanks DrJones) You **squeeze** the teats of the cow with your _fingers_ but it's your first try and you don't have any milk come through the _holes_ , so you take a _saw_ and cut the teats to make bigger _holes_. Poor cow, this story **squeeze** s my heart.
匿;hide;Box . . . young.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 8-3-2007(280): _Young_ kids likes to **hide** in _cardboard boxes_. (Primitive: _CARDBOARD BOX_ , especially kids playing with them.).;2) [[RoboTact](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/RoboTact)] 28-7-2007(61): Note that stroke order with _box_ primitive is as follows: first horizontal line, then enclosed element, and then a hook (it's incorrect in 4th edition).
肘;elbow;Instead of the familiar "grease" we usually associate with the **elbow** of someone hard at work, the kanji gives us a _part of the body_ that has been _glued to_ its task.;1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 10-6-2007(60): Sometimes I get carried away and do **elbow** curls until the point where my forearm snaps off! When that happens I simply pull out the _glue_ and re-attach the **elbow** to my _flesh_.;2) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 14-11-2008(22): Picture two Siamese twins glued together at the **elbow**.
軌;rut;Combine the primary and secondary meanings of this keyword to form your story. Begin with the _car_ whose tires get caught in a **rut** and spin without going anywhere. Then go onto the _baseball team_ who can't win a game because it has fallen into a **rut** of losing.;1) [[sethimayne](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sethimayne)] 25-10-2007(262): My _car_ got so stuck in a **rut** it required _nine_ people pushing to get it out again.;2) [[Verdana](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Verdana)] 24-2-2009(47): My _car_ got so stuck in a **rut** it required _a baseball team_ pushing to get it out again.
厘;rin;No doubt you will find it in your heart to forgive me for forcing yet another Japanese word on you in this frame. It is not the last time it will happen in this book, but I can assure you they are used only when absolutely necessary. One **_rin_** is equal to about 1/1000 of a yen - or rather was worth that much when it still made economic sense to mint them. While inflation took its toll on this kanji as a monetary unit, it survived with the not at all surprising sense of something  "very, very tiny." The kanji shows a _cliff_ with a _computer_ under it, apparently because it has been pushed over into the abyss by someone fed up with the thing. The total market value of one home _computer_ that has fallen over rock and bramble for several hundred feet: about one **_rin_**!;1) [[krungthep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/krungthep)] 26-3-2008(198): I threw my **Rin** dows _computer_ off a _cliff_ because it kept crashing. Now, after its last crash, it's worth less than a **rin**.;2) [[tomusan](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tomusan)] 16-2-2008(76): A _computer_ dropped off of a _cliff_ would be worth about 1 **RIN**.
膜;membrane;The _part of the body_ first affected by a stroll through a haunted _graveyard_ is the skin, which gets goose bumps. But we save the word  "skin" for another kanji, and use the odd word " **membrane** " here. Think of being so scared through and through that the goose flesh moves from the outside in, giving you goose **membranes**.;1) [[notgoing2argue](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/notgoing2argue)] 25-3-2007(287): In the _moon_ light of the _graveyard_ I hear a zombie say, **MMMMM..EMM…BRANE** sssss.;2) [[calittle](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/calittle)] 5-9-2007(96): The **membrane** s in your flesh rot when placed in the graveyard.
槽;vat;Tree . . . cadet.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 4-12-2005(146): Also as part of some army survival exercise, the _cadets_ (including _Bender_ see frame 1172) are sent into the _woods_ to build a **vat** (for collecting water for example).;2) [[jimsublimeman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jimsublimeman)] 27-11-2007(63): _Bender the Cadet_ (kudos to Fuaburisu) is found on an army training exercise, hiding behind a _tree_ , getting drunk on the famous scotch whiskey **Vat** 69.
褐;brown;The color of the serape or _cloak_ of our muchacho on _siesta_ is a dull **brown** , the color this kanji indicates.;1) [[rhclaghorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rhclaghorn)] 26-12-2007(110): Why is my package late? Imagine a UPS driver dressed in **BROWN** _garments_ taking a _siesta_. What can **BROWN** do for you?;2) [[Francois](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Francois)] 8-4-2008(88): Mexicans use a _cloak_ (pancho) for their _siestas_. Their color is usually **brown**.
祥;auspicious;Altar . . . sheep.;1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 13-9-2006(189): Bringing a _sheep_ to sacrifice on the _altar_ was a sign of an **auspicious** life. The poor could only afford a pigeon, the more **auspicious** an expensive _sheep_ for an offering.;2) [[ziggr](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ziggr)] 24-5-2007(73): On this **ewe-spicious** occasion, you sacrifice a _sheep_ at the _altar_. —— Sorry, but I really need more than generic altar sacrifices to connect keywords to stories. Sometimes an egregious pun is the only way.
腎;kidney;Slave . . . crotch . . . flesh.;1) [[n1williams](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/n1williams)] 9-12-2009(47): If you have a weak **KIDNEY** , you'll become a SLAVE to your CROTCH's need to pee. Oh well, it's just a weakness of the FLESH.;2) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 16-11-2008(36): When the _sex slave_ misbehaves, threaten to sell his _body parts_ starting with his **kidney**.
缶;tin can;Though the meaning has no reference to animals, the parts do: _horse_ with a _mountain_ underneath.;1) [[Piitaa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Piitaa)] 13-7-2006(245): Horses kept in the mountains have a unique savory taste. At least so the text on this **tin can** would have us believe, which contains 100% authentic mountain horse.;2) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 8-10-2007(62): The starving _horse_ , stranded on the _mountain_ , is forced to eat a tasty **tin can**.
淑;graceful;Water . . . uncle.;1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 5-10-2006(216): _Uncle_ (the one who is lonely and coaches kids in his spare time) is actually a **graceful** guy once he hits the _water_ , as he used to be part of the swimming team in his youth.;2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 28-6-2008(96): Four straight kanji here with 叔 in it, so let's make one story: Your UNCLE was full of [loneliness](../v4/720.html) (#720 寂) ( 寂 ), and he lived by himself. He was naturally [graceful](../v4/721.html) (#721 淑) ( 淑 ) in the water, and you knew he was once on the Olympic synchronized swimming team. You knew that there was something different about him, but you joined his youth team and he _watched_ over you carefully as [coach](../v4/719.html) (#719 督) ( 督 ). It was uncomfortable, though, how your [uncle](../v4/718.html) (#718 叔) often touched you just _a little above_ the _crotch_ ( 叔 ) when coaching…
販;marketing;Shells/money . . . anti-.;1) [[genbaku](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/genbaku)] 9-1-2008(272): The goal of **marketing** is to get people who are naturally anti-buying to spend their shells (money).;2) [[sutebun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sutebun)] 18-10-2007(54): 『MARKETING: MONEY, ANTI』 The wide presence of **MARKETING** in our society has led people to become ANTI-MONEY.
勲;meritorious deed;_Move_ . . . _oven fire_. So as not to confuse this kanji with the general character for _merit_ (Frame 1369), you may associate the key word with military decorations and medals of distinction, both of which it is used for.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 14-4-2007(188): A **meritorious deed**? Like moving a damsel in distress out of a fire, maybe.;2) [[lunairejam](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/lunairejam)] 9-10-2007(66): Prometheus did a meritous deed for humanity by MOVING FIRE from the gods to us humans.
堆;piled high;Soil . . . turkey.;1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 15-6-2007(71): After our pre-Thanksgiving massacre, we **piled high** all the _turkey_ corpses atop the _soil_ of the farmyard.;2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 30-6-2008(36): During the _Turkey_ Holocaust (this is what the animal kingdom calls Thanksgiving - they have really short memories and thus don't recall that it actually happens every single year), _turkeys_ are killed en masse, and their bodies are **piled high**. To keep them from tumbling down, a pile of _dirt_ is **piled high** right next to them to keep them standing upright so that they will be fresh when it is time to eat them.
睦;intimate;Eye . . . rice seedlings . . . ground.;1) [[Shizuru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shizuru)] 29-8-2007(146): I keep an **intimate** relationship with my rice seedlings – I never take my eye from the soil.;2) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 11-4-2006(121): [land](../v4/1513.html) (#1513 陸) Some of them begin to see _eye_ to eye about the possibility of reaching the promised land. A group of awakened _rice- seedlings stuck in the ground_ becomes **intimate** and starts to form a plan.
抹;rub;Fingers . . . extremity.;1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 29-6-2008(344): I like to **RUB** my FINGERS over my EXTREMITIES ….like my extremity-ly long, umm, hair…. This has been edited in response to being reported …you can change "hair" to whatever extremity-ly long body part you like.;2) [[forestsprite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/forestsprite)] 30-9-2007(114): When you're cold, your **RUB** your FINGERS over your EXTREMITIES vigorously to warm up a bit. I'd still rather go in for a warm fire and some hot cocoa, though.
枠;frame;You might think of the **frame** this character refers to as the sort of **frame** we have created by drawing a dark line around this kanji and its explanation. Then think of that line as made of very thin _wood_ , and finally note how each time the line bends it forms a 90° angle, thus giving us the _nine_ and the _ten_.;1) [[alkulp](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/alkulp)] 22-10-2007(176): **wood** at **90 (9 * 10)** degrees.;2) [[javiergakusei](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/javiergakusei)] 24-10-2007(93): Nine out of ten picture **frame** s are made out of wood. The rest are made of metal or plastic.
舗;shop;_Cottage_ . . . _dog tag_. The key word refers to the noun, not the verb.;1) [[AryllWind](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/AryllWind)] 30-3-2008(128): A **shop** in an impoverished country is just a cottage with a dog tag identifying it.;2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 1-1-2007(97): Normal cottages ( 舎 actually means a building) don't have tags advertising their names, but **shop** s do.
剰;surplus;Ride . . . saber.;1) [[mcfate](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcfate)] 17-5-2008(118): If you go for a _ride_ and find a _saber_ beside you, perhaps you got into an Army **surplus** jeep.;2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 7-7-2007(88): Recall the wheat sabers we made a [profit](../v4/906.html) (#906 利) off. We made too many and now there's **surplus** , for sale on this hay _ride_.
沫;splash;The **splash** this kanji refers to is the dash of _water_ against the rocks, with all the foam and spray that this creates. If you think of a **splash** in this sense as a wave that has run its full course and reached its _extremity_ , namely the seashore, and if you think of it pictorially in your mind's eye, this somewhat rare (but oh so-easy-to-learn) kanji is yours for good.;1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 5-10-2007(153): The _extremity_ of a wave of _water_ is the **splash**.;2) [[gametip](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gametip)] 21-7-2008(78): A **splash** is WATER that has reached its EXTREMITY.
詐;lie;The **lie** in this character refers to falsehoods and fibs. Its elements: _words_ . . . _saw_.;1) [[wrightak](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wrightak)] 6-6-2006(518): Pinnochio gets frustrated that every time he utters a _word_ of a **lie** , his nose grows and he has to get the _saw_ out again.;2) [[jameserb](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/jameserb)] 23-4-2008(44): Her **lie** s are words that cut not like a knife, no not cleanly, but savagely like a saw.
幌;canopy;A large _towel_ stretched overhead with only a few of the _sun's rays_ breaking through represents a **canopy** over one's bed.;1) [[wasurenaide](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wasurenaide)] 19-12-2008(269): A **canopy** is a _towel_ to block the _suns_ _ray_ s.;2) [[shadolite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/shadolite)] 18-3-2008(62): From the _Hitch-Hiker's Guide to the Universe_ : A towel is useful, among other things, as a **canopy** to keep out the sun's rays from your face while napping.
汐;eventide;In the next lesson we will meet the character for morning- _tide_ and the element for _drops of water_. Meantime we have a perfect blend of picture and idea in this kanji to play on the English word for nightfall, **eventide** : _drops of water_ inching their way up the shore in the _evening_.;1) [[mcdreamer374](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mcdreamer374)] 1-4-2007(163): **Eventide** is just another word for evening, and it has the word tide in it which we associate with water.;2) [[stereovibe](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stereovibe)] 13-2-2008(72): _Drops_ of water shower the beach as the _evening_ tide approaches: **eventide**.
薦;recommend;_Flowers_ . . . _deer_ . . . _one_ . . . _tail feathers_. Note the doubling up in these last two elements as in frame 2091.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 3-11-2006(150): Picture an ad in which Uncle Jimbo (of "South Park" fame) **recommend** s the latest craze in deer hunting : a high tech _slingshot_! The ad begins with Bambi prancing around, smelling the _flowers_. Then, all of a sudden, Bambi is brutally murdered with the _slingshot_ , put on the _cooking fire_ , and the camera pans to Uncle Jimbo happily munching on crispy cooked Bambi! Note: the _slingshot_ is strokes 11-12.;2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 7-1-2007(142): It is **recommend** ed that deers stick to eating flowers. If they try to eat birds, they may end up choking on them, like this one here. Note that the head ( 白 ) is gone and the visible part of the body which is normally written with a stroke of the head must by necessity be drawn with a stroke of the tail.
閥;clique;Gates . . . fell.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 21-4-2007(154): You set a guard at the gate to fell intruders not of your **clique**.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 9-9-2007(62): The _felled_ souls of the world, cut down like trees, pass through the _gates of hell_ and join the **clique**.
允;license;Elbow . . . human legs.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 21-10-2005(237): In some Asian kung-fu version of James Bond, the main protagonist has a “License To Kill” with his deadly _elbows_ and _human legs_. His suit is always stained of red blood at the _elbows_ and _lower legs_ (this to help create an image that distinguish the two elements).;2) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 12-9-2008(82): A midget driver trying to pass the road test to get their driver's **license**. Their _elbows_ are too short to turn the wheel and their _legs_ are too short to reach the gas and breaks.
培;cultivate;The barrel hoops used by many Japanese farmers to stretch clear plastic over row of vegetables in a garden patch in the hopes of **cultivating** bigger and bigger vegetables is a way of _muzzling_ the _soil_.;1) [[uberclimber](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/uberclimber)] 15-10-2010(186): To **cultivate** the _land_ is to tame it, control it. In short, you _muzzle_ it's unruly, chaotic nature. 培う つちかう to **cultivate** , to foster, 栽培 (さいばい) : cultivation.;2) [[PepeSeco](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PepeSeco)] 13-3-2008(137): The illegal immigrants **cultivate** the _land_ but are socially and politically _muzzled_ (wear muzzles while they work too).
憩;recess;_Tongue_ . . . _nose_ . . . _heart_. The sense of _breath_ from the last frame should not be used, it could lead you to put only the _nose_ over the _heart_ and leave the _tongue_ off to one side.;1) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 1-3-2007(274): **Recess** to me is a school break. At **recess** some kiddies are comparing their latest body piercings. _Tongues_ and _noses_ are nothing special. The new cool is to have your _heart_ done!;2) [[strugglebunny](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/strugglebunny)] 17-11-2008(104): At **recess** , little boys stick their _tongues_ out and pick their _noses_ while little girls draw _hearts_ on the ground with chalk. It's winter now, so any _tongues_ –left– out for too long will freeze.
亥;sign of the hog;This kanji is the 12th sign of the Chinese zodiac: the **sign of the hog**. It is best learned by thinking of an acorn-eating **hog** in connection with the primitive meaning given below.;1) [[Floatingweed5](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Floatingweed5)] 20-11-2007(193): A greedy hog in a top hat who has eaten all of the acorns. He even elbows people out of the way to get them.;2) [[tryllid](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tryllid)] 8-10-2008(39): Top Hat + Elbow + Person: The **sign of the hog** was a very recognizable tattoo - a hog with a big grin in a _top hat_ , sticking his _elbow_ into the _person_ next to him.
荻;reed;You've no doubt seen cattails, those swamp **reeds** with a furry _flower_ to them like the tail of a cat. This might just turn out to be a good way to get rid of a troublesome _pack of wild dogs_ : lure them into a swamp of these **reeds** with the cattail _flowers_ and then set _fire_ to the swamp. Take care to focus on the _flower_ rather than the  "cattail" to avoid confusion with frame 259 below.;1) [[sannomiya](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sannomiya)] 22-2-2007(218): **REED** S are the only FLOWERS that WILD DOGS like to FIRE up and smoke while they are playing poker.;2) [[sindhikara](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sindhikara)] 30-6-2008(137): A **reed** is a flower that looks like a hot dog.
逝;departed;The connotation is of a "dearly **departed** " who has passed away. The elements: _fold_ . . . _road_.;1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 11-4-2007(383): One of the dearest of Japan's dearly **departed** is Sasaki Sadako, who developed Leukemia after the bombing of Hiroshima, and became famous for _folding_ more than a thousand paper cranes, never giving up hope. To this day, people in Hiroshima still _fold_ origami cranes in her memory. For this character, let us imagine a parade in her honor, the entire _road_ lined with _folded_ cranes.;2) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 20-1-2008(46): The BIG ONE hits Tokyo. You see a news report of the recently **departed** victims who died when the _roads_ _folded_ (from the earthquake).
串;shish kebab;This pictograph of two pieces of meat on a skewer, a **shish kebab** , will help us in the next frame.;1) [[Texie](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Texie)] 30-7-2008(119): This is a pictograph if ever I saw one. Two chunks of meat on a skewer.;2) [[poopdeedoo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/poopdeedoo)] 20-3-2008(101): Naka naka , "who's there?" **shish kebab** …. "shish kebab who?".
勾;hooked;_Bound up_ . . . _elbow_. Think of this key word in the sense of something that has been nabbed or cought.;1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 14-2-2007(60): Your _elbow_ is _bound up_ so that your biceps will stay **flexed**.;2) [[FoxintheStars](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FoxintheStars)] 18-1-2011(18): In RTK1 Supplement as "hooked." A friend **hooked** someone literally, by _binding them up_ with their **hooked** _elbow_.
蚕;silkworm;_Heavens_ . . . _insect_. Be sure to do something about the position of the two elements.;1) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 31-8-2007(211): There are no _insects_ in _heaven_ \- well, that is, except for **silkworm** s. What, do you expect Jesus to import his fancy robes from China?;2) [[kokeshidoll17](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/kokeshidoll17)] 16-9-2008(164): In China it was believed that the **silkworm** s were _insects_ sent from _heaven_ because of the beautiful material they produced.
墳;tomb;_Soil_ . . . _haystack_ . . . _clams_. In order not to confuse this kanji with that for a _grave_ (Frame 246), something like the image of an Egyptian **tomb** should be adopted, with all its special connotations.;1) [[stefanot](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/stefanot)] 10-2-2007(201): After the eruption all is a **tomb**. The soil has covered the remains of the farmers gathering _haystacks_ and of the fisherman collecting _shells_.;2) [[Soseki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Soseki)] 21-4-2008(97): Using _soil_ and _hay_ to make bricks, the Egyptians built the pyramids to **entomb** the Pharaohs along with all of their _money_.
菌;germ;Flowers . . . pent in . . . wheat.;1) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 22-12-2009(189): Can also mean bacteria…..imagine the _wheat pent in your fridge_ growing to the point where they resemble _flowers_ …….I actually had something similar happen to onions…they grew footlong legs after about 2 or 3 years……OR just think of that Cowboy Bebop episode with the lobster in the fridge… :-).;2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 18-4-2007(91): Actually it means **germ** s as in microorganisms. So for example, you have to keep wheat enclosed so it isn't exposed to other plants. That way it can't catch any **germ** s (like fungi) from them.
鋼;steel;Metal . . . Mount.;1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 20-7-2007(117): _Mount_ Fuji is completely made up of a _metal_ known as **steel**.;2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 5-1-2007(46): Sturdy metal is obviously **steel** (see previous frame).
挫;sprain;Fingers . . . assembly line . . . soil.;1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 9-2-2007(58): I **sprained** my _fingers_ when I _sat in meditation_ (by sitting in a strange position).;2) [[algarich](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/algarich)] 10-12-2010(23): (Using the primitives in the RTK1 addendum) The workers at the _assembly line_ in the coal cave ([squat/sit](http://kanji.koohii.com/study/kanji/1024) (#1024 座)) frequently claim to " **sprain** " their _fingers_ because working within all the _dirt_ around them is hard and they'd much rather stay at home.
鋳;casting;_Metal_ . . . _longevity_. As you probably guessed from the elements, the key word refers to the **casting** of metals.;1) [[scout](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/scout)] 9-2-2008(160): They made a _metal_ **casting** of the Chinese man who _glued_ _shrubs_ to himself to increase his _longevity_. It's now sold around the world as it's thought that having one will increase your own _longevity._.;2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 6-2-2007(86): You make a **casting** of your baby's shoes in _gold_ to ensure the _longevity_ of the experience.
覇;hegemony;Old West . . . leather . . . moon.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 14-3-2007(253): In the _Old West_ , cowboys had **hegemony** OVER the Indians despite their _leather_ craft and ability to navigate by the _moon_.;2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 2-1-2007(51): In the old west, animal skins were made into leather and their flesh was eaten, thus using the whole animal, which viewed from the animal side could be taken as humans asserting complete **hegemony** over them. All your base are belong to us.
滋;nourishing;_Water_ . . . double- _mysterious_. Note the doubling up of the element for _top hat_ in the primitive for _mysterious_ and assign it a special image, as it will come up in the next two frames.;1) [[greenapple](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/greenapple)] 27-8-2006(198): Water is doubly mysterious. It's in all our nourishment…and yet, it's really not **nourishing** at all.;2) [[Okonomiyaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Okonomiyaki)] 24-5-2008(113): Going off the idea of the right side meaning rapid growth/increase of small objects, I've decided to make the right side be _Gremlins_ , those little _mysterious_ creatures that _double_ rapidly. _Gremlins_ find _water_ a little too **nourishing** , as it makes them instantly multiply.
賓;V.I.P.;The **V.I.P.** indicated here is an important guest making a visit. The elements are: _house_ . . . _ceiling_ . . . _few_ . . . _shells_.;1) [[nolusu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nolusu)] 19-7-2007(385): This _house_ is reserved to **V.I.P.** only. If you are not _one of the few_ with enough _money_ to call you that way, keep out!;2) [[bendyarm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bendyarm)] 4-10-2007(51): The **V.I.P.** visits your _house_ , but your _ceiling_ is too low for his inflated head, which he bumps and hurts. You have to give him your _few_ _shells_ as compensation.
凸;convex;Maybe this helps you see how the Japanese have no trouble keeping **convex** distinct from _concave_. Note the odd feeling of the third stroke. If it doesn't feel all that strange now, by the time you are done with this book, it will. There are very few times you will have to write it.;1) [[rakutenka](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rakutenka)] 30-6-2007(108): When I get _vex_ ed, I give people the middle finger.;2) [[xiteru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/xiteru)] 9-10-2007(63): **Convex** has a **convex** shape.
茨;briar;Earlier we made mention of the story of **Briar** Rose (or  "Sleeping Beauty," as we called her in frame 165) and drew attention to the **briar** hedge that grew up all about her castle. But in the _second_ part of the story, these **briars** blossomed into _flowers_. Hence her name, **Briar** Rose. Be careful not to confuse this character with that for _thorn_ (Frame 446).;1) [[ihatobu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ihatobu)] 15-8-2007(225): To prevent animals from eating the beautiful flowers in your garden, the best thing to do is to plant **briar** bushes immediately _next_ to them.;2) [[bendyarm](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/bendyarm)] 26-9-2007(69): The **briar** patch may look unremarkable now before it blooms, but there will be _flowers_ _next_ , and it will be beautiful.
亘;span;"Sunrise, sunset, sunrise, sunset..." goes the song of the Fiddler on the Roof. You can almost see the journey of the sun as it moves from one horizon (the _floor_ ) to its noonday heights in the sky overhead ( _ceiling_ ) and then disappears over the other horizon - day after day, marking the **span** of our lives.;1) [[Christine_Tham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Christine_Tham)] 21-7-2007(227): The sun **span** s from horizon to horizon in a day.;2) [[nihonnicko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nihonnicko)] 1-5-2008(45): The **span** of the day is the time between the sun goes up and comes down.
苑;garden;Flowers . . . mailbox.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 28-2-2007(214): Japanese " **gardens** " aren't anything more than a pot of _flowers_ on top of the _mailbox_.;2) [[desmidus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/desmidus)] 8-6-2008(90): My mailbox is actually right in the middle of my **garden** , which kind of sucks since the mailman has to trample all my flowers to get to it.
唆;tempt;Mouth . . . license . . . walking legs.;1) [[LordGolem](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/LordGolem)] 17-7-2007(232): I named the right part _legal prostitute_ has it represents a walker [ _walking legs_ ] with the _license_. It's easy to imagine a _legal prostitute_ **tempt** ing a man with her _mouth_.;2) [[synewave](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/synewave)] 20-2-2007(154): Prostitutes in Amsterdam have a _license_ to show off their _walking legs_ and **tempt** customers with their _mouths_.
阻;thwart;Pinnacle . . . shelf.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 25-12-2007(201): In a last ditch effort to **thwart** the invaders of _The Pinnacle_ , they push glass _shelves_ over the edge onto their heads below.;2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 30-12-2006(69): The shortness of the Japanese **thwart** s their attempts to reach the topmost (pinnacle) shelf without grabbing a chair.
殉;martyrdom;Bones . . . decameron.;1) [[Johnnyltn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Johnnyltn)] 14-8-2006(224): Think of the early Christian martyrs who suffered **martyrdom** because of their faith. See them held in cells for 10 days (a decameron) before being fed to the lions. They appear before the chanting Roman crowds as _bones_ to be devoured. Think of what was leftover after the lions finished them off….nothing, not even a pile of _bones_ to bury.;2) [[ruisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruisu)] 14-11-2007(86): The _boney_ man martyred himself during his 10 day hunger-strike.
桁;girder;Tree . . . going.;1) [[timcampbell](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/timcampbell)] 29-12-2008(62): When the _wooden_ **girders** start to snap, the workmen shout "Run! Let's _go!_ ".;2) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 12-3-2007(16): **Girder** s are support beams that are nowadays mostly made out of steel. But in the ancient houses that are placed at the _boulevard_ the **girder** s will be made out of _wood_.
菱;diamond;Named after a **diamond** -shaped flower (the water caltrop), this key word refers to things shaped like a **diamond**. Its elements: _flower_ . . . _rice seedlings_ . . . _walking legs_.;1) [[fiminor](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fiminor)] 20-6-2006(145): [land](../v4/1513.html) (#1513 陸) Deciding to use the **diamond** -shaped water caltrop _flower_ as cover/protection, the _rice-seedlings_ with their _walking legs_ (now free from soil), can start their journey.;2) [[Zarxrax](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zarxrax)] 6-6-2008(141): Some girls want **diamond** s, but others will be satisfied with just _flowers_. However if you think you can win her over with _rice seedlings_ , expect her to get up on her _walking legs_ and walk on out!
憬;hanker;State of mind . . . scenery.;1) [[FooSoft](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FooSoft)] 1-1-2010(38): I'm in a _state of mind_ where I **desire** to see the _sun_ over the _capital_ for some nice _scenery_ for a change (no more rain!).;2) [[perrin4869](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perrin4869)] 16-9-2010(16): Think of a commercial designed at making you **hanker** for the product they're advertising. See how they cleverly use that _scenery_ to put you in the _state of mind_ they desire.
訟;sue;Words . . . public.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 28-2-2006(357): Take care what _words_ you say in _public_ lest you be **sue** d.;2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 4-9-2007(29): [+radical_tyro] _Socrates_ was giving a speech in public. Things were going rather well, until his robe opened a bit and people saw his, well, not-public area. He was promptly **sue** d for public indecency. Certain things shouldn't be made public in public, you know?
搬;conveyor;Fingers . . . carrier.;1) [[laxxy](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/laxxy)] 16-10-2006(175): When workers neglect workplace safety, their fingers get cut off and carried away by the **conveyor** belt, which looks like a 'finger carrier' in that case.;2) [[Ikeda_kat2007](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ikeda_kat2007)] 23-3-2008(73): During WWII, morse code was the primary means of communication from sea. The morse code specialist was the **conveyor** of messages to and from the crew of the carrier, using his fingers to tap out the secret messages. (This works especially well for 搬送周波数 carrier frequency and 搬送波 carrier wave, being the radio waves/frequencies used in morse code).
嗣;heir;Mouth . . . scrapbook . . . director.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 13-3-2007(158): The _director_ 's _mouth_ dropped open as he flipped through the _scrapbook_ of properties he was about to become **heir** to.;2) [[rtkrtk](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rtkrtk)] 27-2-2008(78): Careful with [inherit](../v4/1370.html) (#1370 継). The egoistic _director_ leaves instructions about what shall be handed down to his **heir** upon the director's death. First, the director's _mouth_ should be surgically removed and preserved, to be handed down to his **heir**. Second, a scrapbook of the director's proudest scenes should also be handed down. The _mouth_ reminds the **heir** that the _director_ must be a loudmouth, the _scrapbook_ reminds the **heir** of how to be a good director.
旺;effulgent;The radiant, **effulgent** splendor of he _sun_ makes it _king_ of all the planets and other stars. Just to be sure you don't take this too abstractly, picture the _sun_ seated on a throne, flourishing its _scepter_ this way and that.;1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 7-6-2007(60): The _Sun King_ (Louis XIV) was known for his **effulgent** reign.;2) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 2-8-2008(19): [+katsuo] This is the _Sun King_. Sayeth Wikipedia: "The _Sun King_ (in French le Roi Soleil) because of the idea that, just as the planets revolve around the _Sun_ , so too should France and the court revolve around [the _king_ ] ("<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_XIV_of_France>). And just like the _sun_ , he was quite **effulgent** and actually emitted _sun_ light.
妊;pregnancy;A _woman_ who is in her **pregnancy** is a bit like a _porter_ , bearing her new companion wherever she goes.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 1-12-2006(170): A pregnant woman is a porter of her child.;2) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 22-6-2008(79): A _woman_ becomes **pregnant** when _a drop of gentleman_ gets inside her.
詔;imperial edict;The **imperial edict** , spoken with the force of unquestionable law, is made up of _words_ intended to _seduce_ the masses - be it through fear or respect - to follow obediently.;1) [[fuaburisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/fuaburisu)] 9-2-2006(207): The mnemonic "words to seduce the masses" was just too vague and I kept forgetting it. So now instead I picture a seductive female reading aloud the **imperial edict** to the masses, thus "seducing" the masses.;2) [[anthropic](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/anthropic)] 12-8-2008(56): The emperor did not need an **imperial edict** , his _words_ were more than enough to _seduce_ Anakin to the dark side.
衷;inmost;Between the _top hat_ and the _scarf_ you will see the character for _in_ which is truncated at the bottom so as not to interfere with the _scarf_. You can think of this character forming as a pair with that of the former frame: there the _in_ (the _walking stick_ in the _mouth_ ) was set on its side, here it is set upright.;1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 17-7-2007(267): The guy from [pathetic](../v4/401.html) (#401 哀) shared his **inmost** feelings with a girl and she rammed a _walking stick_ down his throat. It ruptured his **inmost** organs.;2) [[Zactacular](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Zactacular)] 4-10-2007(59): Besides making money from acting like a dog (see decline), the _pathetic_ man has risked his **inmost** internal organs by becoming a _cane_ swallower!
弔;condolences;_A bow_ . . . wrapped around a _walking stick_.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 19-9-2006(255): Perhaps a pictograph of a soldier's weapons–his sword and bow-placed ceremonially over his body before burial, while people offer their **condolences**.;2) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 24-6-2007(80): Send your **condolences** to the old geezer whom you shot the _walking stick_ into with your _bow_. (see [pull](../v4/1232.html) (#1232 引)).
娠;with child;_Woman_ . . . _sign of the dragon_. The key word is a synonym for _pregnant_ , whose character we met earlier (Frame 546). Although the two kanji are often used together, they should be kept distinct.;1) [[adrianbarritt](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/adrianbarritt)] 5-9-2007(254): Any _woman_ spending a night with the virile _Bruce Lee_ is bound to end up **with child**.;2) [[romanrozhok](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/romanrozhok)] 28-3-2008(54): BRUCE LEE'S WOMAN was **WITH CHILD** and it really upset her stomach because little Brandon Lee was kicking ass from the inside.
斤;ax;This character represents a picture of an **ax** , the two vertical lines being the handle and the horizontal strokes of the blade. Note the writing order carefully.;1) [[radical_tyro](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/radical_tyro)] 4-7-2007(178): Errata: stroke order in 4th edition is wrong. Top stroke is first.;2) [[Shibo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shibo)] 16-5-2008(104): The **axe** -wielding maniac _nails_ a poor victim, right under a _cliff_. Blood everywhere! (thanks scottamus!).
酢;vinegar;Whiskey bottle . . . saw.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 18-4-2007(284): Drinking alcohol that's turned to **vinegar** feels like a saw going down your throat.;2) [[szreter](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/szreter)] 24-6-2008(85): I spent ages _saw_ ing that _whiskey bottle_ open, but when I got in, it had all turned to **vinegar**!
旭;rising sun;This character is a sort of nickname for the Japanese flag with its well-known emblem of the **rising sun**. If you can picture two seams running down that great red _sun_ , and then imagine it sitting on a _baseball_ bat for a flagpole, you have a slightly irreverent - but not altogether inaccurate - picture of how the sport has caught on in the Land of the **Rising Sun**.;1) [[Ameyama](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ameyama)] 11-11-2007(249): 9am carries with it the **rising sun**.;2) [[sutebun](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sutebun)] 2-7-2007(137): _Nine planets_ revolve around our **rising sun**.
墾;groundbreaking;The **groundbreaking** referred to here is not for the erection of new buildings but for the opening of farmlands. The elements: _skunk_ . . . _silver_ . . . _soil_.;1) [[CharleyGarrett](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CharleyGarrett)] 25-5-2007(178): It was the **groundbreaking** of the new farm, but there was an uninvited guest to the ceremony. It was a famous _skunk_ , the one with the familiar _silver_ stripe. The feet of the crowd rushing from the ceremony site churned up the _soil_ very nicely. The ceremony was ruined but the **groundbreaking** was a great success.;2) [[inuki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/inuki)] 2-1-2007(39): I got sprayed by a skunk, so no one is helping me with the **groundbreaking** of my farm. On a positive note, I found silver laying all over the soil. Mine all mine!
綻;come apart at the seams;Thread . . . determine.;1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 21-5-2008(86): Even though his costume is **coming apart at the seams** as he chases the bad guys, _Spiderman_ is still _determined_ to catch them.;2) [[hissatsu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hissatsu)] 16-11-2010(17): _Spiderman_ is so _determined_ to catch criminals that he doesn't notice his costume is **coming apart at the seams**. The Daily Bugle will love this! "Spider-pervert terrorizes city!".
舶;liner;The type of _boat_ connoted by this key word is a large oceangoing **liner**. The important thing here is to work with the elements _boat_ and _dove_ to make an image distinct from that of the former frame. Don't count on size alone to distinguish the _boat_ from the **liner**.;1) [[Transtic](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Transtic)] 28-4-2008(170): The most famous **LINER** is the Titanic, which struck an iceberg and sunk. Just imagine that huge **LINER** strucking an even huger mass of **white** ice.;2) [[Matthew](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Matthew)] 1-7-2006(92): A **liner** is to _boat_ as an [emperor](../v4/261.html) (#261 皇) is to a [king](../v4/255.html) (#255 王), or a [chief](../v4/967.html) (#967 伯) is to a [person](../v4/951.html) (#951 人): in each case we need only add _white_ to the latter in order to get the former.
帥;commander;Maestro . . . towel.;1) [[happychair](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/happychair)] 6-3-2006(244): The **COMMANDER** is a military MAESTRO who never throws in the TOWEL.;2) [[tomtosh](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/tomtosh)] 16-1-2008(43): I like to recall **commander** in conjuntion with _expert._ Both are _maestros_ with _towels_ – however, there is no upper limit (no _ceiling_ ) to what a **commander** can achieve in comparison to a mere expert.
渚;strand;The **strand** referred to here is the stretch of land along a beach or shoreline. Its elements are: _water_ . . . _puppet_.;1) [[Talka](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Talka)] 9-9-2007(161): I was **strand** ed on a desert island surrounded by water for hundreds of miles on end. I wasn't upset though - I had my love doll! What a great **strand** of sand to be **strand** ed on - just me and my love doll!;2) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 10-5-2007(76): A lovely romantic walk on the **strand** , splashing in the _water_ with my _love doll_.
脹;dilate;Flesh . . . long.;1) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 14-8-2007(246): Taking Viagra let's your blood vessels **dilate** …resulting in a _body part_ getting _long_.;2) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 22-10-2007(70): Staying out in the dark moonlit sky for a long time, your pupils **dilate**.
尿;urine;Flag . . . water.;1) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 5-1-2008(237): Animals use their **urine** to mark their territory. So for them, their body _water_ works as a _flag_ denoting their "country" ( _why bother? we all know which story you are going to pick_ ).;2) [[chamcham](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/chamcham)] 15-9-2006(128): Someone is pissing on the American flag, but since the **urine** is clear it looks like water.
賄;bribe;To the left we have the primitive for a _shellfish_ , and to the right the kanji we just learned for _possess_. Keep the connotation of the last frame for the word _possess_ , and now expand your image of _shells_ to include the ancient value they had as money (a usage that will come in very helpful later on). Now one who is _possessed_ by _shells_ is likely to abandon any higher principles to acquire more and more wealth. These are the easiest ones to **bribe** with a few extra _shells_.;1) [[Jiten](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Jiten)] 16-3-2006(185): To **bribe** someone, money is a necessary possession.;2) [[martinirwin](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/martinirwin)] 23-10-2007(162): If you possess enough shellfish, you can **bribe** anyone.
汎;pan-;The sense of the key word here is the "all-inclusive" we find in terms like " **Pan-** American Games." (It is also the character used in mathematics for "partial" as in partial differentials, in case you are a math major and want to take your story in that direction.) Instead of a _water_ sports event that brings together the best talent, think of a meet of the region's most _mediocre_ athletes, many of whom cannot even tread _water_. Now try to find a sponsor for the  " **Pan-** _Mediocre_ _Water_ Sports Competition. ";1) [[herman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/herman)] 23-1-2009(54): This is **pan** \- as in the prefix meaning "all". I think of **Pan** gea as being a mediocre continent with water covering the rest of the planet. This was before it broke up into the first-class, well-distributed continents we got now.;2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 17-6-2007(22): Yeah, all our _water_ is fairly _mediocre_ , but if we work together in some **pan** -continental union, we can make some better _water_! As if.
栓;plug;Here we think of **plug** in the sense of a cork or stopper used to seal the mouth of a bottle, water faucet, or something with liquid running out of it. Forgetting the abstract picture of the former frame, let us work with all the primitive units: _tree_ . . . _umbrella_ . . . _ball_. Imagine a _tree_ with a faucet in the side out of which tennis _balls_ are flowing, bouncing all over the ground by the hundreds. You fight your way up to it and shove your giant beach _umbrella_ into the _tree_ to **plug** it up.;1) [[dwhitman](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dwhitman)] 12-10-2007(155): The fat _king_ under his _umbrella_ offers useless advice to the workers. "You'll need the _whole_ _tree_ to **plug** that gap". Imagine a grossly fat, incompetent king under a parasol giving annoying advice to sweating workers who know what they're doing. (I always have trouble bringing up the "whole" primitive. This story reminds me how to build that part. ).;2) [[sethimayne](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/sethimayne)] 12-11-2007(92): To **plug** the hole, you need to use a _whole_ piece of _wood_ \- like a cork or something.
緻;fine;The key word should be taken to mean minute, detailed, or nuanced. Its primitive elements are: _thread_ . . . _doth_.;1) [[perrin4869](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perrin4869)] 23-9-2010(33): This kanji shows _Spiderman_ giving a dress of the **finest** thread to his girlfriend. Of course, the real purpose of the gift is to get his girlfriend to _doth_ him.;2) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 9-1-2010(16): **fine** : If the _thread_ _doth_ fit through the eye of the needle, it is **fine** _thread_ indeed.
硫;sulfur;Rock . . . infant . . . flood.;1) [[ruisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruisu)] 4-11-2007(317): **Sulphur** is like a _rock_ , but it can stink like a _stream_ of _infant_ doodie.;2) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 6-2-2007(69): Infants are baptised in streams inorder to prevent their descent into a place of **sulphur** and brimstone.
票;ballot;Old West . . . altar.;1) [[rptb1](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rptb1)] 12-11-2005(270): In the Old West there were no **ballot** boxes. Afraid of fraud and fighting among the gunslingers, the **ballot** s were posted into a slot in the top of the local church altar instead. They may have been rough, but the cowboys wouldn't fight in the church.;2) [[Soseki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Soseki)] 19-3-2008(42): In _western_ political elections (US), peoples **ballots** will often depend on religion and at which _altar_ the prospective president prays.
蛍;lightning bug;Schoolhouse . . . insect.;1) [[DrWarrior12](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrWarrior12)] 6-9-2007(241): Bugs have to go to school to learn how to become **lightning bugs**. Only the brightest bugs graduate to become **lightning bugs**.;2) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 15-2-2007(106): Q: Who's the smartest _insect_ in _school_? A: The **lightning-bug**. Because he's so bright! (Image: lightning bug in school with glasses, pocket protector, etc. Maybe even have some cool kids teasing him).
酉;sign of the bird;Though we shall later encounter the kanji for _bird_ , we introduce this one for the tenth sign of the zodiac mainly because of its use as a primitive, where it has a different meaning.;1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 15-7-2006(181): The **sign of the bird** on this whiskey bottle is of course the Famous Grouse blended Scotch.;2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 3-4-2007(124): Normally birds fly south, but _one_ bird flew _west_. People were worried about it and kept asking "Is there any **sign of the bird** – you know, the _one_ that flew _west_?".
丙;third class;Those no-frills flights the airlines offer to attract customers should help create an image from _ceiling_ . . . _person_ . . . _belt_. The kanji meaning " _inside_ " should not be used because of its proximity to the element for " _in_. ";1) [[nilfisq](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nilfisq)] 15-9-2007(385): In this **third class** flight, the seat _belts_ are so bad that with the slightest turbulence all the _persons_ hit the ceiling. (it's almost pictographic here!).;2) [[somukeru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/somukeru)] 11-2-2008(26): Travelling by ship **third class** the cabins are all _inside_ (no windows) and the _ceilings_ are so low you hit your head.
醸;brew;Whiskey bottle . . . grass skirt.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 2-9-2007(198): On the troical island of JOU, they **brew** _whiskey_ while wearing _grass skirts_ (top hats and scarves too). (Image: the strangely dresses islanders stirring a pot of **brew**. Careful [fermentation](../v4/1430.html) (#1430 酵)).;2) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 26-12-2006(79): To me, the grass skirt is composed of six celery sticks and a scarf. Apparently you can **brew** whiskey out of grass skirts. No wonder it tastes horrible.

匁;monme;This character obliges us once again to make use of a Japanese key word for want of an English equivalent. It refers to an old unit of weight, equal to about 3.75 grams. The word is only slightly more useful in modern Japanese than cubits and kites are in modern English. Its primitives, if you look closely, are: _bound up_ . . . _arm_.;1) [[ergerg](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ergerg)] 2-9-2006(270): "Dude! What happened to your arm! It's all bound up!" "Yeah man, it's a bummer… with my arm like this I can only lift one **monme**!".;2) [[mspertus](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mspertus)] 3-12-2007(57): "Dude! What happened to your arm! It's all bound up!" "Yeah man, it's a bummer… with my arm like this I can only lift one **monme**!" "You'll never be able to use your dagger now!" (adapted from ergerg).

謁;audience;Imagine an **audience** with the emperor or the pope in which all those in attendance are sitting down, leaning against the wall, sleeping like our muchacho on _siesta_ as the honorable host delivers his _speech_.;1) [[ruisu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ruisu)] 26-11-2007(231): The _talk_ was so boring the **audience** took a _siesta_.;2) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 30-10-2008(59): Note: The keyword meaning is "Have an **audience** with . . . (Pope, King, etc)". Story: When you arrive for your **audience** with the Pope, he appears to be dozing. His assistant says, "Sorry about your **audience** , but you won't get a _word_ out of him while he's having his _siesta_ ".
匕;spoon;This character, a pictograph of a **spoon** , is easy enough to remember, provided you keep it distinct from that for _seven_ , where the first stroke is written left to right (the opposite of here) and cuts noticeably across the second.;1) [[DrWarrior12](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrWarrior12)] 3-9-2007(146): To remember the primitive meaning, picture someone sitting on the ground performing Seppuku…with a **spoon**. <http://tinyurl.com/co48k>.;2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 16-1-2008(52): Not only is stroke order important, but also be sure to note the _direction_ of a stroke. In both 'spoon' and 'seven', the first stroke is the horizontal one - but here it is written right to left in a downward flick, while in 'seven' it is a strong line from left to right.
酎;hooch;This kanji is used for thick, low-grade saké made from various kinds of grains. Its primitives are: _whisky bottle_ . . . _glue_.;1) [[raulir](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/raulir)] 22-12-2006(48): While the keyword is "hooch", this usually means 焼酎 . It has similar effect as whiskey and sniffing glue has: you get intoxicated.;2) [[endote](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/endote)] 7-3-2011(21): Tastes like whiskey, smells like glue? Then it must be しょうちゅうの「ちゅう」 ( **hooch** ). - There you go, reading meaning and a catchy ad jingle, all in one. Possibly the best story I've written. ^^.

拉;yank;The sense of this key word is to pull or jerk, as in opening a door or making "ramen" noodles. Its elements: _fingers_ . . . _vase_.;1) [[Splatted](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Splatted)] 8-6-2011(40): He quickly **yank** ed his _finger_ s out of the _vase_. Maybe no one noticed the attempt to steal the cookies…;2) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 11-5-2010(16): As well as the meaning of 'taking captive', this also means 'crush' or 'batter'. One also often sees it written in Chinese, with the meaning "pull". (I think this is where 拉麺 comes from - 'drawn' or perhaps 'flattened' noodles.) My keyword is **crush** (I **crushed** my _fingers_ trying to lift a heavy _vase_ ) but **Ramen** or the other common use for this kanji in Japanese, **Latin** (it's the abbreviation for the Latin language) would also be appropriate, as they help you learn the reading (ラ).

塁;bases;The kanji of this frame refers to the four **bases** that are placed at the corners of a baseball infield. They stick _sparklers_ in the _ground_ for the **bases** so they can be seen, and to be more festive.

芯;wick;Flowers . . . heart.;1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 24-7-2009(68): Giving a girl _flowers_ is like lighting the **wick** to her _heart_.;2) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 27-5-2007(64): My favorite are heart shaped candles that smell like sweet flowers. The trick is to find one with a thick **wick** , they give off the most flower scent (but burn the quickest).
沃;irrigate;Suffering from a drought, the farmers call on a _witch_  who conjures up _water_  to **irrigate**  their crops.;1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 16-5-2007(62): You use _water_ to **irrigate** your _saplings_.;2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 12-10-2008(22): A _fairy_ needs a lot of _water_ to **irrigate** those beating wings, so you have make sure they drink a lot to be well **irrigate** d (see [bewitched](../v4/2078.html) (#2078 妖).
栃;horse chestnut;A tree . . . cliff . . . ten thousand.;1) [[onsen_monkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/onsen_monkey)] 6-9-2006(276): There are a bunch of **HORSE CHESTNUT** TREES on top of this CLIFF above the beach. Chestnuts keep rolling off the cliff and falling on people's heads. So far TEN THOUSAND people have been killed by falling chestnuts, and the Japanese government still ain't did shit about it.;2) [[nest0r](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/nest0r)] 26-1-2008(72): There is a **horse chestnut** _tree_ that has grown by a _cliff_ for so long, it has deposited _10,000_ **horse chesnut** s that lie at the bottom. Don't worry over this one too much, you'll spend so much time trying to figure out the right story for it, you probably won't forget it.
丼;donburi;_Donburi_ is a bowl of rice with eel or meat on it. The character is a pictograph, perhaps designed by someone who felt that the portion of meat he was served with his bowl of rice looked to be no more than a tiny _drop_ in the _well_.;1) [[billyclyde](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/billyclyde)] 2-11-2007(65): A little one is eating a **domburi** while standing over, looking down into, a WELL. He drops it, and it falls down  & down until it looks like nothing more than a DROP, landing at the bottom of the well!;2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(24): I _drop_ a **domburi** down into the _well_ for the goblin living there.
璧;holed gem;The **holed gem** to which this kanji refers is a flat, circular object of about a foot in length, made of stone or glass and having a large hole in the middle. It's elements: _ketchup_ . . . _ball_.;1) [[perrin4869](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/perrin4869)] 30-9-2010(35): This kanji shows a policeman with a **holed gem** (which can be thought of as _jewelry_ , I guess), but he thinks it's a doughnut. For some reason though, he liked his doughnuts with ketchup on them, so he added some, and tried to take a bite. He lost a few teeth on the process.;2) [[thecite](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/thecite)] 9-12-2009(20): **perfection** : Only the tomatoes of perfection, comparable to jewels, were used for the expensive ketchup.
捗;make headway;Let your _fingers_  do the _walking_  as you **make headway**  through the Yellow Pages in search of something hard to find.;1) [[ikmys](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ikmys)] 1-5-2007(81): "Come on people, the only way to **make headway** in this business is to let your _fingers_ do the _walking_!" bust out the yellow pages and dial as many numbers as possible, surely someone is a sucker for a cold call sell.;2) [[icamonkey](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/icamonkey)] 18-8-2009(15): You can't just point with a _finger_ and **make headway** , you have to actually walk* there.
箋;stationery;_Bamboo_ . . . _float_. Note that the drawing of the primitive for _float_ uses the abbreviated form that has become standard in the general-use kanji and as we met it earlier (Frames 393-95). Until such time as typesetting fonts make the adjustment, only the older form has been approved. Here we have opted for the simpler, avant garde drawing.;1) [[Katsuo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Katsuo)] 25-7-2007(74): Note: the spelling should be **stationery** (= paper, office supplies), not **stationary** (= not moving). The error is in the original book.;2) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 30-9-2007(52): The _two fiestas_ communicated to each other on their respective floats by using _bamboo_ **stationery**.
痘;pox;Sickness . . . beans.;1) [[dingomick](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dingomick)] 8-3-2007(158): _Caveman_ has horrible **pox**. They look like edamame _beans_ oozing bight green paste.;2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 12-9-2006(137): **Pox** is a _sickness_ which symptoms include _bean_ -shaped bumps on the skin.
彙;glossary;The top primitive of this character is actually an old form of _broom_. The remaining elements are: _crown_ . . . _fruit_.;1) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 3-12-2008(42): I was having _mutual difficulties_ in my relationship. She was always the one wearing the _crown_ and I was the one picking the _fruit_. In order to fix the problem I checked the **glossary** for " _mutual difficulties_ " but found nothing. I guess we're going to have to _mutually end_ our relationship.;2) [[Meconium](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Meconium)] 12-3-2010(27): When I went to _Headless Mutual_ , the bank for tough London gangsters, I was given a pamphlet that said "If you try'a rip us off, we'll give you the rough end of a pineapple." I didn't quite understand this phrase, but it was important that I knew my legal obligations, so I consulted my **Glossary** of British Thieves' Argot. The result: "'give one the rough end of a pineapple': lit. insert the _crown_ of the _fruit_ into the recipient's anus. Metaphorically used to mean 'to exact vengeance'. Oh, I see now.
恣;selfish;Second . . . heart.;1) [[CasualTatsumaki](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/CasualTatsumaki)] 15-10-2010(64): **Selfish** lover breaks your _heart_ and moves on to the _next_ lover. (And _yawns_ with a _heart_ of _ice_ at your suffering).;2) [[terozen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/terozen)] 8-4-2012(13): A **selfish** person doesn't care about the _next_ person's _heart_ , only their own.
泌;ooze;_Water_ . . . the _invariably_ divided heart.;1) [[rizzo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rizzo)] 22-10-2005(234): Anything full of _water_ will _invariably_ begin to **ooze**.;2) [[DrJones](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/DrJones)] 22-12-2007(85): When you pierce a _heart_ with a _stake_ , it _invariably_ **oozes** _blood_.
氾;widespread;Water . . . fingerprint.;1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 7-3-2007(65): It's a **widespread** belief that they cannot find _fingerprints_ on a body that has been deposited in the _water_.;2) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 23-7-2009(37): It's a **widespread** belief that _water_ takes away _fingerprints_.
繭;cocoon;Though it's a good thing that the primitive for **cocoon** has been radically abbreviated from this, its full form as a kanji, the story it holds is a charming one. The silkworm ( _insect_ ) eats the leaves of the mulberry bush (the _flowers_ ), digests them and transforms them into _thread_ with which it spins about itself, in mystic wisdom, its own coffin (the _hood_ ). The dividing line that separates the two elements helps the picture of the little worm cutting itself off from contact with the outside world, but as a character stroke, it is a clear exception.;1) [[dihutenosa](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/dihutenosa)] 27-7-2008(190): This is a simple two-column manga showing the metamorphosis of a caterpillar into a **cocoon**. First, the caterpillar gets under a large flower (bees tend to hang around flowers, which scare away other predators). Then, in the first frame, we see the caterpillar ( _insect_ ). Then, a bar separating this frame from the next frame (remember that Japanese manga run the other way!), in which we see the _insect_ covered with _thread_ , making a beautiful **cocoon**.;2) [[eightyd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/eightyd)] 15-8-2009(172): I dont like lesson 51 so far.
陪;auxiliary;Pinnacle . . . muzzle.;1) [[PacifistGod](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/PacifistGod)] 22-7-2007(169): In case of emergency, The Pinnacle has **auxiliary** guard dogs, but they keep them muzzeled until they're needed.;2) [[meolox](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/meolox)] 18-1-2008(102): When you climb the _pinnacle_ you'll need to take a _muzzle_ of **auxiliary** oxygen.
頒;partition;Part . . . head.;1) [[henroski](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/henroski)] 6-2-2008(226): The PART of my HEAD where I remember the KANJI is in the kanji **PARTITION**.;2) [[akrodha](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/akrodha)] 22-11-2006(129): The last time I tried to **partition** a hard drive under Linux, I got a severe migraine that parted my head.
彰;patent;_Badge_ . . . _shape_. The key word is synonymous with  "clear" or "openly expressed.";1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 14-4-2007(206): The _shape_ of a sheriff's _badge_ makes it **patent** who he is.;2) [[ayoung24](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/ayoung24)] 18-12-2006(36): _Mystique_ the shape-shifter sneaks into the **patent** office easily after she steals an identity _badge_ from a security guard.
埼;cape;The **cape** pictured here is a jut of _land_ like **Cape** Cod. The _soil_ on the left tells us we have to do with _land_ , and the _strange_ on the right tells us it is a **_cape_** where unusual things go on. Put a haunted house on it, an eerie sky overhead, and a howling wind rustling through the trees, and you have yourself a picture of **Cape** _Strange_ (or, if you prefer, **Cape** _Odd_ ).;1) [[frychiko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/frychiko)] 3-7-2008(160): This refers to LAND, not the STRANGE gear superheroes wear.;2) [[usis35](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/usis35)] 27-5-2007(77): **Cape** Cod "odd" is a land where odd=strange things happen.
摯;clasp;Of the many and widely different meanings of this kanji, we select the verbal meaning of **clasp** , which fits in well with its primitive elements: _tenacious_ . . . _hand_.;1) [[FooSoft](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/FooSoft)] 1-1-2010(38): _Tenaciously_ **clasping** something with your hand.;2) [[hissatsu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/hissatsu)] 24-12-2010(18): You could tell he was **earnest** from how _tenaciously_ he shook your _hand_.

畿;capital suburbs;Two cocoons . . . field . . . fiesta.;1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 31-7-2009(78): People aside, I wonder _how many rice fields_ there are in the **capital suburbs**.;2) [[Neobeo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Neobeo)] 22-1-2009(14): _How many brains_ does it take to run the **capital suburbs**?
壌;lot;_Ground_ . . . _grass skirt_. The **lot** of this key word refers to a portion of land.;1) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 19-2-2007(213): My dream is to buy a small _lot_ on a tropical island and spend the rest of my days relaxing in a _grass skirt_.;2) [[OddAndersen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/OddAndersen)] 27-1-2008(66): On the island of JOU, in order to be considered a **lot** , a _ground_ must be big enough to grow sufficient grass for a _grass skirt_.
填;inlay;When we hear the world **inlay** , we usually think of setting precious stones in pieces of jewelery, but the primitive elements here suggest _truth_ being **inlaid** in the _soil_. You might think instead of the cosmic wisdom that **inlaid** the _truth_ of the universe in the stuff of the earth.;1) [[astridtops](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/astridtops)] 9-4-2007(63): In a hole in the _ground_ , the body of the victim was placed. And then the killer **stuffed it up** so that the _truth_ would not be found out, he hoped.;2) [[Ragnarocko](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Ragnarocko)] 22-7-2008(26): I stuffed up his mouth with dirt to keep the truth from coming out.
賂;graft;To those who believe in the inevitability of **graft** in government, everything has a price - or as this character has it, to _each_ office its outlay of _shells_.;1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 16-7-2007(68): It might sound simple to bribe someone, but then you have to **graft** the guy above him and the guy below him, and soon you're just giving _shells_ to _each_ and everyone!;2) [[cameron_en](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cameron_en)] 28-11-2008(18): When I was caught by the police doing some **graft** (graffiti), I gave _each_ cop some _clams_ and told them to be on their way. 賄賂 【わいろ】 bribe.
轄;control;_Car_ . . . _harm_. Stay in **control**!;2) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 14-3-2007(99): The roads are icy, and a whole bunch of _cars_ have spun out of **control**! 逓;parcel post;Drag . . . cornstalk . . . belt . . . road.;1) [[Virtua_Leaf](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Virtua_Leaf)] 23-1-2008(211): (I prefer _2 towels_ over cornstalk and belt) - Have you ever wondered why your parcels always end up in such bad condition when you get them? 酵;fermentation;Whiskey bottle . . . filial piety.;1) [[Raichu](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Raichu)] 12-7-2006(208): The secrets of **fermentation** are passed to the son who displays the most filial piety.;2) [[rgravina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rgravina)] 14-6-2006(131): Since _filial piety_ is all about respecting ones elders, and the older a _whiskey bottle_ is (i.e. the time it have spent undergoing **fermentation** ) the more respect you should give it, the meaning of this kanji becomes clear. 勺;ladle;If you want to _bind up drops_ of anything - water, soup, lemonade - you use something to scoop these _drops_ up, which is what we call a **ladle**. 塑;model;This kanji depicts the art of **modeling** clay or wood into a figure of your choice. 諮;consult with;To seek the _words_ of a _second mouth_ is to **consult with** someone about something.;1) [[Megaqwerty](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Megaqwerty)] 28-4-2007(171): Having a _word_ with the _next mouth_ over, like a neighbor, is usually a good way to **consult with** somebody for cheap. 楷;block letters;The key word refers to kanji that are written in full, squared form, as opposed to cursive writing which is more flowing andabbreviates some of the strokes. Here **block letters** are pictured as tidy rows of _trees_ that are _all_ the same size and can be read easily by _all_ , whatever calligraphic skills they possess.;1) [[Elphalpo](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Elphalpo)] 5-7-2010(25): **Print-style writing** (as opposed to cursive): _All_ **print-style writing** looks rather _wooden_ to me. I prefer the fancy curves of cursive. (Note: Heisig gives this character the official keyword "block letters," but based on what I've read about the meaning of the character in the Yahoo! Japan Dictionary, I prefer "print-style writing").;2) [[Magnus13](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Magnus13)] 10-7-2011(15): **Block letters** (as opposed to cursive) are rigid and lifeless like _wood_ , they're _all_ the same size so that _all_ can read them.
搭;board;The key word refers to **boarding** vessels for travel. Its elements are: _finger_ . . . _flowers_ . . . _fit together_ (See frame 270).;1) [[decamer0n](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/decamer0n)] 31-1-2007(340): Ok, this is a little wierd, but i took this back to the kanji for [pagoda](../v4/254.html) (#254 塔). I think it helps simplify the image, and also helps anchor the pagoda kanji in memory better as an added bonus. say this aloud once, and i think it will bring out a vivid image very quickly: "Now **board** ing the _pagoda_ ride. Please keep your _fingers_ inside at all times…".;2) [[taijuando](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/taijuando)] 20-4-2006(86): When you **board** the ship on the way out from Hawaii a beautiful crewmember takes her _fingers_ and fits a lei around you ….a lei is _flowers_ _fitted together_ with your _fingers_.

訃;obituary;The _words_ of this **obituary** work like a _magic wand_ , conjuring up the desceased.;1) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 23-3-2010(40): **Obituary**. 哺;suckle;Mouth . . . dog tag.;1) [[gfb345](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gfb345)] 2-6-2010(35): The extremely efficient (military veteran) wet-nurse keeps track of which infant has been **SUCKLE** d already by marking each _MOUTH_ with a _DOG-TAG_. 銑;pig iron;**Pig iron** refers to iron in the crude form in which it emerges from the smelting furnaces. Of all the various forms _metal_ can take, this one shows us _metal_ _before_ it has been refined. Imagine two photographs labeled  " _before_ " and "after" to show the process.;1) [[wzafran](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/wzafran)] 16-6-2007(174): **Pig iron** is basic/crude _metal_ , that is, _before_ it has been processed.;2) [[Danieru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Danieru)] 7-7-2008(121): **Pig- iron** is crude _metal_ ( 金 ) _before_ ( 先 ) it is refined. If you have trouble with this character, envision a big minotaur ( _cow_ head with _human legs_ ) as a blacksmith, smelting metals and making swords for war.
瘍;carbuncle;Sickness . . . piggy bank.;1) [[gavmck](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/gavmck)] 27-6-2010(44): The witches _piggy bank_ was cursed with a spell causing any thief who stole it's contents to fall ill. The _illness_ would result in the victim being covered from head to toe in a mass of **carbuncles**. Crime doesn't pay!;2) [[Asayoru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Asayoru)] 10-11-2010(19): _Caveman_ has to open up his _piggy bank_ to receive treatment for his monstrous **carbuncle**.
酪;dairy products;Whiskey bottle . . . each.;1) [[Shizuru](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Shizuru)] 27-8-2007(163): To stay healthy, Dr. Phil told me to have some **dairy products** with each bottle of whiskey I drink…;2) [[Stormchild](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Stormchild)] 29-11-2006(139): In an attempt to increase sales of **dairy products** , the grocery store is giving away a free miniature _whiskey bottle_ with _each_ dairy product you buy.
錮;weld;Metal . . . harden.;1) [[Dakoina](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Dakoina)] 2-9-2010(42): RTK supplement: **weld** (metal, harden) - **weld** ing the metal bars of a cage together, to _harden_ the cage even more… nothing shall escape now!;2) [[Boy.pockets](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/Boy.pockets)] 25-1-2011(11): You **weld** _metal_ in the knowledge that it will _harden_ again.
劾;censure;Acorn . . . muscle.;1) [[rhclaghorn](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/rhclaghorn)] 29-3-2008(146): _Acorn Power_ is the people's way to **CENSURE** a congressman you don't agree with. Pelt your Senator with acorns today.;2) [[johnzep](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/johnzep)] 8-8-2007(96): The liberal squirrel blogged that he would give all his ACORNS to congress if it would exercise its POWER to **censure** Bush and Cheney.
祉;welfare;Altar . . . footprint.;1) [[esaulgd](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/esaulgd)] 11-9-2007(184): And in front of every _altar_ , she _stopped_ to pray for the **welfare** of the others.;2) [[smithsonian](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/smithsonian)] 7-3-2007(161): Religious Republicans regularly go to the _altar_ to pray for a _stop_ to **welfare**.
篭;basket;_Bamboo_ . . . _dragon_. Note that the older (and still official) form of this kanji uses the old character for dragon 龍, which is good to learn and is fun to write in any case. It is made up of five primitive elements: _vase_ . . . _flesh_ . . . _slingshot_ . . . _fishhook_ (enclosure) . . . _three_.;1) [[mantixen](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/mantixen)] 15-2-2007(39): The only **cage** that can keep a _dragon_ is made of _bamboo_.;2) [[cb4960](http://kanji.koohii.com/profile/cb4960)] 22-1-2009(24): A _bamboo_ **cage** won't hold a _dragon_!
